Policy: Decreto Nº 22/95 - Crea el Programa de los Polos de Desarrollo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, que consta de 13 artículos, crea el Programa de los Polos de Desarrollo (POLDES), como organismo adscrito al Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural (PNDR). El objetivo principal del POLDES es promover un modelo de desarrollo sostenible que permita mejorar la calidad de vida de la población mediante el manejo sostenido de los recursos naturales, impulsando la diversificación agropecuaria y el uso de la tecnología para elevar la productividad, promoviendo la realización de las obras de infraestructura y apoyando la comercialización de los productos, tomando en cuenta a la mujer campesina como parte fundamental del proceso de producción agropecuaria (art. 2º). POLDES asumirá el Programa Polos de Desarrollo del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería (art. 12).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Décret nº 95-377 portant refonte du décret nº 92-926 relatif à la mise en compatibilité des investissements avec l'Environnement.
Policy_Content: Conformément à l'article 10 de la loi nº 90-033 du 21 décembre 1990 portant Charte de l'Environnement, les investissements publics ou privés susceptibles de porter atteinte à l'Environnement, ainsi que ceux qui sont soumis à autorisation ou à approbation d'une autorité administrative, doivent faire l'objet d'une étude d'impact, compte tenu de la nature technique, de l'ampleur desdits projets ainsi que de la sensibilité du milieu d'implantation. Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les règles et procédures à suivre en vue de cette mise en compatibilité des investissements avec l'Environnement et de préciser les organes habilités à la mise en oeuvre de ces règles et procédures. Le décret est formé par 37 articles répartis en 5 chapitres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Règles et procédures applicables pour la mise en compatibilité des investissements avec l'environnement (II); Du suivi, de l'évaluation et du contrôle (III); Dispositions transitoires (IV) et Dispositions finales (V). Une annexe fixe la liste des investissements soumis à l'étude d'impact environnementale.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Law amending the Land Transaction Law.
Policy_Content: The present Act introduces some amendments to the Land Transaction Act (LGBl. No. 61/1993). The amendments concern articles 1, 3, 7 and 11 on Acquisition of land by foreigners, as well as article 24 dealing with the succession by death in land property.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece los requisitos previstos de manera especial para inscribir un documento en el Registro Nacional de Valores e Intermediarios y Oferta Pública.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Institution,Internal trade,International trade,Agricultural commodities

Policy: Law on fees for the use of natural flora.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to regulate the assessment and payment of fees for the use of natural flora. Mongolian nationals, foreigners, stateless persons or economic entities shall pay a fee to use endangered, rare or common flora for any purpose except in the following cases: (a) common flora used for household purposes; (b) rare or common flora used for research purposes; and (c) natural flora used for hay production and livestock grazing.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 July 1995.

Policy: Loi visant à encourager l'implantation, la sauvegarde et l'entretien de surfaces de compensation écologique.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte la réglementation relative à l’encouragement de l’implantation, la sauvegarde et l’entretien de surfaces de compensation écologique. Par «surface de compensation écologique», on entend les surfaces proches de l'état naturel, présentant un intérêt écologique marqué. Le texte comprend 5 articles répartis en 5 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Contributions (II); Mise en oeuvre (III); Sanctions et contentieux (IV); Dispositions finale et transitoire (V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente loi entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 1996.

Policy: Ley Nº 19.386 - Normas para la enajenación de bienes comunes provenientes de la reforma agraria.
Policy_Content: La Ley, que consta de 8 artículos, sin perjuicio de las normas generales sobre liquidación de comunidades, establece normas especiales de procedimiento para la enajenación de los bienes comunes comprendidos dentro de la asignación individual de predios provenientes de la reforma agraria (art. 1º). Se declaran indivisibles aquellos retazos de terreno de los bienes comunes inmuebles destinados en forma permanente a actividades asistenciales, deportivas, recreativas, religiosas, sociales o comunitarias, pero podrán ser cedidos a título gratuito a personas jurídicas sin fines de lucro con la obligación de mantener su destino de origen (art. 2º). El procedimiento establecido en esta Ley tendrá el carácter de no contencioso; las cuestiones que se susciten entre los comuneros durante el proceso de enajenación se tramitarán en el mismo expediente y no suspenderán el procedimiento principal, sujetándose a las reglas de los incidentes (art. 3º). Las disposiciones de la presente Ley no se aplicarán a la enajenación de aquellos bienes comunes que constituyan caminos y pozos (art. 6º). La escritura pública de enajenación será justo título (art. 7º).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law On fees for the harvest of timber and fuelwood.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this law is to regulate fees for harvest of forest timber and fuel wood by citizens, economic entities and organizations and procedures for paying these fees to the State budget. Mongolian citizens, foreign citizens, or persons with no citizenship cutting trees for any purpose from the Forest Reserve which is the state property of Mongolia shall pay a forest use fee. The issuance of a permit for cutting timber and fuel wood shall be regulated by the Forest Law of Mongolia. A timber and fuel wood fee shall be imposed for cutting of any kind of tree in the forest for any purpose. A fee payer shall be exempt from fees for cutting trees for timber, if the purpose is: (a) to protect afforestation areas or the sources of springs; and (b) to build an office for rangers in border areas.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law shall take effect on July 1, 1995.

Policy: Order No.65 of 1995 of the Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil regarding validation of the Instruction on the modalities of re-registration of licences on the use of subsoil.
Policy_Content: Deputy minister orders to validate the Instruction. The present Instruction determines the modalities regarding examination of issue related to re-registration of licences on the use of subsoil. It is compulsory for all legal and natural persons claiming on the right to use subsoil by means of re-registration of licences irrespectively of subordination, form of property and organizational and legal form. The document consists of IV Sections. Sec.I lays down general provisions. Sec.II establishes requirements to the documents to be forwarded for re-registration of licences for the use of subsoil. Sec.III establishes modalities and terms for the examination of materials for re-registration of licences for the use of subsoil. Sec.IV establishes the modalities for issuing of duplicate licence for the use of subsoil in case of its loss.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Andhra Pradesh Mutually Aided Co-operative Societies Act, 1995 (Act No. 30 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 45 sections, broke new ground in the history of the Indian cooperative movement. This is a cooperative law which respects the right of members to fully own and control their own cooperative enterprise. The enactment, an act of political courage and wisdom by the Andhra Pradesh Government, was the final step in a long effort to create a new legislative environment for cooperatives in Andhra Pradesh. It provides for the voluntary formation of cooperative societies as accountable, competitive, self reliant business enterprises, based on thrift, self-help and mutual aid and owned, managed and controlled by members for their economic and social betterment and for related matters.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 1 June 1995.

Policy_Content: The Statute consists of 109 sections and three Schedules. The sections are divided into 16 Parts: Preliminary (I); General principles (II); Institutional Arrangements (III); Environmental planning (IV); Environmental Regulation (V); Establishment of Environmental Standards (VI); Environment management (VII); Control of Pollution (VIII); Environmental Restoration Order and Environmental Easements (IX); Records, Inspections and Analysis (X); Information, Education and Public Awareness (XI); Financial Provisions (XII); Offences (XIII); Judicial Proceedings (XIV); International Obligations (XV); Miscellaneous Provisions (XVI).

Policy: Genetic Participation Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the release into the environment of genetically modified organisms. Its ultimate aim is to protect human health and the environment when: a) carrying out the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms for any other purposes than placing on the market ; b) placing on the market genetically modified organisms as or in products within the Community. The text consists of 6 articles as follows: Procedures for requests of release under the Genetic Technology Act (1); Requests for release from Member States of the European Union or other parties (2); Rrequests for marketing of products under the Genetic Technology Act (3); Requests for marketing of products from ,member states or other parties (4); Suspension of authorization for marketing or interim ban on the marketing of products (5); Entry into force (6).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Aliens Landholding Regulation Act, 1995 (No. 17 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The Act regulates the holding of lands in Dominica by foreigners. "Alien" means a person or who is not a citizen of one of the Member States of the Organization of Eastern Caribbean States, including companies which are under the control or are deemed to be under the control of an alien (sect. 2). No unlicensed alien shall hold land or an interest in land other than in the circumstances as specified in subsection 4(1) and sections 5 and 6: Aliens may acquire or hold land without a licence for purposes of residence (not more than 1 acre), for purposes of trade and business (not more than three acres), and specified circumstances. Land held contrary to subsection 3(1) shall be forfeited to the State (subsect. 3(2)). Subject to section 3(3) any agreement to hold land or an interest in land shall not vest any interest in land in the purchaser unless a licence to hold land or interest is obtained (sect. 8). Companies of Dominica shall have the right to restrict the holding of shares and debentures by aliens (sect. 9). Provisions of this Act in respect of licences apply to land held in trust for an alien (sect. 12). (22 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decree No. 547 of 1995 relative to the registration of arable land which is abandoned or lies fallow.
Policy_Content: The scope of the present Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture is to provide a clear picture of all land suitable for cultivation but presently not in use. Such land shall be under consideration for measures to be taken pursuant to section 8 of the Land Use Act of 1995. Municipalities shall be responsible for registration. Priority shall be given to land in good shape in areas where a lot of cultivation takes place. Position, present condition, and size shall be registered and information provided on the best possible use, suitability of the land, etc. (4 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree entered into force on 1 July 1995.

Policy: Law No. 6.855 providing for the Policy, Management and the State Water Resources Plan.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 24 articles divided in nine Chapters, establishes the Policy, Management and the State Water Resources Plan. The State Policy on Water Resources aims at the development and rational use of water resources of the State, and should comply with the following basic principles: ensure the everyone's right to have access to state natural resources; the distribution of water in the territory of the State of Bahia must always comply with economic, social and environmental criteria in a global manner and without distinction of prevalence; plan and manage the use of the water resources of the State of Bahia according to the requirements of sustainable development; charging for the use of water resources of the State shall always take into account the economic and social situation of consumers and its purpose. The guidelines of the State Policy of Water Resources are: the balance of regional development; the maximization of the economic and social benefits resulting from the multiple and/or integrated use of the water resources of its territory; the protection of its watersheds against actions that may compromise its current and future use; defense against critical hydrological events that offer risks to public health and safety, as well as social and economic damages; the development of permanent programs for the conservation and protection of groundwater against pollution and excessive or uncontrolled exploitation; registration, monitoring and inspection of the rights of research and exploitation of water resources of the State, in addition, the institution of the granting mechanism, authorization or permission to use its waters; prevention of the adverse effects of droughts, floods, pollution, erosion or any other natural or non-natural effect.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy_Content: The President decrees that normative cost of land for the sale of the plots of land to privatized enterpises situated on them must be estimated as the land tax rate for a unit of area multiplied by ten times.

Policy: Regulation on maximum allowable concentration of pollutants in the atmospheric air in the area of growing of forest forming species.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes maximum allowable concentration limits of pollutants in the atmospheric air in the area of growing of forest forming species. It shall be compulsory for the authorized state environmental institutions and legal persons that have impact on the atmospheric air quality. The purpose of this Regulation shall be to prevent damage and destruction of forest forming species growing in the area of impact thereon by economic and other activities. The observance of this Regulation shall ensure air quality safeguarding resistance of forest forming species to damaging factors.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decision by the Interdepartmental Committee for Economic Planning (C.I.P.E.) approving the national programme for agricultural development services.
Policy_Content: The national programme aims at the reorganization of the agricultural development services through the harmonized action of the Government, the Regions and the authorities concerned, and at the rational utilization and allocation of human and financial resources. The matters pertaining to the agricultural development services have been gradually extending from the traditional technical assistance to the management of enterprises, the protection of the environment and the management and conservation of the national territory. For this reason seven sections are devoted to the explanation of the characteristics, means and objectives of the following matters that are deemed to come under the competence of the agricultural development services: 1) agricultural research and testing (at the national and regional level) aimed at the discovery of new production technologies in order to enhance the competitiveness of the national agricultural products; 2) collection, classification and dissemination of data; 3) technical assistance to agricultural enterprises in the production process, through analysis and planning methods constantly updated and tested; 4) commercial assistance (i.e. marketing strategies and research, trade promotion, etc.); 5) vocational training; 6) agricultural statistics.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Agricultural Tenancies Act 1995 (Chapter 8).
Policy_Content: An Act to make provision for farm business tenancies which begin after 1 September 1995. Section 4 excludes in part the Agricultural Holding Act, 1986 to tenancies covered by the present Act. Sections 5 to 7 provide rules for the termination of tenancies. Tenancies continuing for more than two years shall afterwards continue from year to year unless terminated by notice (sect. 5). Section 8 recognizes the right of a tenant to remove buildings and fixtures. Part II regulating the review of tenancy contracts shall apply in relation to a farm business tenancy unless the tenancy is created by an instrument which expressly excludes revision of the rent during the period of tenancy or provides that the rent is to varied by or to a specified amount or in accordance with specified formula (sect. 9). This Part provides for statutory review of rent by an arbitrator appointed either by agreement or by the President of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors. Part III makes provision for compensation on termination of the farm business tenancy for improvements made by the tenant. Part IV provides for miscellaneous matters such as the resolution of disputes in the form of arbitration, agricultural values and the estimation of best rent, and for supplemental matters such as the service of notices and the applicability of provisions to Crown land and contains an interpretation section. The text of the Act consists of 41 sections, divided into 4 Parts and one Schedule.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. 5.887 providing for the State Environmental Policy.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 158 articles divided into six Titles and 14 Chapters, establishes the Environmental Policy within the State of Pará. It provides for its objectives, formulation and application mechanisms, and constitutes the State Administration System for Environmental Quality, Protection, Control and Development and the Appropriate Use of Natural Resources (SEAQUA), pursuant to article 225 of the Federal Constitution and article 193 of the State Constitution. The objectives of the State Administration System for SEAQUA aim to organize, coordinate and integrate activities corresponding to the direct, indirect and basic administration agencies and entities established by the public authorities, ensuring the participation of the society in the execution of State Environmental Policy with a view to protecting, controlling and developing the environment and the sustainable use of natural resources. In addition, it creates the State Environmental System (SISECTAM), specifying its composition, duties and responsibilities entitled to implement the State Environmental Policy, as well as to control its execution.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy_Content: This Decree applies to the Antarctic defined as the area south of the 60th southern parallel and to activities of: (a) Norwegian citizens; (b) Norwegian legal persons; (c) Norwegian ships and aircrafts; (d) foreigners resident in Norway; (e) and foreigners who are members of or responsible for the organization of expeditions to the Antarctic which are organized in Norway or which depart from Norway directly to the Antarctic (sect. 2).

Policy: Regional Law No. 7 “On protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes organizational and legal norms in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters. The scope of this Law shall be as follows: (a) prevention of the outbreak of disasters; (b) reduction of damages caused by disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof; (c) delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters. Regional early warning system shall be integral part of the national early warning system. Population shall be granted timely access to reliable information regarding natural and technological disasters and state o territory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulations relating to the protection of the environment and safety in Antarctica  (No. 412 of 2013).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Decree is to ensure the protection of the Antarctic environment and its dependent and associated ecosystems, to preserve Antarctica's value (including wild and landscaping values), and to maintain the area's scientific research activities. These regulations are also aimed to all activities in Antarctica for the safety and self-sufficient planning and execution. It applies to air and water quality, glacial and marine environment, biological, scientific, historic or aesthetic impact on the wild habitat. Various tasks prescribed by the present Decree are assigned to the Norwegian Polar Institute. Such tasks include the granting of licences and the supervision on the implementation and enforcement of provisions of the present Decree.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Sea, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Waste management,Data collection/reporting,Inspection,Marine pollution,Waste prevention,Wild fauna,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

The Alpine Register is to be established and run at the competent office of the regional government. Its purpose is the survey of actual stock and the management of alpine regions. Policy_Content: These Provisions are formulated in accordance with the Environmental Protection Law of the People's Republic of China, the Mineral Resources Law of the People's Republic of China and the Regulations of the People's Republic of China on Nature Reserves, aiming to strengthen the management of geological relics and make them effectively protected and rationally utilized. Policy: Regulation on forest officer.
Policy_Content: Forest officer shall be official of the authorized state forest institution carrying out forest management in forestry that a structural unit of the regional forestry administration. Forest officer pertains to Federal Forest Service being at the same time the state forest inspector  authorized to control the state, management, reproduction, conservation and protection of forests. Forest officer shall be issued countermark and bark mark for the purpose of control sanitary felling, allotment of standing timber, and also for the protection of forests against illegal logging. Forest officers shall be authorized to detain and convey the infringers of the forest legislation to the police station, confiscate hunting and logging gear, issue forest certificate for collection and harvesting of non-timber products, trade timber after sanitary felling and request information necessary for carrying out forest control functions.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Décret nº 95-793 réglementant l'encouragement de l'Etat au profit des petits agriculteurs et des petits pêcheurs.
Policy_Content: Ce décret réglemente l'encouragement que l'Etat apporte au profit des petits agriculteurs et des petits pêcheurs sous forme de prêts d'investissement. Il comprend 29 articles portant dispositions générales relatives aux prêts d'investissement et celles particulières relatives aux prêts pour les activités agricoles ainsi que 2 annexes fixant les montants maximums de la dépense prise en considération et la durée du prêt et du délai de grâce ou période de non production. Les activités agricoles pour lesquelles les prêts peuvent être accordés sont: 1) la création des points d'eau et de périmètres d'irrigués; 2) le développement de l'élevage et de la production fourragère; 3) le développement des plantations et la réalisation de brise-vents internes; 4) l'acquisition de matériel agricole neuf et la révision du matériel agricole usagé; 5) les travaux de conservation des eaux et du sol; 6) le développement sylvo-pastoral; 7) la réalisation de constructions rurales rattachées aux activités agricoles. Pour les activités de pêche, les prêts peuvent être accordés pour: 1) l'acquisition d'unités de pêche côtière entièrement équipées pour la pêche dans la région du nord; 2) la réparation et la remise en état des armements de pêche côtière; 3) la modernisation des armements de pêche côtière par l'acquisition et l'installation de moteurs et de matériels et d'équipements de pêche. Le pourcentage des prêts d'investissement ne doit pas dépasser 65 pourcent du montant de l'investissement, à l'exception des constructions rurales pour lesquelles le taux peut arriver à 90 pourcent du coût. Les prêts d'investissement sont débloqués sur les ressources du fonds spécial du développement agricole et de la pêche et ne viennent remboursés que pendant la période de production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: General Regulation - Topsoil Preservation Act (N.B. Reg. 95-66).
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides the definition of topsoil, which is “soil containing 0.9 percent or more organic carbon, as determined by the Walkley and Black method, and sand, silt and clay”. It specifies the procedure and requirements for obtaining a permit for the removal from site or he move of topsoil as well as for its transportation. Permits have to be accompanied by a rehabilitation plan for topsoil removal sites; among others such plan must cover the removal of all equipment, buildings and structures placed or erected on the site for the purpose of topsoil removal, clearing of all debris from the site, and management of the site in order to ensure that the grass or vegetation is maintained for a period of at least two years.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Alpine Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to protect and conserve alpine regions as living and recreational space for human beings, animals and plants as well to ensure a secure cultivation. Moreover, the Law regulates the use of such regions for tourism and the improvement of alpine industries. Special attention shall be paid to sustainable development of the environment, and in particular to the conservation of the groundwater and the related potable water supply. Article 4 establishes that alpine regions s shall be cultivated harmoniously and environment-friendly; endemic plants shall not be endangered. The grazing of sheep requires the authorization of the relevant agricultural office. Organic fertilizers shall not be used. The use of commercial fertilizers is allowed only within a of a soil improvement programme. No hazardous substances classified as being higher than 5 shall be employed in alpine regions. The text consists of 18 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Basic rules concerning exploitation of alpine regions (II); Contributions and subsidies (III); Alpine regions of the Canton (IV); Right of appeal and criminal prosecution (V); Implementation and final provisions (VI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen.
Keyword: Agricultural development,Mountain area,Less favoured areas,Subsidy/incentive,Court/tribunal,Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Fertilizers/nutrients,Hazardous substances,Internal trade,Animal production,Sheep/goats,Grazing
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 January 1996.

Policy: Regulations of Jiangxi province on Environmental Management of Construction Projects.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to strengthen the environmental management of the construction projects, effectively control environmental pollution and ecological damage, protect the environment, safeguard the people's health, and promote social and economic sustainable development in Guangdong province. The Regulations consist of 31 Articles divided into 5 Chapters: General provisions; Environmental protection management in project establishment phase; Environmental protection management in project construction phase; Legal liabilities; Supplementary provisions. Construction projects may be involved in industry, hospitals, hotels, water conservancy, transportation, slaughtering, city sewage treatment, garbage (waste) processing, warehouses of dangerous goods and materials, etc. (Art.2).  The construction of projects as listed in Article 2 must follow the submission, examination and approval procedures of construction project environmental impact statements. Construction projects that deal with toxic and hazardous wastes must be approved by the environmental protection competent authority.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act XXVIII of 1995 on National Standardization.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to facilitate the supply of the participants of the national economy with up-to-date technical knowledge required for marketability and the implementation of the obligations for standardization undertaken in international agreements. This Act defines the organizational framework, principles of operation, requirements, relations and financial ressources for management of national standardization. The national standards organization is the Hungarian Standards Body (MSZT). It is a public body. Among its organs there are the national standardizing technical committees which are the basic professional units of MSZT, organized on voluntary basis, and fulfils national standardization tasks of each sector of economy.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Resolución de 28 de abril de 1995 - Acuerdo del Consejo de Ministros de 17 de febrero de 1995, por el que se aprueba el Plan Nacional de Recuperación de Suelos Contaminados.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución dispone la publicación del Plan Nacional de Recuperación de Suelos Contaminados (1995-2000), aprobado por el Consejo de Ministros el 17 de febrero de 1995, consta de 4 partes: Introducción (I); Diagnóstico de la situación actual (II); Objetivos y líneas de actuación del Plan Nacional de Recuperación de Suelos Contaminados (III); Financiación del Plan Nacional de Recuperación de Suelos Contaminados (IV). El objetivo del Plan Nacional es el de orientar la actuación de la Administración del Estado en materia de recuperación de suelos contaminados a medio y largo plazo, incorporando desde ahora los planes autonómicos ya existentes.

Policy: Regulation on pit-sawing of timber (FDA Regulation No. 22).
Policy_Content: Out of environmental concern, the Forestry Development Authority hereby regulates the ever-increasing activity of pit-sawing. Pit-sawing means small-scale commercial logging activities other that concession logging allowed in heavily fragmented patches of forests that are not suited for a grant of concession. Each operator shall obtain a permit from the FDA for pit-sawing operations. No pit-sawing shall take place in National Forests, environmentally-threatened areas, National Parks and Salvage areas. Other rules impose fees for registration and other fees, defines offences and prescribe penalties.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber extraction/logging,Forestry protection measures,Protected area,National parks,Offences/penalties,Authorization/permit,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Law No. 440-XIII on water conservation zones and water belts of rivers and waterbodies.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates creation of water conservation zones and littoral water belts of rivers and waterbodies, the modalities of management and protection thereof. Special water management terms and conditions shall be applicable to water conservation zones and water belts. In case of the use of surface waterbodies for water abstraction for the purpose of potable water supply there shall be established sanitary protection zone in place of water abstraction. The Act consists of four Sections divided into 21 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) dimensions of water conservation zone and water belts; (3) liability; and (4) conclusive and transitional provisions. Compulsory planting of protection forests shall be carried out on the banks of rivers and waterbodies especially where soil erosion is under way. Boundaries of water conservation zones and water belts shall be delimited in-situ by protection forests, roads and anti-erosion waterworks.
Subject: Forestry, Water
Keyword: Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Freshwater resources management,Surface water,Water conservation zone,Water abstraction,Water supply,Waterworks
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Petroleum Products Regulation Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 64 sections divided into eleven Parts, establishes the marketing of petroleum products in South Australia. Part 2 specifies the requirement for licence. The Minister may, on application by a person, issue or renew, or refuse to issue or renew, a licence under this Act. The Minister may renew a licence despite the fact that application for renewal of the licence was made after the end of the previous term of the licence. In addition, The Minister may: a) exempt a class of persons or petroleum products from the application of this Act or a specified provision of this Act unconditionally or subject to specified conditions; and b) vary or revoke a notice under this subsection. The Minister may, by notice in writing to a person: a) exempt the person from the application or a specified provision of this Act unconditionally or subject to specified conditions; and b) vary or revoke a notice.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: National Environment Protection Council (Victoria) Act 1995.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to provide for the establishment of a National Environment Protection Council, define its functions and powers and regulate its operation. Functions of the Council include: to make national environment protection measures and to assess and report on the implementation and effectiveness, in participating jurisdictions, of national environment protection measures. The Act is divided into the following parts: Preliminary (1); Establishment and membership of the National Environment Protection Council (2); Functions and powers of the Council (3); Meetings of the Council and establishment and meetings of its Committees (4); NEPC service corporation, NEPC executive officer and staff (5); Finance (6); and Miscellaneous (7).

Policy: Coastal Management Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the management of coastal areas in the State of Victoria to protect and maintain areas of environmental significance on the coast and to maintain and improve coastal water quality. It provides for the establishment and operation of the Victorian Coastal Council and of Regional Coastal Boards. It also promotes a coordinated approach in the preparation and implementation of management plans for coastal Crown lands. The Act consists of 42 sections and is divided into the following parts: Preliminary (1); Coastal planning and management system (2); Coastal planning (3); and Transitional (4).

Policy_Content: La presente Ley instituye la Semana del Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales, la primera semana de junio de cada año, que tendrá por objeto impulsar la preservación, conservación y rescate del medio ambiente y de los recursos naturales, a través de un proceso de concientización y de participación activa de la ciudadanía en general.

Policy: National Energy Board Rules of Practice and Procedure, 1995 (SOR/95-208).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the National Energy Board Act (RSC 1985, c. N-7). The Board regulates pipelines, energy development and trade in the Canadian public interest. The Regulations lay down provisions relating to the Boards’ rules of practices and procedures and their purpose is to provide applicants with a clear definition of the Board’s expectations for complete filings. In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to the National Energy Board’s rules of practices and procedures. The text consists of 56 sections divided into 5 Parts as follows: General (I); Public hearing (II); Applications for review or rehearing (III); Plan, profile and book of reference of a pipeline or an international or inter-provincial power line (IV); Right of entry to lands (V); One Schedule is enclosed.

Policy: Decree of the Minister of Forestry No. 236/Kpts-II/95 re procedures and requirements for applying for forest concessions.
Policy_Content: A Decree to regulate the eligibility of applicants for concessions on public forest land and the procedures of application. Forest concessions shall be the rights granted to manage forests in a forest area covering activities such as wood felling, reafforestation and forest maintenance, forest product processing and marketing in accordance with a working plan (art. 1(1)). Applications can be filed by state-owned companies and (private) Limited Liability Companies. Concessions can be granted on permanenent production forest areas, limited production forest areas or forest areas declared as permanent production forest areas carrying no other rights (art. 2). Survey of the concession area under the guidance of the Director General of Forest Protection and Nature Conservation and an environment impact assessment shall form part of the application procedure. (15 articles and an Annex)
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 22 on the establishment of an integrated forest safeguarding team.
Policy_Content: The Decree concerns the establishment of the Central Integrated Forest Safeguarding Team (TPHT Pusat), which shall: (a) formulate policies on forest safeguarding; (b) control, supervise and coordinate the implementation of forest safeguarding policies. For the implementation of its tasks the TPHT Pusat shall be assisted by (a) a Task force and (b) a Secretariat. Further provisions concern the establishment of Provincial TPHT (Regional TPHT) by the Ministry of Forest as the Chairman of TPHT Pusat.

Policy: Law No. 2.393, ruling on native populations’ permanence in Conservation Units.
Policy_Content: This Law, composed of eight articles, rules on native populations’ permanence in Conservation Units. The Law authorises the State Government to grant the right of using the occupied land to those native populations residing since over 50 years in Rio De Janeiro Conservation Units. The Law also requires native populations to actively participate in the preservation of the aforesaid units. To this end, the Law specifies forbidden activities, natural resources’ conservation duties as well as fines and penalties for non compliance.

Policy: Regional Act No. 44 rearranging environmental controls and setting up the Regional Agency for Environmental Prevention (ARPA) in Emilia-Romagna
Policy_Content: The Regional Agency for Environmental Prevention (ARPA) is hereby set up for the purpose of contributing to protection of the environment in the Emilia Romagna Region, in conjunction with local health authorities, the National Agency for the Protection of the Environment (ANPA) as well as the European Environment Agency. The tasks and duties of the ARPA are listed in article 5. Article 19 states the right to have access to environmental information.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 010/95/AG - Dependencias que estarán a cargo de los contratos de extracción forestal en bosques de libre disponibilidad.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo, que consta de 14 artículos, establece que los contratos de extracción forestal en bosques de libre disponibilidad, con fines industriales y/o comerciales, serán otorgados por: a) el Director de la Agencia Agraria hasta una superficie de 1 000 hectáreas; b) el Director Regional Agrario desde superficie mayor de 1 000 hectáreas hasta 10 000 hectáreas; c) el Director Regional Agrario, autorizado en cada caso por resolución ministerial cuando se trate de superficies mayores a 10 000 hectáreas hasta el máximo que prevé la Ley; cuando se trate de contratos de exploración y evaluación de recursos forestales en bosques de libre disponibilidad, la competencia para cada instancia será hasta por el doble de la superficie prevista para el otorgamiento de contratos de extracción forestal (art. 1º). Las solicitudes deberán estar acompañados de una propuesta técnica que indique cómo serán cumplidas las condiciones a que se refiere la legislación forestal y de fauna silvestre, con precisión de las características de los recursos que se desean aprovechar y ubicación correcta del área comprendida, y será refrendada por un ingeniero forestal colegiado y habilitado (art. 2º). Las Direcciones Regionales Agrarias deberán efectuar la supervisión de contratos y permisos forestales directamente o mediante contratos con personas naturales o jurídicas debidamente registradas (art. 5º).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Measures for the registration and administration of Rural Cooperative Foundation.
Policy_Content: The Measures aim to strengthen the management of the rural cooperative foundations, guarantee the legitimate rights and interests thereof, and promote the healthy development of the rural cooperative foundations. The Measures consist of 25 articles divided into 4 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Registration (II); Supervision and Administration (III); Supplementary Provisions (IV).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Measures entered into force on 19 April 1995.

Policy: Patent Law.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that objects covered by patent can be, inter alia, substances, strain of microorganism, cells of plants and animals for meeting public demand. The right to patent shall be granted to inventor or to his legal successor. Application for issuance of a patent must contain: (a) filled application form; (b) description of utility invention; (c) design if necessary for comprehension of invention; (d) annotation; and (e) document attesting payment of dues for submittal of application.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret nº 95-408 relatif à la lutte contre les bruits de voisinage et modifiant le Code de la santé publique.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions du présent décret modifient le code de la santé publique en ajoutant des dispositions relatives à la lutte contre les bruits de voisinage.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regional Act No. 33 on the protection of genetic resources of indigenous wood flora.
Policy_Content: The Veneto Region promotes the protection and restoration of the indigenous wood flora of the regional territory with a view to contributing to the rational management of regional natural resources. This Act pursues the protection of the genetic resources of the wood flora species listed out in Annex A. To this end, the Region shall: (a) determine the regional forests and plant population thata are most likely to supply seed and propagating material and therefore register them in the Regional Book of Seed Forests referred to in article 4; (b) purchase forest areas of biogenetic importance to be entered into the regional forest domain; (c) provide for the installation and management of arboreal cultures intended for the production of selected propagating material; (d) create the Regional Forestry Nursery, intended for the production of propagating material of certified origin, as per article 7.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Public forest,Registration,Institution,Planting material/seeds,Wild flora,Genetic resources,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 168/95/PE - Designa órgano encargado del Registro administrativo donde se inscribirán las instituciones que realicen estudios de impacto ambiental y programas de adecuación y manejo ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, que consta de 2 artículos, autoriza a la Dirección de Medio Ambiente del Ministerio de Pesquería para llevar el Registro administrativo en el que se inscribirán las instituciones públicas y privadas que realicen estudios de impacto ambiental (EIA) y programas de adecuación y manejo ambiental (PAMA) de las actividades comprendidas en el ámbito sectorial pesquero.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decisión Nº 376 - Crea el Sistema Andino de Normalización, Acreditación, Ensayos, Certificación, Reglamentos Técnicos y Metrología.
Policy_Content: La presente Decisión crea el Sistema Andino de Normalización, Acreditación, Ensayos,  Certificación, Reglamentos Técnicos y Metrología, que tiene por objeto facilitar el comercio intrasubregional, a través de la mejora en la calidad de los productos y servicios, y de la eliminación de las restricciones técnicas al comercio.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Decree No. 139 validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “May Morning”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “May Morning” shall be considered biological (zoological) reserve constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of precious, rare and endangered wild fauna species and natural habitats thereof. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of forest steppe areas of Barabino zone in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection of migration routes, places of mass nesting and gathering of waterfowl and moorfowl, mating and reproduction grounds of roe deer and other wild fauna species; (d) maintenance of the hydrological regime of watercourses ensuring their water cut is not lower than the level of water recorded during the low-water period; (e) protection of habitats of rare and endangered species; (f) maintaining overall ecological balance and stable functioning of ecosystem; and (g) ensuring environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, sport, artisanal hunting and other form of wildlife management; (b) all types of fisheries except for artisanal and sport fishing by local residents; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder and harvesting of spruce and other coniferous tree species for New Year holidays); (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal from natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) washing vehicles in water protection areas and movement of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (y) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons; and (z) stay with unleashed dogs outside residential areas, sharpening and training of hunting dogs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Protection of habitats,Education,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Birds,Endangered species,Game,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 140 validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “Manuylovsky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Manuylovsky” shall be considered biological (zoological) reserve constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of precious, rare and endangered wild fauna species and natural habitats thereof. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of the ancient Sokur Upland in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection of colonies of marmots, reproductive populations and reproductive habitats of elk, roe deer and other wild fauna species; (d) maintaining the hydrological regime of the watercourses, ensuring that their water cut is not lower than the water level recorded during the low-water period; (e) protection of habitats of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (f) maintenance of ecological balance and stability of functioning of ecosystems; and (g) ensuring environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, sport, artisanal hunting and other form of wildlife management; (b) all types of fisheries except for artisanal and sport fishing by local residents; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder and harvesting of spruce and other coniferous tree species for New Year holidays); (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal from natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) washing vehicles in water protection areas and movement of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; Policy: Law No. 2200
Policy_Content: This Law consists of 5 Chapters that contain 26 articles. Chapter 1 lays down the general provisions. Chapter 2 lists the types of activity that are subject to obligatory licensing. Chapter 3 determines licensing for export and import of commodities (produce  service). Chapter 4establishes the modalities of issuing licences. Chapter 5 establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation currently in force on licensing. The types of activity for which licensing is obligatory include land survey, mapping and cartographic practices ; production of ethyl alcohol and spirituous liquors, storage and trade of ethyl alcohol, storage, wholesale and retail sale of spirits (except for beer) ; formal acceptance, storage and processing of grain and the by-products of its processing at grain-elevators. The types of licences are classified in three categories : 1) In accordance with the legal status of the holder (physical and juridical persons of the Republic of Kazakhstan/foreign physical and juridical persons, stateless persons and international organizations) ; 2) In accordance with the amount (general licence that is issued for the unlimited period of time and which may cover more than one type of activity on condition that they are part of the same technological complex/ licences valid only for one (single) operation within the established limits of amount, weight and quantity) ; 3) In accordance with the sphere of application (territorial licences valid only for a part of the territory of Kazakhstan/ valid for the whole territory of Kazakhstan/ valid outside Kazakhstan).
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Instruction No. 29 of 1995 of the Federal Tax Service regarding the application of the Land Charges Act.
Policy_Content: This Instruction is issued on the basis of the Land Charges Act. Use of land shall carry a charge, with the following forms of payment: land tax, rent, normative price of land. The owners, holders and users of land, except leaseholders (tenants), shall be liable to an annual land tax. Land charges are designed to stimulate the rational use, protection and development of lands, to enhance soil fertility, to even out the socio-economic conditions of economic operations on lands of different quality, to ensure the development of the infrastructure in populated localities, and so form special funds to finance these measures. The document consists of VIII Sections that contain 58 Articles. Section I specifies payers of land tax and rental charges for land, and objects liable thereto. Section II establishes land charges benefits and rules for the granting thereof. Section III determines rules of assessment and payment of land tax. Section IV regards rules of review of taxation and payment of sums of tax additionally increased or reduced in the process. Section V deals with the rules of audit of land tax settlements. Section VI establishes payers' liability. Section VII concerns procedure of entry, centralization and use of funds received as land charges. Section VIII establishes normative price of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official promulgation.

Policy: Décret nº 95-414 1995 relatif au comité interministériel d'aménagement et de développement du territoire et pris pour l'application de l'article 33 de la loi nº 95-115 du 4 février 1995 d'orientation pour l'aménagement et le développement du territoire.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 313 on the State Commission on Land Reform.
Policy_Content: The State Commission on Land Reform is responsible for carrying out land reform. It carries out the following functions: (a) elaborates land reform programme; (b) examines and validates territorial land reform programmes; (c) elaborates instructions and recommendations for the implementation of land reform; (d) informs the population on the advancement of land reform.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: Presidential Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Act No. 60 setting up the Regional Agency of Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Act provides for the establishment of the Regional Agency of Environmental Protection (ARPA) which shall exercise advisory and control functions with a view to preventing the deterioration of the environment and ensuring environmental protection. The Agency shall be subject to the surveillance of the President of the Regional Council. Article 3 defines with detail the tasks and duties of the Agency.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Regional Act came into force on 20 April 1995.

Policy: Topsoil Preservation Act (S.N.B. 1995, c. T-7.1).
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits the removal of topsoil from a site or the move of topsoil from a parcel unless with the proper permit. Under section 4, no person shall transport topsoil in, on or by a vehicle on a highway except in accordance with the regulations. The Act provides for inspections, enforcement and offences and penalties.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté nº 13/MDRET/MDR/DGDR portant création d'un comité technique sur l'afforestation et la journée de l'arbre.
Policy_Content: Il est crée sous la présidence du Ministère du développement rural, de l'environnement et du tourisme, un comité technique sur l'afforestation et la journée de l'arbre.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Order No. 95/1 establishing Forest Villagers Development Fund Regulation
Policy_Content: The objective of this Regulation has been determined as reduction of the adverse influence on the forests by the residents of villages within or adjacent to forest by means of contributing to the development thereof, in order to achieve the goals of conservation, development, exploitation and extension of the forests. It covers the scope and types of expenditures to be realized from the Fund, general and specific conditions and guidelines for the contibutions, the term and interest limits, preparation and implementation of the Fund Budget and procurement and sales transactions. Eight sections establishing the conditions to be satisfied in order to benefit from contributions, composition, duties and competencies of the aforementioned Fund governed by the General Directorate and regulating the issuing of such contributions to forest villagers for forestry exploitation (including agricultural activities, tourism establishments, silkworm and apiculture enterprises, etc.).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Law No. 7917 on protecting pastures and meadows.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for the administration, rights of use and protection of pastures and meadows. Pasture and meadows are every kind of land covered by grass or shrubs which forms part of agricultural land or the forest fund according to the cadastral documentation of 1 August 1991 (and not being classified afterwards) which is used for grazing by livestock (art. 2). Pastures and meadows are classified as State-owned, State-owned made available for general use, and pastures and meadows in private or co-ownership (art. 3). Private pastures and meadows of which ownership is certified by legal documents and have clear borders shall be subject to restitution to ex-owners and heritable persons who shall enjoy all the rights of private property (art. 4). Pastures and meadows of the State can be given in tenancy to native natural and legal persons (art. 6). Change of destination of pastures and meadows require approval of either ministry officials or the Minister or the Council of Ministers, depending upon the size of the land in question (art. 8). Provisions of Chapter III deal with contracts of tenancy of State-owned pastures and meadows and the use of such lands. Chapter IV provides for the management and protection of pastures and meadows. The text consists of 29 articles.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Land tenure,Agricultural land,Lease,Land reform
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Law shall enter into force 15 days after publication.

Policy: Forest Fire Prevention and Suppression Regulation (B.C. Reg. 169/95).
Policy_Content: This Regulation has eight Parts, and enacts the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act. Part 1 deals with definitions, Part 2 deals with Personnel and equipment. Section 4 outlines the duties of the firewatcher, that is, a person at a worksite who provides surveillance for forest fires. The rest of this part details the; Fire fighting tools and water delivery systems. Part 3 deals with fire prevention mechanisms. Part 4 outlines stipulations on open fires in or within 1 km of a forest. It is divided in to 5 divisions; Division 1 deals with scope and open fires for cooking, warmth and ceremony. Division 2 outlines provisions concerning small open fires. Division 3 deals with large open fires. Division 4 highlights resource management open fires. Finally Division 5 contains miscellaneous provisions. Part 5 goes in to specific detail in relation to railways. Part 6 outlines forest protection measures. This part is further divided in to 3 divisions, dealing with; planning for protection operations, fire hazard assessment and abatement and initial fire suppression and site rehabilitation. Part 7 stipulates forest fire fighting compensation provisions; whist Part 8 deals with offences. There are also 7 Schedules to this Regulation.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest fires,Forestry protection measures,Forest service/forest officers,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Décret exécutif nº 95-107 fixant l'organisation de la Direction générale de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Ce décret fixe l'organisation de la Direction générale de l'environnement, dans le cadre des attributions dévolues au Ministre de l'intérieur, des collectivités locales, de l'environnement et de la réforme administrative. Cette direction est compétente pour: prévenir toutes les formes de pollution et de dégradation; préserver la diversité biologique; délivrer les visas et les autorisations dans le domaine de l'environnement; approuver les études d'impact sur l'environnement; promouvoir les actions d'information, d'éducation et de sensibilisation ainsi que la coopération internationale.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Primary Industries and Energy Legislation Amendment Act (No. 1) 1995.
Policy_Content: Amendments of the principal Act relate to the introduction of a new section in Part 3 relating to agreements for granting money between the Commonwealth and persons other than States for purposes of rural adjustment.

Policy: Act to amend the Fisheries Act (No. 562 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The amendments of the present Act concern land survey procedures in accordance with the recently enacted Real Property Formation Act (554/95) for various kinds of water areas to which provisions of the Fisheries Act apply. Borders of fish protection areas shall be established by a certified engineer at the request of Fisheries Area Offices (sect. 45). Section 55 provides for the designation by the Land Survey Office of the part in a water area of members in Fisheries Associations in accordance with section 101 of Act 554 of 1995. Also sections 117 and 124 are amended so as to provide for mapping of water areas.
Subject: Fisheries, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Fishing area,Fishery management and conservation,Survey/mapping,Freshwater resources management
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: These amendments came into force on 1 January 1997.

Policy: Act to amend the Act regulating property rights in relation with projects in watercourses (No. 567 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The principal Act provides for the procedures of the application for rights relative to constructions in watercourses or related to watercourses as foreseen in the Water Act (sect. 1). The amendments of the principal Act are made mainly as a consequence of the introduction of the Real Property Formation Act (554/95) which formulates, inter alia, rules relative to land survey and mapping. Section 4 refers to procedures in accordance with section 8(a) of Chapter 21 of the Water Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Act to amend the Rural Activities Management Act (No. 560 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The amendments introduced by the present Act concern the use of land and procedures for the formation of real property. Section 38 is amended so as to provide for formation of common forests and land use rights with respect to common forests, and in particular servitude. Such servitude shall be established in accordance with procedures outlined in section 43. The procedures shall be in accordance with rules laid down by the Real Property Formation Act (No. 554/95).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Nova Scotia Offshore Area Petroleum Production and Conservation Regulations (S.O.R./95-190).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations implements the Canada-Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Resources Accord Implementation Act. They apply a) to every operator who develops a production site or produces petroleum in the offshore area; and b) in respect of every operation related to the production of petroleum from a well in the offshore area. The text consists of 64 articles divided into 9 Parts as follows: Approval and authorizations (I); Well, pool and field evaluations (II); Operation of wells (III); Conservation requirements (IV); Production rates (V); Measurements and testing (VI); Environmental requirements (VII); Operations (VIII), Safety and training of personnel (IX).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Approvals Procedure Regulations (N.S. Reg. 48/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Environment Act. In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to approval procedures. Section 3 establishes that an application for an approval shall be made on a form prescribed by the Minister. The text – consisting of 23 sections – deals, amongst others, with the following aspects: confidential business information, approval application information, review of application, purpose and scope of review, issuance of approval, sampling, duration of approval, transfers, amount of security, compliance monitoring, abandonment and rehabilitation.

Policy: Emergency Spill Regulations (N.S. Reg. 59/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Environment Act. The Regulations apply to an environmental emergency, an unauthorized release or an impending unauthorized release of a contaminant including an environmental emergency, an unauthorized release or impending unauthorized release on lands owned or claimed by Her Majesty in the Right of Canada. The text – consisting of 14 sections – deals with the following aspects: designated contaminants, duty to report the release of a contaminant, verbal reporting requirements, written reporting requirement, emergency order, powers of the Minister/administrator and recovery of cost. Policy: Sulphide Bearing Material Disposal Regulations (N.S. Reg. 57/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Environment Act. The Regulations lay down provisions relating to the disposal of material containing sulphide. Section 4 establishes that no person shall dispose of a sulphide bearing material in the Province where the total volume excavated is greater than 500 m3 in situ or 1300 tonnes unless the person responsible for the disposal holds a valid approval issued under the present Regulations. The text – consisting of 13 sections – deals with the following aspects: exemptions, initial screening, sampling, analysis and evaluation, excavation requirements, disposal of excavated sulphide bearing material, operation of a disposal site and approval application.

Policy_Content: Ce décret porte partie réglementaire du Code forestier. Il est formé par 67 articles répartis en 3 titres, à savoir: Des forêts et du domaine forestier (I); Mise en valeur des forêts (II); Dispositions diverses (III). Il réglemente le plan d'aménagement national, ainsi que les plans locaux et de gestion, la procédure de classement, les défrichements, les contrats de culture et le pâturage, les feux de brousse.

Policy_Content: This Order provides that provisions of the Antarctic Act 1994 of the United Kingdom shall extend to Guernsey subject to the modifications specified in the Schedule to this Order. The modifications all regard adaptations of the original text with a view of application of the Act to Guernsey.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 193 validating the Regulation on state registration of the atmospheric air.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that state register of the atmospheric air shall contain data and documentation on the state of air basin of the country. State register of the atmospheric air shall provide state bodies and legal persons concerned with data and information required for: (a) registration of air pollution in the process of distribution of industrial enterprises; (b) projecting of economic entities and automobile roads under condition of rational management and conservation of the purity of the atmospheric air; (c) prevention of negative impact of the atmosphere on public health; (d) regulation of the emissions to the atmosphere by stationary and non-stationary sources; (e) compliance with air quality standards; and (f) calculation of the atmospheric pollution indices.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Assignment to provinces of the Environment Conservation Act under section 235(8) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa (G.N. R. No. 29 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Notice of the President of South Africa, made under section 235 of the Constitution of South Africa, assigns administration of the Environment Conservation Act, 1989, except provisions which fall outside the functional areas or scope of specified in specified provisions of the Constitution, to a competent authority within the jurisdiction of a province as mentioned in section 124 of the Constitution. The Notice also determines that the Act is assigned to provinces as specified in the Schedule to this Notice and makes consequential amendments to the Act. Furthermore, the Notice contains certain rules regarding the administration of a specified Protected Natural Environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Assignment to provinces under the Mountain Catchment Areas Act in accordance with section 235(8) of the Constitution of South Africa (GN. R. 28 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Notice of the President of South Africa, made pursuant to section 235(8) of the Constitution, assigns the administration of the Mountain Catchment Areas Act, excluding certain functions that fall outside the functional areas specified in Schedule 6 to the Constitution, to a competent authority, to be designated by the Premier of the province concerned,  within the jurisdiction of the government of a province mentioned in section 124 of the Constitution. The Notice defines the extend of the assignment (the whole Act except section 8(2) and amend the Act as specified in the Schedule.

Policy: Loi relative à la prévention de la pollution de la mer par les navires.
Policy_Content: La susdite loi porte la réglementation relative à la prévention de la pollution de la mer par les navires. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, «substance nuisible», «rejet», «port», «bateau de plaisance». L’article 5 établit qu’il est interdit à tout navire battant pavillon belge de rejeter une substance nuisible à la mer sauf dans les cas et de la façon prévus par ou en vertu de la Convention ou de la présente loi. Les règles à prescrire en vertu de la présente loi peuvent notamment différer selon les différentes catégories de navires auxquelles elles se rapportent, les zones maritimes à parcourir, les voyages à effectuer ou les substances nuisibles à transporter. Le texte comprend 39 articles répartis en 8 chapitres comme suit: Définitions et champ d'application (Ier); Obligations générales (II); Obligations du capitaine (III); Surveillance et contrôle (IV); Procédure de recours (V); Dispositions pénales (VI); Modification de la loi organique du 27 décembre 1990 créant des fonds budgétaires. Création du fonds budgétaire "Environnement" (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII).
Subject: Environment gen., Sea

Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Agreement between the states of Berlin and Brandenburg is to: 1) promote a common land use policy; 2) protect and conserve natural living conditions; 3) strengthen the common economic position, as well as 4) integrate the two states in the European Union. The text consists of 24 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: Tasks and competences of the common land use planning (I); Principles, objectives and procedures of the common land use planning (III); Safeguard of land use planning (IV); Preliminary and accompanying instruments of the common land use planning (V).

Policy: Local Government (Planning and Development) (No. 2) Regulations, 1995.
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the principal Regulations of 1994 to provide for the making available for public inspection of documents relating to planning appeals and other matters determined by an Bord Pleanála. In any such case received by an Bord Pleanála on or after 10 April 1995, the documents, including the inspector's report, will be available for inspection for a period of five years commencing on the third working day following the day on which An Bord Pleanála makes its decision. It will be possible also to obtain a copy of all or part of any such document, except a plan or other drawing or a photograph.
