Policy: Environment, Sports and Territories Legislation Amendment Act 1995 (Act No. 25 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The first and second Schedule to this Act set out amendments to the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Act 1975: offences (sect. 38); preparation , amendment and revocation of plans of management by the Marine Park Authority (new Part VB); search powers of inspectors (sect. 46); penalties (various sections); and other matters. The Authority may prepare plans of management for: (a) one or more areas of the Marine Park; (b) one or more species in the Park; (c) one or more ecological communities within the Park (sect. 39X). The main objects of the plans of management are to ensure that appropriate proposals are developed to reduce or eliminate threats to protected natural or cultural values or ecological communities and to provide for a basis for managing the uses of the Park or particular areas of the Park in an ecologically sustainable manner (sect. 39X).
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret nº 95-372 étendant à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte, modifiant et complétant les dispositions du Code rural relatives au conservatoire de l'espace littoral et des rivages lacustres.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte extension et adaptation à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte de la partie réglementaire du livre II (nouveau) du Code rural intitulé Protection de la nature. Il ajoute au titre VI du livre II du Code rural, un chapitre III "Dispositions particulières à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte", relatives, notamment, à la protection de la faune et de la flore, à la chasse, à la pêche en eau douce. Il remplace le deuxième alinéa de l'article R 243-22 par la disposition suivante: "Les lacs entrant dans le champs d'attribution du Conservatoire de l'espace littoral et des rivages lacustres, lorsqu'ils sont situés en totalité ou en partie dans les cantons côtiers, ainsi que ceux qui constituent avec le lac une unité écologique ou paysagère, sont rattachés aux conseils de rivage maritime correspondant".

Le fonds de gestion de l'espace rural, prévu à l'article L. 112-16, est réparti en trois sections: une section gérée au niveau national et destinée au financement d'actions d'expérimentation, d'innovation et d'évaluation en matière de gestion de l'espace rural; une section répartie entre les départements d'outre-mer et les collectivités territoriales de Mayotte et de Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon; une section répartie entre les départements métropolitains autres que Paris, les Hauts-de-Seine, la Seine-Saint-Denis et le Val-de-Marne.

Policy: Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Installations Regulations (S.O.R./95-191).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations lay down provisions concerning petroleum installations in areas offshore Nova Scotia. At the outset the Regulations contain a definition clause relating to various terms employed therein such as “certifying authority”, “class society”, “contingency plan”, “control point”, “control station”, “development plan”, “drilling base”, “drilling unit”, “hazardous area”, “installation”. For the purpose of ensuring the safety of an installation, no operator shall use the installation unless the equipment on the installation is arranged in accordance with these Regulations to a) provide for the safety of personnel; b) minimize damage to the environment; and c) enable easy access to the equipment. The text consists of 27 sections.

Policy: Water Catchment Rules 1995 (S.R.O. No. 11 of 1995).

Rule 5 contains provisions relative to the design, location and operation of sewerage systems, cesspool or septic tanks of dwelling houses. Applications to alter, construct or extend individual sewerage disposal systems shall be made to the manager of DOWASCO Ltd. This company may also enter protected forests at any time and carry out or survey works as the Minister may direct. (9 rules)

Policy_Content: These Regulations define which areas along rivers, streams and lakes form part of a water catchment area and place restrictions on activities within such areas. Inland waters are classified as class A, B, or C streams and appropriate protected areas are designed for each class. The operations which are allowed in protected areas under certain conditions include timber extraction and logging. (8 sections)

Policy: Circular guiding the setting up and appraisal of assessment report on environmental impact.
Policy_Content: This Circular concerns environmental protection as regards to the appraisal and implementation of foreign direct investment projects. The licensing of investment projects will be dependent on the results of environmental assessment reports. When submitting an investment licensing application, investors must prepare an explanatory report describing any factors that may have an environmental impact. It is on this basis that the relevant State management agency will give consideration when appraising the project file. The appraisal note made in respect of the assessment report acts as the basis for obtaining construction permits. The State agencies will also be responsible for environmental protection inspection following construction. The project investors must undertake any necessary measures to comply with requirements if the project does not meet the approved environmental requirements. Under section 3, an assessment report on environmental impact shall contain information such as a brief description of the project, the possible impact of the project on environmental factors and impacts on factors related to the living standards of people. The report also outlines the proposed solutions for the protection of the environment following completion of the project (sect. 4).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: EIA,Pollution control,Inspection,Data collection/reporting,Environmental planning,Land-use planning,Monitoring,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Use restrictions
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Forest Rules, 2051 (1995).
Policy_Content: The Rules aim at regulating the management and the rational exploitation of forests and forestry products. In particular, it draws a distinction among the following categories of forest: 1) Government-managed forests; 2) protected forests; 3) community forests; 4) leasehold forests; 5) religious forests; 6) private forests. Based on the classification mentioned above, the Rules establish the formulation of an operational plan and lists out the particulars to be mentioned therein. Moreover, it makes provisions for the granting of the required licenses as well as for the collection, sale and distribution of forest products (timber, firewood, medicinal herbs and non-timber products). Further provisions concern tree marking, grazing and transport of timber. The Rules make provision for the management of a part of a national forest by a User Group as a community forest and states the procedure to be followed for its establishment, registration and resumption. As far as the leasehold forests are concerned, chapter 5 deals, in addition to the aforementioned matters, with the right to sell or transfer rights, the ownership of trees existing at the time of handover, fees to be paid by the lessee. These Rules consist of 8 Chapters divided into 69 sections, and 25 Schedules.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Non-timber products,Policy/planning,Transport/storage,Classification/declassification,International trade,Marking/identification,Public forest,Authorization/permit,Timber extraction/logging,Royalties/fees,Community management,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: These Rules enter into force immediately.

Policy: Resolución Nº 15/95 - Funciones asignadas a la Dirección Forestal y a la Dirección del Plan Turquino-Manatí.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución elenca 28 funciones para la Dirección Forestal. Entre ellas resaltan: a) proponer, y una vez aprobada, dirigir, instrumentar, orientar y controlar la política del Estado para el fomento del patrimonio forestal y la fauna cinegética, así como el uso racional de sus productos; b) proponer los programas y estrategias de la política forestal del país en consonancia con los lineamientos generales que para el manejo y explotación de los recursos del patrimonio forestal y fauna cinegética establece el Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología y Medio Ambiente; c) elaborar y controlar las metodologías, así como dirigir los trabajos de inventario y ordenación de bosques; d) dirigir, instrumentar, orientar y controlar la política de reforestación, incluida la producción de semillas y especies; e) controlar en lo que compete a la actividad forestal, la ejecución de los proyectos de manejo y ordenación de cuencas hidrográficas; f) supervisar y controlar los aprovechamientos del patrimonio forestal con fines comerciales e industriales; g) adoptar las medidas necesarias encaminadas al manejo y utilización sostenible de la fauna cinegética, así como regular y controlar su aprovechamiento con fines deportivos y comerciales; h) proponer las regulaciones para la caza y la veda de las diferentes especies de la fauna silvestre; i) dictaminar la introducción de especies exóticas de origen forestal y regular la exportación de productos forestales; j) proponer la política de precios e incentivos para estimular las producciones y actividades forestales; k) controlar el otorgamiento de permisos y autorizaciones para el uso de las tierras forestales con fines agrícolas, ganaderos, turísticos, mineros o de otra índole.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Forest Law, 1995.
Policy_Content: Purpose of this Law is "to regulate the protection of forests, the proper utilization and regeneration of forests" (art. 1). The State may grant to citizens, economic entities and organizations (a) ownership rights, (b) the use of forests and forest products and (c) the ownership of timber, according to the legislation in force, contracts and licences and upon payment of the relevant charges. The management regime of forests is based on the following classification: (a) Special forest zones, consisting of sub-alpine forests, virgin zones and protected zones within National Conservation Parks; (b) Protected forest zones, which include, inter alia, forests of the specially protected areas, the green zone, prohibited strips, oases, small tree groupings, etc.; (c) Industrial forest zones, consisting of all other forests except those listed above. Management and conservation measures shall include forest fire protection, protection from diseases and harmful insects and cleaning of forests. Chapter 6 deals with forest utilization, i.e. determination of the volume of the harvest, stipulation of timber contracts, issuance of licences for cutting trees, obligations of the forest user, etc.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Basic legislation,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Non-timber products,Classification/declassification,Protected area,Forest fires,Afforestation/reforestation,Timber extraction/logging,Offences/penalties,Authorization/permit

Policy: Acuerdo sobre identidad y derechos de los pueblos indígenas.
Policy_Content: Las disposiciones del presente Acuerdo tienen por objeto el reconocimiento de la identidad y de los derechos culturales, civiles, políticos, sociales y económicos de los pueblos indígenas de Guatemala. Entre los derechos reconocidos se contemplan aquellos relativos a la tierra, los cuales incluyen tanto la tenencia comunal o colectiva, como la individual, los derechos de propiedad, de posesión y otros derechos reales, así como el aprovechamiento de los recursos naturales en beneficio de las comunidades, sin perjuicio de su hábitat. En este marco, el Acuerdo establece que el Gobierno adopte o promueva medidas para regularizar la situación jurídica de la posesión comunal de tierras por las comunidades que carecen de títulos de propiedad, incluyendo la titulación de las tierras municipales o nacionales con clara tradición comunal. Para ello, en cada municipio se realizará un inventario de la situación de tenencia de la tierra.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Law No. 11.206 establishing the Forestry Policy of the State of Pernambuco.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 Chapters divided into 79 articles, establishes the Forestry Policy of the State of Pernambuco. This Forestry Policy defines all the forestry related sectors and specifies the importance of forestry resources and related biodiversity. It aims at the management protection and use of the forestry resources in order to improve and rehabilitate the quality of environment, to guarantee sustainable development conditions to local populations in the following areas: economic development of this sector; social function of ownership; rational use of forests and other plants; social, ecological and  economic importance of forests; State commitments to protect and rehabilitate forests and other plants; and other activities related to forestry sector. The Policy also establishes all the necessary requirements to be satisfied in order to perform any activity in this sector.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Survey and Mapping Regulations of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.
Policy_Content: These Regulations are enacted to strengthen the administration on surveying and mapping and promote the development of the surveying and mapping undertaking. The Regulations consist of 54 Articles divided into 10 Chapters: General Provisions (I);  Surveying and Mapping Datums and Systems (II); Basic Surveying and Mapping (III); Boundary Surveying and Mapping and Other Surveying and Mapping (IV); Surveying and Mapping Qualifications and Surveying and Mapping Market (V); Administration on Maps (VI);  Administration on the Surveying and Mapping Results (VII) ;   Protection and Administration of Survey Markers (VIII); Legal Liabilities (IX); Supplementary Provisions (X).
Subject: Land & soil, Sea, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 1000 on single duty.
Policy_Content: Single duty is paid by physical persons selling products, commodities and agricultural products in the markets, fairs and in other places especially allotted for trade. The Law consists of 8 Articles Article 1 specifies payers of single duty. Article 2 specifies objects liable to single duty. Article 3 regards procedure of withdrawal of single duty. Article 4 classifies categories of single duties. Article 5 establishes obligations and responsibility of payers and persons taking single duties. Article 6 establishes Procedure of use of money obtained in the form of single duties. Article 7 establishes control over withdrawal of single duties. Article 8 gives instruction on application of the present Law.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Law on energy (No. I-828).
Policy_Content: This Law defines the general provisions of energy  activities, the basic principles of  energy development, functioning and management. Activities of individual sectors of energy, of state, municipal and private energy enterprises, energy producers, suppliers and consumers, their legal and economic relations when the object thereof is energy or energy resources, shall be regulated by other laws and subordinate legislation. The principal goals of the state energy policy shall be: (a) energy saving; (b) efficient consumption of primary energy resources; (c) reduction of comparative energy consumption for the production of the national product; (d) reliable supply of energy resources; (e) promotion of renewable energy use; and (f) reduction of adverse effects of energy on the environment. Special Energy Saving Fund shall be set up for the purpose of efficient implementation of the arrangements for the supply of energy resources, energy production and consumption. Energy activities shall be regulated by laws on environmental protection and it shall be prohibited to initiate any energy activity if they are not complying with the environmental norms and standards. Energy activities shall be subject to licensing. Energy sectors shall be classified as follows: (a) electric energy; (b) thermal energy; and (c) gas and petroleum.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Limitation Act (Cap. 83).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes periods of limitation and other limitations for bringing actions of the various classes mentioned in the Act. Section 42 extends the applicability of the Act also to arbitration. Actions include various actions in respect of land: actions to recover land by the Crown or any person and rent; action to recover money secured by a mortgage or charge or to recover proceeds of the sale of land; and actions in respect of trust property or the personal estate of deceased persons and actions for an account.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Ley Nº 9/1995 - Medidas de política territorial, suelo y urbanismo.
Policy_Content: La Ley consta de 10 títulos, 118 artículos, 4 disposiciones adicionales, 3 transitorias, una derogatoria y 5 finales. Esta Ley tiene por objeto: a) la regulación de los instrumentos de ordenación o gobierno del territorio necesarios para la determinación de la estrategia territorial de la Comunidad de Madrid; b) el establecimiento y la organización de la concertación interadministrativa en materia de ordenación del territorio y urbanismo; c) la ordenación de la actividad urbanística directa y propia de la Comunidad de Madrid, en el mercado de la ordenación del territorio; d) el desarrollo del régimen urbanístico del suelo no urbanizable y urbanizable no programado; e) la precisión y mejora de la ejecución del planeamiento urbanístico y la regulación de la intervención pública en el mercado de suelo; f) la regulación del ejercicio de la potestad expropiatoria por razón de urbanismo; g) el establecimiento y articulación de medidas de garantía y fomento para la rehabilitación del patrimonio inmobiliario; y h) la adopción de medidas para incrementar la eficacia administrativa en la gestión urbanística. (art. 1º) El artículo 2º establece como competencias urbanísticas de la Comunidad de Madrid la elaboración, formulación, tramitación y aprobación de los instrumentos o planes de ordenación del territorio, sin perjuicio de la participación de los municipios en los términos de la ordenación de los correspondientes procedimientos. El artículo 3º fija el principio que la actividad urbanística constituye, en su conjunto, una función pública, cuya titularidad y responsabilidad corresponden a las administraciones públicas competentes.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,Environmental planning,Urban land,Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Institution,Protected area

Policy: Regulation implementing the Ordinance on contributions for protection of agricultural land.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation implements the Ordinance of 16 November 1994 on contributions for the protection of agricultural land. Part 1 establishes the specific competence of the various authorities and offices dealing with the subject matter. Part 2 lays down provisions relating to selected areas and, in particular, to their specific requirements, as well as provisions relating to details of application forms to claim payment, etc. The text consists of 31 articles divided into 3 Parts.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Agreement between the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and the Committee on Geology and the Use of Subsoil on cooperation of their bodies regarding state control over environmental protection at the objects of the use of subsoil (1995).
Policy_Content: The present Agreement establishes the main directions of and principles of inter-action between the Ministry and the Committee and their territorial bodies in the process of carrying out state control over environmental protection at the objects of the use of subsoil. The competence of the Ministry and the Committee is distributed in the following manner: 1. the Ministry carries out state ecological control over the impact of subsoil on atmospheric air, surface water, soil, natural landscapes, the vegetable kingdom and wildlife, as well as the state of water basins and the ground of inland water basins, territorial sea, EEZ, continental shelf outside EEZ and the plots of the World Ocean assigned to the Russian Federation; 2. the Committee carries out state control over the rational use of subsoil in the process of management of underground resources under the surface soil and bottom silt accessible for geological study and management. Control must be carried out at the platforms determined by licences for the use of subsoil issued by the Committee, as well as at the platforms of the regional and other geological works carried out without licence.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water

Policy: Land Administration Act 1995 (No. 2 of 1995).
Policy_Content: Section 2 empowers the Minister of Land Affairs to delegate any power conferred upon him or her by or under a law regarding land matters to a premier or member of the Executive Council of a Province or any officer contemplated in section 1 of the Local Government Transition Act, 1993. The power delegated shall be exercised subject to directions of the Minister. The Premier or a member of the Executive Council may again delegate the power delegated to him or her to specified local government officials. The President may, by proclamation in the Gazette, assign the administration of a law reading land matters to a Premier of a province or reassign the administration of a law assigned to a Premier to a Minister referred to in section 88 of the Constitution. The President is granted certain powers with respect to modification of the law and regulation making in the case of assignment by him or her of administration of a law in terms of this Act. The President is also granted certain legislation making or amending powers for the purpose of uniformity of laws in respect of land matters. Repeal, amendment or adaptation of any law shall be done by Proclamation published in the Gazette.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Pictou Landing Indian Band Agreement Act (S.C. 1995, c. 4).
Policy_Content: The present Act approves the Agreement concluded on July 20, 1993 between Her Majesty in right of Canada and the Pictou Landing Indian Band. Section 4 deals with recourse for individual claims establishing that claims by members of the Pictou Landing Indian Band arising from the adverse effects referred to in section 13 of the Agreement may only be made against the continuing compensation account, and in accordance with the procedure, referred to in that section. The text consists of 4 sections.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: Cet arrêté porte approbation du cahier des charges fixant les clauses et conditions générales des concesions agricoles en Guyane, attribuées en application de l'article R 170-31 du Code du domaine de l'Etat en vue de la culture ou de l'élevage en Guyane.

Policy: Local Government (Planning and Development) Regulations, 1995.
Policy_Content: The changes made relate to exempted development, the requirements and procedures in respect of planning applications, Part X of the 1994 Regulations and prescribed forms. Works consisting of or incidental to the carrying out of development referred to in section 84 (4) (a) of the Environmental Protection Agency Act, 1992 (No. 7 of 1992) for the purpose of giving effect to a condition attached to a licence or revised licence granted by the Environmental Protection Agency under Part IV of the said Act shall be exempted development.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi fédéral concernant la coopération avec les Etats d'Europe de l'Est.
Policy_Content: Un arrêté fédéral concernant la coopération avec les Etats d'Europe de l'Est. Cette coopération a, entres autres, pour but: la promotion d'une développement économique et social durable, conforme aux principes de l'économie de marché et favorisant la stabilité économique, le développement culturel, l'accroissement des revenus et l'amélioration des conditions de vie des populations, tout en encourageant le respect de l'environnement ainsi que l'utilisation rationnelle des ressources naturelles. Les moyens nécessaires au financement de la coopération avec les Etats d'Europe de l'Est sont alloués sous forme de crédits de programme ouverts pour plusieurs années. L'arrêté comprend 18 articles divisés en 5 sections.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent arrêté entre en vigueur le 1er mars 1998.

Policy: Loi fédérale sur l’égalité entre femmes et hommes (Loi sur l’égalité, LEg)
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour but de promouvoir dans les faits l’égalité entre femmes et hommes. Les dispositions de la présente section s’appliquent aux rapports de travail régis par le code des obligations et par le droit public fédéral, cantonal ou communal. Il est interdit de discriminer les travailleurs à raison du sexe, soit directement, soit indirectement, notamment en se fondant sur leur état civil ou leur situation familiale ou, s’agissant de femmes, leur grossesse. L’interdiction de toute discrimination s’applique notamment à l’embauche, à l’attribution des tâches, à l’aménagement des conditions de travail, à la rémunération, à la formation et à la formation continue, à la promotion et à la résiliation des rapports de travail.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 542/93 - Ley de los recursos forestales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de interés social el aprovechamiento y el manejo sostenible y racional de los bosques y tierras forestales del país, así como también el de los recursos naturales renovables que se incluyen en el régimen de esta Ley. Se declaran asimismo de interés público y obligatorios la protección, conservación, mejoramiento y acrecentamiento de los recursos forestales. Son objetivos fundamentales de esta Ley: a) la protección, conservación, aumento, renovación y aprovechamiento sostenible y racional de los recursos forestales del país; b) la incorporación al patrimonio y economía nacional de aquellas tierras que puedan mantener vegetación forestal, como bienes de producción de recursos forestales; c) la regulación de las actividades de sustitución o eliminación de la cobertura forestal natural por des d) la protección de las cuencas hídricas, nacientes naturales de agua y el control de la erosión de los suelos, en coordinación con los organismos pertinentes; e) la promoción de la forestación, reforestación, protección de cultivos, defensa y embellecimiento de las vías de comunicación, de salud pública y de áreas de turismo; f) el ordenamiento y desarrollo del sector económico forestal, en sus fases de producción, aprovechamiento, elaboración, consumo y comercialización; g) el estudio, la investigación y la difusión de las disciplinas forestales y del medio ambiente; h) el perfeccionamiento de la capacidad técnica y de gestión de la administración forestal pública; i) la promoción y el fomento de la industrialización forestal y el uso eficiente de sus materias primas; j) la prevención y represión del tráfico ilegal de maderas en rollos y elaboradas; y, k) la conservación y promoción de los recursos naturales en todo el territorio nacional con el objeto de mejorar el equilibrio ambiental y obtener beneficios.
Subject: Forestry, Water
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Framework law,Institution,Afforestation/reforestation,Erosion,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Protected area,Mountain area,Special fund,Forest service/forest officers,Private forest,Public forest,Research,Environmental standards,Monitoring,Indigenous peoples,Water conservation zone
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic North Ossetia-Alania regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of environmental protection and the use of natural resources.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic North Ossetia-Alania have agreed as follows: 1) To carry out common state policy in the field of environmental protection and ensuring ecological safety. 2) Land and other natural resources are used and protected in the Republic North Ossetia-Alania as the basis of vital activity of its people. 3) To provide for common regulation in the field of licensing of some types of natural resources. 4) The Parties, for the purpose of ensuring environmental protection must secure the observance of environmental legislation and enforce the liability for its violation; keep record of natural resources and their use and carry out environmental monitoring; to make arrangements for reproduction, conservation and renewal of wildlife species and biodiversity; develop and maintain the system of protected areas, natural reserves and National Parks, and to restrict economic and other types of activity in the adjoining areas; to carry out state ecological expertise of productive forces, investment and other types of projects and economic development programs; to keep state Red Books. 5) The Parties, for the purpose of carrying out common policy in the field of environmental protection and use of natural resources must co-ordinate adopted environmental legislative acts, ecological norms and standards; elaborate and carry out joint programs and projects in the field of environmental protection and ecological safety; make all-round assessment of ecological consequences of economic and other types of activity carried out on their territories; set up and support common ecological information system. 6) The competent authority of the Parties, for the purpose of carrying out joint plenary powers institute Co-ordinating Council. They can set up common institutions on the basis of separate agreements.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Monitoring,Registration,Protected area,EIA,Biodiversity,Endangered species,National parks,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Ley Nº 3/1995 - Ley de Vías Pecuarias.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el régimen jurídico de las vías pecuarias. Se entiende por vías pecuarias las rutas o itinerarios por donde discurre o ha venido discurriendo tradicionalmente el tránsito ganadero. Asimismo, las vías pecuarias podrán ser destinadas a otros usos compatibles y complementarios en términos acordes con su naturaleza y sus fines, dando prioridad al tránsito ganadero y otros usos rurales, e inspirándose en el desarrollo sostenible y el respeto al medio ambiente, al paisaje y al patrimonio natural y cultural. Las vías pecuarias son bienes de dominio público de las Comunidades Autónomas y, en consecuencia, inalienables, imprescriptibles e inembargables. La Ley distingue tres tipos de vías pecuarias: cañadas (cuya anchura no excede de los 75 metros); cordeles (cuya anchura no sobrepasa los 37,5 metros); y veredas (que tienen una anchura no superior a los 20 metros). Los abrevaderos, descansaderos, majadas y demás lugares asociados al tránsito ganadero tendrán la superficie que determine el acto administrativo de clasificación.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolution No. 28 of 1995 establishing the Environmental Protection Council.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 2 articles. Article 1 deals with the establishment, management and internal organization of the Council.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania regarding delimitation of plenary powers as regards providing facilities in sanatoria and health resorts, rest and tourism.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian federation and the Government of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania consider it necessary that for priority development of health resorts and tourism on the territory of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania to elaborate and validate federal and territorial programs. The purpose of the aforesaid programs is to elaborate and introduce efficient system of measures and mechanisms of state influence for ensuring rational use of economic and health resort and recreational potential of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania for cure, rehabilitation and prophylaxis of the most widely spread illnesses, active rest of the population of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania, the Russian Federation and other countries; organization of the health resort region; maintenance and re-construction of sanatoria sites and health resorts; ecological improvement of the territory of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania; conservation of natural resources and historical and cultural heritage. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation exercises authority in the sphere of regulation of functioning, development and protection of health resorts, recreational localities and natural health resources as regards: a) determination of the main directions of state policy in the sphere of sanatoria, health resorts and rest of the population; b) improvement of the legislation concerning natural healing resources, recreational localities and health resorts; c) establishment of norms and regulations regarding the use of natural healing resources, recreational localities and health resorts; d) state registration of health resorts, recreational facilities and keeping register of recreational localities and health resorts; e) delimitation of boundaries and regime of districts of sanitary (mountain-sanitary) protection of recreational localities and health resorts of federal importance.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania regarding ownership, use and management of land and other natural resources.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania have agreed as follows: 1) Land, subsoil, water and other natural resources within the boundaries of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania being public property is managed and protected as the basis of life and vital activity. 2) The parties recognize the presence on the territory of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania of natural resources pertaining to federal, republican and joint management. 3) The parties carry out by mutual agreement delimitation, management and utilization of natural resources taking into account the interests of the people living on the territory of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania. 4) The parties have agreed that utilization and management of the objects pertaining to federal property on the territory of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania is carried out by the Government of the Russian Federation reciprocally with executive bodies of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania. 5) The Government of the Russian Federation is entitled to carry out regulation, co-ordination and financing of the programs concerning the use of natural resources of federal importance in the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Public land,Land tenure,Land-use planning,Freshwater resources management,Sustainable development,Transboundary effects
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania.
Policy_Content: The authorized representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania have agreed on the following: 1)The relations between State Bodies of the Russian Federation and State Bodies of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania shall be governed by the Constitution of the Russian Federation, the Constitution of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania and the present Treaty. 2) The Republic of North Ossetia-Alania shall execute the authority in the following fields: a) management of state property; b) decide issues relating to possession, use and disposal of land, subsoil, water, forest resources in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation and the legislation of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania; c) conservation of natural, historical and cultural monuments. 3) The Russian Federation and the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania jointly are authorized to administer the following issues: a) management of state property; b) decide issues relating to possession, use and disposal of land, subsoil, water and other natural resources. b) delimitation of state property; c) management of natural resources, environmental protection and ensuring ecological safety, protected areas, conservation of historical and cultural monuments; d) conservation, utilization development and protection of health resorts, medicinal and sanitary localities and natural health resorts situated on the territory of the Republic; e) carrying out the arrangements for the prevention of natural disaster and liquidation of their consequences. 4) The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation: a) federal state property and its management; b) establishment of the basis for federal policy and federal programs in the field of governmental, economic, environmental, social, cultural and national development of the Russian Federation; c) federal power systems, nuclear energy, fissile materials, federal transport, traffic, communication pathways, information and communication systems; d) status and defence of state borders, territorial waters, air space, the exclusive economic zones and continental shelf of the Russian Federation; e) meteorological service, standards, gauges, metric system and time calculation, geodesy and cartography; f) Federal State Service.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Disasters,Environmental planning,Cultural heritage,Navigation,Continental shelf,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Land reform,Land tenure,Public land,Land-use planning
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy_Content: These Regulations are enacted in accordance with the Air Pollution Control Act.

Policy: Regulation on suspension of equipment, installations, works, proceedings, enterprises and organization infringing environmental protection terms and conditions.
Policy_Content: This Regulation governs the activity of the environmental protection bodies as regards application thereby of administrative proceedings such as suspension of technological equipment, enterprises and organizations in case of the infringement of environmental legislation and, in particular, excessive discharge of wastewater, emissions to the atmosphere and waste management. Legalized administrative regulation of suspension of proceedings shall be handed over to the manager of the suspended works. Suspension shall be carried out in the form of sealing waterworks, air protection equipment or main installation or equipment governing production process. Suspension shall not be authorized for continuing technological processes if it can cause emergency situations.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 317 regarding the state control of the state, reproduction, protection, conservation and management of forests.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the state control shall be to ensure compliance with the established regulations on forest management, forest uses, registration, protection, conservation and monitoring of forests with a view of ensuring rational and inexhaustible use of the forest resources. The state control consists of: (a) forest monitoring; (b) environmental audit; (c) periodical control of forest management activities; (d) regional inspections. The state forest service shall have the competence as regards: (a) enforcement and compliance with forest legislation; (b) forest registration; (c) forestry; (d) allotment of standing timber and timber extraction; (e) forest use for research and hunting; (f) compliance with forest seeds harvest, storage and processing requirements; (g) compliance with protected areas requirements; (h) compliance with forest fires requirements; (i) compliance with requirements set for forest pest control.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy_Content: The amendments of the above-mentioned Ordinance (BGBl. 245/1995) concern, inter alia, replacement of article 4 on monitoring of sick wood. Policy: Environmental Assessment Regulations (N.S. Reg. 26/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under section 49 of the Environment Act and provide together with the Act the legislative framework for environmental assessment . Act and Regulations are administrated by the Environmental Assessment Administrator. The Environmental Assessment Branch (EA Branch) promotes good project planning and sustainable development through the coordination and administration of environmental assessment in Nova Scotia. Table 1 lists developments required to undergo an environmental assessment. These developments are called undertakings and are divided into two classes, Class 1 and Class 2. The text consists of 31 sections and 1 Schedule.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Mining Proclamation No. 68/1995.
Policy_Content: The Proclamation shall apply to all mining operations, i.e. acts carried out to prospect, explore and mine for minerals within the territory of Eritrea. No person may carry out any mining operations without a license granted under this Proclamation. A person applying for a right must be eligible in accordance with section 5. Certain criteria do not apply to persons wishing to acquire an Artisanal mining right (as defined in section 2). Any Eritrean may prospect without a license on land not already subject to an existing license or application for a license. The Government may designate areas reserved for or excluded form specified mining operations (sect. 6). Section 8 defines a prospecting license, whereas section 9 provide for exploitation licenses. Discoveries of existence of minerals shall be immediately notified to the Controller, i.e. a person appointed by the Licensing Authority to control mining operations (sects. 12 and 13). An Artisanal mining license may be granted in respect of a part of the surface of an area subject t an existing exploration license (sect. 14). Sections 16 and 17 deal with mining licenses. Mineral water may be used or produced in accordance with section 18. Sections 20 to 27 specify rights and obligations of licensees. The licensee may occupy land covered by the license during the term of the license. All types of licenses shall be issued by the Ministry of Energy, Mines and Water Resources acting as Licensing Authority (sect. 43). Section 45 deals with registration and representation of licensees. Section 48 concerns settlement of disputes.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Regulations on mining operations (L.N. No. 19/1995).

Policy: Regional Governor’s Decree No. 110 validating the Regulation on state botanical reserve “Bazhygan”.
Policy_Content: State botanical reserve “Bazhygan” is natural (botanical) protected area of regional significance formed for the preservation and reproduction of valuable, rare and endangered natural resources of the wild flora of the semi-desert steppes of the region without expropriation of land plots from tenants. The reserve performs the functions of preserving and reproducing the reference variant of the vegetation of the steppe semi-desert. Within 100 sq. m, there are 35 species of vascular plants. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) plowing of land; (b) grazing and transit of livestock; (c) digging up plants, collecting flowers, fruits and berries; (d) construction of buildings, structures, roads, pipelines, power lines and other communications; (e) planting of alien species; (f) reclamation work; (g) the use of pesticides, mineral fertilizers, plant protection chemicals and growth stimulants; (h) mining and exploration work; (i) movement and parking of all types of transport means; (j) unorganized recreation of the population, arrangement of rest halts, bivouacs and tourist camps; (k) systematic continuous mowing and burning of grass stand; and (l) hunting. The following types of economic activities shall be limited: (a) excursions and other forms of recreation; and (b) haymaking (mowing shall be carried out with leaving stripes-crests).
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wild flora,Plant variety,Protection of species

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 230 implementing Directives (Euratom) No. 80/836, 84/467, 89/618, 90/641 and 92/3 in matter of ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: The present Legislative Decree has been enacted in implementation of a number of Euratom Directives relative to ionizing radiation. The Legislative Decree is composed of twelve Chapters and five Annexes. Chapter I defines the application scope and lays down general principles concerning the protection against those dangers that might arise from ionizing radiation. The provisions hereby established shall apply to: (a) the realization, operation and closing of nuclear installations; (b) the production, importation, exportation, manipulation, treatment, use, transport, keeping, collection and disposal of radioactive materials; (c) any other activity that implies the risk of dangers due to ionizing radiation. Annex I describes with further details the conditions that shall determine the application of the Legislative Decree. Article 2 defines the principles to be implemented in order to guarantee health safety and the protection of the population, workers and the environment against ionizing radiation. Chapter II lays down numerous definitions. Chapter III defines the competences of different institutions and provides for the setting up of specific organisms. The Interdepartmental Council for Coordination and Consultancy in matters connected with the pacific use of nuclear energy is established by article 8. The Technical Commission for Nuclear Energy is set up under the National Agency for Environmental Protection (ANPA) by article 9. The ANPA is charged with inspective functions (art. 10). Chapter V makes detailed provisions as regards the importation, production, marketing, transport and keeping of radioactive materials. Such activities shall be subject to the prior notification to the competent Ministries. Chapter VI lays down rules on the authorization required for installations and contains particular provisions as regards radioactive waste. Chapter VIII is entirely devoted to health safety of workers. Article 104 concerns controls on environmental radioactivity to be carried out by the Ministry of the Environment. Controls on foods and beverages destined to human or animal consumption shall be carried out by the Ministry of Health. Chapter X describes the content of the plans to be approved and implemented in case of nuclear emergency. Chapter XI lays down penalties.
Subject: Energy, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Gene Technology Act (No. 377 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act aims at: securing an ethical and safe use and development of genetic technology and to prevent damage to public health, to health of animals or the environment that may be caused by use of genetically modified organisms. The Act regulates use, production, importation, sale, and other placing on the market of genetically modified organisms and products that contain such organisms.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 114 implementing Directive 87/217/EEC on the prevention and reduction of environmental pollution by asbestos.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree implements at national level Council Directive 87/217/EEC which aims at preventing and reducing pollution caused by asbestos in the interests of the protection of human health and the environment. Article 1 of the Legislative Decree establishes limit values applicable to asbestos emissions into the air. Annex A describes the procedures and methods to be followed in order to measure air pollution levels. Article 2, on the other side, prescribes limit values to be applied to effluents resulting from industrial activities. Annex B regulates their respective analysis methods and procedures. Article 4 concerns duty to report and data transmission. The competent authorities shall submit annually to the Ministry of the Environment and to the Ministry of Health a report relative to the activities that have been carried out in order to ensure compliance with the limit values hereby prescribed. The Ministry of the Environment shall therefore present to the European Commission its own report.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Hazardous waste,Waste non-domestic sources,Effluent waste water/discharge

Policy: Official Letter No.2-11/531 of1995 of the Committee on land resources and land survey regarding the modalities of official registration of the map of the plots of land conceded on condition of ownership.
Policy_Content: The Committee on land resources and land survey specifies that in the process official registration of the map of the plots of land in the upper left corner of the document is adduced the series of the respective Ownership certificate of a physical or juridical person to a given plot of land while the number of the same Ownership certificate is adduced in the line 8220;. The cadastre number of the plot of land is adduced over this line. Surname, first name of a physical person or the name of a juridical person, location of the plot of land (area, condominium, cooperative and so on), as well as predestination of the plot of land are reported in the blank after the wording 8221;. Other requirements as regards official registration of the map of a plot of land are regulated on the basis of 8221; validated by the Committee on the 15th of February 1994. The Annex contains a sample of the official registration of the plot of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 290 - Ley de Régimen Especial y Transitorio de la Promesa de Venta, dentro del Programa de Transferencia de Tierras.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que tiene por objeto establecer un régimen jurídico especial y transitorio que regule el contrato de promesa de venta a fin de asegurar la negociación de los inmuebles ofertados por medio del Banco de Tierras, se inscribe en el contexto del Decreto Legislativo Nº 150, de 11 de octubre de 1994, que emitió la Ley Transitoria para la Agilización del Programa de Transferencia de Tierras (PTT), con el propósito de procurar que dicho programa consolide y de cumplimiento a los Acuerdos de Paz, así como de establecer mecanismos jurídicos transitorios que faciliten la transferencia voluntaria de los inmuebles a favor de los beneficiarios del PTT. El artículo 13 establece que la presente Ley no será aplicable para las propiedades que a la fecha de vigencia de ésta, cumplan con los requisitos legales correspondientes para la celebrar la compraventa respectiva.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Act on prevention of marine pollution by vessels.
Policy_Content: The Act is composed of eight Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Utilization pollution from vessels (Sec.2); Sinking of wastes and other substances from vessels (sect. 3); Preventing water pollution and international cooperation (sect. 4); Control on vessels (sect. 5); Functioning of directorate of the marine office (sect. 6); Penal provisions (sect. 7); Changes in valid provisions, and final provisions (sect. 8). The Act applies to: vessels on Polish marine areas; Polish vessels which are out of Polish marine areas. A vessel can be allowed to navigate in maritime waters only when it fulfills the conditions of marine pollution prevention hereby established. .
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Ley que crea el Instituto para el Desarrollo de Sistemas de Producción del Trópico Húmedo de Tabasco.
Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Ley se crea el Instituto para el Desarrollo de Sistemas de Producción del Trópico Húmedo de Tabasco, cuyos objetivos primordiales consisten en: a) coordinar, fomentar, promover y divulgar la generación de metodologías en sistemas de producción tropical, empleando como estrategia principal la investigación, transferencia y adopción de tecnologías; b) formar recursos humanos a fin de contribuir al desarrollo socioeconómico del Estado en materia agrícola, pecuaria, forestal y acuícola, impulsando la conversión de sistemas de producción para la integración económica de la entidad a los mercados potenciales; c) generar fuentes alternativas de alimentación en respuesta al crecimiento poblacional; d) aprovechar los recursos naturales para el rescate y conservación de la biodiversidad.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Criminal Code Act 1995.
Policy_Content: In various Commonwealth Acts relating to environment, wildlife or fisheries provisions of Chapter 2 of the Criminal Code apply, i.e. Chapter 2 of the Criminal Code applies to all offences against those Acts. The purpose of Chapter 2 is to codify the general principles of criminal responsibility under laws of the Commonwealth. It contains all the general principles of criminal responsibility that apply to any offence, irrespective of how the offence is created.

Policy: Federal Law No. 33-FZ on protected areas.
Policy_Content: The present Federal Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, protection and use of protected areas for the purpose of conservation of unique and typical environmental complexes and objects, notable natural formations, plant and wildlife species, their genetic fund, study of natural processes in the biosphere and control over its alterations and ecological education of the population. The Federal Law consists of 12 Sections that contain 38 articles. Section 1  (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 6-11) regards state natural reserves. Section 3 (arts. 12-17) regards National Parks. Section 4 (arts. 18-21) regards natural parks. Section 5 (arts. 22-24) regards state natural reserves. Section 6 (arts. 25-27) regards natural and historic memorials. Section 7 (arts. 28-30) regards arboretums and botanical gardens. Section 8 (arts. 31-32) regards recreational areas and resorts. Section 9 (arts. 33-35) deals with organization of the protection of protected areas. Section 10 (art. 36) establishes liability for the infringement of the regime of protected areas. Section 11 (art. 37) deals with international agreements in the sphere of protected areas. Section 12 (art. 38) lays down final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Federal Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ordinance on the organization of the alarm system and intervention in case of chemical incidents and on fees.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present regulation is to lay down provisions relating to the organization of the safety system, as well as to the intervention in case of chemical incidents. Chemical incidents are considered those threatening human life or amounting to a hazard for the environment. The Department of the Territory is entrusted with the enforcement of this Regulation. In case of an actual or a feared chemical incident the Cantonal Police shall immediately be informed and it shall take appropriate emergency measures without delay. The Cantonal Police shall also inquire as to the cause of the incident and submit a report. According to article 10 the related costs shall be borne by those responsible. The text consists of 15 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Environmental fees/charges
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Arrêté ministériel relatif à l'octroi d'une aide à la réalisation de projets de démonstration relatifs à l'application des méthodes de production agricole compatibles avec les exigences de la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, parmi d'autres, "règlement", "Ministre", "Inspecteur générale", "cahier des charges", "Comité". Le chapitre II a pour objet l'installation du Comité; à savoir le Ministre de l'Agriculture nomme un Comité compétent pour rendre des avis sur les projets introduits et proposer des critères permettant de les juger; déterminer les normes vers lesquelles il faut tendre pendant et au terme des projets de démonstration; déterminer les lignes de conduite de base des projets; le contrôle du bon déroulement de tous les projets, etc. Ensuite, l'arrêté traite des matières telles que les Services d'observations et d'avertissement pour les cultures végétales (chap. III); l'article 6 de ce chapitre énumère les conditions qui doivent être remplies par lesdits services; Projets de démonstration en agriculture biologique (chap. IV); Autres projets de démonstration (chap. VI); Octroi des aides (chap. VII). L'arrêté comprend 22 articles divisés en 8 chapitres.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Nº 13 – Declara monumento natural las especies forestales Queule, Pitao, Belloto del Sur, Belloto del Norte y Ruil.
Policy_Content: En el marco de la Convención para la Protección de la Flora, la Fauna y las Bellezas Escénicas Naturales de América, se declaran monumento natural las especies forestales Queule, Pitao, Belloto del Sur, Belloto del Norte y Ruil. La Corporación Nacional Forestal sólo podrá autorizar la corta o explotación de las especies citadas cuando estas acciones tengan por objeto llevar a cabo las siguientes actividades: (a) desarrollar investigaciones científicas debidamente autorizadas; (b) habilitar terrenos para la construcción de obras públicas o de defensa nacional; (c) desarrollar planes de manejo forestal por parte de organismos oficiales del Estado cuyo exclusivo objeto sea el de conservar y mejorar el estado de conservación de las especies protegidas.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Water Association Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements article 3 of the Brandenburg Water Law of 8 December 2004. In order to keep the waters as indicated in article 3 of the Brandenburg Water Law, the present Law establishes water and soil associations as listed in article 1. The text deals with the following issues: provisions to be applied, statutes, composition, functions, and financing of the associations.

Policy: Water Rights Law of the Canton Graubünden(Graubünden Water Rights Law).
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates the use of public waters of the Canton Graubünden employed to produce electrical energy, as well as the supply of electricity for municipalities and the Canton. The purpose of the present Law is: a) the rational use of the local hydropower for the well-being of local authorities, regions and cantons; b) the optimization and improved performance of exisisting hydropower generated stations; c) a rational and environment-friendly development of hydro powers; d) a safe, sufficient and steady supply of energy for the Canton; e) the coordination of interests of municipalities, regions and cantons. The text consists of 86 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Exploitation of hydropower (II); Supply of electrical energy (III); Penalties (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Energy, Water

Policy: National Environmental Management Policy.
Policy_Content: The Policy: (a) defines the overall Policy goal, key policy objectives and key principles in Chapter II; (b) defines in Chapter III cross-sector policy objectives, principles and strategies in the following fields: land and resource tenure, land use policy and planning, environmental information, conservation of biological diversity, water resource conservation and management, wetlands conservation and management, environmental economics and macro-economic policy, environmental accounting correct market failures with appropriate pricing policy, financial and economic sustainability, use of economic incentives and disincentives to change people's behaviour, environmental impact assessment, control of pollution and management of domestic and industrial waste and hazardous materials, climate, population, health and human settlements, gender integration, environmental education, human resource development and research, and public participation in environmental management; (c) defines in Chapter IV sector policy goals, objectives and strategies in the following fields: agriculture and farming systems, forest conservation and management, wildlife conservation and management, livestock and rangelands management, fisheries and other aquatic resources conservation and management; (d) deals in Chapter V for policy implementation. The strategies in the policy are intended to provide and assist decision-makers and resource users in determining priorities in the national context and also at the sector, private sector and individual levels.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Environmental planning,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Community management,Gender,Traditional rights/customary rights,Access and benefit-sharing,Policy/planning
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 77 “On establishment of leshoz “Manas” on the territory of Kara-Bura and Manas districts of Talas province and Ala-Buka district in Jalalabad province.
Policy_Content: In order to improve ecological situation in Talas and Jalalabad provinces, to regenerate and protect forests, better forestry management the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic decrees as follows: (a) to establish leshoz “Manas” (area – 35486 ha, including 6154 ha of forests) on the lands of forest parcels in Kara-Bura and Manas districts (Annex 1); (b) to establish Ala-Buka leshoz (area – 40920 ha, including 29038 ha of forests) on the lands of Ala-Buka forestry, Ala-Buka district of Jalalabad province (Annex 2); and (c) to oblige the head of Ala-Buka local administration of Jalalabad province to allot 100 ha of ploughed lands for the purpose of full reforestation of Ala-Buka forestry and development of nurseries for growing tree seedlings and increase agricultural production output.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 78 on transfer of Talas town forests to State Forest Fund of Talas mechanised forestry.
Policy_Content: In order to improve ecological situation of Talas town forests, to preserve and regenerate them and for better forestry management the Government of Kyrgyz Republic decrees as follows: (a) to transfer forested area of urban forests amounting to 33 ha in the Northern part and 16 ha in the Eastern part of Talas city to State Forest Fund of Talas mechanised forestry in accordance with the Annex; and (b) Local administration must fulfil explication of land registration documents for Talas province.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 76 “On establishment of Sarychat-Ertash state national park”.
Policy_Content: Prime Minister, in order to preserve unique natural complexes, rare and endangered species and varieties in Issyk-Kul province and with a view of maintaining ecological balance in the region decrees to establish Sarychat-Ertash state national park on lands of state land reserve in Diety-Oguz district on area covering 72080 ha, including 13495 ha of pastures and 58585 ha of other unsuitable lands, in accordance with the Annex 1. Annex 2 contains definition and mapping of borders of Sarychat-Ertash state national park.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 76 regarding organization of Sarychat-Ertash state biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: The Government, for the purpose of conservation of unique natural ecosystems, rare and endangered animal and plant species of the Issyk Kul region and maintenance of ecological balance decrees to set up Sarychat-Ertash state biosphere reserve with total land area of 72080 hectares within the boundaries contained in the Annexes 1 and 2.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Fisheries Regulation No. 22223.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines fisheries sector specifying: fisheries licences, sport fishing, changes in aquaculture areas, the use of explosive and harmful substances in fishing activity, hazardous materials and pollutants which are prohibited to be discharged within aquaculture areas, specifications, conditions and use of fishing gear, regulations on trawling, accidental catches, fish health, processing of manufactured and semi-manufactured fisheries products, marketing procedures and prohibitions, limitations, liabilities, precautions, quality control and safety inspection and proper management of stocks. This Regulation consists of 11 chapters divided into 36 articles and 10 annexes. It concerns procedures and conditions for obtaining a fishing licence, listing forms for requiring a fishing licence; fishing gear for sport fishing; aquaculture infrastructure requirements; prohibited activities; marine pollution (dumping of hazardous waste in water); fishing gear, etc. It also prescribes quality standards, hygiene control and import and export of fisheries products for human consumption (treated food requirements, disease prevention, quarantine, etc.).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Marine fisheries,Marine pollution,Fishery management and conservation,Non-commercial fishing,Aquaculture,Artisanal fishing,Fishing gear/fishing method,Mesh,Bycatch,Fish disease,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Fish products,Data collection/reporting,Fishing authorization
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Decreto Nº 266/95 - Plan ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente, Urbanismo y Vivienda de la Provincia de Mendoza, en coordinación con los Municipios, elaborará un Plan Ambiental, de conformidad con el procedimiento y contenidos que se determinan en el mismo.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 1/1995 - Ley de protección del medio ambiente de la Región de Murcia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer un sistema de normas adicionales de protección del medio ambiente en Región de Murcia, los procedimientos administrativos para la concesión de autorizaciones, la elaboración de las declaraciones de impacto ambiental y calificación ambiental para las industrias o actividades potencialmente contaminantes o que alteren el medio ambiente, y el desarrollo de la legislación básica del Estado sobre calidad ambiental. A los efectos de esta Ley, el órgano ambiental de la Comunidad Autónoma de la Región de Murcia es la Consejería de Medio Ambiente. En cada Ayuntamiento el órgano ambiental será aquel que tenga atribuidas las competencias en materia de calificación ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Protection of environment,Basic legislation,Institution,Environmental planning,Ecosystem preservation,EIA,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Act No. 53 on support for municipal projects in sewerage matters.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to promote the construction of municipal sewers using grants. The initiative for making plans for sewers and sewerage projects is in the hands of local authorities and is their responsibility. Article 3 describes the structures that might be subsidised by the State. A sewerage committee shall be established, which shall discuss grant applications and the implementation and cost plans of municipalities for sewerage projects in the current year and estimates the eligibility of each planned project and make a proposal to the Executive on the contribution to municipal sewerage in next year's budget.
Subject: Water, General
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Act No. 54 on the protection of Breiðafjörður.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to promote the protection of Breiðafjörður, in particular the landscape, geological formations, ecosystems and cultural monuments. The provisions of the law apply to all islands, islets and skerries in Breiðafjörður as well as indicated shores in the inner part of the fjord. The Act establishes a Committee (Breiðafjarðarnefnd) to advise on all matters relating to the implementation of this Act. The Committee shall also, in consultation with the municipalities, elaborate a protection plan stating how the objectives set by the protection of the area are to be achieved. The Executive shall issue a regulation providing for protection measures on the basis of the Act, protection against any kind of pollution and access for tourists to certain places in the area that are sensitive to nature.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protection of environment,Ecosystem preservation,Management/conservation,Protected area,Protection of habitats,Biodiversity,Institution
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Environmental Management Act, 1995 (Act No. 3 of 1995).
Policy_Content: Comprehensive Act relative to principles of environment management and protection and making provision for the establishment of the Environmental Management Authority (sect. 6), the Environmental Trust Fund (sect. 72) and the Environmental Commission (sect. 81), the last being a special tribunal on matters regarding the environment.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances, Water

Policy: Resolution No. 42/1 of 1995 concerning afforestation experiments and wind-breaks in the region of Harbata.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 2 articles: the Minister of Agriculture authorizes afforestation experiments and wind breaks at the Government's expense in the zone of Harbata in the province of Al-biqa' (art. 1).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Water Associations Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Federal Water Association Act of 12 February 1991 (BGBl. I p. 405). In preparing the budget, the Associations must comply with the principles of efficiency and economy. The budget must include all incomes and expenses anticipated in the relevant financial year. For greater investments over several years, an appropriate plan has to be made. The text consists of 16 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: Budget, accounting and inspections (1); Public announcements of the competent authority (2); Water charges (3); Dissolution of existing associations (4).
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Institution,Environmental standards,Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Water users' associations,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Policy/planning,Enforcement/compliance,Pollution control

Policy: Regulation of the Ministry of Environment on list of professionally qualified persons for environmental impact assessment (1995).
Policy_Content: This Regulation specifies details on : a). entering of natural persons and legal entities into the register of professionally qualified persons for considering of effects of intended structures, facilities and other activities; b). keeping a register; c).deleting of natural persons and legal entities from the register; d).fees for entering register. The document consists of V Secs. that contain 15 Arts. Section I (arts. 1-2) lays down introductory provisions. Section II (Arts. 3-7) establishes the modalities of entering data into register. Section III (Arts. 8-9) establishes the modalities of keeping register. Section IV (Arts. 10) establishes the modalities of writing off data from the register. Section V (Arts. 11-15) lays down common and final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
