Policy: Transport Operations (Marine Pollution) Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act aims at protecting the marine and coastal environment of Queensland, it consists of 17 Parts divided into 160 sections. The Act also aims at implementing provisions of Annexes of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships, MARPOL, 1973. Given the limited jurisdiction of provinces in territorial sea, this Act only deals with discharges from ships that happen in the first three nautical miles of the territorial sea (sect. 11). Part 3 is dedicated to marine pollution strategies in general while Parts 4 to 8 cover the prevention of pollution, respectively, by oil, by noxious liquid substances in bulk, by packaged harmful substances, by sewage and by garbage. Part 9 concerns pollution that might occur in transfer operations of pollutants between ships.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Philippine Mining Act of 1995 (Republic Act No. 7942).
Policy_Content: All mineral resources in lands privately or publicly owned within the territory and exclusive economic zone of the Republic of the Philippines are property of the State, which shall promote and supervise for their rational exploration, development, utilization and conservation while attentively safeguarding the environment and protecting the rights of affected communities (as ancestral rights). Surveys and subsequent mapping of all quarries shall be produced, and a regular monitoring of their operations in order to evaluate if they are still productive, if they are polluting the environment or are unproductive and have to be closed. Mining licence as exploration licence shall be granted to public and private enterprises by the competent authorities.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Mining,Basic legislation,Minerals,Access right,Concession,Exploration,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,EIA,Environmental planning,Pollution control,Royalties/fees,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Tax/levy,Use restrictions,Zoning,Authorization/permit,Indigenous peoples,Sustainable use

Policy: Sub-decree On the establishment of the Inter-Ministerial Technical Committee for oil exploration and exploitation.
Policy_Content: The Sub-decree provides for the institution of the Interministerial Technical Committee for Oil Exploration and Exploitation whose responsibilities, tasks, powers and functions shall be the redaction of the Petroleum Law, the planning and supervision of the exploitation and exploration of the oil resources, the monitoring of investments and operations related to oil exploitation.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 6765/511 amending Ministerial Decree No. 28433/2448, as amended by Ministerial Decree No. 33976/3189, relating to measures to be taken against air pollution by emissions from motor vehicles, in compliance with the provisions of Council Directive 94/12/EC.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to align the Greek legislative frame with the provisions of Council Directive 94/12/EC regarding the measures to be taken against air pollution by emissions from motor vehicles. This Decree amends Annex I of Ministerial Decree No. 33976/3189 of 1993 which sets out emission standards for motor vehicles.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Hydro Electricity Charges (O. Reg. 106/95).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation lays down provisions relating to hydro electricity charges. Section 2 establishes that the holder of a water power lease shall pay to the Crown a hydro-electricity charge for each calendar year covered in whole or in part by the term of the lease. The text consists of 6 sections.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Federal Law No. 27-FZ of 1995 on Underground Resources.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that those underground resources within the territory of the Russian Federation, including subsoil domain and mineral resources contained therein are state property. Therefore, subsoil areas shall not be subject to purchase, sale, gift, inheritance, deposit, pledge or any other form of alienation. The right of use of underground resources may be subject to alienation or assignment by one person to another insofar as such transfer right is permitted by federal laws. Mineral and other underground resources produced under license terms may have the status of Federal Property, the property of the Russian Federation subdivisions, municipal, private, or any other property status. This Law decrees that the State Reserve of Underground Resources consists of areas in use defined as geometric blocks of subsoil domain, as well as subsoil areas not in use within the territory of the Russian Federation and its continental shelf. Federal Bodies of the Russian Federation and its subdivisions exercise the joint control over the ownership and the disposal of the State Reserve of Underground Resources within the territory of the Russian Federation and its continental shelf. This Federal Law is composed of 7 sections containing 52 articles. Section I contains 5 articles and outlines the general provisions for the use of underground resources. Section II contains articles (6-22) that regulate the use of underground resources. Section III comprises articles (23-34) regarding the rational use and conservation of underground resources. Section IV comprises articles (35-38) and deals with the state regulation of the use of underground resources. Section V comprises articles (39-48) and concerns the issue of payments for the use of underground resources. Section VI specifies the liability for the infringement of this Federal Law. Section VII contains article 52 regulating the application of the provisions of International Agreements in the matter of the use of underground resources.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on the date of signature.

Policy: Law No. 86/95-BP on pesticides and agrochemicals.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 7 Sections composed of 24 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 4-8) regards state testing and state registration of pesticides, agrochemicals and technical equipment for the application thereof. Section 3 (art. 9-15) sets requirements for manufacturing, transport, trade, conservation, application, utilization, annihilation and sterilization of pesticides and agrochemicals. Section 4 (arts. 16-17) regards realization of state policy, state supervision and state control over the observance of the legislation on pesticides and agrochemicals. Section 5 (arts. 18-19) sets safety requirements for agricultural raw materials and foodstuffs. Section 6 (art. 20) establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on pesticides and agrochemicals. Section 7 (arts. 21-21) lays down final provisions. The present Law regulates legal relations related to the state registration, manufacturing, purchase, transport, storage and application of pesticides and agrochemicals safe for human life and environment, establishes the rights and the duties of enterprises, institutions, organizations and citizens, and also plenary powers of state executive bodies and officials in the aforesaid sphere. The basic principles of the state policy in the sphere of pesticides and agrochemicals are: 1) priority of environmental protection in respect of economic efficiency of the utilization of pesticides and agrochemicals; 2) minimization of the application of pesticides at the expense of introduction of biological agriculture and other ecologically safe plant protection means (art. 3). National and imported pesticides and agrochemicals must comply with high biological efficiency, safety for human life and environment, state standards and sanitary norms (art. 4). Preparative forms of pesticides and agrochemicals shall be subject to state registration (art. 7). The application of pesticides and agrochemicals shall be carried out in conformity with regulations set for determined soil and climatic areas, with the consideration of agrochemical study of soil, the state of crops and forecasts for the development of pests and disease (art. 12). On the areas destined for growing crops destined for breastfeeding and dietetic foodstuffs pesticides and agrochemicals shall be applied according to special technologies ensuring compliance of breastfeeding and dietetic foodstuffs with sanitary and hygienic requirements set for such products (art. 13). Agricultural raw materials and foodstuffs of vegetable and animal origin in the process of manufacturing, storage and transport of which pesticides and agrochemicals were used must comply with sanitary and hygienic requirements confirmed by compliance certificate (art. 18). Safety for human health and the environment during manufacturing, transportation, storage, testing and use of pesticides and agrochemicals shall be ensured through compliance with the requirements established by state standards, sanitary norms, regulations and other normative documents. State registration of pesticides and agrochemicals shall be performed by the central executive body that implements state policy in the field of environmental protection, on a paid basis in the manner and amounts established by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, based on positive test results and research materials. Technical means of application of pesticides and agrochemicals, which are subject to the requirements and procedures of technical regulations on safety of machinery, are not subject to state testing, state registration and re-registration.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pesticides,Ecological production/organic production,Registration,Certification,Basic legislation,Fertilizers/nutrients,Public health,Transport/storage,Plant protection,Hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: National Environment Protection Council (South Australia) Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the National Environment Protection Council, which shall make national environment protection measures and to protect from air, water or soil pollution and from noise. The national environment protection measures may concern inter alia: (a) ambient air quality, (b) ambient marine, estuarine and freshwater quality; (c) general guidelines for the assessment of site contamination; (e) environmental impacts associated with hazardous wastes; (f) re-use and recycling of used materials.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Arrêté n°054/MINAGRA/DGEF/DPIF du 2 mors 1995 fixant les modalités d'application du décret n° 94-368 du 1er juillet 1994portant modification du décret n° 66-421 du 15 septembre 1966 réglementant l 'exploitation des bois d'œuvre et d’ébénisterie, de service, de feu et à charbon.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte les modalités d'application du décret n° 94-368 du 1er juillet 1994 portant modification du décret n° 66-421 du 15 septembre 1966 réglementant l 'exploitation des bois d'œuvre et d’ébénisterie, de service, de feu et à charbon. Notamment, il crée 170 périmètres d'exploitation forestière.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Arrêté du 1er mars 1995 relatif à l'organisation territoriale de la défense dans le domaine de l'agriculture, de la pêche et de l'alimentation.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté est relatif à l'organisation territoriale de la défense dans le domaine de l'agriculture, de la pêche et de l'alimentation. Les directeurs régionaux de l'agriculture et de la forêt sont les délégués de zone du ministère de l'agriculture et de la pêche, compétents pour toutes les questions de responsabilité du ministre et notamment pour celles relatives à l'approvisionnement en denrées alimentaires et au ravitaillement.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Land Transfer Act of 1994 (No. 8 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment the Land Transfer Board control by the Land Transfer Board of land transfer transactions in Zanzibar. No permanent transfer of land or long term lease shall take place until the transaction is reviewed and approved by the Land Transfer Board. The Board may withhold its consent on specified grounds.   An appeal from any decision of the Land Transfer Board may be taken to the Lands Tribunal. The Act defines offences.  The registration of any instrument or other document which contravenes these provisions relating to the permanent transfer of land or lease shall be void until the proper review process is completed.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Order No. 25 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on setting up, protection and registration of biosphere reserves.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 6 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1); 2) classification of biosphere reserves (sect. 2); 3) the modalities of setting up biosphere reserves (sect. 3); 4) the modalities of functioning of biosphere reserves (sect. 4); 5) protection of biosphere reserves (sect. 5); 6) registration of biosphere reserves (sect. 6). Biosphere reserves shall be considered areas allotted for the purpose of conservation and reproduction of one or several species and maintaining general ecological balance. The biosphere reserves shall be classified in the following manner: 1) landscape reserves destined for the conservation of precious natural complexes; 2) biological (botanical, zoological) reserves destined for the conservation of protected and endangered animals and plants; 3) paleontological destined for the conservation of minerals and mineral deposits; 4) hydrological (marsh, lake, river) destined for the conservation of precious water objects. The proclamation of the state biosphere reserves shall be carried out by authority of the Council of Ministers and shall not entail expropriation of land. Depending upon the destination of biosphere reserves the following activities can be prohibited on their territory: 1) ploughing up; 2) some types of forest management; 3) hunting; 4) fisheries; 5) mowing; 6) grazing; 7) collection of berries, fruits and flowers; 8) land reclamation; 9) tourism; 10) extraction of minerals, peat and sapropel. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection shall keep record of each national biosphere reserve.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Decreto Nº 14 - Reforma el Reglamento Regulador de estatutos de las asociaciones cooperativas agropecuarias.
Policy_Content: Las reformas introducidas al Reglamento se orientan al logro de su armonización con el principio constitucional de la libre disposición de los bienes, en cuanto a que las asociaciones cooperativas de la reforma agraria puedan decidir libremente sobre el destino de su patrimonio que mejor convenga a sus intereses, sin necesidad de autorización del Instituto Salvadoreño de Transformación Agraria, siempre que con ésto se beneficie directamente a sus asociados y su grupo familiar, y no se menoscaben los derechos de ellos ni de los de otras personales naturales o jurídicas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Customary Land Records Act.
Policy_Content: For the purposes of this Act there is hereby established an office to be known as the Central Land Record Office which shall be responsible for the administration of the provisions of this Act and be the central repository of copies of all records of customary land holdings. These offices shall be managed by the Judicial and Legal Service Commission acting as National Recorder. Tasks of the National Recorder are set out in section 7 and include registration of customary land. "Customary land" has the meaning ascribed thereto in section 2 of the Land and Titles Act Titles. The Minister may by order declare all or any part of the province so recommended to be a Customary Land Record Area. Land Record Offices shall be established for each province. Any customary land holding group or any person who claims an interest in any customary land may apply to the Land Record Office in the province for the recording of such primary rights and the demarcation of the extent of the boundaries of such customary land.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Common property,Traditional rights/customary rights,Cadastre/land registration,Ownership
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 41 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on supply and use of thermal energy.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that supplier of thermal energy shall be considered natural or legal person performing entrepreneurial activity related to generation and supply, or only supply, of thermal energy in accordance with contract concluded with consumers of thermal energy. Technical regulation for connecting consumer to thermal energy supply network must include specification of the source of thermal energy, place of connection, type of regulation of thermal energy supply and authorized maximum capacity.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolution No. 1 of 1995 defining the bases and procedures for the appropriation of land and buildings in Bahrain by citizens of the Cooperation Council of Arab Gulf Countries.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to lay down the bases and procedures for the appropriation of land and buildings in Bahrain by citizens of the Cooperation Council of Arab Gulf Countries. This Resolution is composed of 9 articles. Articles 1-3 deal with the registration of all rights of disposal and usufruct over lands and buildings by citizens of the Cooperation Council of Arab Gulf Countries in the Land Register of Bahrain. The Property Document issued by the Cadastre shall comply to article 2 of Legislative Decree No. 1 of 1995 (art. 4). Article 6 provides for the procedures to be taken by the Land Register in case of violations or infractions of Legislative Decree No. 1 of 1995 by owners. Article 8 repeals Resolution No. 4 of 1987 implementing Legislative Decree No. 6 of 1985 regulating the appropriation of lands and buildings by citizens of the Cooperation Council of Arab Gulf Countries.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Small Island Developing States, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Resolution No. 14900 of 1995 implementing the Irrigation and Drainage Law as amended by Law No. 213 of 1994.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 5 Sections divided into 66 articles. Section I deals with  disinfection of canals. Section II provides for Irrigation of new lands. Section III establishes the Trade Union of Water Employees in New Lands. Section IV refers to the management and use of developed irrigation systems in old lands by farmers. Section V establishes a fund for canal maintenance and development projects. The Minister decrees the establishment of a register for the disinfection of canals. The irrigation of new cultivation lands is to be carried out by the use of advanced technologies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Resolución Nº 021/95/INRENA - Guía para la formulación de términos de referencia para los estudios de impacto ambiental en el sector agrario.
Policy_Content: La Guía para la formulación de términos de referencia de estudios de impacto ambiental en el sector agrario consta de 3 secciones. INDICE: Términos de referencia para estudios de impacto ambiental en el sector agrario (I); Contenido del estudio de impacto ambiental (II); Procedimiento metodológico para el estudio de impacto ambiental (III).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolution on Debts of State Farms and Collective Farms under Reorganisation (No. 42 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Agriculture and Food of is allowed to sell the property and cattle of the reorganized state farms and collective farms to individual and peasant farms, agricultural cooperatives with the registration of the passive debts and their repayment in equal parts during 10 years. State credit debts of reorganized state farms in the amount of 50 percent, and collective farms 75 percent are to be transferred to new creating individual and peasant farms, agricultural cooperatives with the payment in equal parts during 15 years starting from 1 January 1997 and the remaining part of debts are to be transferred to state debt. Re-registration and writing off of debts of the reorganised state and collective farms before 1 July 1995 should be done in accordance with the Board's decision on land-agrarian reform of Ministry of Agriculture.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Order No. 37/95 implementing Law No. 21-C/92.
Policy_Content: This Order, composed of four articles, implements article 22 of Law No. 21-C/92 (Land Act). In particular, it authorizes the Provincial Delegation of the Ministry for Agriculture to enforce land expropriation in Cunene Province and to proceed with land parcelling and concession.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force immediately .

Policy: Skolt Development Act (No. 253 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The scope of the Act is to improve the living standards and the opportunity of earning of "skolt" people (defined in section 5) involved in agriculture or forestry in areas specified in section 2 in Northern Finland in proximity of the Russian border. Chapter II provides for with various incentives. Incentives may be used for agriculture, fisheries, and forestry.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 May, 1995.

Policy: High-Value Crops Development Act of 1995.(Republic Act No. 7900).
Policy_Content: Non-traditional crops are crops other than rice, corn, coconut and sugar, while high-value crops (HVC) are other crops including but notlimited to: coffee and cacao, fruit crops (citrus, cashew, guyabano, papaya, mango, pineapple, strawberry, jackfruit, rambutan, durian, mangosteen, guava, lanzones, and watermelon), root crops (potato and ubi), vegetable crops (asparagus, broccoli, cabbage, celery, carrots, cauliflower, radish, tomato, bell pepper, and patola), legumes, pole sitao (snap beans and garden pea), spices and condiments (black pepper, garlic, ginger, and onion), flowers and ornamental plants (chrysanthemum, gladiolus, anthuriums, orchids. The provisions aim to increase the production of corps and their marketing and sales abroad as a revenue for the farmers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Federal Law No. 26-FZ on natural curative resources, medicinal and sanitary localities and health resorts.
Policy_Content: The Federal Law consists of 9 Sections that contain 22 articles. Natural curative resources, medicinal and sanitary localities and health resorts are national property of the peoples of the Russian Federation destined for cure and recreation of the population and pertain to protected areas and territories with proper particulars in their use and protection. The present Federal Law determines the principles of state policy and regulates relations in the sphere of study, use, development and protection of natural curative resources, medicinal and sanitary localities and health resorts on the territory of the Russian Federation. The present Federal Law establishes the particulars of the use of natural curative resources, specifies regulation in the sphere of spa treatment and recreational use of curative resources, sanitary (mountain sanitary) resources, protection thereof, sets forth the modalities of dispute settlement and establishes liability for the infringement of the present Federal Law.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Federal Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Republic Act No. 7907 to amend the Code of Agrarian Reforms in the Philippines.
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Republic Act No. 3844 in several sections; the government through its Presidential Agrarian reform Council (PARC) shall provide funds to pay all bonds and other obligations incurred by the Bank of the Philippines as compensation to the landowners (sect. 2). Section 4 of the Act relates to the capital stock of the bank whereas there are also provisions relating to the membership of the board of directors (sect. 5).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act commenced on the 23 February 1995.

Policy: Immovables Expropriation Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides a basis for the procedure of all expropriation of immovable property including "restricted real rights". Expropriation" is defined in section 2 as "the transfer of an immovable without the consent of the owner in the public interest for fair and immediate compensation". The sections of the Act are divided into 9 Chapters: General provisions (1); Preliminary work and resolution for expropriation (2); Expropriation payment (3); Agreement process (4); Valuation process (5); Abandonment of expropriation (6); Transfer of possession and ownership of immovables under expropriation and payment of expropriation payment (7); Return of expropriated immovables (8); Final provisions (9). Section 3 lists all circumstances in which expropriation is permitted. Expropriation applications shall be submitted by local authorities to the Minister of Internal Affairs and contain information as set out in section 11. The "agreement process" concerns the amount of compensation to be paid for the expropriation. Requests for such procedure shall be made to the County Governor.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Sustainable Development Act (1995)
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the principles of the national strategy of sustainable development. The national strategy of sustainable development is based on the principles established in the decisions of the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development (Rio de Janeiro, 1992). Part II of this Act establishes the grounds for the sustainable use of the natural environment and natural resources. The grounds of sustainable development in other fields are established by Acts, other legislation or national programmes. The purpose of the sustainable use of the natural environment and natural resources is to guarantee that the environment meets human needs as well as provides the resources required for economic development without causing significant damage to the environment or depleting biological diversity.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi nº 33-94 relative aux périmètres de mise en valeur en bour promulgué par le dahir nº 1-95-10 du 22 février 1995.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte création de périmètres de mise en valeur en bour délimités par décret afin de créer les conditions nécéssaires au développement intégré d'une agriculture moderne et performante. La loi comprend 57 articles répartis en 7 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Zones de mise en valeur des terres agricoles (II); Zones d'amélioration pastorale (III); Zones de conservation des sols (IV); Contrôle des obligations et sanction (V); Déclaration d'utilité publique de l'aménagement des structures foncières et de la création de lotissements agricoles dans les périmètres de mise en valeur en bour (VI); Dispositions diverses (VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 (S.I. 419 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Order consolidates with amendments the procedural provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 and subsequent amending instruments. A separate Order, the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (S.I. 1995/418), consolidates with amendments the remaining provisions which deal with permitted development. The Order specifies the procedures connected with planning applications, appeals to the Secretary of State and related matters so far as these are not laid down in the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and the Town and Country Planning (Applications) Regulations 1988 (S.I. 1988/1812). It also deals with the maintenance of registers of planning applications, applications for certificates of lawful use or development, and other related matters
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order (S.I. 418 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Order consolidates with amendments the permitted development provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 and subsequent amending instruments. A separate order, the Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 (S.I. 1995/419), consolidates with amendments the remaining provisions which deal with procedures connected with planning applications and related matters. The main purpose of this Order is to grant planning permission for certain classes of development without any requirement for an application to be made under Part III of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. Schedule 2 to the Order, which is subject to the provisions of the Order and to regulations 60 to 63 of the Conservation (Natural Habitats) Regulations 1994, sets out these classes of development in detail. In some circumstances, the permission given is subject to extensive qualifications and restrictions.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Décret relatif à l'assainissement du sol.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte la réglementation relative à l’assainissement du sol. Le texte est formé par 53 articles répartis en 11 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (I); Identification des terrains pollués, registre des terrains pollués; Restrictions de l'usage et mesures de précaution, modification des plans de secteur (II); Pollution du sol générée après l'entrée en vigueur du présent décret (III); Pollution historique du sol (IV); Cessions de terrains (V); Fermeture d’établissements ou arrêt d'activités (VI); Intervention de l’OVAM (VII); Pouvoirs du Gouvernement flamand (VIII); Cession du droit de propriété (IX); Dispositions pénales (X); Dispositions finales (XI).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Registration,Land tenure,Cultural heritage,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent décret entre en vigueur six mois après sa publication au Moniteur belge, à l'exception de l'article 4 qui entre en vigueur un an après cette date et des articles 36 et 41, § 2, qui entrent en vigueur à la date fixée par le Gouvernement flamand.

Policy: Instruction of the Federal Forest Service validating the methodology of forest monitoring in the European part of the Russian Federation in accordance with the program ICP-Forest.
Policy_Content: This Instruction stipulates that the forest monitoring program in the European part of the Russian Federation is to collect and analyze data on damage to forests by biotic and abiotic agents to promote forest viability and the rational use of forest resources. The program shall include: (a) a permanent bioindicator network; (b) selecting trees for inventory and registration; (c) assessing the state of forests through defoliation and change in colour; and (d) submitting the results of assessment and inspection. Annual reports shall be prepared on the outcome of the forest monitoring program.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ordinance on scope and performance of financial aid and compensation under the Forest Act.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Forest Act of 25 March 1991. The government elaborates the basic planning for the protection of natural disasters. The text consists of 33 articles divided into 9 Parts as follows: Safety measures (I); Management (II); Forest reserves (III); Woody plants, hedges, windbreaks (IV); Forest damages,diseases and pests (V); Game damage (VI); Planning (VII); Background material and information (VIII); Final provisions (IX).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Newfoundland Offshore Petroleum Installations Regulations (SOR/95-104).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the Canada-Newfoundland Atlantic Accord Implementation Act. In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to petroleum installations used in areas offshore Newfoundland. Section 3 establishes that for the purpose of ensuring the safety of an installation, no operator shall use the installation unless the equipment on the installation is arranged in accordance with these Regulations to a) provide for the safety of personnel; b) minimize damage to the environment; and c) enable easy access to the equipment. The text consists of 71 sections divided into 6 Parts as follows: General requirements (I); Analysis and design (II); Construction and installation (III); Operations and maintenance (IV); Records and reporting (V); Offences (VI).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Federal Law No.24-FZ of 1995 on information, informatization and protection of information.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law regulates relations originating in the process of formation and use of information resources on the basis of creation, collection, processing, storage, search, dissemination and concession to the consumer of documented information ; creation and utilization of information technologies and the means of their safeguarding ; protection of information, rights of the subjects participating in information processes and informatization. State information resources of the Russian Federation are open to public and are generally accessible except for documented information classified by law as category of limited access. It is prohibited to classy as category of limited access documents, containing information on emergencies, ecological, meteorological, demographic, sanitary and epidemiological and other information necessary for safe functioning of populated areas, industrial units, safety of single citizens and of the population as a whole. The document consists of 5 Chapters that contain 25 Articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (Arts.4-11) regards information resources. Chapter 3 (Arts.12-15) establishes the modalities of utilization of information resources. Chapter 4 (Arts.16-19) regards informatization, information systems, technologies and the means of their safeguarding. Chapter 5 (Arts20-25) regards protection of information and the rights of subjects in the field of information processes and informatization.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 72 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding validation of the Regulation on complex environmental monitoring of protected ecological and health resort area - the Caucasian Mineral Waters.
Policy_Content: The system of complex environmental monitoring is a territorial sub-system of the common state system of ecological monitoring. It is functioning for the purpose of the provision of environmental management with information, safe sanitary and epidemiological environment and stable regional development, rational use of natural resources, first of all the unique natural health resorts, ensuring ecologically safe stable regional development with priority development of health resorts and recreational complex. The main tasks of the system are: 1) reception, generalization, analysis of information on the state on environment, natural resources of the Caucasian Mineral Waters and adjoining territories; 2) complex valuation of the state of environment, exposure of negative tendencies and prognostication of the development of ecology on the aforementioned territory; 3)complex valuation of the development of unfavourable natural and anthropogenic processes and phenomena, substantiation of the arrangements for the minimization of ecological damage; 4) exposure and analysis of environmental factors on public health; 5) provision with information of environmental arrangements and programs, including protection of climatic and balneological and recreational resources – mineral waters, therapeutic baths, unique natural landscapes, transparency of the atmosphere.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act to amend the Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Law of 1988 (Republic Act No. 7881).
Policy_Content: Amendments made to the principal Act concern its application sphere, compulsory land acquisition, incentives for aquaculture projects, conversion of agricultural land into fish ponds and prawn farms, protection of mangrove areas, and change of crops. Lands actually, directly and exclusively used for parks, wildlife, forest reserves, reforestation, fish sanctuaries and breeding grounds, watersheds and mangroves, as well as private lands actually directly and exclusively used for prawn farms and fishponds, shall be exempt from the application of this Act. Commercial farms, which are private agricultural lands devoted to saltbeds, fruit farms, orchards, vegetable and cut-flower farms, and cacao coffee and rubber plantations, shall be subject to immediate compulsory acquisition and distribution beginning ten years after the entry into force of the present Act. No conversion of public agricultural lands into fishponds and prawn farms shall be made except in situations where the provincial government with the concurrence of the Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources declares a coastal zone as suitable for fishpond development. In Fishpond Lease Agreements, a portion of the fishpond area fronting the sea, sufficient to protect the environment, shall be established as a buffer zone and be planted to specified mangrove species.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret nº 95-47 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de l'Agence béninoise pour l'Environnement.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de l'Agence béninoise pour l'Environnement, chargée de mettre en oeuvre, avec la participation de toutes les institutions nationales compétentes, la politique nationale en matière d'environnement.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Antarctic Regulations (S.I. No. 490 of 1995).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the Antarctic Act 1994, prescribe the procedure by which applications can be made for permits under the Act, including provisions relating to environmental evaluations, production of permits and their revocation or suspension. The Regulations establish a Tribunal to hear appeals against revocation or suspension. The Regulations designate special areas protected under the Act. There are also provisions regarding offences. The Regulations will come into force in accordance with regulation 1
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Law on the Sale of Agricultural Land Owned by the Treasury (No. 4070).
Policy_Content: This Law prescribes the principles on the sale of agricultural land owned by the Treasury. Sales shall be made by auction. Any individual who is registered and settled, or who owns or uses a property before 31 December 2002 at the village or the district where the lands are located may participate to the auction. Tenants who have used treasury lands for agricultural purposes since 31 December 2002 are entitled to buy that particular land with direct negotiations. Individuals who have used treasury lands for agricultural purposes for five years before 31 December 2002 are entitled to buy that particular land with direct negotiations. Lands that are sold in accordance to the provisions of this Law may not be used for non-agricultural purposes for a period of ten years. After that, land may be used for non-agricultural purposes prior to the consent of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force one month after its publication in the Official Journal.

Policy: Loi nº 95-3 1995-02-18/PR  portant restructuration de l'office national des céréales (ONC).
Policy_Content: Est rendue effective la mise en application de la restructuration de l'Office National des Céréales conformément aux nécessités des fonctions qui lui sont désormais dévolues; L'Office National des Céréales ainsi restructuré,exécutera les tâches qui lui sont fixées en subtitution des attributions telles qu'elles avaient été énoncées dans l'ordonnance nø19/P.CSM/SGG du 24 septembre 1977. Il a notammentpour objectifs: 1) la constitution, la conservation et la gestion d'un stock de reserve en céréales lui permettant d'intervenir en cas de besoin ou d'urgence.; 2) le concours aux opérations de distribution des aides alimentaires dans le respect de son autonomie financière; 3) l'appui aux divers organismes nationaux concernés par le suivi des marchés et des prix des céréales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Law No. 976 on bases of agrarian reform.
Policy_Content: The present Law determines the main directions of reform of agro-industrial complex (agrarian sector) and their legal coverage. The main directions of the agrarian reform include: 1) creation of new relations in the agrarian sector; 2) land reform, reform of land reclamation system and water economy; 3) creation of various forms of farms; 4) state provision of the agrarian sector (art. 2).The provisions of the present Law serve as basis for other normative acts regarding agrarian reforms. The Law consists of 4 Sections that contain 17 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 4-9) regards formation of new forms of property in the agrarian sector. Section 3 (arts. 10-12) regards setting up different types of agricultural economic entities. Section 4 (arts. 13-17) regards state protection of agrarian sector.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 977 of the National Assembly regarding implementation of Law No. 976 on bases of agrarian reform.
Policy_Content: National Assembly decrees to entitle the Cabinet of Ministers with the task of elaboration and carrying out complex organizational arrangements for the implementation of Law on bases of agrarian reform, to validate arrangements for the reorganization of the structure of management in agrarian sector in conformity with the requirements market economy, to resolve the issues of state financing and provision with material and technical means and other issues originating from the afore-mentioned Law, and to organize extension.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Decree enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 978 on reform of kolkhozes and sovkhozes.
Policy_Content: The present Law guarantees voluntary choice and setting up by persons that have the right to be allotted land share and property share pertaining to the property of kolkhozes, sovkhozes, inter-economic and other agricultural enterprises economic entities (enterprises) of any organizational and legal form. The Law consists of 4 Sections that contain 25 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-8) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 9-12) regards property issues and privatization of property. Section 3 (arts. 13-22) regards setting up agricultural enterprises of various types. Section 4 (arts. 23-25) regards ensuring carrying out reform.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 979 of the National Assembly regarding implementation of the Law No. 978 on reform of kolkhozes and sovkhozes.
Policy_Content: National Assembly decrees that till the conformation of the national legislation to the provisions of the Law No. 978 on reform of kolkhozes and sovkhozes legislative acts currently in force must be applied to the extent that does not contradict the afore-mentioned Law. Cabinet of Ministers is entitled with the task of conformation governmental normative acts to the afore-mentioned Law and to ensure state registration of the newly set agricultural enterprises by the territorial bodies of the Ministry of Justice.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Decree enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 338 of 1995 issuing the Implementing Regulation of Environment Law No. 4 of 1994.
Policy_Content: The Implementing Regulation is composed of 65 articles divided in IV Sections and 10 Annexes. The Egyptian Environmental Affairs Agency (EEAA) is the main authority and its Chairman is the competent Minister for Environmental Affairs. The EEAA's Board of Directors is the supreme authority in charge of the EEAA and sets its general policy, in particular (i) approves the National Plans for Environmental Protection; (ii) approves the Emergency Environmental Plan for disasters; (iii) prepares draft laws concerning the Environment; (iv) approves experimental projects undertaken by the EEAA; (v) approves norms and standards to ensure that the environment is not polluted; (vi) approves the procedures for the assessment of environmental impacts of projects; and (vii) supervises the Environmental Protection and Development Fund. The Fund's resources are allocated, inter alia, for the following (i) confronting environmental disasters; (ii) pilot projects in the field of natural wealth and environmental pollution protection; (iii) transfer of successful low cost techniques; (iv) financing the manufacture of types of equipment, devices and stations treating environmental pollutants; (v) establishing and operating Environmental Monitoring Networks; (vi) establishing and administering Natural Reserves; (vii) confronting pollution from unknown sources; (viii) financing studies for the preparation of environmental programs and assessing criteria required for preserving the environment; and (ix) participating in financing environmental protection projects undertaken by local administrative agencies and non-governmental organizations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Act to amend the Sea Protection Act (No. 221 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The amendments of the principal Act introduced by the present Act concern: permits for the dumping of mud (sect. 9); permits for the construction of installations in marine areas (sect. 10); and permits for the exploitation and exploration of the seabed and its subsoil. The amendments are made so as to provide for the transfer of tasks of the Ministry of the Environment to the Finnish environment centre established recently.

Policy: Land Act, 1965 (Additional Categories of Qualified Persons) Regulations, 1995 (S.I. No. 56 of 1995).
Policy_Content: These Regulations add to the list of qualified persons under section 45 of the Land Act, 1965, persons whose principal place of residence is in a Member State of the European Communities or other European State which is a contracting party to the European Economic Area Agreement and bodies corporate incorporated, having their registered office, central administration or principal place of business in those States. Section 45 places restrictions on vesting of interests in land not situate in a county borough, borough, urban district or town. It prescribes that no interest in land to which section 45 applies shall become vested in a person who is not a qualified person except with the written consent of the Land Commission and subject to any conditions attached to the consent.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Environment Charges Ordinance.
Policy_Content: Article 1 of the above-mentioned Ordinance establishes that for the utilization, especially consultation, evaluations, opinions studies and engineering services of the Bavarian Environment Office, the Bavarian Academy of Nature Protection and Landscape Care and water management authorities fees shall be levied. The text consists of 10 articles and 1 Annex laying down the amount of fees to be levied.

Policy: Agricultural (Commercial) Land Reform Act, 1995.
Policy_Content: The 81 sections of the Act are divided into 8 Parts: Land Reform Advisory Commission (I); Acquisition of Agricultural Land by State for Purposes of Land Reform (II); Preferential Right of State to Purchase Agricultural Land (III); Compulsory Acquisition of Agricultural Land (IV); Alienation of Agricultural Land (V); Restriction of Acquisition of Agricultural Land by Foreign Nationals (VI); The Lands Tribunal (VII); General (VIII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Resolution No. 4/T of 1995 defines steps and measures for the issue of licences for exploitaion of forest materials.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 4 articles. Article 1 defines steps and measures for the issuance of licences for forest exploitation and investment. The General Institution of Geology and Mineral Resources defines the working operations field, while the Forests Department monitors the implementation (art. 2). Prohibition to use explosives during the working operations (art. 3).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 26 of 1995 on preventing the importation of asbestos materials.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 5 articles bans import of asbestos materials, asbestos pipes, asbestos sheets and all other substances that are produced with use of asbestos materials, listed in the Annexes. It also cancels licenses granted to national industries to manufacture products with asbestos presence.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Law No. 56/95-VR “On status of mountain settlements”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the criteria by which settlements acquire the status of mountain areas, defines the basic principles of state policy for the development of mountain settlements and guarantees of social protection of citizens living, working or studying therein. The criteria shall be as follows: (a) location of a settlement or part of it, where more than one third of the inhabitants of this settlement live, at an altitude of 400 meters and above sea level in the territory, the relief of which is very dismembered by ravines, watercourses, etc., and the placement of 50 and more percent of agricultural land within this point on the slopes of a steepness of 12 degrees or more; (b) if for one inhabitant falls less than 0,25 hectares of arable land, or in case of absence of such areas - less than 0.60 hectares of agricultural land; (c) severe climatic conditions: cold and long winter (average duration - not less than 115 days, average daily air temperature in January does not exceed minus 4 degrees Celsius), cool short summer (average duration - not more than two months, the average daily temperature in July does not exceed 20 degrees per Celsius), a large amount of precipitation (average annual precipitation in liquid and solid state - not less than 600 millimetres), occur mudflows, floods, winds, snow tents, seismicity land. Settlements located at an altitude of 400 meters and up above the sea level that meet two criteria and not less than two indicators of the third criterion - "severe climatic conditions" as above-mentioned acquire the status of mountain areas settlements.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Perpetuities Act, 1995 (Cap. 114).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns perpetuity created on property including land by an instrument inter-vivos, the exercise of a special power of appointment or will. The Act prescribes rules for the validity and procedure of the establishment of perpetuity.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Loi nº 95-21 relative aux immeubles domaniaux agricoles.
Policy_Content: Cette loi établit le régime relatif aux immeubles domaniaux agricoles. Elle comprend 33 articles répartis en 5 chapitres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Exploitation des immeubles domaniaux agricoles (II); Aliénation en vue de la régularisation d'anciennes situations foncières (III); Echange (IV); Dispositions communes (V). On entend par immeubles domaniaux agricoles les terres dont l'Etat est propriétaire et qui sont destinées à la production agricole, celles pouvant servir de support à cette production ou celles qui ont été classées comme telles, ainsi que les bâtiments qui s'y trouvent. Ces immeubles ne peuvent être aliénés qu'à fin de régulariser d'anciennes situations foncières ou de les échanger contre des immeubles appartenant à des privés, des collectivités locales, des établissements publics ou des entreprises publiques, qu'ils soient agricoles ou non. Dans le premier cas, il est possible de procéder à l'aliénation par entente directe soit en faveur des exploitants d'immeubles domaniaux agricoles dans le cadre du décret du 1948 relatif à l'aliénation du domaine privé rural de l'Etat ou des attributaires de ces immeubles en vertu de la loi nº 70-25 du 1970, soit au profit des occupants des terres dites sialines et des grands domaines revenant à l'Etat par la liquidation des ex-habous publics ou de Zaouïa.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Regulations of Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture on Rural Forestry.
Policy_Content: These Regulations  are enacted in order to  promote the development of rural forestry and give full play to the role of forest and woodland resources in rural economic construction in Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture. The Text consists of 45 Articles.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agricultural Operations Act (S.S. 1995, c. A-12.1).
Policy_Content: The Act consist of 31 sections divided into 5 Parts and deals with agricultural operations defined as operations carried out on a farm in the expectation of gain or reward. Under section 3, owners and operators of an agricultural operation are not liable to any person in nuisance if they use normally accepted agricultural practices and the onus of proving that an operation creates nuisance lies on the plaintiff or claimant. Part 2 establishes the Agricultural Operation Review Board and regulates its internal structure and functioning. The Board is responsible for solving disputes related to nuisance of agricultural operations. Part 3 deals with intensive livestock. A plan for the management of waste from intensive livestock is required and sections 20-26 provide for the submission, approval and monitoring of the plans. The Act also includes general provisions on liability (sect. 27) and on regulations to be made under the Act (sect. 28).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 28 November 1996.

Policy: Real Estate Formation Act.
Policy_Content: This Act applies to: 1) formation of real estate and other register units; 2) changing the property division in other ways; 3) confirmation of matters concerning the dimensions of a register unit or other property division matters; and 4) registration and amalgamation of real estate and other register units. The present Act does not apply to a matter concerning the formation of real estate provisions for which is made in other legislation (sect. 1). A real estate refers to an independent unit of land ownership which under the Real Estate Register Act (392/85) is to be entered into the Real Estate Register as real estate, and other register unit refers to another separate unit to be entered into the Real Estate Register under the said Act. A real estate comprises the area belonging to it, the shares of the joint property units and of the joint special benefits as well as the easements and the private special benefits belonging to the real estate. The Act regulates land survey and mapping, cadastral procedures, subdivision of land, partitioning of land under joint ownership and other land and consequences of changes in land or title in land to land drainage systems, land exchange, land consolidation, the formation of jointly owned forest (Chapt. 10), easements, etc.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Private forest,Land tenure,Land based credit,Cadastre/land registration,Servitude,Right of use,Common property,Survey/mapping,Land consolidation,Subdivision of land,Drainage/land reclamation,Waterworks

Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: This Act provides for some matters regarding the National Planning Board established under the Constitution of Lesotho such as membership and functions. The Board shall perform all functions stipulated under section 105(2) of the Constitution of Lesotho. (2) The Board shall submit its advice to the Government through the Minister responsible for economic planning. The Board may regulate its own procedure. (7 sections)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Agri-Food Innovation Act (S.S. 1995, c. A-15.3).
Policy_Content: The aim of the present Act is to establish the Agri-Food Innovation Fund as a corporation. The purpose of the Fund is to: a) enhance the diversification of the Saskatchewan agriculture and food industry; b) support of , research in and development of the  Saskatchewan agriculture and food industry; and c) encourage Saskatchewan farmers and rural residents to create economic opportunities and jobs. For that purpose the Fund may: a) support the biotechnology infrastructure; b) support the commercial development of technologies for the processing of agricultural products; c) promote sustainable agricultural development; d) support new primary production alternatives and skills within the agricultural community; e) work in cooperation with organizations similar to those of the Fund; f) support the development of skills to assist agricultural producers in adapting to the changing agriculture and food industry; g) carry out activities provided for in the federal-provincial agreement. The text consists of 15 sections.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Institution,Special fund,Agricultural development,Agricultural commodities,Food quality control/food safety,Research

The Bureau shall be a body corporate and shall be responsible for the promotion and implementation of standards. It shall be supervised by the Council. Policy: Agriculture and Agri-Food Administrative Monetary Penalties Act (S.C. 1995, c. 40).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to establish, as an alternative to the existing penal system and as a supplement to existing enforcement measures, a fair and efficient administrative monetary penalty system for the enforcement of the Agri-Food Acts. For the purpose of the present Act “Agri-Food Act” means, inter alia, the Canada Agricultural Products Act, the Feeds Act, the Fertilizers Act, the Health of Animals Act, the Meat Inspection Act, the Pest Control Products Act, the Plant Protection Act or the Seeds Act. The text - consisting of 26 sections - deals with the following aspects: power of minister, proceedings, notice of violation with warning, notice of violations with penalty, rules of law about violations and general provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to general issues of the afore-mentioned Act. For example, section 4 establishes that an organization is designated to test an appliance or product to which the Act applies if the criteria listed in this section are satisfied. The text – consisting of 9 sections – deals with the following aspects: efficiency standards, testing organizations, labelling, fees. One Schedule is enclosed. One Schedule is enclosed.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Mines and Minerals (Trading in Reserved Minerals) Regulations (Cap.213).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit to: (a) buy, deal in, or receive by way of barter or pledge, either as principal or agent, any reserved mineral, unless a person is licensed or authorized under these regulations to trade in reserved minerals or is the operator of a registered lapidary; (b) sell, offer, display for sale, barter or pledge, either as principal or agent, any reserved mineral unless:(i) subject to the provisions of section forty of the Mines and Minerals Act, a person is the holder of a valid prospecting or exploration licence relating to that reserved mineral; (ii) the reserved mineral is won or recovered by that person from land on which he or she is lawfully mining for reserved minerals; or (iii) he or she is authorized to sell or dispose of that reserved mineral; (c) possess any reserved mineral unless: (i) a person is authorized under these Regulations to be in possession of that reserved mineral; or (ii) he or she has a permit. The Reserved Minerals Traders' Licensing Committee constituted under regulation 5, may grant, in writing, authority to trade and possess reserved minerals to any person who is not a citizen of Zambia or is not ordinarily resident in Zambia for a period of two years.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ley General de Hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce el marco normativo aplicable al sector hidrocarburos que permita su desarrollo y estimule la competencia, teniendo en cuenta, al mismo tiempo, la necesidad de proteger el medio ambiente. Para esos efectos, la Ley regula las operaciones de la industria petrolera en todas sus fases, a saber: exploración, explotación, refinación, industrialización, transporte y almacenamiento, comercialización y otras actividades conexas a dicha industria. La exploración o explotación de hidrocarburos podrá iniciarse por el Estado, mediante una licitación pública, o bien por las entidades petroleras mediante el otorgamiento de una concesión o autorización requerida por esta Ley.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 10/95 - Regula la actividad petrolera exigiendo estudio ambiental previo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto el ejercicio de la actividad petrolera dentro de la Provincia de Chubut, para lo cual se requerirá un previo estudio de impacto ambiental. Las empresas que se dediquen a la exploración y explotación petrolera deberán presentar ante la Dirección de Protección Ambiental el Estudio Ambiental Previo así como el informe correspondiente al Monitoreo Anual de Obras y Tareas. El artículo 9º crea el Registro de Control Ambiental de la Actividad Petrolera, en el cual deberán inscribirse las empresas radicadas en la Provincia de Chubut que se dediquen a las actividades de exploración, perforación, explotación petrolera, almacenamiento o transporte de petróleo crudo. Las violaciones al presente Decreto serán pasibles de las sanciones indicadas en el artículo 12.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Official Catalogue of cultivated species and varieties of agricultural crops.
Policy_Content: The Official Catalogue of cultivated species and varieties of agricultural crops is approved by the National Seed Institute and published with the proposal of the State Commission for Varieties' Testing, and approval of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food. Policy: Ley Nº 716/95 - Sanciona delitos contra el medio ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley protege el medio ambiente y la calidad de vida humana contra quienes ordenen, ejecuten o, en razón de sus atribuciones, permitan o autoricen actividades atentatorias contra el equilibrio del ecosistema, la sustentabilidad de los recursos naturales y la calidad de vida humana. Dispone que quien introdujese al territorio nacional residuos tóxicos o desechos peligrosos o comercializase los que se hallasen en él, o facilitase los medios o el transporte para el efecto, será sancionado.

Policy_Content: The State Environment Protection Bureau approves this Standard, which aim at preventing soil pollution, protecting ecological environment, ensuring agriculture and forestry industry, and ensuring human safety. It rules the maximum density of pollutant in soils in accordance with its function, protection objective and the character of the soil. In part 3 it classifies the environmental quality of soils into three grades, part 4 is the standard for each grade, part 5 is the examination standard.

Policy_Content: The contract concerns the management and the use of land. Policy: Décret réglementant l'organisation et le fonctionnement de l'Institut national de la réforme agraire.
Policy_Content: Ce décret réglemente l'organisation et le fonctionnement de l'Institut national de la réforme agraire (INARA), créé par la Constitution de 1987 en son article 248. L'INARA a pour mission : de résoudre les problèmes fonciers dans le cadre d'une approche globale de développement agricole, de conservation des ressources naturelles et de protection de l'environnement, d'organiser la refonte des structures foncières nationales, de mettre en oeuvre une réforme agraire au bénéfice des réels exploitants de la terre, d'élaborer une politique agraire axée sur l'optimisation de la productivité au moyen de la mise en place d'infrastructures visant la protection et l'aménagement de la terre et sur la participation des intéressés, et spécifiquement des petits exploitants.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Regulation on the functioning, duties and the rights of Regional Environmental Agencies (REA).
Policy_Content: Regional Environmental Agencies are specialized organs for environmental control in each of the prefectures of Albania. The duties of REAs include: (a) to assist in the control and implementation of environmental legislation; (b) to write every 3 months a report on the state of the environment in the respective prefecture; (c) to collect and register specified data; (d) to plan and carry out inspection; (e) to organize environmental impact assessment of projects which obtain a licence from the REA (Part I). Provisions of Part II outline the duties of the REA chiefs; provisions of Part III outline the duties of REA inspectors.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Agricultural Producer's Protection Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act aims at the creation and maintenance of favourable economic conditions for the sustainable development of competitive farms, to ensure the national food balance through the regulation of the production and trade in processed and unprocessed agricultural products. It does so through a system of subsidies, prices, loans, taxes, customs duties, fees, standards and others. The State shall promote the enhancement of labour productivity in agriculture and the modernization of farms, the maintenance of income of persons engaged permanently in agriculture, the zoning of crops and livestock, the protection and improvement of soil fertility and of the genetic resources of crops and breeding animals, as well as the domestic market and the expansion of foreign markets of Bulgarian processed and unprocessed agricultural products. The Council of Ministers shall propose a national agricultural development strategy and, on the basis of that strategy, approve an annual agricultural development programme. The Council shall also determine annually protected purchase prices or annual forecast prices of staple agricultural products. The Minister of Agriculture and Food Industries shall establish and maintain an information system regarding the production and the markets of agricultural products as well as the income of agricultural producers at national and regional levels. It shall establish regional agricultural services to assist agricultural producers in the preparation of their projects for funding and to cooperate with regional organizations of agricultural producers. Chapter II of this Act establishes the State Agricultural Fund. The Fund shall spend its resources in accordance with the objectives of this Act and state agricultural policy. The income of agricultural producers shall be exempted from income tax for a period of five years after the entry into force of this Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Marine Pollution Regulation 1995.
Policy_Content: The Regulation is divided into the following Parts: Preliminary (1); State Waters (2); Pollution by Oil or Noxious Substances (3); Pollution relating to Transfer Operations (4); Ships Carrying or Using Oil or Carrying Noxious Liquid Substances (5); Miscellaneous (6). Part 3 regulates the discharge of oil or oily mixtures, or noxious liquid substances that are carried as a cargo or part cargo in bulk. In particular, the provisions regard the notification of discharges, the time for furnishing discharge reports, and establish the content of discharge reports, the oil and the cargo record books and the matters to be recorded therein. Similar provisions are made with respect to the pollution relating to transfer operations.

Policy: Crown Lands Regulation 1995.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of the following Parts: Preliminary (1); Administration (2); Land Assessment (3); Sale, Lease or Other Disposal of Crown Land (4); Dedication and Reservation of Land (5); Miscellaneous (6). The application for consent to the transfer of land is subject to a recording under the following provisions of the Act: (a) section 36 (4) (a) (condition in contract for sale); (b) section 37 (2) (a) (conditions on a sale to a purchaser); (c) section 38 (a) (transfer restrictions on purchases); (d) section 44 (1) (a) (transfer restrictions on leases). Any application to transfer land: (a) is to be in the approved form; and (b) is to be lodged with an office of the State Lands Services together with the fee specified in Schedule 1. According to section 57 (1) specified activities may not be carried on on land which is the subject of an easement for public access. Applications for permit are required also for the enclosure of roads or watercourses, additional roads or watercourses, for a direction by a local land board to provide gates or other access. For the purpose of Section 108 of the Act temporary licences may be granted, in addition to grazing, for advertising, catering, exhibitions, markets, sporting and recreational activities, etc. Further provisions implement sections of the Act regarding reserve trust reports and reserve trust records. Miscellaneous provisions concern: (a) compensation for land withdrawn from lease or licence; (b) change of conditions or purposes; (c) exemption from conditions; (d) objections to, and appeals against, determination or redetermination of rent; (e) minimum rents; (f) interest on arrears; (g) protection of public land; (h) dumping of materials; (i) unauthorized activities on public land; (l) offences and penalties.

Policy: Politique Nationale Forestière (1995)
Policy_Content: Face à la déforestation et à la désertification, l'État Malien a élaboré en 1995 une Politique forestière nationale (PNF) dans l’optique de contribuer à la réalisation de trois dimensions fondamentales (sociale; économique; et écologique), chacune d’elles ayant des objectifs spécifiques.  En effet, la dimension sociale vise à responsabiliser les ruraux pour une gestion durable des ressources forestières, fauniques et halieutiques. Cette option reconnaît aux ruraux leur capacité de gérer rationnellement les ressources avec les appuis et les conseils dont ils auraient besoin. Il s’agit pour les ruraux d’acquérir un pouvoir de décision sur les ressources qu’ils envisagent d’exploiter et de conserver. Dans certains contextes particuliers, la Politique forestière nationale vise à associer les populations riveraines et divers opérateurs à cette gestion. Quant à la dimension économique de la Politique Forestière Nationale, elle vise à favoriser et à garantir l’investissement foncier en cofinançant l’investissement initial avec les gestionnaires des ressources, en sécurisant les investissements, mobilisant le financement des programmes nationaux, régionaux et locaux auprès des partenaires.  Enfin, la dimension écologique de la Politique Forestière Nationale vise, d’une part, à préserver la diversité biologique dans ses composantes (diversité génétique, diversité des produits et diversité des paysages), et d’autre part, à restaurer les écosystèmes dans le cadre de la lutte contre la désertification et l’avancée du désert. Pour atteindre ces objectifs la Politique forestière nationale prévoit six (6) axes stratégiques ou composantes, notamment favoriser l’initiative privée et le partenariat; préciser le mode de gestion des ressources aux différentes échelles; améliorer les capacités d’intervention des différents partenaires par un dispositif d’appui-formation-conseil efficace; favoriser l’investissement aux différentes étapes des filières; articuler la gestion des ressources aux différentes échelles spatiales et organisationnelles; et conserver la diversité biologique et restaurer les écosystèmes.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
