Policy: National Plan of Action on Food and Nutrition 1995-2000.

It is anticipated that the following objectives would be achieved by the year 2000: 1) Adequate food/nutrient intake by individuals; 2) Improved household food security; 3). Policy makers sensitized in food and nutrition related issues; 4) Strengthening coordination among agencies involve in food and nutrition issues; 5) Improved national capacity to deliver food and nutrition education and services; 6) Strengthened preventive measures against nutrition related diseases; 7) Increased adoption of breastfeeding practices; 8) Strengthened participatory approach to intervention in food and nutrition projects; 9) Increased adoption rate of good hygiene practices by individuals.

Policy: Programa de Acción Nacional de Lucha contra la Desertificación y la Sequía (PAN-LCD).
Policy_Content: El Programa de Lucha contra la Desertificación y la Sequía (PRONALDES) publicado en el mes de Junio de 1996, fue una primera etapa para identificar los problemas y soluciones para las Zonas Secas en Bolivia, juntamente con los Mapas Preliminares de Desertificación de Tierras y de Erosión de Suelos que identifican geográficamente a las zonas afectadas (Noviembre de 1996); sin embargo, el proceso nacional se debe llevar aún más adelante considerando las oportunidades que la CLD ofrece, como son los mecanismos participativos institucionalizados y los mecanismos financieros, para poner en marcha los Programas de Acción Nacionales. Las pasadas actividades o proyectos planeados en el marco del proceso PAN, fueron difícilmente aplicables sobre el terreno por falta de estructuras participativas, además es necesario que exista un grado importante de continuidad para desarrollar proyectos en el marco de este proceso. El presente documento representa un ajuste del PAN (PRONALDES) generado durante el año de 1996 y es considerado como un enfoque del proceso transectorial e integrado que involucra la participación de diferentes sectores, como ser el agropecuario, forestal, salud, educación, minería, industria, desarrollo urbano y rural a diferentes niveles institucionales como el de las comunidades, organizaciones no gubernamentales, sector privado, sector universitario, organizaciones de cooperación internacionales y varias direcciones gubernamentales. Por consiguiente, según nuestros compromisos anteriores a nivel nacional e internacional deben ser participativos y estar dirigidos a acciones concretas para Luchar contra la Desertificación y la Sequía.

Policy: Nepal Agricultural Perspective Plan.
Policy_Content: The Agricultural Perspective Plan (APP) is a national strategy with a cross-sectoral approach with a duration of twenty years (1995-2015). Its goal is to add two percentage points to the country’s agricultural growth which would expand per capita agricultural growth sixfold, from its current 0.5% to 3% per year.  The APP strategy is based on the acceleration of the agricultural growth rate sufficiently to obtrain strong multiplier effect on growth in employment, both in agriculture itself and in nonagricultural sectors. Growth is to occur through technological change in crop agriculture, the consequent demand pull on high value commodities, increasing specialization, and trade. The technological change is to be achieved through investment in research and extension, which is expected to generate the improved technology, through policies promoting fertilizer use and improved water control, which will embody the technology and through specialization and trade made possible by investment in roads and other market infrastructure. Its objectives are: to accelerate the growth rate in agriculture through increased factor productivity; to alleviate poverty and achieve significant improvement in the standard of living through accelerated growth and expanded employment opportunities; to transform the subsistence-based agriculture into a commercial one through diversification and widespread realization of comparative advantage; and to expand opportunities for an overall economic transformation by fulfilling the precondition of agricultural development.

Policy: Free Zone Act, 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act enables the establishment of free zones for the promotion of economic development, to provide for the regulation of activities in free zones and for related matters. The Act establishes a Free Zones Authority and regulates its composition, functioning and functions. The Declaration of a Free Zone is made by the President, on the recommendation of the Board, which is the governing body of the Authority. Such declaration shall also specify the area and the scope of activities in the free zone concerned. A body corporate registered under the Companies Act or a partnership registered under the Incorporated Private Partnership Act can be licensed to develop and/or manage the Free Zone under this Act as Free Zone Developer. Their rights and responsibilities are detailed by the Act and can be sub-contracted. Also enterprises can be established in a free zone their qualifications, rights and responsibilities are fully described by the Act. Also the licensing to develop, manage or establish an enterprise in a free zone is regulated (the application for a licence, its grant, its conditions, its revocation, the register of licences and its transfer). Ina free zone import laws are not applied and the imports of a free zone developer, subcontractor or enterprises into a free zone are exempt from direct and indirect taxes and duties. The sales of up to thirty percent of the annual production of good and services can be authorized in a free zone and the sales from a national territory to a free zone are to be considered as exports. The Act also consider the incentives foreseen for free zone developers and licensed enterprises (like the exemption from payment of income tax on profits for the first ten years from the commencement of operation and the reduction after; the unconditional transfer through authorized dealer banks in a free convertible currency; guarantees against expropriation). Dispute settlement procedures are set by article 32 while the employment and the residence in free zones are regulated by articles 34 and 35. Administration and miscellaneous provisions terminate the Act.

Policy: Myanmar Forest Policy 1995.
Policy_Content: The Myanmar Forest Policy 1995 formalizes the commitment and intent of the Government in ensuring sustainable development of the forest resource both for environmental and economic purposes. The document identifies six imperatives, namely: Protection, Sustainability, Basic Needs, Efficiency, Participation, and Public Awareness. These are called imperatives because without the attainment of these, the broader national goals and objectives would be jeopardized. Therefore, each of them must receive the highest government priority. The objectives identified are: Land Use; Protection and Management; Forest Regeneration and Afforestation; Forest Industry, Marketing and Trade; Forest Research; Forestry Planning; Intersectoral Coordination; Institutional Strengthening; Budget and Finance; People’s Participation and Public Awareness.

Policy: Philippine Plan for Gender-Responsive Development (PPGD) 1995-2025.
Policy_Content: This Philippine Plan for Gender-Responsive Development (PPGD) 1995-2025 is a nationwide  multi-sectoral policy document. In the Plan, sectors on economic and industrial development include: Agriculture and Fisheries; Agrarian Reform; Environment and Natural Resources; and Industry, Trade and Tourism. The following primary objectives are highlighted in the sectoral plans: to promote and enhance the participation of women, both as agents and beneficiaries, in economic and industrial development; and to mainstream gender concerns in the development and management of the sub-sectors in agriculture, environment and natural resources, and industry, trade and tourism.

Policy: National Plan of Action for Nutrition 1995.
Policy_Content: National Plan of Action for Nutrition is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The goal of this Plan of Action is to achieve and maintain nutritional well-being and health of the population.

Policy: National Policy for the Conservation and Management of Wetland Resources, 1995
Policy_Content: This Policy sets the following goals; to establish the principles by which wetland resources can be optimally used now and in the future; to end practices which reduce wetland productivity; to maintain the biological diversity of natural or semi-natural wetlands; to maintain wetland functions and values; and to integrate wetland concerns into the planning and decision making of other sectors. The principles guiding the pursuit of these goals are that wetland resources form an integral part of the environment and their management must be pursued in the context of an interaction between conservation and the national development strategies and activities, wetland conservation can only be achieved through a coordinated and cooperative approach involving all the concerned people and organisations in the country including the local communities and it is of vital importance for wetland conservation and management that the present attitudes and perceptions of Ugandans regarding wetlands be changed. The goals are to be achieved through thirty six policy statements, aimed at ensuring no drainage occurs unless more important environment management requirements supersede; that only non-destructive uses are carried out in and around wetlands; that wetland developments are subject to environmental impact assessment and audit; and maintaining an optimum diversity of uses and users and consideration for other stakeholders when using a wetland. Among the resource problems identified by the Policy, it specifically tries to handle the issues of water loss, reduced runoff control, soil deterioration, crop pest risks, health problems, etc. The policy also provides for the sustainable use of wetlands and provides two strategies to this effect; wetlands may be utilized in such a way that they do not lose traditional benefits presently obtained from them and any decision to use wetlands must consider the requirements of all other users in the community. Strategies are also provided for the environmentally sound management, conservation, water supply and effluent treatment, tenure and use, recovery, environmental impact assessment, research and inventory, developing public awareness, etc. of wetlands.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Biodiversity,Capacity building,Water shortage/drought,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Ecosystem preservation,EIA,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Protection of environment,Wetlands,Freshwater resources management,Governance,Surface water,Water conservation zone,Water quality standards
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Local Government Act 1995.
Policy_Content: This Act consists of 10 Parts and 9 Schedules. The aim of this Act to set a system of local government by (a)providing for the constitution of elected local governments in the State; and (b)describing the functions of local governments; and (c)providing for the conduct of elections and other polls; and (d)providing a framework for the administration and financial management of local governments and for the scrutiny of their affairs. Part 2 laysdown provisions concerning constitution of local government, such as district subdivision, local government creation and role, filling of offices,  qualifications for holding office on the council, commissioner functions and appointment, among others.
Subject: Land & soil, General

Policy: Ley Nº 2/1995 - Ley de protección y desarrollo del patrimonio forestal de La Rioja.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por finalidad establecer el régimen legal para la protección y mejora de la flora y el patrimonio forestal de La Rioja y es de aplicación a todos los montes y terrenos forestales que radican en el territorio de la Comunidad Autónoma. Son objetivos de esta Ley, entre otros, los siguientes: a) promover la actividad de pastoreo en los montes de manera ordenada; b) fomentar la colaboración con las entidades locales en la defensa y protección de los terrenos forestales; c) incrementar el patrimonio forestal; d) fomentar y regular el papel del bosque como marco natural de esparcimiento y recreo.
Subject: Forestry

The new sections specify procedures for the modification requests to the Appeals Committee of the Rural Activities District Office. Modifications may be requested for Disposition Plans or loan terms.

Policy: Act to amend the Rural Activities Management Act (No. 169 of 1995).
Policy_Content: A new definition of "credit institution" is given in section 4. The Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry may appoint other types of credit institutions, for purposes of the Act, than those listed. All other amendments of the principal Act concern the granting of credit: the Ministry may grant interest-free loans (sect. 23); Decisions of the Ministry on credits shall be based on reports of District Rural Activities Offices and local authorities responsible for the administration of rural activities (sect. 31); Disposition Plans may be amended in accordance with section 42. Remaining amended provisions deal with repayment of credit, appeal against decisions of withdrawal or cancellation of credits (sect. 51), modification of terms and conditions of credits (sect. 51(b)), fees for appeal (sect. 51(c)), and request for modification on the basis of previous legislation (sect. 59(d)).

Policy: Order No. 7 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Nuclear Safety validating the Regulation on the content and procedure for drawing up a report on inventory of emissions of pollutants at the enterprise.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that rate setting in the sphere of the protection of atmospheric air is carried out for the purpose of introduction of a complex of mandatory norms, rules, requirements with a view of protection atmospheric air against pollution. The Regulation contains methodical instructions on the content and registration of the necessary documents for drafting of the report on the inventory of emissions of pollutants that are formed at the enterprise with the consideration of technological process and its particulars. Inventory includes the characteristics of the technology, gas treatment plants in terms of formation and discharging pollutants, determination of parameters of stationary emission sources, as well as the characteristics of unidentified sources.      Inventory of emissions of pollutants can be carried out both on full scale and selectively by definition of parameters of separate sources of formation or emissions, determination of qualitative and quantitative characteristics of individual pollutants that are discharged into atmospheric air in the process of operation of technological equipment.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 49 of 1995 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding validation of the Regulation on the Integral state system of ecological monitoring (EGSM).
Policy_Content: The Minister orders to validate the Regulation. This Regulation determines the purposes and the tasks of organization and functioning of the Integral state system of ecological monitoring (EGSM), its structure, the modalities of functioning and legal informational status. EGSM is functioning and developing for the purpose of informational support of environmental management, rational use of natural resources, ensuring ecologically safe sustainable development of the country and its regions, keeping up state data base regarding the state of environment and ecosystems, natural resources and the sources of anthropogenic impact. The document consists of 3 Sections. Section 1 determines the purposes, the tasks and the functions of EGSM. Section 2 establishes the structure of EGSM. Section 3 concerns the functioning of EGSM.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: State Lands Regulations, 1995 (L. N. No. 13 of 1995).
Policy_Content: Regulations to make provision for the granting of state lands or the granting of leases of state lands and for the use of such lands. The 46 regulations are divided into 9 Parts: Preliminary; Application for grant of state land for residential purpose (I); Application for grant of state land for non-residential purpose (II); Application for lease by deemed lessee (III); Covenants in all leases (IV); Additional covenants in specific leases (V); Contents of a lease (VI); Premium (VII); Miscellaneous (VIII). Grants of state lands shall be in planned areas only (reg. 3). The Land Administration Board shall register and review applications for grant of state lands in accordance with eligibility criteria prescribed in Schedule II. A "deemed lessee" may apply for a lease of land held under the customary tenure or year to year tenancy. Regulation 23 prescribes additional conditions for the lease of agricultural land. (4 Schedules)

Policy: Land Use Regulations, 1995 (L.N. No. 11 of 1995).
Policy_Content: Land uses shall, for purposes of Draft Development Plans and development control, be classified and divided into land uses, classes, and land use zones as specified in Schedule I (reg. 3). Regulation 4 provides for the classification of existing land uses. Intensity of construction may be indicated in Proposal Maps of Draft Local Plans and where intensity is not indicated in such plans, the provisions of Schedule I apply (reg. 6). The Planning Authority shall review and decide on all applications for a Development Permit in accordance with Schedule II (reg. 7).

Policy: Draft Plans Regulations, 1995 (L. N. No. 12 of 1995).

The 8 regulations are divided into 3 Parts: Preliminary (regs. 1 and 2); Form and Content of Draft Development Plans (regs. 3 to 5); Form and Content of Draft Local Plans (regs. 6 to 8). A Draft Development Plan shall contain a Proposals Map which shall indicate in general the proposed land use classes, transport and traffic routes, community facilities and utilities as conceived or recommended by the Plan for the plan period (reg. 4(1)). Comma (2) of regulation 4 prescribes in detail indications which shall be included in such Plan. The written statement attached to the Plan shall contain an analysis of the existing conditions of the planning area (reg. 5). Draft Local Plans may be "Layout Plans", "Action Area Plans" or be named in accordance with the subject to which the Plan relates (reg. 6(1)). (3 Schedules: Notations to be used in existing landuse maps and Proposal Maps (1); Authentication of maps (2); Authentication of written statements (3)).

Policy: Law No. 39/95-VR on the utilization of nuclear energy and radiation safety.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 17 Sections and  90 articles dealing with the following matters: general provisions (sect. 1, arts. 1-9); rights of citizens and associations in the sphere of the utilization of nuclear energy and radiation safety (sect. 2, arts. 10-16); jurisdiction of the executive and managing bodies (sect. 3, arts. 17-21); state regulation of the safe utilization of nuclear energy (sect. 4, arts. 22-30); legal status of legal and natural persons carrying activity in the sphere of the utilization of nuclear energy and radiation safety (sect. 5, arts. 31-36); distribution, construction, putting in and out of operation of nuclear plants and sites for radioactive waste management (sect. 6, arts. 37-44); special regime of the location of nuclear plants and radioactive waste management sites (sect. 7, arts. 45-47); special conditions of regulation of the safety of vessels, space vehicles and aircraft with nuclear reactor or source of ionizing radiation (sect. 8, arts. 48-49); radioactive waste management (sect. 9, arts. 50-53); transport of nuclear materials (sect. 10, arts. 54-59); physical protection of nuclear plants, radioactive materials, radioactive waste and other sources of ionizing radiation (sect. 11, arts. 60-66); prevention of the utilization of nuclear materials, equipment and technologies for military purposes (sect. 12, arts. 67-71); compensation of radioactive damage (sect. 13, arts. 72-80); liability for the infringement of the legislation (sect. 14, arts. 81-83); export and import of nuclear plants, technologies and materials (sect. 15, arts. 84-86); international cooperation (sect. 16, arts. 87-88); final provisions (sect. 17, arts. 89-90). The present Law is the basic in the legislation on nuclear energy, it establishes the priority of the protection of the population and environment and regulates activity connected with the utilization of nuclear plants and the sources of ionizing radiation. The main tasks of the legislation on nuclear energy shall be: 1) legal regulation of all types of the utilization of nuclear energy; 2) establishment of the basic principles of the protection of the population and environment (art. 3). The main principles of the state policy shall be: 1) priority of the protection of the population and environment against impact of the ionizing radiation; 2) to ensure such utilization of nuclear energy which produces the minimum amount of radioactive waste; 3) burial and long-term storage of radioactive waste at the expense of the producers thereof (art. 5). The Law is applicable to all types of activity connected with the utilization of nuclear energy, including: 1) putting in and out of operation nuclear plants and the sources of ionizing radiation; 2) management of the nuclear materials and the sources of ionizing radiation; 3) research; 4) registration (art. 7). The state regulation in the sphere of safe management of nuclear energy envisages: 1) setting criteria and requirements (regulation) for the management of nuclear plants and sources of ionizing radiation; 2) authorization for the aforesaid activities; 3) supervision (art. 22). Construction, reconstruction, putting out of operation, amendment of requirements and safety regulations of nuclear plants and sites for the management of radioactive waste shall be subject to compulsory environmental audit (art. 40). Organization, carrying out the registration and supervision of the nuclear materials shall be the competence of the authorized state institution in the sphere of nuclear and radiation safety (art. 68).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy_Content: This Law outlines the basic provisions regarding the rights of the State in the search, research and exploitation of hydrocarbons, the ways of concession of such rights to third parties and regarding general relative subjects. Also the Law regulates the following issues: disposal of petroleum products in the Greek market; safety reserves of petroleum products; configuration of pricing policy of petroleum products; marketing of petroleum products and issuing of relevant authorisation; supply and special account for guaranteeing unimpeded supply of petroleum to problematic regions of the country.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 68 adopting amendments to the international Convention of 1972 on the dumping at sea of wastes and other matter.
Policy_Content: With the present Decree are adopted the amendments made to Annexes I, II and III of the international Convention on the prevention of marine pollution by dumping of wastes and other matter. The amendments regard the incineration at sea of such wastes. More specifically, the incineration system for every proposed marine incineration shall be subject to a special permit and to specific surveys specified in the text. Where there are doubts as to the thermal destructibility of  wastes proposed for incineration, special studies shall be undertaken. Marine incineration facilities shall follow operational requirements laid down by Regulation 5 and shall utilize recording devices and methods. Criteria governing the selection of incineration sites are laid down by Regulation 8. The list of substances to be incinerated included in Annex I and II is amended with Regulation 9. Also amendments are brought forth to the Annexes of the Convention regarding disposal at sea of radioactive wastes and other radioactive matter.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Loi nº 95-115 pour l'aménagement et le développement du territoire.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte une série de dispositions relatives à l'aménagement et au développement du territoire. Elle a pour objet la mise en valeur et le développement équilibré du territoire de la République, afin d'assurer, à chaque citoyen, l'égalité des chances sur l'ensemble du territoire et de créer les conditions de leur égal accès au savoir. Elle est formée par 88 articles répartis en 7 titres, à savoir: Documents et organismes relatifs au développement du territoire (I); Pays (II); Action territoriale de l'Etat (III); Instruments financiers de l'Etat (IV); Dispositions spécifiques à certaines parties du territoire (V); Compétences, péréquation et du développement local (VI); Dispositions communes (VII).

Policy: Act on protection of agricultural and forest lands.
Policy_Content: The Act, which is composed of eight Chapters, lays down principles of protection of agricultural and forest lands, recultivation and improvement of land quality. Agricultural lands are protected by: limitation of their allocation for other purposes; prevention from degradation and devastation; recultivation; and preservation of peat areas and natural water reservoirs. Forest lands are protected by: limitation of their allocation for other purposes; prevention from degradation and devastation; restoration of land value; and prevention from reduction of productivity.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Agricultural land,Erosion,Soil rehabilitation,Sustainable development,Ecosystem preservation
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Decree No. 77 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on Novogrudok biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Novogrudok biosphere reserve shall have as its purpose the conservation in its natural state the unique natural landscape that is characterized by the spreading of natural aged coniferous forest, broad-leaved forest and plants that are rare for Belarusian flora. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of Novogrudok biosphere reserve: 1) clear final cutting; 2) land reclamation and any other activity causing change of landscape and the existing hydrological regime; 3) damage and annihilation of shrubbery and forest plantations and disturbance of soil; 4) grazing; 5) setting up tourist camps. The proclamation of Novogrudok biosphere reserve shall not entail the expropriation of land. The regional executive bodies shall be the managing authority of Novogrudok biosphere reserve. The damages caused to Novogrudok biosphere reserve shall be compensated by the legal and natural persons in conformity with the modalities established by law.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Land clearing,Protection of species,Wild flora
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Decreto Nº 245 - Ajusta la infraestructura del Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y determina la del Instituto Colombiano de la Reforma Agraria (INCORA).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto ajusta la infraestructura del Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y determina la del Instituto Colombiano de la Reforma Agraria (INCORA). Asimismo, dispone que el Instituto Nacional de Pesca y Acuicultura (INPA), continuará funcionando como un establecimiento público del orden nacional, dotado de personería jurídica, autonomía administrativa y patrimonio independiente, adscrito al Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural. El INPA tendrá como objetivo primordial contribuir al desarrollo sostenido de la actividad pesquera y acuícola, con el fin de incorporarla de manera decidida a la economía del país, garantizando la explotación racional y adecuada de los recursos pesqueros y acuícolas.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 96 regarding validation of the Recommendations on the modalities of realisation of the rights of the owners of land shares and property shares.
Policy_Content: The Government, for the purpose of securing the rights of the owners of land shares and property shares in agricultural commercial enterprises which members have voluntarily agreed to re-organise them, as well as for the purpose of regulating certification of the right of property and property transactions, decrees to validate Recommendations on preparation and issue of certificates on the right to land shares and property shares and Recommendations on the modalities of management of land shares and property shares. Recommendations on preparation and issue of certificates on the right to land shares and property shares are applicable to agricultural commercial organizations (enterprises). Internal administrative commissions carry out inventory of agricultural land and property, calculate (define more exactly) land shares and property shares, legalise, register and issue certificates on property share and issue certificates on land share elaborated by provincial committees on land resources and land survey. Recommendations on the modalities of management of land shares and property shares are applicable to the transactions of property shares in accordance with Civil Code. The Regulation consists of 12 Sections. Section 1 regards lease. Section 2 concerns transactions of land shares. Section 3 deals with exchange of land share with property share. Section 4 concerns deposition of land share or the right of use of land share as fixed capital share of agricultural commercial organization. Section 5 regards allotment of the plots of land as land share. Section 6 concerns other transactions with land. Section 7 regards the modalities of disposal of unclaimed shares of land. Section 8 regards deposition of property share as fixed capital share. Section 9 regards transactions with property share. Section 10 regards donation and inheritance of property share. Section 11 regards allotment of property as part of property share. Section 12 concerns the modalities of disposal of unclaimed property shares.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Loi n°95/08 du 30 janvier 1995 portant sur la  radioprotection.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet d’assurer la protection de l’homme et de son environnement contre les  risques susceptibles de découler de l’utilisation, soit d’une substance radioactive, ou de l’exercice  d’une activité impliquant une radioexposition. Elle régit les applications pacifiques de substance radioactive et de l’énergie à des fins d’intérêt  général. La protection visée à l’article premier ci-dessus concerne : – la préservation de l’air, l’eau, du sol, de la flore et de la faune ; – la préservation ou la limitation des activités susceptibles de dégrader l’environnement ; – le maintien ou la restauration des ressources que la nature offre à l’homme.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Forestry Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down provisions on forests in the Canton of Solothurn. It is the basis for the implementation of federal laws and ordinances and for the implementation of the cantonal forestry, space, and environmental policy. Its aim is to conserve, promote and protect the forests, as well as to create a frame-work for a sustainable development of the forests. The cultivation of forests shall be carried out with a view to protect and to promote the forest as a living space, in particular for animals and plants. The owners of forests shall put into effect special measures to protect plant varieties and biotopes. Furthermore, to preserve forests they shall renounce in part or completely to wood cutting. In such a case the Canton can make compensation payments. The competent body entitled to authorize land clearing is the Cantonal Forest Office; it decides both on clearing applications and compensation payments. Limitations of access to forests are allowed only on of public interest grounds as, for example, for the protection of rare plants, wild living animals, etc. In case happenings taking place in or on the outskirt of forests may cause harmful effects an authorization is needed. Part C deals with care and use of forests. Forest planning includes forest development planning. Seeds and planting material to be used shall be of first quality and not manipulated. The text consists of 42 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Protection of forests from unauthorized interventions (II); Care and use of forests (III); Promotion measures (IV); Organization and enforcement (V); Final provisions (VI).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Basic legislation,Forestry protection measures,Land clearing,Enforcement/compliance
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 January 1996.

Policy: Decree No. 39 of 1995 concerning the discharge of water for purposes of soil protection.
Policy_Content: "Discharge" is defined in article 2 as the bringing into the soil of liquids for as a permanent solution. The Decree does not apply to discharge of surface water, rain or drinking water, or groundwater, to which no pollutant are added and is not heated, and to irrigation for agricultural purposes (art. 2). Chapter II places limits on smaller discharge of household waste water. Chapter III places limits on larger discharge of household waste water. Permit, for Chapter IV, provides for the discharge of cooling water and other liquids. Permits for discharges are required and certain infrastructural measures to be carried out compulsorily. The remaining Chapters contain administrative, final and transitory provisions.

Policy: Land Consolidation Act (1995)
Policy_Content: This Act sets out the procedure and principles for land consolidation. For the purposes of this Act, ‘land consolidation’ means an activity aimed at creating opportunities for the more practical use and management of immovables or parts thereof by taking land consolidation steps. Land consolidation steps are reallocation of an immovable or a part thereof; exchange of parts of immovables; change of the boundary of immovables; division of an immovable; joining of immovables; establishment of the boundary of immovables; and ascertainment of restrictions on immovable property ownership. Land consolidation is based on the following: land consolidation requirements; the planning solution, provided that a plan has been established; the rights of the owners of immovables; and the public interests. Land consolidation in the territory of a city or rural municipality is within the competence of the local authority. Administrative supervision over the lawfulness of land consolidation is exercised by the Land Board.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

The main tasks of the National Committee shall be: 1) coordination of the international research; 2) creation of data base of the environmental information for the purpose of the prognostication of the global environmental changes and granting access to the aforesaid information; 3) expertise.

Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. The Interministerial Co-ordination Commission functions for the period of effect of the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development concerning the land based credit for putting into effect land reform. The main task of the Interministerial Co-ordination Commission is to control the fulfilment of the project of the support of land reform and assistance to the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey in the solution of issues that require inter-departmental co-ordination and cooperation. The Interministerial Co-ordination Commission is made up of the representatives of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Economy and other Federal Executive Bodies concerned and is presided by the President of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey.

Policy: Act relative to the administration of the environment (No. 55 of 1995).
Policy_Content: Section 1 outlines the general task of the environment administration, which consists according to section 2 of the Finnish Environment Centre and the regional environment centres. These organizations shall be responsible for the enhancement of sustainable development and the right use of natural resources. Both kinds of public bodies form part of the administration of the Ministry of the Environment. The geographical areas of administration of the regional centres shall be established by the Council of Ministers. The tasks of the regional environment centres are outlined in section 4. The rather general description of the sphere of competence of these regional bodies includes protection of the use of land and water resources, the prevention of damage to the environment, and the monitoring the condition of the environment. The regional environment centres shall take over various tasks from other local bodies currently involved in the protection of the environment in general and the protection of water resources in particular. The tasks of the Finnish Environment Centre seem to lie mainly in the field of monitoring and research. (12 sections)
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Regulation relative to Regional Environment Centres (No. 57 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides rules relative to the administration and internal organization of regional environment centres which shall be established pursuant to Act No. 55 of 1995. Regulation 54 of 1995 outlines in general the tasks of such centres which shall include in part tasks previously carried out by other local environment protection agencies. Each of the centres shall draw up for its area a regional environment plan and programme which shall take into account also structural funds of the European Union (sect. 7). Section 8 provides for the administration of matters which concern two or more environment centres. (10 sections)
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: This Regulation provides rules relative to the administration and internal organization of the Finnish Environment Centre established by Act No. 55/95. Regulation 54 of 1995 outlines in general the tasks of this institute. Section 1 deals with the composition of the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall supervise the work of the Centre and develop the general policy of the institute. The day to day administration shall be carried out by the Director General (sect. 4). The Director General shall be assisted by a director responsible for research and a director responsible for development.

Policy: Decree relative to the Ministry of the Environment (No. 54 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Regulation outlines tasks, internal organization and working procedures of the Ministry of the Environment. The Ministry shall be responsible for sustainable development. In particular the Ministry shall: conserve the natural riches, production capacity and beauty of natural resources; prevent and limit damages to the environment caused by actions of men; enhance a friendly living environment, structure of society and the right use of land; protect the landscape; create the conditions for safe, healthy and economically sustainable development (sect. 1). The Finnish Environment Centre, the State Construction Fund, and the regional environment centres shall be part of the administration of the Ministry (sect. 3).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Order No.18 of 1995 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding organization of the system of certification on the basis of ecological requirements for the prevention of environmental damage (system of ecological certification).
Policy_Content: The Minister orders to validate the Regulation. Ecological certification is carried out for the purpose of creation of economic and legal mechanism for the realization of the right of citizens to favourable environment envisaged by the Constitution of the Russian Federation. The system envisages voluntary and compulsory certification. Ecological certification must be carried out compulsory in cases envisaged by the federal and regional legislation of the Russian Federation. Voluntary certification within the framework of the system is carried out if the legislative acts of the Russian Federation do not envisage compulsory certification. Voluntary certification is carried out in accordance with the contract between certification body and applicant concluded on the initiative of the applicant. The document consists of 11 Secs. Section 1 is the introduction. Section 2 introduces terms and concepts. Section 3 lays down general provisions. Section 4 establishes the main rules of the system. Section 5 establishes the structure of the system and the modalities of its functioning. Section 6 regards the modalities of attestation of environmental auditors. Section 7 establishes normative and methodical basis of the system. Section 8 regards provision the system with information. Section 9 establishes economic principles of the functioning of the system. Section 10 determines the stages of the development of the system. Section 11 contains the list of the normative documents for ecological certification.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Décret nº 95-79 fixant les prescriptions prévues par l'article 2 de la loi nº 92-1444 du 31 décembre 1992 relative à la lutte contre le bruit et relatives aux objets bruyants et aux dispositifs d'insonorisation.
Policy_Content: Il est interdit de fabriquer pour le marché intérieur, de mettre en vente, de vendre, d'importer, de louer, de détenir ou d'exposer en vue de la vente, de mettre à disposition, de céder à quelque titre que ce soit ou d'utiliser tout objet susceptible de provoquer des nuisances sonores élevées ou tout dispositif d'insonorisation qui ne répond pas aux dispositions du présent décret. A chaque type ou famille d'objets ou de dispositifs relevant des catégories mentionnées à l'article 1er sont associées des caractéristiques acoustiques et des valeurs limites admissibles correspondant aux critères suivants: a) Intensité sonore mesurée en niveau de pression acoustique quand la distance est un paramètre de l'appréciation de la nuisance ou en niveau de puissance acoustique dans les autres cas; pour les dispositifs d'insonorisation, l'intensité sonore caractérise la valeur d'atténuation; ces valeurs sont exprimées en décibels pondérés A; b) Importance des dangers et des conséquences négatives des nuisances sonores sur les personnes ou sur l'environnement appréciée en tenant compte de leur mode de fonctionnement, d'utilisation, de l'ampleur de leur diffusion et, le cas échéant, du meilleur état de la technique. Les valeurs limites retenues tiennent compte des caractéristiques de l'objet, notamment de sa puissance et de la source d'énergie employée, ainsi que de la durée et de la fréquence de son utilisation dans des conditions normales.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Law on Supervision of Official Fineness (1995)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to protect the interests of the State and consumers in the field of using precious metals, precious stones and their articles. The Law prescribes the requirements for assaying, marking, and labelling of precious metal articles made and brought (imported) in the Republic of Latvia, the fineness marks with which such articles shall be marked, and also governs the supervision of official fineness. This Law applies to any person who performs economic activity involving precious metals, precious stones and their articles. The persons who perform economic activity involving precious metals, precious stones and their articles have a duty to register the locations where such economic activities are performed with the assay authority of Latvia. Valsts sabiedrība ar ierobežotu atbildību "Latvijas proves birojs" [State limited liability company Assay Office of Latvia] shall be the assay authority of Latvia. Registration fee shall not be required.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi nº 95-003 portant organisation de l'exploitation du transport et du commerce du bois.
Policy_Content: Cette loi fixe les conditions d'exploitation, de transport et de commercialisation du bois (bois-énergie, bois d'oeuvre et bois de service). Les structures rurales de gestion, organisations de producteurs de bois agréées par les autorités en vue d'approvisionner un marché rural de bois, bénéficient d'un quota annuel d'exploitation fixé par une commission ad hoc. Ces structures sont tenues à entretenir et participer aux travaux de régénération des massifs forestiers qu'elles exploitent. Outre aux structures sus-mentionnées, sont habilités à exploiter et à vendre du bois: les propriétaires de forêts privées dûment immatriculées et les particuliers munis de titre d'exploitation pour les zones non délimitées et non aménagées. Ces exploitations sont dites de type contrôlé, quand elles sont faites à partir de forêts délimitées et aménagées, de type orienté, quand elles sont faites à partir de forêts délimitées mais non aménagées, et de type incontrôlé, quand elles sont faites à partir de forêts non délimitées et non aménagées. Le transport de bois-énergie par les particuliers est autorisé et limité aux quantités destinées à l'auto-consommation. Tout transport de bois-énergie doit être justifié par un titre de transport appelé coupon.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Loi nº 95-004 fixant les conditions de gestion des ressources forestières.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte dispositions générales relatives aux ressources forestières. Elle est formée par 99 articles répartis en 5 titres, à savoir: Généralités -définitions, qui porte aussi définitions et réglementations relatives aux défrichements, aux essences protégées, aux droits d'usage et aux feux. Le défrichement est interdit: dans les zones de naissance des cours d'eau, dans les zones de peuplements purs d'essences protégées ou présentant un intérêt économique, dans les zones protégées pour raison de santé publique ou de défense nationale et dans les forêts classées et les périmètres de reboisement. L'article 17 fixe la liste des essence protégées et l'article 18 prévoit que les collectivités territoriales décentralisées puissent décider de protéger des espèces déterminées. Les articles de 21 à 23 réglementent les mises à feu dans le domaine forestier (I); Répartition et composition du domaine forestier national, qui se répartit en domaine de l'Etat, des collectivités territoriales décentralisées et des particuliers et se compose du domaine forestier classé et du domaine forestier protégé (II); Gestion du domaine forestier national, visant à la protection des ressources forestières et effectuée selon des plans d'aménagement. Les chapitres 2,3 et 4 de ce titre portent respectivement les dispositions relatives à la gestion du domaine forestier classé et protégé de l'Etat, du domaine des collectivités territoriales décentralisées et du domaine des particuliers. (III); Répression des infractions (IV); Dispositions diverses (V).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Measures of Tianjin Municipality for  implementing the Water and Soil Conservation Law of the People’s Republic of China.
Policy_Content: These Measures are formulated in accordance with the provisions in the Water and Soil Conservation Law, aiming to prevent and control water and soil loss, protect and rationally utilize water and soil resources, reduce flood, drought, sandstorm disasters, improve the ecological environment, and ensure the sustainable economic and social development. The Text consists of 28 Articles.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 48 validating the Regulation on main felling in the plain forest and low hill forest.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be compulsory for forest owners and forest managers irrespectively of their departmental subordination and form of property. Plain forest and low hill forests shall be considered small insular forests growing in low hill areas, deserts and floodplain forests. The Ministerial Decree consists of 12 Sections dealing with: (1) general provisions; (2) timber extraction methods and techniques of main felling; (3) felling in insular forests of forest and steppe areas; (4) felling in the low hill forest; (5) felling in coniferous forest belts; (6) felling in the insular coniferous forests; (7) felling in the desert forests; (8) felling in the intrazonal forests; (9) ecological and forestry requirements for cutting area work; (10) use of felling debris and land clearing; (11) forest reproduction in the cutting areas; (12) liability. Main felling must ensure: (a) conservation and improvement of protection forests; (b) timely substitution of mature forest with underwood; (c) reproduction of the precious forest species in the cutting areas; (d) sustainable and inexhaustible forest management and rational use of forest land; (e) improvement of forest productivity. Trees and shrubbery of precious and rare species shall not be destined for main felling. In the protected areas, national parks and nature reserves shall be authorized only cleaning cutting and sanitary felling.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Land clearing,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon portant réglementation de l'utilisation sur ou dans les sols des boues d'épuration ou de boues issues de centres de traitement de gadoues de fosses septiques (M.B. 12.04.1995).
Policy_Content: Le présente arrêté a pour objet réguler l'utilisation sur ou dans les sols des boues d'épuration ou de boues issues de centres de traitement de gadoues de fosses septiques. Au sens du présent arrêté, on entend par: boues, les boues résiduaires issues de stations d'épuration d'eaux usées domestiques, de processus d'épuration d'eaux usées industrielles ou de centres de traitement des gadoues de fosses septiques; utilisation, l'épandage des boues sur les sols ou toute autre application des boues sur et dans les sols; et producteur, tout gestionnaire d'une station ou d'une installation d'épuration privée ou publique ou d'un centre de traitement de gadoues de fosses septiques, qui par son activité, génère une boue. Les boues ne peuvent être utilisées sur ou dans les sols que lorsqu'il est satisfait aux conditions suivantes: 1° les boues sont non dangereuses et non toxiques et présentent des concentrations inférieures aux valeurs limites en métaux lourds figurant à l'annexe I A et ont un pH (eau) supérieur à 6; 2° les sols présentent des concentrations inférieures aux valeurs limites en métaux lourds figurant à l'annexe I B et ont un pH (eau) supérieur à 6; et 3° les quantités épandues ne dépassent pas les seuils maxima déterminés conformément à l'annexe I C. Tout produit réalisé à base de boues et destiné lui-même à être utilisé sur ou dans les sols, doit respecter les mêmes impositions que celles prévues pour l'utilisation des boues sur ou dans les sols.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Waste management,Soil pollution/quality,Fertilizers/nutrients,Risk assessment/management,Waste non-domestic sources,Water quality standards,Recycling/reuse,Effluent waste water/discharge,Pollution control

Policy: Law No. 11.054 providing for the State Policy on Forestry.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 74 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes the Policy on Forestry of the State of Paraná. The existing forests in the territory of Paraná and other forms of vegetation, recognized as useful, are property of common interest to all inhabitants of the State, exercising the property rights with the limitations that this State Forestry Law establishes. Forestry activities must ensure, in addition to their socio-economic objectives, the maintenance of quality of life and ecological balance. Authorization for the exploitation of native forests of the State will only be allowed through management techniques. The forest policy and the execution of this Law will be applied by competent forestry authority. The forests and other forms of native vegetation existing in the territory of Paraná are classified in: permanent preservation areas; legal reserve; productive; and conservation units. The forests and other forms of vegetation specified in the Brazilian forest code are considered to be permanent preservation within the State of Paraná. The forestry authority will create mechanisms and encourage the restoration of permanent preservation areas currently degraded.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG24/1995 validating the Regulation on the content of land cadastre documentation.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the content of land cadastre documentation sets the content, purpose and timing of submission to higher authorities of the general land cadastral documentation. The cadastral documentation is official documentation, mandatory for compilation and keeping at the level of requirements of the cadastre of the village (communities), city, municipality, district, national level. Based on this Regulation, local public authorities (land management service) shall carry out on site work on daily keeping of cadastral documentation and submit it in full within established deadline. Cadastral register of land owners, act confirming the right of land owner, the project for the organization of the territory and the decision of the local authority and decision of local public administration on allotment of land serve as the basis for a decision related to taxation, purchase and sale of land plots of public ownership, inheritance and resolution of land disputes over land plots, rights to which were not registered by the territorial cadastral authority in real estate register. The purpose of the cadastral documentation is to confirm the right of ownership, possession and use of land when land plots are allotted to the owners by the state.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Décret nº 95-20 pris pour l'application de l'article L. 111-11-1 du Code de la construction et de l'habitation et relatif aux caractéristiques acoustiques de certains bâtiments autres que d'habitation et de leurs équipements.
Policy_Content: Les bâtiments nouveaux et parties nouvelles de bâtiments existants relevant de tout établissement d'enseignement, de santé, de soins, d'action sociale,de loisirs et de sport ainsi qu'aux hôtels et établissements d'hébergement à caractère touristique sont construits et aménagés de telle sorte que soient limités les bruits à l'intérieur des locaux, par une isolation acoustique vis-à-vis de l'extérieur et entre locaux, par la recherche des conditions d'absorption acoustique et par la limitation des bruits engendrés par les équipements des bâtiments. Des arrêtés conjoints des ministres chargés de la construction, de l'environnement, de l'intérieur et, selon les cas, des autres ministères intéressés, pris après consultation du Conseil national du bruit, fixent, pour les différentes catégories de locaux et en fonction de leur utilisation, les seuils et les exigences techniques, applicables à la construction et à l'aménagement, permettant d'atteindre ces objectifs.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regulation on Duties and Functions of the High Council of Oceanography.
Policy_Content: The Regulation, which consists of 12 articles, is the Executive Regulation on Duties and Functions of the High Council of Oceanography. The Council compromises the Chairman of the Council, the Secretariat and Committees. Council meetings shall be convened at least once every three months. Main duties of the Council include coordination and making appropriate policies for efficient use of marine resources, increase in the safety of maritime shipping and transportation, coordinating the scientific and research activities regarding the Oceanography, providing appropriate suggestion for relevant law making, making appropriate communication between Marine Information Centers and development of international cooperation.

Policy: Biotechnology Support Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to develop and support biotechnology more efficiently by laying the foundation of biotechnology research and to contribute to the sound progress of the national economy by facilitating the industrialization of the technology. Article 13 deals with the establishment of a policy to support biotechnology and establishes, inter alia, that the Minister of Trade, Industry and Energy shall provide assistance in enhancing the biotechnology-related industrial process, developing new and renewable energy, efficiently utilizing energy and mineral resources and developing biotechnology-related manufacturing technology, and facilitating the industrialization of such developed technology. Article 15 emphasizess that the experimental guidelines shall include measures necessary to prevent biological hazards, negative influences upon the environment and any ethical problems that may arise in the course of research on biotechnology and its industrialization, and shall also include safety standards for the transfer, handling and use of genetically converted organism. The text consists of 20 articles.

Policy: Tamil Nadu Rosewood Trees (Conservation) Act, 1994 (No. 1 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits any person from cutting, felling, girdling, lopping, tapping, burning, uprooting or otherwise damaging any rosewood trees in any forest in the State. Further, the Act also prohibits the transport, sale or possession of rosewood trees. However, as per the Act, dead or fallen rosewood trees may be removed with the permission of the prescribed authority.  Additionally, the Act provides for penalties for violating the provisions of the Act. "Rosewood tree" includes Blackwood rose wood, Indian rosewood and Malabar black wood, their stumps and brush woods and also includes rose wood trees when they have fallen or have been felled and all rose wood whether cut up or fashioned or hollowed out for any purpose or not.

Policy: Decree No. 1-CP  promulgating the regulation on the allottment of land by State-owned businesses for agricultural production, forestry and aquaculture.
Policy_Content: The Decree provides the allotment of state-owned land destined to planting of perennial trees, seasonal crops and forestation, plus the water surface required for aquaculture farming to individuals, households and organizations which shall invest in the resulting production. Planning and financial evaluation of production costs shall be prepared and funds destined to support all agricultural, forestry and aquaculture activities and operations. Dossiers shall be prepared, including the map, contract for land concession, the inventory of existing tress, crops or livestock already in the property that shall be given with the allotted plot of land. Allotted land shall be compensated and levies issued. In case of forestry, the allottment shall regard protection forests for forestry ecological production, tourism or cultural heritage. The water surface shall be allotted for aquaculture operations, including ponds, lakes and rivers.

Producers or suppliers of sludge shall be responsible for the declaration of contents which shall be drawn up in accordance with provisions contained in Annex II.
