Policy: Basic guiding manual on initial land and forest allocation in Luang Prabang Province for Leading Committee and Technical Staff.
Policy_Content: This Manual aims at providing advises for field work operations as well as principles for the evaluation, monitoring and control of works. After evaluating the present situation of the environment and forest resources in the province of Luang Prabang, the manual states the main objectives of the land and forest allocation method, which are: (1) to improve the living conditions of the population; (2) to ensure the proper management and protection of forest; (3) to ensure "clear ownership" of land or land parcel; (4) to support land reform and development; (5) to create zones for agricultural and forest production. Furthermore, it states "general objectives" (mainly relating to the production of food and commercial products) and "specific objectives" (to be achieved at the village level). Within said framework, the manual establishes policies and strategies regarding the organization of land and forest allocation, the cultivation of the land, the possession and right of use of the land. Further provisions are made with respect to mountain areas and plain areas to be allocated. Moreover, the following committees are established: (a) Leading Committee, consisting of the concerned Division committee and direction committee of the district and province; (b) Working Committee, under the control of the Leading Committee, consisting of the provincial forest service and working teams of provincial forest service, in charge of the implementation and execution of works; (c) Village Supporting Committee, consisting of the village administrative committee and a number of village volunteers, in charge of assisting the working committee in the implementation of the operations after the allocation of land and forest. Final provisions give definition of certain terms and establish the division of areas for the management of land and forest allocation operation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Mountain area,Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Land reform,Environmental planning,Farming,Land-use planning,Right of use,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Subdivision of land,Transfer,Use restrictions,Vested rights/existing rights,Zoning
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Port Vila Urban Land Leases Selection Committee Rules (Cap. 163).
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the Urban land Leases Selection Committee, which shall, within the Municipality of Port Vila: (a) consider, on behalf of the Minister responsible for lands, all applications for the granting of new leases, transfer of leases and surrender of leases for the creation of new leases, transfer and transfer of shares between lessor and lessee companies; (b) advise the Minister on any matter in relation to the such transactions; and (c) do or perform such other functions or responsibilities as the Minister may from time to time direct or delegate.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Implementing Measures of Jilin province on grain risk funds.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to protect the farmers’ enthusiasm for growing grains, ensure the stable growth of grain production, and promote the reform of the grain circulation system The Measures consist of 14 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Provisions on the Management of Inspection and Acceptance of Completed Environmental Protection Facilities of Construction Projects.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Provisions is to strengthen the management of environmental protection at the stage of inspection and acceptance of completed construction projects, prevent and control pollution and ecological destruction and ensure that the protection facilities of construction projects are constructed simultaneously with the main project.  Construction projects shall meet the standards for the discharge of pollution. Attached to these provisions is the “Inspection and acceptance application report on the completed environmental protection facilities of construction projects”.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Provisions enter into force on 31 December 1994.

Policy: Common Leasehold Schemes Act (Cap. 208).
Policy_Content: The Act provides for common leasehold schemes, i.e. a scheme registered under this Act for the division of a parcel of land and its buildings into units. “Units” means the part of the parcel of land and buildings specified as a unit in a common leasehold scheme together with the share of the common property appurtenant thereto.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Common property,Contract/agreement,Registration,Land-use planning,Right of use,Servitude,Cadastre/land registration
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Decree No. 68 of 31 December 1994 establishing rules for the application of the Sea Spaces Act.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets out the regime governing entry and exit of ships from ports and roadsteads regulated mainly by the International Rules of Preventing Collision at Sea. It regulates the visit by a foreign warship or submarine, by a foreign government ship operated for non-commercial purposes, by a foreign non-military nuclear-powered ship, as well as by a ship carrying radio active substances. Chapter VI deals with the protection and regime of the state maritime frontier of the People's Republic of Bulgaria. The exercise of rights and powers of the authorities (Ministry of the Interior, Ministry of defence and Ministry of Transport) competent in the matters governed by this Decree is regulated in Chapter VII. This Decree deals also with marine research, prospecting and economic activities. Protection of sea water from pollution is regulated in Chapter IX. Safety of navigation is governed by Chapter X. Diving and other underwater activities may be performed only in ranges established by the authorities, and out of them only with authorization granted by the senior naval officers of the region.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Loi n° 94-02 du 31 décembre 1994 autorisant la ratification de la Convention sur le changement climatique.
Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise la ratification de la Convention sur le changement climatique.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Act No. 162 on organic agricultural production.
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down rules on organic agricultural production in Iceland. It applies to the production, processing, transport, storage and distribution of all kinds of organic agricultural products. The Icelandic Food and Veterinary Authority shall be the competent authority for the purposes of this Act. The Icelandic Intellectual Property Office shall handle the accreditation of certification bodies. A regulation should be adopted specifying the minimum requirements for certified organic production methods in Iceland. The Act further sets rules on operation licenses and responsibilities of farmers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Agroecology,Certification,Agricultural commodities,Food quality control/food safety,Packaging/labelling
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Mercury Law, 1989.
Policy_Content: Any person who: (a) imports any quantity of mercury into the country; or (b) has in his possession or buys, sells or transfers any mercury, except under licence issued by the secretary of Trade under section 2, shall be guilty of an offence in accordance with section 1. Unauthorised buying or transferring of mercury is prohibited under section 3. Small-scale gold miners shall observe good mining practices and shall be exempted from purchasing restrictions as far as mercury necessary for mining operations is concerned. The Court may cancel mercury licenses pursuant to section 6.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Environment Impact Assessment Act.
Policy_Content: The Act is formulated in order to prevent and mitigate adverse impacts of development activities so as to attain the goal of environmental protection. Article 2 establishes the responsible agency for this Act which shall be the Environmental Protection Administration of the Republic of China on Taiwan (TEPA) under the Executive Yuan at the central government level; the Environmental Protection Department (or bureau) of a provincial (or municipal) government at the provincial (or municipal) level; or the County (or City) Government at the county (or city) government level. Article 4 gives the definitions of terms used in the Act, e.g. Development Activities and Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA). Article 5 defines those development activities, which are likely to have an adverse impact on the environment, and then EIA shall be conducted for. Chapter two determines the procedures of an EIA. Chapter three concerns the penalties.
Subject: Environment gen.
Entry into force notes: The Law has come into force on 30 December 1994.

Policy: Ley Nº 38/1994 - Reguladora de las organizaciones interprofesionales agroalimentarias.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto regular el reconocimiento de las organizaciones interprofesionales agroalimentarias como entes de naturaleza jurídica privada y la de sus finalidades dentro del ámbito de las relaciones interprofesionales en el sistema agroalimentario, que es el conjunto de los sectores agrícola, ganadero, forestal y pesquero, así como la comercialización y transformación de esos productos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Non-governmental entity,Internal trade,Registration
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: National Environment Protection Council (Northern Territory) Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment and operation of the National Environment Protection Council as a means to ensure that people enjoy the benefit of equivalent protection from air, water or soil pollution and from noise. Functions of the Council are: make national environment protection measures and to assess and report on the implementation and effectiveness, in participating jurisdictions, of national environment protection measures (sect. 12). The Council has power to do all things that are necessary or convenient to be done for or in connection with the performance of its functions (sec.13).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 15 September 1995.

Policy: Protection of the Sea (Prevention of Pollution from Ships) (Orders) Regulations 1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe that a person must not fail to comply with a provision of an order, made under subsection 34 (1) of the Protection of the Sea (Prevention of Pollution from Ships) Act 1983, that is expressed to be a penal provision. An offence against subregulation (1) is an offence of for strict liability, see section 6.1 of the Criminal Code.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 30 December 1994.

Policy: Environmental Protection Agency Act, 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Environmental Protection Agency to replace the Environmental Protection Council and provides with respect to pesticides control and management registration of pesticides. It also establishes the National Environment Fund and the Pesticides Technical Committee. The Agency shall advise the Minister on the formulation of environmental policies; coordinate activities of technical bodies; secure the control and prevention of waste discharge and protection of the environment generally; issue permits and pollution abatement notices; prescribe standards and guidelines relating to air, water, land and other pollution,  regulate the import, export, manufacture, distribution, sale and use of pesticides; etc. The Agency shall be governed by a Board composed of ministerial and technical representatives, including at least one woman. The Agency's enforcement and control powers include the power to require environmental impact assessments of any person responsible for an undertaking which has or is likely to have adverse effects on the environment, issuing of enforcement notices and the appointment of environmental inspectors. A National Environment Fund is established to support environmental education, research and human resource development.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: EIA,Framework law,Basic legislation,Institution,Environmental planning,Special fund,Pollution control,Pesticides,Hazardous substances,PIC-prior informed consent,Plant production,Plant protection,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Law on the special duty on imports of agricultural and food products.
Policy_Content: This Law, in order to protect the national production of agricultural and food products, in order to ensure the necessary market stability and in order to regulate the impact of imported agricultural and food products on the domestic market, here determines the additional tax payment principle aimed for all enterprises and other legal and natural persons, that has to be paid for all imported agricultural and food products.  This kind of tax is defines as a national special customs or duty tax.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Federal Law No.79-FZ of 1994 on state material reserve.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes the general principles of formation, distribution, storage, use, replenishment and refreshment of state material reserve. State material reserve is a special federal (Pan-Russian) stock of material values destined for the use for the purposes and in accordance with the modalities established by the present Federal Law. State material reserve is composed of the stock of material values for mobilization needs of the Russian Federation (mobilization reserve), stock of strategic materials and commodities, stock of material values for the ensuring urgent activity in the process of liquidation of the consequences of emergencies. The document consists of VI Chapters that contain 20 Articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-8) lays down general provisions. Chapter II (Arts.9-11) regards organization of delivery of material values to the state reserve and its distribution. Chapter III (Arts.12-15) establishes the modalities of delivery of material values to and from the state reserve. Chapter IV (Arts.16-17) deals with financial responsibility. Chapter V (art. 18) regards control, registration and accountability. Chapter VI (Arts.19-20) lays down transitional provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Trees and Timber (Amendment) Act, 1994 (Act No. 493 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Trees and Timber Decree, 1974 with respect to export levies and other charges  and powers to arrest offenders. A new Part (IIa) concerning the imposition and calculation of export levy on unprocessed and processed timber is inserted. Arrests pursuant to section 15 of the principal Act may now be carried out by forest Officers or a person authorized by the Minister.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Resolution SMA-42 establishing the procedures for the analysis of Environmental Impact Studies (EIA/RIMA).
Policy_Content: This Resolution SMA establishes the procedures for the analysis of Environmental Impact Studies (EIA/RIMA) under the control of the Secretary of the Environment (SMA). It consists of 4 Parts defining: Initial Procedures for EIA/RIMA Analysis (Part 1); Review of the EIA and RIMA (2); Project Analysis (3); Licensing (4).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the date of publication.

Policy: Sea Protection Act (No. 1415 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The scope of this Act is to prevent pollution of marine areas and to regulate the construction in and exploration and exploitation of marine areas outside of the territorial waters of Finland. Protection of marine areas within the borders of Finland is provided for by the Water Act (No. 241/61) (sect. 2). The present Act shall not apply to pollution caused in the course of ordinary navigation and to measures to combat pollution as foreseen in Act 300/79 to prevent pollution caused by vessels. In addition to what has been provided for in Act 149/65 relative to the Continental Shelf, in matters of permits for exploration and exploitation of the Continental Shelf shall apply provisions of section 11 concerning permits issued by the Ministry of the Environment (sect. 3). Section 5 establishes precedence of international obligations of Finland over provisions of the present Act. Section 1 concerns the pollution of marine areas in general. Section 7 prohibits dumping. Section 8 prohibits the burning of waste. The dumping of mud and construction of installations by Finnish nationals require a permit issued by the Ministry of the Environment (section 9, respectively section 10). (16 sections)
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Management/conservation,Marine protected areas,Continental shelf,Protected area
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Act to amend the Water Act (No. 1416 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The amendments of the Water Act are made in consequence of the recent introduction of the Sea Protection Act. All provisions of the Act which apply to inland waters shall also apply to the territorial waters of Finland (sect. 3 of Chapter 1). Other provisions which have been amended concern: pollution of territorial waters (sects. 18 and 19 of Chapter 1), permits issued by the Water Court (sect. 20 of Chapter 1), dumping of mud (sect. 6 of Chapter 4), general provisions applicable to waste water and other polluting substances (sect. 2(a) of Chapter 10); permits for the drainage of waste water (sects. 24, 24(a), 24(e), and 25 of Chapter 10) and international relations (sects. 13 and 15 of Chapter 21).
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Maritime zone,Effluent waste water/discharge,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Act relative to voluntary participation of industrial enterprises in environment protection and environmental auditing proceedings (No. 1412 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The Act implements provisions of the Regulation of the Council of the European Communities allowing voluntary participation of companies in the industrial sector in a Community eco-management and audit scheme. Section 2 gives definitions of 'enterprise', 'establishments', accredited environment controller', `environment accounts', and 'industrial activity'. Section 4 appoints the Water and Environment Council as the competent authority in Finland for purposes of the Regulation and section 5 outlines the tasks of this institution. Provisions of Chapter 3 (sects. 6 and 7) appoint as the accrediting authority in Finland the technical measurement centre respectively describes its tasks. Chapter 4 prescribes penalties and regulates the appeal against decisions of authorities appointed under the Act. The Cabinet Council may issue further directives for the implementation of this Act (sect. 11). (12 sections)
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Act amending the Nuclear Energy Act (No. 1420 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Nuclear Energy Act with respect to a wide variety of matters including: the definition of "nuclear waste", "emergency preparedness measures"; handling and storage of nuclear waste generated in Finland and of nuclear waste generated outside of Finland; various uses of nuclear energy; and the implementation of the EURATOM treaty and supervisory and enforcement powers.
Subject: Energy, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Nuclear energy,Waste management,Waste disposal,Hazardous waste,Transport/storage,Enforcement/compliance,Radiation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 125 - Ley de fraccionamientos rurales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley sobre fraccionamiento rurales del Estado de Zacatecas establece las disposiciones que rigen: 1) los procedimientos administrativos que se promuevan por los titulares y que se generen con motivo de la tenencia de la tierra en zonas de fraccionamientos; 2) los procedimientos sucesorios que deban tramitarse ante la Dirección de Fraccionamientos con motivo del fallecimiento del titular de un lote; 3) el mejoramiento de la explotación del terreno, atendiendo primordialmente a su vocación productiva; 4) el establecimiento de las servidumbres que deban instituirse en los predios para el aprovechamiento de los aguajes, los que se considerarán de uso común.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Freehold Titles Act (Cap. 233).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for matters relating to the right to occupy, use and enjoy land under a freehold title by indigenous people. Any indigenous citizen who is the proprietor of an unconditional head-lease registered under the Land Leases Act may apply to the Minister for the grant of freehold title to the land of which he is proprietor. Upon receipt of a properly completed application form and the prescribed fee from an indigenous citizen who is the registered proprietor of an unconditional head-lease of land to which this Act applies, the Minister shall grant freehold title to the proprietor of the land of which he is the leasehold proprietor subject to restrictions set out in section 4. In the event that a freehold estate is transferred to any person who is not an indigenous citizen, whether by virtue of gift, sale, inheritance, the materialization of a charge or otherwise, the estate transferred to that person shall be a leasehold estate for the maximum period permitted under the Land Leases Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Traditional rights/customary rights,Right of use
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Décret n°94-447/P-RM du 28 décembre 1994 portant ratification de la convention cadre sur les changements climatiques, signée le 12 juin 1992 à Rio de Janeiro.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret ratifie la convention cadre sur les changements climatiques, signée le 12 juin 1992 à Rio de Janeiro.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Decree No. 224 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on mandatory certification of agricultural equipment.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of mandatory certification of agricultural equipment either manufactured on the national territory or imported from abroad. The scope of mandatory certification shall be to prevent trade of poor quality equipment and compliance of equipment with ecological requirements and technical standards. National certification authority shall be State Baltic Machinery Testing Station subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture. The aforesaid authority shall issue certificate attesting safety and harmlessness of agricultural machinery and equipment for human life, health and environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. 10.330 establishing the organization of the State System for Environmental Protection (SISEPRA) and the elaboration, implementation and control of the State environmental policy.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 31 articles, establishes the organization of the State System for Environmental Protection and the elaboration, implementation and control of the State environmental policy (SISEPRA). This Law, based on article 252 of the State Constitution, establishes responsibilities of SISEPRA, aiming at carry out environmental monitoring, preserving environmental balance and characteristics essential to healthy quality of life, as well as promoting sustainable development. SISEPRA acts with the immediate objective of organizing, coordinating and integrating the actions of the different organs and entities of the public administration, state and municipal. SISEPRA is organized and operates based on the principles of regional decentralization, integrated planning, intersectoral coordination and representative community participation. It also establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the State Council for the Environment (CONSEMA) which is a deliberative and normative body responsible for approving and monitoring the implementation of the State Environmental Policy.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Environmental planning,Inspection,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Monitoring,Biodiversity,Protection of habitats,Ecosystem preservation,Policy/planning,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Protection of environment,Wild fauna,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Décret nº 94-1212 pris pour l'application du code de la consommation en ce qui concerne le mode de production biologique des produits agricoles et sa mention sur les produits agricoles et les denrées alimentaires.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions de l'article 5, à l'exception des 7, 8 et 9 de cet article; de l'article 6; de l'article 7, à l'exception du 3 et du 4 de cet article; du 1 de l'article 8; du 1 et du 2 de l'article 10; du 1, du 3 et du 6 a de l'article 11 du règlement (C.E.E.) nº 2092/91 du 24 juin 1991  concernant le mode de production biologique de produits agricoles et sa présentation sur les produits agricoles et les denrées alimentaires constituent les mesures d'exécution prévues à l'article L. 214-1 du code de la consommation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Ecological production/organic production,Farming,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Animal production,Plant production
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Instruction for guiding Environmental Impact Assessment to Operating Units.
Policy_Content: These instructions are issued by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment and provide guidance for implementing environmental impact assessment. Ministries, and other specified public bodies guide consultant units to carry out environmental impact assessment report. These are then submitted to the relevant environmental agency for appraisal. Section 2(1) lists the units that must make reports for environmental impact assessment under the "inventory of production activities environment" form. Units include chemical stores, pesticides, and other forms of production and services that may have an impact on the environment. The Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment will then determine whether the Units require environmental protection due to excessive pollution that would directly impact the health of the surrounding population. Units producing excessive pollution must provide alternatives and finance its implementation (sect. 2).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Resolution No. 216 of 1994 promulgating Law No. 27 of 1994 on the first amendment to the Cooperation Law (No. 15 of 1992).
Policy_Content: This Act introduces various amendments to the principal Act: section 3 on the establishment of the General Federation of Cooperation is repealed and substituted by a new provision; article 6 is completely rewritten so as to provide for the Cooperative Committee for Supervision and Follow-up to replace the Qualitative Federations; various articles on the cooperative societies, now called "cooperative associations", are modified or repealed and substituted.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This amendment enters into force 180 days after the date of publication.

Policy: Décret présidentiel nº 94-465 portant création du Haut conseil de l'environnement et du développement durable et fixant ses attributions, son organisation et son fonctionnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création du Haut conseil de l'environnement et du développement durable et fixe ses attributions, son organisation et son fonctionnement. Le Haut conseil est chargé: d'arrêter les grandes options nationales stratégiques de la protection de l'environnement et de la promotion d'un développement durable, d'apprécier régulièrement l'évolution de l'état de l'environnement, d'évaluer régulièrement la mise en oeuvre des dispositifs législatifs et réglementaires relatifs à la protection de l'environnement et de décider des mesures appropriées, de suivre l'évolution de la politique internationale relative à l'environnement et de faire entreprendre par les structure concernées de l'Etat, les études prospectives à même de l'éclairer dans ses délibérations, de se prononcer sur les les dossiers relatifs aux problèmes écologiques majeurs, dont il est saisi par le ministre de l'environnement, de présenter annuellement au Président de la République un rapport sur l'état de l'environnement et une évaluation de l'application de ses décisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Regulations of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region on Protection of Agricultural Environment.
Policy_Content: With a view to protect and improve the agricultural environment, to prevent pollution and protect ecosystem, the Regulations are formulated. The agricultural environment is defined as including land, water for agricultural purposes, air and other factors which have an impact on the survival and development of agricultural resources.The purpose of these Regulations is to protect and improve agricultural environment, prevent and control agricultural environmental pollution and ecological destruction, rationally develop and utilize agricultural natural resources. The Regulations consist of 34 Articles divided into 5 chapters: General provisions; Supervision and administration; Measures for protection, prevention and control; Legal liabilities; Supplementary provisions. Agricultural construction projects must carry out agricultural environmental impact assessment. The environmental impact report shall be subject to preliminary examination of the administrative department of agriculture at the same level before being submitted for approval. The people's governments at or above the county level shall, according to the situation of the local agricultural natural resources and the requirements of agricultural environmental protection, rationally adjust the structure of agricultural production, carry out ecological construction, and improve agricultural environmental quality. It is prohibited to dump, abandon and store solid waste in the farmland, the basic farmland protection area. The city solid wastes and sludge supplied to the farmland must meet the relevant national standards.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Environmental planning,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Waste non-domestic sources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1418 regarding licensing some types of activity.
Policy_Content: The Government, for the purpose of carrying out common state policy in the field of licensing of some types of activity and ensuring protection of vital interests of individuals, society and state, decrees to validate the Regulation on licensing (attached) and the List of types of activity subject to licensing in accordance with the Annex 1. The Regulation determines the modalities of licensing in the Russian Federation. Some types of activity are carried out by enterprises, organizations and institutions irrespectively of organizational and legal form and by natural persons without formation of legal entity on the basis of licence – special permits issued by authorized institutions. Licence is an official document, which authorizes carrying out specified type of activity for the established period and determines conditions for its realization. Licence is issued separately for each type of activity. It is prohibited to transfer licence to another legal or natural person. The Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources is entitled to license activity regarding utilization, storage, transportation, distribution, burial and extermination of industrial and other waste (materials, substances), carrying out ecological documentation, certification and ecological audit as well as realization of the types of activity connected with environmental protection work. The Committee on Geology and Subsoil is entitled to license geological supervision and mapping, geophysical research of subsoil. The Federal Fisheries Committee is entitled to license industrial fisheries and fish farming. The State Inspection for Ensuring State Spirits Monopoly is entitled to license manufacturing, bottling, storage at the manufacturing enterprises and wholesale trade of ethyl alcohol manufactured from all types of raw materials, manufacturing, bottling, storage at the manufacturing enterprises and wholesale trade of spirits, wine and semi-finished products of the aforesaid commodities.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Mineral resources
Keyword: Environmental audit,Certification,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Aquaculture,Mariculture,Fishing authorization,Fishery management and conservation,Marine fisheries,Authorization/permit,Viticulture/oenological practices,Transport/storage,Processing/handling,Mining,Exploration
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Règlement du Gouvernement en conseil modifiant le règlement du Gouvernement en Conseil modifié du 23 février 1990 concernant l’octroi d’un subside aux exploitants agricoles pour l’amélioration de l’infrastructure de stockage de lisier et purin.
Policy_Content: Le susdit règlement modifie l’article 4 du règlement du 23 février 1990 concernant l’octroi d’un subside aux exploitants agricoles pour l’amélioration de l’infrastructure de stockage de lisier et purin. Plus exactement les points 1 et 2 sont rédigés comme suit: «1. Les dispositions du présent règlement s’appliquent aux citernes construites entre le 1er janvier 1990 et le 31 décembre 1996 inclusivement. 2. Les demandes en vue de l’obtention de la subvention sont à introduire avant le 31 décembre 1996.» Le texte comprend 2 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Environmental Taxation Act.
Policy_Content: This Act imposes a levy on water supplied through pipelines, waste matters, coal, energy and packaging. The Act prescribes the method of imposition and calculation of these environmental taxes and defines exemptions. The Minister of Environment may issue Rules to supplement or implement provisions of this Act.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 2.487/1994 - Estatuto regulador de las actividades de distribución al por mayor y de distribución al por menor mediante suministros directos a instalaciones fijas, de carburantes y combustibles petrolíferos.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto aprueba el Estatuto regulador de las actividades de distribución al por mayor y de distribución al por menor mediante suministros directos a instalaciones fijas, de carburantes y combustibles petrolíferos en todo el territorio nacional por quienes obtengan la condición de operador o de distribuidor, respectivamente, previa acreditación del cumplimiento de las condiciones que se establecen para dichas actividades.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Décret n° 94-118-PMRT du 23 décembre 1994 portant création, attribution et organisation du secrétariat technique du comité de coordination (STCC) et du comité d’étude de la reforme urbaine (CERU).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée le Secrétariat technique du comité de coordination (STCC) et du comité d’étude de la reforme urbaine (CERU) et fixe ses attributions et son fonctionnement et  son organisation. Le STCC comprend un secrétariat général, un secrétariat et des charges de missions.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Law No. I-734 on the State Regulation of Economic Relations in Agriculture.
Policy_Content: The objective of this law is to regulate the economic relations between agricultural economic entities and state institutions and agricultural market partners, to establish the basic state regulatory measures of these relations, to facilitate the implementation of agrarian policies and to sustain the balance of agricultural market. Agricultural entities means farmers' farms, agricultural companies and other enterprises registered in accordance with the procedure established by the Laws of the Republic of Lithuania, the annual income from the sales of tradable agricultural produce and production services for agriculture account for more than 50 % of the total income. Economic relations between agricultural entities and the State institutions and agricultural market partners shall be regulated according to the procedure established by the Government of the Republic of Lithuania by: 1) guaranteeing the buying up of agricultural produce according to the quotas; 2) supplementing or selling the part of state food product reserves; 3) supporting agricultural investments; 4) regulating the import and export of agricultural produce and food products; 5) controlling the quality of the produce; 6) restricting the activities of agricultural entities which dominate on the market; 7) promoting or limiting the production of certain agricultural produce; 8) protecting the interests of agriculture by international agreements. The Law consists of 3 Sections that contain 17 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-4)lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 5-15) regards state regulation. Section 3 (arts. 16-17) regards implementation of state regulation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Agricultural commodities,Credit,Food quality control/food safety,Food security
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from 31 March 1995.

Policy: Ley Nº 16.688 - Régimen de prevención y vigilancia ante posible contaminación de las aguas de jurisdicción nacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece un régimen de prevención y vigilancia ante posible contaminación de las aguas de jurisdicción nacional u otros elementos de ese medio, surgida por agentes contaminantes provenientes de buques, aeronaves y artefactos navales.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Water quality standards,Navigation,Harbour,Marine area,Waste non-domestic sources

Policy: Farmland Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the strengthening of the agricultural competitiveness, the balanced development of the national economy, and the preservation of the environment of national land through the stabilization of farmers' management and the improvement of productivity, by stipulating necessary matters for the ownership, utilization, preservation, etc. of farmland in order to utilize and manage farmland efficiently. The Act consists of 65 articles divided into 6 Chapters: General provisions (I); Ownership of farmland (II); Utilization of farmland (III); Preservation, etc. of farmland (IV); Supplementary provisions (V); Penal provisions (VI). Restrictions on ownership of farmland are provided for in article 6. A person who intends to acquire farmland shall obtain the qualification certificate for acquisition of farmland (art. 8). Disposition of farmland, etc. that is not used for agricultural management is specified in Article 10. For the efficient utilization of farmland a Farmland Utilization Plan shall be established. A promotion project for the utilization of farmland in accordance with the farmland utilization plan shall be carried out (arts. 14 to 18). The State and the local government shall devise policies concerning the experiment, research, survey, etc. for the improvement and preservation of the soil so as to help farmers and agricultural corporate bodies continue their agricultural management in a pro-environmental manner. No farmland shall be leased with charge or leased free of charge except for cases listed in article 22. The Mayor/Do governor shall designate agricultural development regions for the efficient utilization and preservation of farmland (arts. 30 to 35). A person who desires to divert the use of farmland shall obtain the permission of the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry (arts. 36 to 42). For the efficient management of farmland and of the lease of it, the Farmland Administration Committee shall be established (arts. 46 to 48).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Land consolidation,Agricultural land,Public land,Policy/planning,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Lease
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento sobre protección contra las radiaciones ionizantes, que tiene por objeto establecer los criterios tendientes a proteger la salud de la población de los riesgos radiológicos que puedan derivarse del empleo de las radiaciones ionizantes y actividades afines.

Policy: Act to amend the Rural Activities Management Act (No. 1304 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The scope of the principal Act is to improve the structure of agriculture and forestry as well as rural activities in general. The amendments concern, inter alia, the scope of the Act in the light of the common agricultural policy of the European Communities, the definitions of enterprise restructuring and certain others, economic requirements for the granting of financial support (sect. 70), support for investment (sect. 15), loans for the acquisition of land (sect. 16), investment subsidies for small-scale economic activities (sect. 19), start-up capital (sect. 20), and programme-based financial support (Chap. 4a).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 31 March 1995.

Policy: Law on protection of immovable cultural properties (No. I-733).
Policy_Content: This Law shall regulate protection and state management of protection of immovable cultural properties, located within the territory and territorial waters of the Republic of Lithuania, and according to right of ownership, belonging to the state, local governments, religious organizations and other legal and natural persons. Immovable cultural property means structures of cultural and public significance, their parts and groups, complexes, clusters and sites, which shall be registered according to the procedure prescribed by this Law. The State Commission for Cultural Heritage Protection shall be the institution responsible to the Republic of Lithuania Seimas with regard to formulation of the state policy on protection of state monuments and management of the implementation of this policy. Functions of the State Commission for Cultural Heritage Protection shall be as follows: 1) to form state policy and strategy on protection of cultural properties; 2) to evaluate programs that implement the policy and strategy on protection of cultural properties; etc. The Seimas of the Republic of Lithuania shall approve, upon the recommendation of the Government of Lithuania, a list of historical, archaeological and cultural objects of state significance. In order to protect the structures and their clusters, groups and areas that have been included in the Immovable Cultural Property Register of the Republic of Lithuania, from external influence and to preserve their surroundings, the Department of Cultural Heritage Protection shall establish individual protection zones.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Act amending the Nature-based Activities Act (No. 1306 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The definition of the scope of the principal Act is amended so as to take into account rules of the European Communities concerning State aid (sect. 1). Other amendments of the Act concern, inter alia, requirements of persons who may receive support (sect. 4), the sale price of land (sect. 28), terms of loans financed out of the Agricultural Development Fund (sect. 29), contributions to the construction of waterworks (sect. 34) and the use of moneys from the Agricultural Development Fund (sect. 36).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on a date to be fixed by Order.

Policy: Act amending the Radiation Safety Act (No. 1334 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Radiation Safety Act in various provisions concerning, among other things: exemptions from licensing requirements; product safety and radiation measurements; control measures regarding products; measurements of radiation; supervision; charges; and offences. It also adds new section 52a on import, export and transit of radioactive waste or materials containing radioactive waste. Radioactive waste or materials containing radioactive waste may be imported, exported or transported through Finnish territory only under the condition that any movement of waste is in advance approved by the Nuclear Safety Agency. Radioactive waste may not be exported to a country that is not adequately prepared in terms of technology, legislation and administration to manage the radioactive waste.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Federal Law 68-FZ on protection of the population and of the territories from environmental and technological emergencies.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law establishes general organizational and legal regulations in the field of protection of the citizens of the Russian Federation, foreign citizens and stateless persons residing in the territory of the Russian Federation, the whole land, water and air space within the territory of the Russian Territory or a part of it and the environment from environmental and technological emergencies. The document consists of IX Chapters that contain 31 Articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-7) lays down the general provisions. Chapter II (Arts.8-11) establishes plenary powers of state executive bodies, regional executive bodies and local administration in the field of protection of the population and of the territories from environmental protection. Chapter III (Arts.12-17) regards state management in the field of protection of the population and of the territories from environmental and technological emergencies. Chapter IV (Arts.18-19) determines the rights and the duties of the citizens. Chapter V (Arts.20-21) deals with training of the population in the field of protection from emergencies. Chapter VI (Arts.22-25) determines the modalities of financial and material arrangements as regards protection of the population and territories from emergencies. Chapter VII (Arts.26-28) deals with state audit, survey and control in the field of protection of the population and of the territories from emergencies. Chapter VIII (art. 29) regards international agreements of the Russian Federation. Chapter IX (Arts.30-31) lays down the final provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 76 - Ley de Minas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objetivos establecer la política minera y las regulaciones jurídicas de dicha actividad de manera tal que garanticen la protección, el desarrollo y el aprovechamiento racional de los recursos minerales, trazando directivas obligatorias controladas por los funcionarios del Gobierno vinculados con la actividad. Se entiende por recursos minerales todas las concentraciones de minerales sólidos y líquidos que existan en el suelo y en el subsuelo del territorio nacional, así como en el fondo marino y subsuelo de la zona económica de la República. Los minerales radioactivos y los hidrocarburos líquidos y gaseosos se rigen por su legislación específica.
Subject: Mineral resources
Keyword: Basic legislation,Institution,Mining,Minerals,Exploration,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Inspection,Servitude,Concession,Subsidy/incentive,Continental shelf,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,Soil pollution/quality,Pollution control,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Registration

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 2/94 extinguishing several Ministries and Commissions and instituting nine Ministries.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of five articles, institutes nine Ministries, among them the Ministry for Coordination of Environmental Activity, the Ministry for Mining and Energy, and the Ministry for Agriculture and Fisheries. Moreover, it extinguishes ten Ministries, three Secretariats of State and two National Commissions and defines the succession regime of financial, human and material resources to the newly established Ministries.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Federal Law No. 69-FZ on fire prevention.
Policy_Content: The present Federal Law determines general legal, economic and social basis of the ensuring fire prevention in the Russian Federation, regulates relations in this sphere between state executive bodies, local self-government, enterprises, institutions, organizations, peasant farms, other legal persons irrespectively of their organizational and legal forms and forms of property, as well as between social associations, officials, Russian nationals, foreign citizens and stateless persons. Ensuring fire prevention is one of the principal functions of the state. State fire supervision in the forests shall be carried out by the bodies of the Federal Forest Service (art. 6). The Federal Law consists of 6 Chapters composed of 42 articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (arts. 4-15) regards fire security service. Chapter 3 (arts. 16-19) establishes plenary powers of state executive bodies and local self-government in the field of fire prevention. Chapter 4 (arts. 20-33) regards ensuring fire safety. Chapter 5 (arts. 34-39) establishes the rights, duties and liability in the field of fire safety. Chapter 6 (arts. 40-42) lays down final provisions.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Federal Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Loi n°94-036 du 21 décembre 1994 portant Code de l’électricité.
Policy_Content: La présente loi réglemente le service public de l’électricité : les activités de production (production d’origine hydraulique, thermique), de transport et de distribution de l’énergie électrique, conformément aux textes réglementaires en vigueur relatifs à la politique nationale de l’environnement. Elle est formée de 40 articles répartis en 7 chapitres, à savoir: règlement du service public de l’électricité (I); action de l'Etat (II); gestion du service public (III) électrification rurale (IV); établissement et exploitation des centrales électriques autonomes (V); établissement et exploitation des centrales électriques privées dans l'intérêt du service public (VI) et divers (VII). Sont exclues du  service public de l’électricité, les recherches effectuées dans le domaine Energique et des installations destinées à la transmission des signaux ou de la parole et les installations militaires.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Ley nº1604 de 21 de diciembre de 1994 de Electricidad.
Policy_Content: La presente ley norma las actividades de la Industria Eléctrica y establece los principios para la fijación de precios y tarifas de electricidad en todo el territorio nacional. Están sometidas a la presente ley, todas las personas individuales y colectivas dedicadas a la Industria Eléctrica, cualesquiera sea su forma y lugar de constitución. La producción de electricidad de origen nuclear será objeto de ley especial. Las actividades relacionadas con la Industria Eléctrica se regirán por principios de eficiencia, transparencia, calidad, continuidad, adaptabilidad y neutralidad. De acuerdo a lo dispuesto en el artículo 5, el aprovechamiento de aguas y otros recursos naturales renovables destinados a la producción de electricidad, se regulará por la presente ley y la legislación en la materia, teniendo en cuenta su aprovechamiento múltiple, racional, integral y sostenible. La ley regula la estructura del sector  eléctrico así como las concesiones, licencias y servidumbres. De acuerdo al artículo 37, el Titular de una Licencia de Generación tiene derecho a solicitar la declaratoria de área protegida a la zona geográfica de la cuenca aguas arriba de las obras hidráulicas para el uso y aprovechamiento de los recursos hídricos inherentes a la respectiva Licencia. El Titular tendrá la obligación de administrar y preservar a su costo el área protegida. La norma también incluye disposiciones generales sobre precios y tarifas.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Hydropower generation,Concession,Public private partnership (PPP),Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Nuclear energy,Sustainable use,Servitude,Waterworks
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: European Parliament and Council Directive 94/63/EC on the control of volatile organic compound (VOC) emissions resulting from the storage of petrol and its distribution from terminals to service stations.
Policy_Content: This Directive, which aims at the control of volatile organic compound (VOC) emissions resulting from the storage of petrol and its distribution, shall apply to the operations, installations, vehicles and vessels used for storage, loading and transport of petrol from one terminal to another or from a terminal to a service station. Storage installations shall be designed and operated in accordance with the technical provisions of Annex I, which are designed to reduce the total annual loss of petrol. Moreover, loading and unloading equipment shall be designed and operated in accordance with the technical provisions of Annex II. Mobile containers shall be designed and operated in accordance with the requirements prescribed by article 5.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Oil pollution,Emissions,Environmental standards

Policy: Land Titles Validation Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act validates past acts that are invalid because of the existence of native title and provides for the implementation of compensation rights for the holders of native title which has been affected by past acts attributable to the State. The Act consists of 17 sections and is divided into the following Parts: Preliminary (1); Validation of past Acts (2); Validation of intermediate period Acts (2A); Confirmation of pasts extinguishment of native title by certain valid or validated Acts (2B); Validation of future Acts by agreement (2C); Confirmation of rights (3) and General (4).

Policy_Content: El Procedimiento para el registro de empresas o instituciones públicas o privadas calificadas para realizar estudios de impacto ambiental en el sector agrario, que consta de 5 títulos, 35 artículos, 1 disposición complementaria y diversos anexos, establece las normas que regulan la calificación y registro de empresas o instituciones públicas o privadas interesadas en realizar estudios de impacto ambiental (EIA) de los programas y proyectos relacionados con las actividades del sector agrario. Policy: Sea Pollution (Control of Pollution by Noxious Liquid Substances in Bulk) Regulations, 1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations give effect to Annex II of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships adopted by the International Maritime Organization on 2 November, 1973 and as amended by its Protocol adopted on 17 February, 1978, and as further amended by resolutions adopted by the Marine Environment Protection Committee (MEPC) of the International Maritime Organization. The Regulations apply to all Irish ships carrying noxious liquid substances in bulk wherever they may be and to all other ships carrying noxious liquid substances in bulk when they are in the territorial waters of the State. Noxious liquid substances are divided into four categories A, B, C and D according to the severity of the hazard which they present to human health and the marine environment, category A presenting the worst hazard and category D the least. Under the Regulations discharges into the sea of these substances or mixtures of them are prohibited except when the discharges are made under specified conditions. These conditions vary according to the degree of hazard posed to the marine environment. The most stringent controls apply in two recognised "special areas", namely the Baltic Sea and the Black Sea. The Regulations require ships to follow specified procedures when washing cargo tanks in accordance with the category of the substance and the geographical location. They also provide for adequate facilities at ports, terminals or repair ports for the reception of residues or mixtures of noxious liquid substances. Under the Regulations ships are required to be surveyed, to carry an International Pollution Prevention Certificate for the Carriage of Noxious Liquid Substances in Bulk.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Environmental fees/charges,Special fund,Hazardous substances,Oil pollution,International agreement-implementation

Policy: Native Title (Tasmania) Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 15 sections divided into seven Parts, concerns native titles on land and water resources in New South Wales and aims at ensuring that the law of New South Wales is consistent with the standards set by the Commonwealth Native Title Act.  The Act is divided as follows: Validation of Past Acts (2); Effect of Validation on Native Title (3); Other Effects of Validation (4); Compensation (5); Confirmation of Certain Rights Under Section 212 of Commonwealth Act (6)
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Traditional rights/customary rights,Land tenure,Ownership,Indigenous peoples,Water rights
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Emergency Program Management Regulation (B.C. Reg. 477/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Emergency Program Act. In particular, the Regulation identifies duties and responsibilities of provincial ministries and government corporations in relation to specific hazards and generally in the event of an emergency. The text consists of 9 sections as follows: Interpretation (1); Provincial Emergency Program (2); Emergency plans and procedures of ministers (3); Emergency plans and procedures of government corporations (4); Inter-Agency Emergency Preparedness Council (5); Role of ministers in relation to hazards (6); Role of ministers in emergency or disaster (7); Role of government corporations in emergency or disaster(8); Authority for policing and firefighting in declared state of emergency (9)
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Electricity Regulation 1994.
Policy_Content: This regulation implements the Electricity Act 1994, it consists of 250 sections and is divided into nine Chapters. Chapter 2 contains technical requirements, Chapter 3 concerns the electricity supply and sale, Chapter 4 contains market and system arrangement and Chapter 5 defines which are prohibited interests. Chapter 6 provides for energy efficiency and the performance of electrical equipment and Chapter 8 and 9 contains provisions on the administration of the Act. The regulation is completed by nine schedules.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Internal trade
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Land Valuers Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 24 sections and completed by two Schedules, regulates the activities of land valuers, i.e. any person who carries on a business that consists of or involves valuing land. The Act defines the qualifications required to carry out the business of land valuers, regulates their activities and provides for the solution of disputes arising from their work.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Environment Protection (Fees and Levy) Regulations 1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement the Environment Protection Act 1993 by providing specifications on fees and levies related to authorizations and licences and waste deposits. The levy for waste deposits is related to the concentration of chemicals substances in wastes, whose levels are set in Schedule 6 attached to the Regulations.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: NOM-080-ECOL-1994: Límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido proveniente del escape de vehículos automotores.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana establece los límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido proveniente del escape de los vehículos automotores, motocicletas y triciclos motorizados en circulación y su método de medición.

Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana establece los límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido que genera el funcionamiento de las fuentes fijas y el método de medición por el cual se determina su nivel emitido hacia el ambiente.

Policy: NOM-079-ECOL-1994: Límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido proveniente de vehículos automotores nuevos.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana establece los límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido de los vehículos automotores nuevos en planta y su método de medición, conforme a su peso bruto vehicular.

Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana establece los límites máximos permisibles de emisión de ruido de las motocicletas y triciclos motorizados nuevos en planta y su metodo de medición.

Policy: Department of Natural Resources Act (S.C. 1994, c. 41).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the establishment and organization of the Department of Natural Resources. Section 5 outlines the powers, duties and functions of the Minister. They extend to and include all matters over which Parliament has jurisdiction, not already assigned by law to any other department, board or agency of the Government of Canada, relating to: a) natural resources; b) explosives; and c) technical surveys relating to any matter other than that relating to the powers, duties and functions of the Minister of the Environment and the Minister of Fisheries and Oceans applicable by law. The text consists of 10 sections.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: National Environment Protection Council Act 1994.
Policy_Content: The object of this Act is to ensure that, by means of the establishment and operation of the National Environment Protection Council people enjoy the benefit of equivalent protection from air, water or soil pollution and from noise, wherever they live in Australia; and decisions of the business community are not distorted, and markets are not fragmented, by variations between participating jurisdictions in relation to the adoption or implementation of major environmental protection measures.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 15 December 1994.

Policy: Order No. 265 of Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on management of the national forest fund.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that the objective of forest management shall be to elaborate measures aimed at the rational management and use of the forest fund, including efficient reforestation, protection of the forest and realization of common scientific and technical policies in the area of forest management. The Order provides that the national forest fund shall be managed by the authorized forest institution (the Federal Forest Service) and its subordinated bodies, such as forest divisions and forest agencies. Such institutions shall not be authorized to carry out main use felling, timber extraction or processing. Intermediate felling shall be done by the owners of the forest fund, which shall be collective farms, public agricultural enterprises, and administrators of protected areas and national parks. Forest fund plots for long-term lease (1-50 years) shall be allotted through forest tenders and auctions. Lessees shall be authorized to carry out all types of felling and timber extraction, conditioned upon subsequent reforestation. The main purpose of this Order shall be to ensure a high reliability of data regarding forest management and forest inventory.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Native Title (South Australia) Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns traditional rights to land in South Australia. The Act provides for the registration of native title rights, investigations on native title rights, claims and determinations of native title rights and compensation for acts affecting native title rights.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Traditional rights/customary rights,Access right,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Liability/compensation,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Regulation confirming criteria for discharge of waste water into water bodies and the ground (No. 464 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Regulation contains maximum allowed amounts of specified polluting substances in waste water discharged in water bodies and into the soil. Section 1 species rates of discharge for towns and other settlements and objects the average amount of which is more than 2000 cubic metres a day. Section 2 contains requirements regarding pollution for towns and other settlements and objects which discharge water in a rate between 200 and 2000 cubic metres a day. Also standards are given for smaller units. Waste water may discharged into soil at a rate of 50 cubic metres a day after preliminary treatment and meeting the requirements" if no facilities for the recuperation of waste water are nearby present. Conditions for the discharge of waste water into the soil shall be established in a water permit. The highest level of groundwater shall be at least 1.2 metre below the depth of the waste water infiltration.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Environmental standards,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Groundwater
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Act relative to voluntary environment management and audit.
Policy_Content: An Act to give effect in Sweden to Council Regulation (EC) allowing voluntary participation by companies in the industrial sector in a Community eco-management and audit scheme. The Government is appointed as authority in the sense of articles 6 and 18 of the Regulation. The Government or body appointed in its place shall be empowered to regulate charges in accordance with article 11.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Order No. 326 regulating Act No. 8.746 on the establishment of the National Council of Environment - CONAMA.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates Act No. 8.746 on the establishment of the National Council of Environment - CONAMA under the Ministry of Environment and Amazones. It consists of 3 chapters establishing composition, competencies and duties of the aforementioned Council.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Resolución Nº 478/94/PE - Límites permisibles de emisión de desechos al medio ambiente marino para la actividad pesquera de consumo humano indirecto.
Policy_Content: La Resolución fija los límites permisibles de emisión según la siguiente tipología: 1) en los efluentes generados por las plantas evaporadoras de agua de cola; 2) en los efluentes generados en el agua de bombeo; 3) en la sanguaza; 4) en el desagüe general. Además establece que en caso se identifiquen emisiones que, a pesar del cumplimiento de los límites permisibles fijados, causen efectos negativos en el cuerpo receptor, se podrán señalar límites más estrictos.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Effluent waste water/discharge,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Organic waste,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regulations of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region on Grassland Management.
Policy_Content: These Regulations aim to protect, construct and utilize rationally grasslands, improve the ecological environment, maintain the biodiversity, develop modern animal husbandry, and promote the sustainable development of economy and society. The Text consists of 52 Articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Grassland Tenure (II); Grassland Planning and Construction (III); Grassland Utilization (IV); Grassland Protection (V); Supervision and Inspection (VI); Legal Liabilities (VII); Supplementary Provisions (VIII).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Biodiversity,Land tenure,Public land,Agricultural development,Common property,Cooperative/producer organization,Farming,Right of use,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Policy/planning,Authorization/permit,Offences/penalties,Pastoralism,Animal production
