Policy: Split Lake Cree First Nation Flooded Land Act (S.C. 1994, c. 42).
Policy_Content: The present Act provides for compensation payment to the Split Lake Cree First Nation settling matters arising from the Flood Agreement of 16 December 1977. In particular, section 6 establishes that a claim provided for by the Flood Agreement may be exercised by: a) a member of the Split Lake Cree First Nation; b) the Council of the Split Lake Cree First Nation, or c) a body corporate or an unincorporated association to which the Flood Agreement applies. The text consists of 7 sections.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Loi nº 54/94/ADP portant suppression du prélèvement sur les loyers d'immeubles et institution d'un impôt sur les revenus fonciers.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte suppression du prélèvement sur les loyers d'immeubles et institution d'un impôt sur les revenus fonciers applicable aux produits de la location des immeubles bâtis ou non bâtis, quel que soit leur usage y compris les revenus accessoires.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: La présente loi prend effet à compter du 1er janvier 1995.

Policy: Decreto Nº 475 - Política nacional de uso del borde costero del litoral de la República, y crea Comisión Nacional que indica.
Policy_Content: El Decreto establece los principios generales, el ámbito de aplicación, los objetivos generales y los objetivos especificos de la Política Nacional de Uso del Borde Costero del Litoral de la República. Se trata de una política multidisciplinaria, sistémica e interinstitucional que se aplica a los siguientes bienes nacionales: a) terrenos de playa fiscales ubicados dentro de una franja de ochenta metros de ancho, medidos desde la línea de la más alta marea; b) la playa; c) las bahías, golfos, estrechos y canales interiores; y d) el mar territorial. La Comisión propondrá al Presidente acciones que impulsen la política.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Institution,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Marine area
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Cut Control Regulation (B.C. Reg. 578/2004).
Policy_Content: The present Act enacts the Forest Act. The Regulation lays down provisions relating to cut control of timber to be harvested. The text consists of 18 sections divided into 3 Parts as follows: Penalty for excess harvest (1); Adapting cut control provisions respecting conversion of timber sale licences (2); Licences affected by the Forestry Revitalization Act (3); Volume of timber harvested (4). Three Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté conjoint du ministre d'Etat à l'intérieur et à l'information, du Ministre de l'agriculture et de la mise en valeur agricole et du ministre des finances nº 3941-94 fixant les modalités de l'aide de l'Etat pour la réalisation d'unités de conditionnement de produits agricoles: construction et équipement des stations de conditionnement.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté fixe les conditions requises pour obtenir la subvention instituée par l'article 1er du décret nº 2-69-313 réglementant les encouragements de l'Etat en vue de l'acquisition de matériel agricole, et notamment l'aide pour la construction et l'équipement des stations de conditionnement des produits agricoles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Subordinate Legislation Act 1994.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act, consisting of eight Parts and one Schedule, is: to ensure that the power to make subordinate legislation is exercised subject to Parliament's authority and control; to regulate the preparation, making, publication and scrutiny of subordinate legislation; to provide for public participation in the preparation and scrutiny of subordinate legislation; to amend the Interpretation of Legislation Act 1984 in relation to incorporated documents, the incorporation of amendments and the admissibility of Acts and subordinate instruments. By virtue of section 5 of this Act also repeales the following legislation: Transfer of Land (General) Regulations 2004 and Zoological Parks and Gardens Regulations 2003.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Habitat (Broadleaved Woodland) (Wales) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 3099 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The aid granted under these Regulations aims at the management of land of broadleaved woodland compatible with the requirements of the protection of the environment the beneficiaries of aid shall conclude an agreement with the Secretary of State in which management requirements laid down in the Schedule to these Regulations are included. Such requirements regard the use of traditional materials for hedges and fences, the preservation of existing drainage systems, the abstinence from the use of pesticides, lime and inorganic fertilizers, the conservation and maintenance of all streams, lakes, ponds existing on the land, the conservation of all broadleaved trees for which the beneficiary is responsible, etc. (11 regulations and a Schedule)
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Farming,Subsidy/incentive,Inland waters,Freshwater resources management,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Habitat (Coastal Belt) (Wales) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 3101 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for aid to eligible persons, defined in regulation 2, who undertake not to use eligible land for agricultural purposes for a period of 10 years. The beneficiary agrees with the Secretary of State upon a programme of management for the land and shall comply with obligations undertaken under these Regulations. The management requirements are set out in the Schedule to these Regulations and include: (a) the use of traditional materials for the maintenance of hedges and fences; (b) the beneficiary shall not plough, level, reseed, cultivate the land; (c) the beneficiary shall not install a new drainage system without prior written approval; (d) the beneficiary shall not apply lime or use any inorganic or organic fertilizer or specified herbicides and fungicides; (e) the beneficiary shall conserve and maintain all existing lakes, ponds and streams; (f) the beneficiary shall not cause overgrazing; (g) the beneficiary shall control pests in a lawful manner; and (h) the beneficiary shall agree within 6 months with the Secretary of State on programmes for mowing and grazing of livestock and certain conservation measures.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Farming,Subsidy/incentive,Coastal zone management,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1244 validating State Control Regulation on Land Use.
Policy_Content: The purpose of state control over land use shall be to ensure compliance with the acting legislation regulating land use. State control over land use shall be exercised by the National Land Services officials appointed by the Head of the Ministry of Economy. Land use inspections shall be carried out in accordance with the manual of approved rules and regulations of the National Land Service setting out the procedure and duration of inspections. An annual land management plan shall be drawn up and approved by the head of the National Land Service. In the annual plan of the National Land Service for territories shall be specified the number and priorities of scheduled land use inspections of land plots and land areas subject to inspection. Annual plan shall be approved by 1 March each year. Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Lithuania gives recommendations regarding the implementation of state control over land use in the current year; supplies information on abandoned agricultural land; lists violations of land use identified during previous land use inspections; and expresses proposals and recommendations on land use submitted by other public administration entities that exercise state control over land use. In the process of state control shall be verified compliance with specific land use, compliance with the established servitudes, application of land conservation and land rehabilitation provisions to disturbed land and application of soil protection measures against erosion and degradation.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Joint Order No.125 of the Russian Academy of Agricultural Sciences and No.382 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding setting up Centre of ecological and pesticides research (1994).
Policy_Content: President of the Academy of Agricultural sciences and the Minister order to set up Centre of ecological and pesticides research that is the official authorized institution of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources in this sphere. Department of state ecological control attached to the Ministry must ensure coordination of activity on registration of pesticides with the participation of the Centre and other institutions concerned.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Crown Forest Sustainability Act, 1994 (S.O. 1994, c. 25).
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Act are to provide for the sustainability of Crown forests and, therefore, to manage Crown forests to meet social, economic and environmental needs of present and future generations. The Forest Management Planning Manual shall provide for determinations of the sustainability of Crown forests in a manner consistent with the following principles: 1) Large, healthy, diverse and productive Crown forests and their associated ecological processes and biological diversity should be conserved. 2) The long term health and vigour of Crown forests should be provided for by using forest practices that, within the limits of silvicultural requirements, emulate natural disturbances and landscape patterns while minimizing adverse effects on plant life, animal life, water, soil, air and social and economic values, including recreational values and heritage values. The text consists of sections divided into Parts as follows: General (I); Management planning and information (II); Forest Resource Licences (III); Forest Operations (IV); Trust Funds (V); Forest Resource Processing Facilities (VI); Remedies and enforcement (VII); Miscellaneous (VIII); Transitional provisions (IX).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Framework law,Public forest,Special fund,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Forest species,Forestry protection measures,Recreational forest,Authorization/permit,Planting material/seeds,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ley Foral Nº 18/1994 - Reforma de las infraestructuras agrícolas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Foral, que consta de 7 títulos, 130 artículos, 4 disposiciones adicionales, 3 transitorias, 1 derogatoria y 2 finales, regula la actuación de la Comunidad Foral de Navarra en la reforma de las infraestructuras agrícolas, que se llevará a cabo principalmente a través de la concentración parcelaria; no obstante se establecen otros procedimientos de reordenación de parcelas para supuestos concretos en los que, por las características de los terrenos afectados, no sea posible la concentración parcelaria (art. 1º). La concentración parcelaria se llevará a cabo, por razones de utilidad pública, en las zonas donde el parcelamiento de la propiedad rústica revista caracteres de acusada gravedad o carencia de infraestructuras, que impida la existencia de explotaciones viables, de forma prioritaria para las zonas que hayan de transformarse en regadío o requieran una reestructuración o mejora de los regadíos existentes (art. 2º). Con el fin de auxiliar al órgano competente en materia de concentración parcelaria se constituirá en cada zona una Comisión Consultiva de Concentración Parcelaria (art. 14).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 16/INEFAN - Normas para patente de funcionamiento de las industrias forestales y establecimiento de comercio de madera.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, que consta de 4 capítulos, 29 artículos, 1 disposición transitoria y 1 anexo, dispone que las industrias forestales y los establecimientos dedicados a la actividad comercial interna y de exportación de la madera en su estado primario, tales como aserraderos, depósitos y otros establecimientos o empresas, deberán obtener patente de funcionamiento otorgada por el Instituto Ecuatoriano Forestal de Areas Naturales y Vida Silvestre (INEFAN), que tendrá una duración de 24 meses; quedan exceptuados de esta obligación los artesanos de la madera debidamente registrados como tales (art. 1º). Para efectos de aplicación de las sanciones se admitirá una tolerancia del 10 por ciento respecto a los cálculos y estimaciones relacionadas con la patente (art. 8º). Asimismo, dispone que para el aprovechamiento de bosques de producción de madera se otorgarán licencias a los propietarios, posesionarios y copartícipes del aprovechamiento, sean éstos personas naturales o jurídicas, que tendrá una duración de 24 meses (art. 10). Para la movilización de productos forestales dentro del territorio nacional se requerirá de una guía de circulación (art. 20).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: NOMEM-013-SARH3-1994: Normas sanitarias para importación de paletas (tarimas), paletas-cajas y otras plataformas para carga de madera nuevas o usadas.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia regula sanitariamente la importación de paletas (tarimas), paletas-cajas y otras plataformas para carga de madera nuevas o usadas, estableciendo los requisitos sanitarios que deben cumplir para ser importadas, en todas sus formas y presentaciones. La presente Norma es de observancia obligatoria en todo el territorio nacional y considera a todas las paletas (tarimas) y paletas-cajas y otras plataformas para carga de madera tanto nuevas como usadas, en sus diferentes formas y presentaciones. Las paletas (tarimas), paletas-cajas y otras plataformas para carga de madera deberán importarse secas y sin corteza y según el procedimiento fitosanitario especificado.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: International trade,Internal trade,Timber,Transport/storage,Pests/diseases,Forestry protection measures,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Andaman and Nicobar Islands (Panchayats) Regulation, 1994.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is enacted to provide for Panchayats in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands and for matters connected therewith.
Subject: General

Policy: Act relative to the carrying into effect of the common agricultural policy of the European Community.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for that implementation of the EU common agricultural policy in Finland shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions of this Act if not otherwise provided for by community legislation. Section 2 indicates the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry as the coordinating supervisory authority and various of its agencies as supervisors for specific fields.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 2008 validating the Regulation on State Commission on Land Reform.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that State Commission on Land Reform shall carry out the following tasks: (a) examination and expertise of reports submitted by local self-government related to allotment of land in ownership for the production of agricultural commodities; (b) supervision over allotment of land plots, establishment of size thereof with the consideration of irrigation limits; (c) periodical hearings of the proceedings of local land reform commissions regarding implementation of land reform; and (d) examination of appeals against decisions by local land reform commissions related to allotment of land plot in ownership or long-term tenancy.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Presidential Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Environment Information Charges Ordinance.
Policy_Content: Article 1 of the above-mentioned Ordinance establishes that the implementation of the the Environmental Information Act brings about costs to be paid for official activities by the federal authorities; they are laid down in detail in the Annex. Article 2 deals with exemptions and reductions. The text consists of 4 articles and 1 Annex.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance has entered into force on 3 August 2001.

Policy: Loi n°66/AN/94/3e L portant Code Minier.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte code minier. Toutes les ressources présentes dans le sol et le sous sol terrestre et maritime de la République appartiennent à l'État, la responsabilité en matière de gestion et de mise en valeur est exercée par le gouvernement. L'État se réserve le droit d'entreprendre toutes opérations et activités, soit directement, soit par l'intermédiaire d'une personne morale dont une part ou la totalité du capital est détenue par lui. Il peut également autoriser toute autre personne à entreprendre de telles opérations ou activités, avec ou sans sa participation. Personne ne peut entreprendre des opérations ou activités sans autorisation délivrée conformément à la présente loi. L'État peut, par arrêté, réserver toute zone de la République pour des opérations particulières, telle que l'exploitation artisanale ou l'exploitation à petite échelle, et peut fermer à toutes opérations toutes zones telles que des sites d'une importance écologique, religieuse ou culturelle, ainsi que des bâtiments et autres installations publiques. L'État peut désigner toutes ressources comme exclues ou réservées, soit en interdisant toutes opérations les concernant, soit en assujettissant de telles opérations à certaines conditions supplémentaires.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Basic legislation,Exploration,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Minerals,Mining,Tax/levy,Zoning,Authorization/permit,Thermal and medicinal waters
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Guidelines for the promotion of eco-technical and eco-economical measures (New version).
Policy_Content: The present guideline establishes that the Land of Schleswig-Holstein grants subsidies for the promotion of eco-technological and eco-economical measures. As a result, new eco-technical and eco-economical developments and measures are required to protect human health, nature and the environment, as well as to stabilize the economy in the sense of environment-friendly production processes. The features of such development consist in particular in the combination of biological and ecological principles; introduction of an efficient environmental management, analysis of production processes and in general of a preventive environmental behaviour. Thus, the state of the technique regarding avoidance and reduction of environmental pollution shall be assessed by pilot and demonstration projects. The text consists of 7 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

La section 5 porte les aides financières pour les indemnités. Le texte comprend 19 articles divisés en 5 sections.

Policy: Regional Law No. 6 “On forests”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning management, protection, conservation and reproduction of forests, either pertaining or not pertaining to forest fund, and also unforested land of forest fund.  All the forests, except for urban forests, and unforested forest fund land shall form forest fund. Boundaries of forest fund shall be determined through separation of forest fund land from other categories of land. Forest fund and forests of defence shall pertain to federal (public) property. Forests shall be classified in two categories by degree of protection properties. Calculated felling area shall be established for each forest district in accordance with the principles of rational, continuous and inexhaustible management of forest fund. Timber extraction in the form of clear cutting to the amount exceeding calculated forest area shall be prohibited. Forest management rights shall be regulated by public acts, contracts and court decisions. Forest parcels can be allotted on lease for payment for the period from one year to 49 years. Sub-lease of forest parcels shall be prohibited. Procurement of non-timber forest products shall be carried out exclusively in accordance with felling permit.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Non-timber products,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Contract/agreement

Policy: Agriculture Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law aims at promoting agriculture in the Canton of Solothurn, ensuring favourable conditions for its development, an efficient and environment-friendly agricultural policy. In particular, its implementation must comply with a low-cost, high-quality production of agriculture, the conservation and promotion of land cultivated and developed by man, the protection of the environment, of flora and fauna, the health of people and land use planning in general. The text consists of 74 articles divided into 15 chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Conservation and improvement of production and cultivation methods (II); Consolidation of rural estates (III); Production, marketing and securing income (IV); Production and marketing of cattle (V); Animal protection (VI); Animal health (VII); Animal diseases and safety of foodstuff (VIII); Marketing of cattle (IX); Agricultural formation and further formation (X); Labour and social law (XI); Financing and contributions (X); Legal protection (XIII); Competences and enforcement (XIV); Final and transitional provisions (XV).

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.663 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 160 de 1994, en lo relacionado con los procedimientos de clarificación de la situación de las tierras desde el punto de vista de la propiedad y de la delimitación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamentan los capítulos X y XIV de la Ley Nº 160 de 1994, en lo relativo a los procedimientos de clarificación de la situación de las tierras desde el punto de vista de la propiedad, de delimitación o deslinde de las tierras del dominio de la Nación y los relacionados con los resguardos indígenas y las tierras de las comunidades negras. Dispone que el Instituto Colombiano de la Reforma Agraria (INCORA) adelantará de oficio o a solicitud de los procuradores agrarios, de las comunidades campesinas, indígenas o negras, o de las entidades públicas correspondientes, los siguientes procedimientos administrativos: 1) de clarificación de la situación de las tierras desde el punto de vista de la propiedad; 2) delimitar o deslindar las tierras pertenecientes a la Nación, de las de propiedad privada de los particulares, y en especial cuando hayan quedado al descubierto por desecación provocada o artificial de lagos, lagunas, ríos, ciénagas o depósitos naturales de agua; 3) deslindar las tierras de propiedad de los resguardos indígenas, y las adjudicadas a las comunidades negras; 4) regular el uso y manejo de los playones y sabanas comunales.

También corresponde al INCORA adelantar los procedimientos, ejercer las acciones y adoptar las medidas en los casos de indebida ocupación o apropiación de tierras baldías, o por incumplimiento de las condiciones bajo las cuales fueron adjudicadas.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto faculta al Instituto Colombiano de la Reforma Agraria (INCORA) para adquirir por negociación directa, o por expropiación, las tierras o mejoras de propiedad de los particulares, o las patrimoniales de las entidades de derecho público que requiera, para dar cumplimiento a los objetivos señalados en la Ley Nº 160 de 1994 y a los fines de utilidad pública e interés social contemplados por esa misma Ley. El INCORA será el ejecutor exclusivo de los programas y actividades de adquisición de tierras para los propósitos de reforma agraria, con arreglo a las políticas, criterios y prioridades que establezcan el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural, el Consejo Nacional de Reforma Agraria y Desarrollo Rural Campesino y la Junta Directiva del mencionado Instituto.

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.665 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 160 de 1994, en lo relacionado con la extinción del derecho de dominio privado sobre inmuebles rurales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta parcialmente la Ley Nº 160 de 1994 en lo relacionado con la extinción del derecho de dominio privado sobre inmuebles rurales. Será procedente la declaración administrativa de extinción del derecho de dominio o propiedad en los siguientes casos: 1) respecto de los predios rurales en los cuales se dejare de ejercer la posesión en las condiciones previstas durante tres años continuos; 2) cuando se violen las disposiciones sobre conservación, mejoramiento y utilización racional de los recursos naturales renovables, y las de preservación y restauración del ambiente contempladas en el Código Nacional de Recursos Naturales Renovables y de Protección al Medio Ambiente, y demás normas pertinentes sobre la materia; 3) cuando los propietarios infrinjan las normas sobre zonas de reserva agrícola o forestal establecidas en los planes de desarrollo de los municipios o distritos con más de 300 000 habitantes.

Policy: Land Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the management of land in Queensland, it consists of 540 sections and is divided into nine Chapters. The objectives of the Act and its application are described in Chapter 1. Chapter 2 covers land allocation, in particular allocation powers (Part 1), reservations in grant titles (Part 2) and native title (Part 3). Chapter 3 covers reserves, deeds of grant in trust and roads. Chapter 4 is dedicated to land holdings: making land available (Part 1), eligibility to hold land (Part 2), leases (Part 3) and permits (Part 4). The Act is completed by six Schedules.

Policy: Electricity Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 16 Chapters divided into 343 sections and five Schedules, establishes the electricity industry and the use of electricity. Chapter 1 contains preliminary provisions on the objectives and operation of the Act. Chapter 2 concerns the electricity industry, Chapter 4 provides for electricity industry operations and Chapter 5 addresses industry regulations. Chapter 5A provides for the Queensland gas scheme to reduce the growth in greenhouse gases associated with electricity use in the State and to encourage the development of new gas sources and gas infrastructure. Chapter 6 provides for electricity officers' powers and Chapter 7 concerns enforcement of restrictions and rationing. Chapter 9 covers authorities and approvals and Chapter 10 provides for internal and external reviews. The remaining Chapters address general provisions, State electricity entities, regulation making powers of the Governor in Council and transitional provisions.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Declaration regarding Namibia's environmental assessment policy.
Policy_Content: The principle of achieving and maintaining sustainable development must underpin all policies, programmes and projects undertaken within Namibia. In particular, the wise utilization of the country's natural resources, together with the responsible management of the biophysical environment, must be for the benefit of both present and future generations. All listed policies, programmes and projects, whether initiated by the government or the private sector, should be subjected to the established EA procedure as set out in Appendix A. A list of policies, programmes and projects requiring an EA is set out in Appendix B. In terms of the Environmental Assessment Act, an Environmental Commissioner shall be appointed by the Ministry of Environment and Tourism, and housed in the office of the National Planning Commission.The Environmental Commissioner shall be responsible for administering the EA process as described in Appendix A. This will include registration, establishing the procedural framework for the process in consultation with the proponent, screening, evaluation and review procedures as appropriate. The Environmental Commissioner shall report to an Environmental Board. Appendix A contains procedures for EIA.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

The sum of the land based credit is 80 million US dollars. This Decree establishes that the restitution of the credit must be financed by the introduction of the special land tax. The Government accepts the proposal of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey to set up the Interministerial Coordination Commission for carrying out the project of the support of the land reform.

Queda asimismo prohibida la instalación y funcionamiento de industrias procesadoras de maderas en rollos, a una distancia menor de 20 kilómetros de la frontera con la República Federativa del Brasil.

Policy: Scaling Regulation (B.C. Reg. 446/94).
Policy_Content: This Regulation is divided into 6 parts and two schedules as follows: Definitions; Scaling Procedures (sec 2-12); Check Scale (sec 13-15); Second Scale (sec 16); Fees (sec 17-18) Offences (sec20); Schedule of Coast Timber Grades and Schedule of Interior Timber Grades. The procedure to scale states that timber required to be scaled under the Forest Act is scaled as soon as possible after the timber is cut. Generally a person must not cut timber that has arrived at a scale site until the timber has been scaled, the type of scale is dealt with at section 5, and scaling procedures at section 7. Timber must be classified by grade and section 10 deals with how to calculate the scale volume. This Regulation also sets out the prescribed amount of scaling charges, costs and expenses. The fourth part of this Regulation entitled Check Scale enacts section 94 of the Forest Act which states that a parcel or lot of timber that has been most recently scaled must be retained at the site and made accessible for check scale by a licensed scaler who is a forest officer. This Regulation sets out the prescribed percentage and penalty if timber not retained for check scale.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant la procédure applicable à la commission consultative visée à l'article 24 du décret 23 janvier 1991 relatif à la protection de l'environnement contre la pollution due aux engrais.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté réglemente l'activité de la Commission consultative visée à l'article 24, paragraphe 2, du décret du 23 janvier 1991 relatif à la protection de l'environnement contre la pollution due aux engrais. Par exemple, l'article 2 établit que la Commission délibère valablement lorsque tous ses membres ont été convoqués régulièrement et qu'au moins la moitié des membres est présente. L'arrêté comprend 11 articles.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Law No.930 of 1994 on leasing activity.
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates leasing relations in the Azerbaijan Republic, determines rights and obligations of subjects of leasing contract. The document consists of V Secs. that contain 16 Arts. Section I (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Section II (art. 4) specifies the forms of leasing activity. Section III (Arts. 5-8) regards leasing contract. Section IV (Arts. 9-12) establishes rights and obligations of the subjects of leasing contract. Section V (Arts. 13-16) regards termination of the leasing contract.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia

Policy: Forest Directory and Forest Protection Directories Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Bavarian Forestry Law. The Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the forest directory and forest protection directories. Article 1 establishes that the lower forest authorities keep in a file in coorporation with the land surveying offices the directory of all forests in the Free State of Bavaria according to article 2 of the Bavarian Forestry Law. The text consists of 10 articles divided into 3 Parts as follows: Forest directory (I); Forest protection directories (II); Final provisions (III).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Ordonnance du Département fédéral de l'intérieur sur le matériel forestier de reproduction.
Policy_Content: Cette ordonnance, composée par 14 articles divisés en 5 sections, définit d'abord les termes employés, comme par exemple, "matériel de base", "matériel de reproduction", "verger à graines". Elle règle l'utilisation de matériel de reproduction et établit que la provenance doit être attestée. En outre, l'importation et l'exportation du matériel forestier sont réglementées. La section 4 impose la séparation du matériel forestier en lot et les mélanges de semence sont admis seulement à l'intérieur de la même catégorie. En plus, les marchandises doivent être contrôlées dans les sécheries et le pépinières forestières. Cinq annexes sont ajoutées à cette Ordonnance. Annexe 1 (art. 1er, 1er alinéa, lettre a): Arbres forestiers dont le matériel de reproduction est soumis à la présente ordonnance); annexe 2 (art. 2): Critères de sélection pour le matériel de base; annexe 3 (article 2): Exigence pour les essais comparatifs effectués en vue de l'admission d'in matériel de base; annexe 4 (art. 2): Exigences auxquels doit répondre le matériel de reproduction identifié; annexe 5 (art. 6, 1er alinéa).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er juillet 1995.

Policy: NOMEM-005-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de hojas de palma de vegetacion forestal.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de hojas de palma de vegetación forestal. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de hojas de palma de vegetación forestal en poblaciones naturales. Para realizar el aprovechamiento de hojas de palma de vegetación forestal, el dueño o poseedor del predio correspondiente, deberá presentar una notificación por escrito ante la Delegación de la Secretaría en la entidad federativa que corresponda, que podrá ser anual o por un período máximo de 5 años. El dueño o poseedor del predio, deberá presentar en la Delegación de la Secretaría un informe trimestral, avalado por el responsable técnico, respecto del cumplimiento de lo especificado en la notificación, indicando a su vez, las cantidades aprovechadas. Sólo se podrá aprovechar plantas en la etapa de madurez de cosecha, identificándolas por el tamaño y las características vegetativas de cada especie. Deberá dejarse distribuido uniformemente en el área de aprovechamiento sin intervenir, el 20 por ciento de las plantas en etapa de madurez de cosecha, para que lleguen a su madurez reproductiva y propiciar la regeneración por semilla. Durante el aprovechamiento, se deberá utilizar la herramienta adecuada, a efecto de no dañar la zona de crecimiento terminal. De cada hoja cortada, deberá dejarse una parte del pecíolo, de 3 a 5 cm, a fin de no dañar el tallo principal de la planta. La intensidad de corta en cada planta, deberá ser como máximo del 75 por ciento del total de las hojas existentes, incluyendo en este porcentaje la eliminación de las hojas secas, y se deberán dejar de 3 a 4 hojas en la parte cercana a la zona de crecimiento terminal.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Transport/storage,Forestry protection measures,Authorization/permit

Policy: NOMEM-004-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de corteza, tallos y plantas completas de vegetación forestal.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de corteza, tallos y plantas completas de vegetación forestal. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de corteza, tallos y plantas completas de vegetación forestal en poblaciones naturales. En terrenos comprendidos en zonas declaradas como áreas naturales protegidas, el aprovechamiento de corteza, tallos y plantas completas, deberá supeditarse a la autorización que en materia de impacto ambiental, emita la Secretaría de Desarrollo Social. Corresponde a la Secretaría y a la Secretaría de Desarrollo Social, en el ámbito de sus respectivas competencias, realizar las acciones de inspección y vigilancia para el cumplimiento de la presente Norma.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: NOMEM-003-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia, considerando que las raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal son productos forestales no maderables, el aprovechamiento de algunas especies como el barbasco (Dioscorea spp.), la raíz de zacatón (Muhlenbergia spp.), la raíz de "memela" o "rattan mexicano" (Clusia spp.) y la raíz de pingüica (Arctostaphylos spp.), constituyen una importante fuente de ingresos para la población rural de las regiones donde se distribuyen dichas especies, establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal en poblaciones naturales. Para realizar el aprovechamiento de raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal, el dueño o poseedor del predio correspondiente, deberá presentar una notificación por escrito, ante la Delegación de la Secretaría en la entidad federativa que corresponda, misma que podrá ser anual o por un período máximo de 5 años. En terrenos comprendidos en zonas declaradas como áreas naturales protegidas, el aprovechamiento de raíces y rizomas de vegetación forestal, deberá supeditarse a la autorización que en materia de impacto ambiental, emita la Secretaría de Desarrollo Social.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: NOMEM-008-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de látex de vegetación forestal.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia, considerando que el látex de vegetación forestal es un producto forestal no maderable, que se obtiene de algunas especies como el árbol del hule (Castilla spp.), el guayule (Parthenium spp.) del cual se obtienen sustancias tan importantes como el caucho y la gutapercha, destacando además el chicozapote (Manilkara spp.) con el que se elabora el chicle, establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de látex de vegetación forestal. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de látex de vegetación forestal. Para realizar el aprovechamiento de látex de vegetación forestal, el dueño o poseedor del predio, deberá presentar una notificación por escrito ante la Delegación de la Secretaría en la entidad federativa que corresponda, misma que podrá ser anual o por un período máximo de 5 años. La extracción se realizará aplicando, preferentemente, el método de aprovechamiento denominado "lengüeta", "zig-zag" o de "rombo", en el que la pica debe ocupar menos de la mitad de la circunferencia del tronco. Por árbol, se realizarán aprovechamientos dejando un período de descanso entre pica y pica de 5 años o más, hasta la cicatrización de las heridas producidas en la intervención anterior. Cuando el aprovechamiento de látex de chicozapote se realice en forma combinada con el de la madera, podrán intensificarse los métodos de extracción, y los criterios y especificaciones técnicas deberán establecerse en los programas de manejo correspondientes.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Transport/storage,Forestry protection measures,Authorization/permit

Policy: NOMEM-007-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de cogollos de vegetación forestal, para la obtención de ixtles.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia, considerando que el aprovechamiento de cogollos de vegetación forestal como producto forestal no maderable, se realiza para la obtención de fibras duras, conocidas con el nombre común de ixtles, y las principales especies de donde se obtiene son la lechuguilla (Agave spp.); la palma samandoca (Yucca spp.) y la palma real (Sabal spp.), de estas especies las dos primeras son las de mayor importancia económica, representando su aprovechamiento una de las principales fuentes de trabajo de las zonas áridas y semiáridas de los estados donde se distribuyen, establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de cogollos de vegetación forestal, para la obtención de ixtles. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de cogollos de vegetación forestal en poblaciones naturales para la obtención de ixtles. Para realizar el aprovechamiento de cogollos de vegetación forestal para la obtención de ixtles, el dueño o poseedor del predio, deberá presentar una notificación por escrito ante la Delegación de la Secretaría en la entidad federativa que corresponda, misma que podrá ser anual o por un período máximo de 5 años.

Policy: Regulation on forestation.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation provides guidelines to the Ministry of Environment and Forestry on planning afforestation activities: (i) Preparation of afforestation projects; (ii) Selection of areas for afforestation; (iii) Organizing forest - social community relations; and (iv) Preparation of annual programs and location distribution tables. One year prior to afforestation, all trees and shrubs that are classified as non-economic will be cleared from the area. Zoning shall cover access roads and paths, fire access paths, guard and forest officers's houses, water channels, energy lines.The Annex provides technical and administrative details for land allocations and ownership rights of the lands subject to afforestation, erosion control and soil improvement.

Policy: Ley Nº 6.571 - Ley sobre Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula el procedimiento de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental a ser realizado antes de la implementación de cualquier proyecto, público o privado, que pueda perjudicar al equilibrio biológico y a la preservación de los recursos naturales existentes en la provincia de San Juan. El artículo 17 enumera todas las actividades y obras que quedan sometidas a la realización de la Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Restitution of Land Rights Act (No. 22 of 1994).
Policy_Content: Persons or communities contemplated in section 121(2) of the Constitution are entitled to enforce restitution of a right in land (sect. 2). A person shall be entitled to claim title in land if the claimant, or his, her or its antecedents was prevented from obtaining or retaining title in the claimed land because of a racially discriminatory laws, and if the claimant proves that the registered owner of the claimed land holds title as a result of a transaction between such registered owner or his, her or its antecedents and the claimant or his, her, or its antecedents, in terms of which such registered owner or his, her or its antecedents held the land on behalf of the claimant or his, her or its antecedents (sect. 3). Chapter II provides for the establishment of a Commission for the restitution of land rights consisting of Land Claims Commissioners (sect. 4). The Commission shall prepare hearings of claims by the Court and advise and assist claimants in preparation and submission of the claims (sect. 6). Chapter II provides also rules with respect to the procedure of lodgement of claims, the Commission's power of investigation, mediation by a mediator appointed by the Chief Land Commissioner, a certificate of feasibility of restitution, and various other matters relating to activities of the Commission. Chapter III provides for the establishment of a Land Claims Court and regulated various matters relating to the Court and court proceedings. Chapter IV contains miscellaneous provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land reform,Land tenure,Court/tribunal,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Land commission,Ownership

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1306 regarding validation of the Complex federal programme for ensuring protection of the Baikal lake and rational use of the natural resources within its basin.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Complex federal programme, to appoint state customers of the programme the Government of the Republic of Buryatia, the administration of the Irkutsk Region, the administration of the Chita Region and the appropriate ministries and departments for specific arrangements of the Programme. Financing of arrangements of the Programme must be carried out in accordance with the established modalities within the limits of expenditure envisage for carrying out the programme arrangements. The Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources is entitled to carry out co-ordination of activity regarding the fulfilment of the arrangements envisaged by the Programme. The Programme envisages elaboration and realization of interlinked environmental protection projects and socio-economic arrangements, as well as creation of organizational and administrative conditions (in accordance with the Annex) ensuring sustainable development of the Baikal Region, conservation and reproduction of the unique ecological system of the Baikal lake. The Programme is aimed at the solution of the most important regional problems, concentration of effort and means, co-ordination of activity of a huge number of enterprises and organizations situated either within the Baikal lake basin or outside it. The Programme consists of 5 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 specifies the main ecologic, economic and social problems of the region. Section 3 determines the targets of the Programme and the expected results from its realization. Section 4 traces the main directions of economic and social development of the region under conditions of the rational use of natural resources of nature management and ecological restrictions. Section 5 deals with environmental protection and rational nature management.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: EIA,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Protected area,Inland waters,Water conservation zone
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 6.549 - Ley de preservación y mejoramiento del medio ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece  el marco normativo para la preservación del medio ambiente y la protección de la dinámica ecológica en la provincia de San Juan, al fin de lograr y mantener una óptima calidad de vida para sus habitantes y las generaciones futuras, asegurando el derecho irrenunciable de toda persona a gozar de un medio ambiente sano y ecológicamente equilibrado. En este contexto, la Ley regula los procesos de planificación ambiental y prevé la aplicación de los mecanismos de protección jurisdiccional de intereses colectivos y difusos en lo que respecta a la tutela del ambiente. Asimismo, la Ley dispone la realización de un Estudio de Factibilidad Ambiental previo a la implementación de los proyectos u obras que puedan afectar, directa o indirectamente, el medio ambiente. Las restantes disposiciones se refieren a: educación y difusión de la cultura ambiental; implementación de un régimen integral de manejo de residuos sólidos urbanos; manejo de sustancias o residuos tóxicos o peligrosos; creación del Consejo Provincial del Ambiente y del Fondo Provincial del Ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Ecosystem preservation,Education,Environmental planning,EIA,Institution,Special fund,Waste management,Waste disposal,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-1009 “On improvement of efficiency of land tenure”.
Policy_Content: The President authorizes experimental allotment on unused land and land of marginally profitable or unprofitable agricultural enterprises to citizens on condition of life-long hereditary possession. The aforesaid land shall be used for agricultural purposes. The dimensions of land area shall be established with the consideration of local conditions but shall not exceed 5 hectares for irrigated areas and 15 hectares for non-irrigated areas. Local government shall be granted the right of allotment through tenders to citizens on condition of life-long hereditary possession plots of land of 0.06 hectares for family farming. Banks shall be recommended to provide credits to the population for purchase plots of land at tenders with instalment payments distributed over the period of 5 years.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Council Directive 94/57/EC on common rules and standards for ship inspection and survey organizations and for the relevant activities of maritime administrations.
Policy_Content: This Directive establishes measures to be followed by the Member States and organizations concerned with the inspection, survey and certification of ships for compliance with the international conventions on safety at sea and prevention of marine pollution. Member States shall ensure that their competent administrations can assure an appropriate enforcement of the provisions of the relevant international conventions (particularly the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships), in particular with regard to the inspection and survey of ships and the issue of certificates and exemption certificates. Each Member State must satisfy itself that the recognized organizations acting on its behalf for the purpose of article 3 (2), effectively carry out the functions referred therein to the satisfaction of its competent administration and that such organizations fulfill the criteria specified in the Annex.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Entry into force notes: This Directive came into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Science, Technology and their Development (No. 603 of 1994)
Policy_Content: The Law of Georgia on Science, Technology and their Development forms a legal basis for state policy that is a precondition for the intellectual and technological progress and welfare of the country. The state recognises that scientific and technological progress is one of the main factors for social development, improvement of the public welfare and for the self-enrichment of people, and that it facilitates the manifestation of intellectual capabilities and economic development of the country. The State ensures the development of humanities, natural and technical sciences as integral parts of national culture and education, and perceives scientific research as a form of creative activity. Activities in the field of development of science and technology include fundamental and applied research and its development plan, application of outcomes, improvement of current technologies and equipment in order to raise the production level and produce competitive products. The State shall draw up a policy in this field in accordance with state interests and capabilities, determine the forms of state participation in the development of science and technology and establish agencies to protect state interests and rights. The Law determines the basic goals and principles of state policy in the field of science and technology, authorities of state legislative and executive bodies in the implementation of the policy, defines creative freedom and responsibilities of scientists and legal rules and guarantees for the activities in this field. The State recognises its obligation to increase funding for the development of science. Notably, the Law also provides for the creation of the Georgian Academy of Agricultural Sciences.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-1005 on tightening control over destruction of crops by agricultural animals.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of prevention of loss of grain and prevention of uncontrolled destruction of crops by agricultural animals, decrees that in case of exposure of the aforesaid offence to identify owners of agricultural animals and poultry and to apply civil, administrative and criminal liability to the culprits. Means of destruction of agricultural crops shall be arrested until complete compensation to the owners of agricultural crops.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decree No. 39.551 regulating the prevention and monitoring of environmental pollution.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates Law No. 8.943 of 29 September 1994 with amendment of the provisions of Law No. 997 of 31 May 1976, which regulates the prevention and monitoring of environmental pollution, as approved by Decree No. 8.468 of 8 September 1976. All construction, activities, installations, processes, operations, mobile or stationary devices or means of transportation which, directly or indirectly, cause or may cause environmental pollution, are considered sources of pollution; all motor vehicles, boats and similar devices are considered mobile sources and all other devices stationary sources. Garnishing and demolition penalties shall apply for cases of work or construction carried out without the necessary CETESB permits or when in violation thereof, when their existence or maintenance places in risk or causes damage to the environment. It prescribes authorized activities, controls to be carried out and sanctions to be paid by offenders.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 2252 ratifying the “international Convention on oil pollution preparedness, response and co-operation, 1990” and other provisions.
Policy_Content: The law ratifies the Convention on oil pollution preparedness, response and co-operation and all its provisions so as to strengthen collaborative initiatives, in terms of research and technical operations, in order to control environmental pollution by oil and to avoid and better respond to oil pollution incidents. The law is composed by 11 articles as follows: ratification (art. 1); definitions (art. 2); implementation (art. 3); national coordinating authority for the implementation of emergency plans (art. 4); approval and implementation of oil pollution emergency plans (art. 5); inspection of facilities – control certificate (art. 6); extension of application and regulation of minor issues (art. 7); amendments and completions of the Convention – codification (art. 8); sanctions (art. 9); amendments and completions of national provisions (art. 10); entry into force (art. 11). The law, according to article 10, provides for amendments throughout the provisions of Law No. 743/1977.

Policy: Ordinance on contributions for protection of agricultural land.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Ordinance is to protect and conserve valuable living space and landscape through compliance of ecological requirements in agriculture. In particular, it regulates the financial contributions of the Canton to attain such results. The cultivation, maintenance and use of certain areas shall maintain their characteristic plants. According to article 12 the amount of contributions depends on various factors thereby envisaged. Part 5 deals with details of contracts made for particular cultivations. They shall contain special clauses regarding fertilizers, admissible plant varieties and measures on care and maintenance. The text consists of 21 articles divided into 9 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Selected areas (2); Regulations for cultivation (3); Contributions (4); Contracts for cultivation (5); Subsidies for a special area (6); Competence and proceedings (7); Compliance with the  contract (8); Final provisions (9).

Policy: Law on special protected areas.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to regulate the use and procurement of land for state special protection, preservation and conservation in order to conserve the specific features of natural zones, unique formations, rare and endangered plants and animals, and historic and cultural monuments and scenic areas, and to study and understand their evolution. Special protected areas shall be classified into the following categories: (a) strictly protected areas; (b) national conservation parks; (c) nature reserves; and (d) monuments. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of special protected areas: (a) changes to natural characteristics by any means; (b) agriculture; (c) hunting, trapping or destruction of natural habitats of wild fauna; (d) causing a negative environmental impact by any means, technique or substance; (e) construction; (f) grazing; and (g) use of water bodies for commercial purposes. Land within limited-use zones of strictly protected areas may be leased to citizens under land tenancy contracts for a period of five years. Any activity on land shall be carried out in accordance with eco-friendly methods and techniques.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Basic legislation,National parks,Classification/declassification,Sustainable development,Water conservation zone,Management/conservation,Cultural heritage,Endangered species,Protection of species

It applies to the organizations operating in the nuclear energy sector. The issuing authority shall be the Federal Nuclear and Radiation Supervision Service. Export and import permits shall be valid for the period specified therein and it shall expire automatically in case of liquidation, reorganization or modification of the form of property of the operating organization. Policy: NOMEM-011-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento de leña para uso doméstico.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento de leña para uso doméstico. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible de leña para uso doméstico, proveniente de vegetación forestal. La leña deberá provenir de desperdicios de cortas silvícolas (puntas y ramas), limpia de monte, podas de árboles y poda o corta total de especies arbustivas, y para la ejecución de las podas y el aprovechamiento de especies arbustivas deberán emplearse las herramientas adecuadas y realizar los cortes que favorezcan la reproducción vegetativa.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific
Entry into force notes: Al día siguiente de su publicación en el Diario Oficial de la Federación y tendrá una vigencia de seis meses.

Policy: NOMEM-006-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de ramas, hojas o pencas, flores, frutos y semillas de vegetación forestal.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de ramas, hojas o pencas, flores, frutos y semillas de vegetación forestal, entre cuyas especies destacan a nivel comercial: para ramas, el orégano (Lippia spp.), la gobernadora (Larrea spp.), el guayabo (Psidium spp.), el zapote blanco (Casimiroa spp.), la damiana (Turnera spp.); para hojas, el cortadillo (Dasylirium spp.); para pencas, el maguey (Agave spp.), el nopal (Opuntia spp.); para flores, la manita (Bunchosia spp.), la tilia (Tilia spp.); para frutos, la pimienta (Pimenta spp.), el tejocote (Crataegus spp.) y para semillas, la jojoba (Simmondsia spp.) y el piñón (Pinus spp.). La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de ramas, hojas o pencas, flores, frutos y semillas de vegetación forestal en poblaciones naturales.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Alien species,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Standards,Internal trade,Transport/storage
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: NOMEM-010-SARH3-1994: Procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de musgo, heno y doradilla.
Policy_Content: Esta Norma Oficial Mexicana de Emergencia establece los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones para realizar el aprovechamiento, transporte y almacenamiento de musgo, heno y doradilla. La presente Norma es de observancia general en todo el territorio nacional y tiene por objeto establecer los procedimientos, criterios y especificaciones técnicas y administrativas para realizar el aprovechamiento sostenible, transporte y almacenamiento de musgo, heno y doradilla en poblaciones naturales. Para realizar el aprovechamiento de musgo, heno y doradilla, el dueño o poseedor del predio deberá presentar una notificación por escrito ante la Delegación de la Secretaría en la entidad federativa que corresponda, misma que podrá ser anual o por un período máximo de 5 años. Durante la temporada de aprovechamiento, el dueño o poseedor del predio deberá presentar a la Delegación de la Secretaría un informe mensual, respecto del cumplimiento de lo especificado en la notificación, indicando, a su vez, las cantidades aprovechadas. El aprovechamiento de musgo en orillas de caminos, ríos, arroyos y en general cuerpos de agua se realizará dejando una franja de protección de 2 metros como mínimo, para prevenir problemas de erosión.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Internal trade,Transport/storage,Authorization/permit

Policy: Decree of the Prime Minister relating to the transformation of State land use right and ownership on houses, vehicles and essential household equipment into Government personnel ownership and use right.
Policy_Content: The present Decree concerns the transfer of State ownership and right of use on land, houses, vehicles and household equipment to the Government cadres and personnel. Certain land use rights, houses, vehicles and household equipment that had already been used by cadres and personnel shall be transformed into absolute ownership and right of use, upon payment on sale either in full or in long-term instalments. State houses or lands which are not covered by said procedure might be rented to cadres and personnel at a rate to be determined by the Government. Subsequent provisions concern the calculation and of the selling price and the payment by the purchasers or the lessees. Article 8 establishes three ranks on the basis of which State properties shall be allocated.

Policy: Official Letter No.2-12/1749 of 1994 of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey concerning clarifications as regards technical requirements for the plan of a plot of land.
Policy_Content: The Committee, in connection with the issues arising in the process of the application of the Technical requirements for the plan of a plot of land validated by the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey (ROSKOMZEM) 11 June 1993, clarifies that Technical requirements must be applied exclusively to sale and purchase by the citizens of the Russian nationals of the plots of land or their parts destined for personal subsidiary small-holding, gardening and individual housing. In cases of inheritance and donation for designing the boundaries of a plot of land can be used other materials available at the technical inventory office. In such a case the measurement of lines must be traced along the boundaries of the plot of land. Landmarks must be installed on the location in the process of determination of the coordinates of the turning points of the boundaries of the plots of land only by geodetic and photogrammetric methods. In such case the committees on land resources and land survey make decisions regarding the application of the system of coordinates (local and state) for linkage of the landmarks. The list of activities regarding elaboration of the plans of a plot of land, charged to one of the parties of sale-purchase transactions, must contain work executed within the boundaries of the plot of land in question.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulations for Oil Spill Reporting (Title VII, Chapter 1).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Yap State Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) under the Yap State Environmental Quality Protection Act, implement provisions of that Act by establishing a reporting system for accidental or intentional releases of petroleum products within Yap State. They also provide for immediate response to all petroleum releases and enable the responsible party to assist in the cleanup effort to minimize impacts on the environment. The Regulations shall apply to all spills and releases of petroleum products on land or on water, as defined in these Regulations.
Subject: Sea, Waste & hazardous substances, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Regulations for Earthmoving and Sedimentation Control (Title X, Chapter 1).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Yap State Environmental Protection Agency under the Yap State Environmental Quality Protection Act, shall apply to all earthmoving activities as defined in these Regulations. They provides for measures to prevent erosion caused by earth moving and sedimentation.  All earthmoving activities within Yap State shall be conducted in accordance with these Regulations and in such a way as to prevent accelerated erosion and acceleration of sedimentation. All persons engaging in earthmoving activities shall notify the Agency, and shall design, implement and maintain erosion and sedimentation control measures which effectively prevent accelerated erosion and sedimentation. Those  control measures shall be set forth in an erosion and sedimentation control plan. The Regulations also provide for rehabilitation of the soil.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Erosion,Saltwater intrusion/siltation,Policy/planning
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Small Claims Tribunal Decree (Amendment) Act 1994 (No. 22 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends the Small Claims Tribunal Decree: in section 2 by giving a new definition of "Registrar"; in section 5 by replacing the expression "Chief Magistrate" and replacing it with the expression "Chief Registrar"; in section 15(3), by repealing "proved" and replace it with "provided"; in section 15(5), by repealing " if there were no dispute"; and by inserting in the First Schedule a new form regarding the application to enforce an alternative to a Work Order.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Barbados Agricultural Management Co. Ltd. (Sugar Bonds Guarantee) Act.
Policy_Content: This Act allows the Minister, with the approval of Parliament, to provide guarantee for the payment of principal and interests necessary for the redemption of bonds issued for the financing of the sugar industry. The Act also establishes the Sugar Industry Revitalisation Fund. Monies raised from bonds shall be paid into the Fund. The Fund shall be used by the Barbados Agricultural Management Co. Ltd. to finance operations of the sugar industry.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Sub-Decree on the creation of the Council for Agricultural and Rural Development and Rehabilitation.
Policy_Content: It is hereby decided to create the Council for Agriculture and Rural Development and Rehabilitation. The Council shall be composed of specified Ministers and other government officers: It shall function as the "commanding unit", in cooperation with relevant ministries and institutions, to obtain effectiveness and coherence in the implementation of the following objectives: to manage and implement programs of the Government and the National Program to Rehabilitate and Develop Cambodia in order to develop the agriculture and rural areas; to transform the rice production in Cambodia from domestic usage towards international trade, and to reduce the disparities in incomes and opportunities between rural and urban areas, to establish priorities in the rehabilitation and development of the agriculture and rural areas; to act as co-ordinator of public and private efforts to rehabilitate and develop the agriculture and rural areas; to review all project proposals pertaining to the rehabilitation and the development of agriculture and rural areas; and to provide guidance to ministries or government institutions, and to report to and ask for advice on vital issues from the Royal Government.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Institution,Less favoured areas,Soil conservation/soil improvement
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Sub-Decree on the Establishment of the Ministry Rural Development.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Rural Development shall be established under the Royal Government. The Ministry of Rural Development shall administer and regulate the rural development sector of the Kingdom of Cambodia. The Ministry shall be headed by a Minister and a Secretary of State and assisted as needed by under Secretaries of State. The organization and functioning of the Ministry of Rural Development shall be governed by Anukret.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Resolution No. 193 of 1994 promulgating Law No. 24 of 1994 on the Planning Body.
Policy_Content: An institution named the Planning Body shall be created and attached to the Council of Ministers. This institution shall exercise the following tasks: propose overall sectoral economic and social policies; fix the indicators for the National Development Plans; prepare the National Development Plans and supervise their implementation; monitor and evaluate economic development; give opinions on proposed legislation related to economic development; lay down strategies for regional development; and decide on matters regarding planning and coordination projects and integrated development programmes within the limits of its competence (sect. 1). The institution shall have various departments and shall be guided by a director. (8 articles)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 10 November 1994.

Policy: Mines Safety and Inspection Act 1994.
Policy_Content: The Act, consisting of 110 sections divided into ten Parts and completed by one Schedule, establishes the following objects: to promote, and secure the safety and health of persons engaged in mining operations; and to assist employers and employees to identify and reduce hazards relating to mines, mining operations, work systems and plant at mines; and to protect employees against the risks associated with mines, mining operations, work systems at mines, and plant and hazardous substances at mines by eliminating those risks, or imposing effective controls in order to minimize them; and to foster and facilitate cooperation and consultation between employers and employees, and associations representing employers and employees, and to provide for the participation of those persons and associations in the formulation and implementation of safety and health standards and optimum working practices; and to provide procedures for employers and employees to contribute to the development and formulation of safety legislation for mines and mining operations and to consult regarding its administration.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Tariff of Fees Regulation (Man Reg. 211/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is enacted under the Surveys Act. In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to the fees payable for maps, plans and other documents, materials and services. The text consists 2 sections and 1 Schedule.
Subject: Land & soil
