Policy: Constitution (Basic Law) of the Republic of Tajikistan.
Policy_Content: The Constitution has the highest legal power, direct application (Article 10) and supremacy on the whole territory of Tajikistan. The Constitution proclaims the establishment of a democratic, legal, secular and unitary State (Article 1), where the State power is based on the principle of separation of powers (Article 9). It consists of 100 Articles divided into 10 Chapters: The fundamentals of the constitutional system (I); Rights, liberties, basic duties of individuals and citizens (II); The Majlisi Oli (III); The President (IV); The Government (V); Local Government (VI); The Badakhshan Mountainous Autonomous Region (VII); The Court (VIII); The Prosecutor’s Office(IX) and Procedure for introducing amendments to the Constitution (X). The Republic of Tajikistan shall be a sovereign, democratic, law-based, secular, and unitary state. Being social oriented state Tajikistan shall provide relevant living conditions for every person Article 1). The territory of Tajikistan shall be indivisible and inviolable. Tajikistan shall consist of the Badakhshan Mountainous Autonomous Region, regions, towns, districts, settlements, and villages. The state shall ensure the sovereignty, independence, and territorial integrity of Tajikistan. Agitation and actions aimed at disunity of the state shall be prohibited. The Constitutional Law shall define the procedure of establishing and changing of administrative and border units (Article 7). Land, its entrails, water, airspace, flora and fauna, and other natural resources shall be owned by the state, and the state guarantee their effective use in the interests of the people (Article 13). The protection of natural, historical and cultural heritage shall be the duties of everyone (Article 44).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Cultural heritage,Local government,Minerals,Public land,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Human rights,Constitutional law,Jurisdictional competence,Freshwater resources management,Water rights
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Constitution enters into force on the date of adoption

Policy: Decreto Nº 158/94 - Ley marco del sub-sector eléctrico.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objetivo esencial regular las actividades de generación, transmisión, distribución y comercialización de energía eléctrica que tengan lugar en el territorio nacional y se aplicará a todas las personas naturales y jurídicas y entes públicos, privados o mixtos, que participen en cualesquiera de las actividades mencionadas. Se crea la Comisión Nacional de Energía Eléctrica (CNEE).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.109/94 - Impacto ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, a los efectos de obtener la declaración de impacto ambiental, dispone que el proponente de las obras o actividades comprendidas en el Anexo I de la Ley Nº 5.961, con las excepciones establecidas en el artículo 9 del presente Decreto, deberá presentar ante el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente, Urbanismo y Vivienda, la manifestación general de impacto ambiental que deberá contener, como mínimo, los siguientes datos: 1) datos personales, domicilio real y legal del solicitante responsable de la obra o actividad; 2) descripción del proyecto y sus acciones; examen de las alternativas técnicamente viables y justificación de la solución adoptada; 3) inventario ambiental y descripción de las interacciones ecológicas o ambientales claves; 4) identificación y valoración de impactos, tanto en la solución propuesta como en sus alternativas; 5) establecimiento de medidas correctoras y protectoras; 6) programa de vigilancia ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1205 validating the Regulation on state memorial and nature reserve country-house estate of Lev Tolstoy “Yasnaya Polyana”.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of conservation and protection of the protected area state memorial and nature reserve country-house estate of Lev Tolstoy “Yasnaya Polyana” that is considered object of cultural heritage of natural importance. Nature reserve shall be located in the province of Tula. The institution shall have the purpose of conservation of natural and park landscapes, elaboration and carrying out ecological and environmental protection special complex programs, renewal of historical natural landscape and organization of mass tourism. Land within the boundaries of state memorial and nature reserve country-house estate of Lev Tolstoy “Yasnaya Polyana” shall be allotted on condition of open-ended and free of charge land tenure.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 7447 - Regulación del uso racional de la energía.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto consolidar la participación del Estado en la promoción y la ejecución gradual del programa de uso racional de la energía. Asimismo, se propone establecer los mecanismos para alcanzar el uso eficiente de la energía y sustituirlos cuando convenga al país, considerando la protección del ambiente.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Décret nº 94/108/PRG/SGG portant attributions et organisation du Ministère de l'agriculture, de l'élevage et des forêts.
Policy_Content: A la faveur d'une restructuration du Gouvernement intervenue en août 1994, l'ex-Ministère de l'agriculture et des ressources animales a été scindé en deux départements ministériels: l'un chargé de la pêche et de l'aquaculture; l'autre, objet du présent décret, chargé de l'agriculture, de l'élevage et des forêts. Celui-ci a pour mission de définir, de coordonner et de contrôler la mise en oeuvre de la politique gouvernementale dans les domaines de son ressort. Le Ministère comprend cinq directions nationales respectivement chargées de: l'agriculture; l'élevage; les forêts et la faune; le génie rural; et la météorologie. Il dispose en outre: (i) de services d'appui (dont le Bureau de coordination de la politique agricole; le Centre national de documentation et d'information pour le développement rural; le Service national de statistique agricole); (ii) de services rattachés (comme l'Office guinéen du bois; le Laboratoire de la protection des végétaux; le Laboratoire central de diagnostic vétérinaire); et (iii) d'établissements publics (tel l'Institut de recherche agronomique de Guinée). L'organisation et les attributions spécifiques des directions, services et établissements relevant du Ministère feront l'objet de textes complémentaires du présent décret.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Livestock, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Law No. N C-1109-1-3P-121 on atmospheric air protection.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 19 Chapters that contain 43 articles. Atmospheric air is one of the basic vital elements of the natural environment. Proceeding from interests of the present and future generations, the Republic of Armenia carries out scientifically proved actions which purpose is to prevent and remove pollution of atmospheric air, other harmful influences on it, and carries out the international cooperation in the sphere of protection of atmospheric air. The Law gives specifications of maximum permissible concentration of substances polluting atmospheric air and maximum permissible physical harmful influences and specifications of levels of maximum permissible emissions of substances polluting atmospheric air and maximum permissible physical harmful influences, regulates emissions of substances polluting atmospheric air by stationary and mobile sources of pollution. The present Law also regulates location, designing, construction and operation of enterprises, constructions and other objects influencing state of atmospheric air, establishes the modalities of compliance with requirements on atmospheric air protection as regards management of pesticides and other preparations, extraction of minerals, location and operation of pit refuse heap and ore barrows, removal, transportation and use of substances polluting atmospheric air and waste products.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Forest Code (No.S-1111-1.-ZR-122 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The purpose of Forest Code is to promote scientifically substantiated conservation, protection, reproduction and rational use of forests proceeding from ecological, social and economic importance of forests. The Law consists of 22 Sections that contain 62 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-4) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 5-8) regards state management of forests. Section 3 (art. 9) regards classification of forests into categories. Section 4 (arts. 10-11) regards felling age and final yield calculation. Section 5 (arts. 12-13) regards transfer of forests areas into non-forest areas. Section 6 (arts. 14-15) regards distribution, projecting, construction and putting in operation objects having impact on the state and reproduction of forests. Section 7 ( arts. 16-22) regards forest management. Section 8 (arts. 23-27) establishes rights and duties of forest managers. Section 9 (arts. 28-29) establishes the modalities of timber extraction and calculation of the amount of timber extraction. Section 10 (arts. 30-31) establishes the modalities of extraction of secondary forest products. Section 11 (arts. 32-34) establishes the modalities of carrying out collateral forest management. Section 12 (arts. 35-37) regards forest management for hunting, scientific research and cultural and recreational purposes. Section 13 (arts. 38-40) regards the particulars of forest management on protected areas, urban forests and borderland. Section 14 (arts. 41-44) regards regeneration, raising the productivity of forests and reforestation. Section 15 (arts. 45-48) regards conservation and protection of forests. Section 16 (art. 49) regards state forest service. Section 17 (arts. 50-51) regards forest charges. Section 18 (arts. 52-53) regards forest management. Section 19 (art. 54) regards state forest cadastre and state registration of the stock of forest. Section 20 (arts. 55-56) regards state control over the state, conservation, protection, regeneration and use of forests. Section 21 (arts. 57-61) regards dispute settlement and establishes liability for the infringement of forest legislation. Section 22 (art. 62) regards international agreements.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Basic legislation,Forest service/forest officers,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Dispute settlement,Afforestation/reforestation,Classification/declassification,Registration,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Recreational forest
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Elle ajoute aux missions de ces commissariats celle de promouvoir la pêche et l'aquaculture en veillant notamment à l'exploitation rationnelle des espèces aquatiques et leur conservation.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Entrepreneurs (№578–IS of 1994)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the legal forms of the subjects of entrepreneurial activity. Entrepreneurial activity shall be a legitimate and repeated activity carried out independently and in an organised manner to gain profit. Artistic, scientific, medical, architectural, legal or notary, audit, consulting (including tax consultants’), agricultural or timber-industry activities of natural persons, as well as the utilisation by a natural person or a legal person, or another organisational unit of a micro power plant connected to the electrical distribution network under the procedure established by the appropriate legislation shall not be considered as entrepreneurial activity. Agricultural or timber industries may exist in the legal form provided for in Article 2 of this Law, if they are registered with the Registry of Entrepreneurs and Non-entrepreneurial (Non-commercial) Legal Persons. Registration shall be mandatory if at least 5 persons who are not members of the owner's family are permanently employed in the enterprise. The Law further provides that cooperatives shall include a) cooperatives obtaining raw materials for members by way of extracting raw materials; b) cooperatives jointly selling agricultural products or hunting and fishery produce; c) cooperatives producing agricultural products and manufacturing different articles, and selling them at joint expenses (agricultural and production cooperatives); d) cooperatives buying consumer goods by wholesale and selling them by retail; e) cooperatives buying and producing, as well as jointly using material and technical resources necessary for agricultural production or for hunting and fishing; f) agricultural-credit cooperatives; g) consumer (diversified) cooperatives whose legal, economic and social bases shall be governed by the Law of Georgia on Consumer Cooperatives; h) non-bank deposit institutes – credit unions; i) agricultural cooperatives whose legal, economic and social bases shall be governed by this Law unless otherwise determined by the Law of Georgia on Agricultural Cooperatives. The Law is divided into six chapters and 71 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Cooperative/producer organization,Registration,Business/industry/corporations,Financial agricultural measures,Fish products,Fishing authorization,Fishery management and conservation,Processing/handling,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Forest management/forest conservation,Wildlife products,Hunting/capture

Policy: Ley Nº 3.142 – Aprobación del Acuerdo Federal Minero y adhesión al régimen de inversiones mineras institutido por Leyes Nº 24.196 y 24.296.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley la Provincia de Misiones aprueba el Acuerdo Federal Minero y, por otro lado, se adhiere al régimen de inversiones mineras introducido por la Ley Nacional Nº 24.196 y su Decreto reglamentario Nº 2.686/93. El anexo adjunto a la presente Ley contiene el texto del Acuerdo Federal Minero. En virtud de este último cada Provincia de la Nación está facultada para aplicar en su ámbito el concurso público reglado en el título XX del Código de Minería. Otras normas se refieren a la cooperación entre la Nación y las Provincias para desarrollar acciones que mantengan actualizado el Catastro Minero, tasas relativas a la actividad minera, evitando distorsiones entre las jurisdicciones. En lo que se refiere a la protección del medio ambiente, queda establecida la necesidad de cumplimentar, tanto para la actividad pública como privada, una declaración de impacto ambiental para las tareas de prospección, exploración, explotación, industrialización, almacenamiento, transporte y comercialización de minerales.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Law on Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the principles of environment protection in Croatia, provides a framework for further regulation with respect to environment protection and makes provision for the implementation of environment protection policies and plans and the administration of the environment. Provisions of Chapter I (General provisions) state the objectives of environment protection, give definitions of several key notions of the Law and establish the Environmental Protection Council, a public advisory body. Chapter II contains a series of basic environmental protection principles including: the preventive principle; the principle of natural resources and biodiversity conservation; the principle of integrity; the polluter pays principle. Chapter III defines "environmental protection documents" such as the (national) Environmental Protection Strategy, Environmental Protection Programmes for areas of counties and the city of Zagreb, the Environmental State Report to be submitted every two years to the Parliament. Chapter IV makes provision for environment protection measures such as the establishment of standards, environment impact assessment, environmental state monitoring, the adoption of "physical plans", the keeping of an Environmental Pollution Cadastre, the establishment of an Environmental Protection Information System, economic incentives, the adoption of emergency plans, and the introduction of an environment protection label. Chapter V defines the liability for environmental pollution damage. Chapter VI provides for the financing of environment protection. The remaining Chapters (VII, VIII, and IX) provide for control and enforcement, prescribe penalties and contain transitional provisions. The Law consists of 76 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Basic legislation,Institution,EIA,Access-to-information,Environmental planning,Offences/penalties,Data collection/reporting,Environmental audit,Polluter pays principle,Environmental standards,Registration,Emissions
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

It consists of 9 articles and 1 appendix laying down the requirements to be satisfied for forests' exploitation and management. It establishes fees to be paid and authorized activities in these protected areas under the control of Ibama. The appendix lists national forests by regions.

Policy: Resolución Nº 435/94 - Reglamento para la importación de plantas, partes de plantas, productos de origen vegetal y otros productos susceptibles de causar perjuicios al estado fitosanitario de las plantas en Cuba.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Reglamento para la importacion de plantas, partes de plantas,productos de origen vegetal y otros productos susceptibles de causar perjuicios al estado fitosanitario de las plantas en Cuba, que tiene como objetivo regular la importación de los materiales subcuarentenados. Están comprendidos en las regulaciones fitosanitarias los materiales siguientes: 1) las especies de plantas vivas y sus partes (posturas, vástagos, raíces, tubérculos, rizomas, flores y otros); 2) las semillas de plantas de cultivo o de plantas silvestres; 3) los granos, frutas, hortalizas, legumbres, especias, harinas, tortas, sémolas, afrechos y demás productos alimentarios en estado natural o semielaborados; 4) los piensos y forrajes (heno, paja, concentrados, lecho de pajas para el transporte de animales); 5) productos forestales, bolos de madera, traviesas, madera aserrada de todo tipo, madera laminada, objetos o artículos de madera; 6) envases o embalajes de cualquier tipo que puedan ser portadores de plagas; 7) tierra ó suelo y abonos orgánicos, monolitos y muestras de suelo para investigaciones; 8) productos elaborados o materias primas para la fabricación de artículos industriales tales como fibras de algodón y lino; 9) tabaco en ramas; 10) plantas o hierbas medicinales y material herborizado; 11) organismos y microorganismos, dañinos o beneficiosos a la agricultura; y 12) todo lo que pueda ser portador de plagas a las plantas o productos de origen vegetal.
Subject: Livestock, Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Timber,Pests/diseases,International trade,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Animal feed/feedstuffs,Plant protection,Quarantine,Pesticides,Planting material/seeds,Certification,Crops/grasses,Textile plants/fibres,Biological agents,Tobacco,Plant production

Están comprendidos en las regulaciones fitosanitarias los materiales siguientes: 1) plantas vivas y sus partes (posturas, vástagos, raíces, tubérculos, rizomas, flores y otros); 2) semillas botánicas y agámicas de plantas de cultivos o plantas silvestres; 3) piensos y forrajes; ch) productos forestales ( bolos de madera, traviesas, madera aserrada de todo tipo, madera laminada); 4) granos, frutas, hortalizas, legumbres, especias, harinas, tortas, sémolas, afrechos y demás productos alimentarios en estado natural o semielaborado; 5) artículos artesanales y muebles confeccionados con productos de origen vegetal; 6) envases, embalajes y jaulas elaborados con productos de origen vegetal cuando se deseen exportar como tales; 7) tierra o suelos y abonos orgánicos, monolitos y muestras de suelos para investigaciones; 8) productos elaborados o materias primas para la fabricación de artículos industriales (fibras de algodón, lino y otras de origen vegetal); 9) tabaco en rama y tabaco manufacturado; 10) plantas o hierbas medicinales y material herborizado; 11) organismos o microorganismos dañinos o beneficiosos a la agricultura.

Policy: Instruction of Federal Agency on Subsoil Management on registration of the state of geological, hydrogeological, engineering geological,geophysical, ecological and geological, and geochemical exploration of the territory of the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: This Instruction establishes the modalities of registration of the state of geological, hydrogeological, engineering geological, geophysical, ecological and geological, and geochemical exploration of the territory of the Russian Federation, including continental shelf, EEZ and the bottom of World ocean. It shall be mandatory for all the organizations carrying out geological exploration. The purpose of registration of all types of exploration shall be: (a) to represent the character and the degree of exploration of the territory of the Russian Federation; (b) to create information database for substantiation of the issuance of licences for subsoil management, and also for planning and guidance of geological exploration of subsoil on the national territory; and (c) to retrieve geological information from geological funds.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Order No. 224 of the Federal Forest Service regarding validation of the Instructions on organization and carrying out by state forest management institution of state control over state, use, reproduction, protection and safeguard of forests.
Policy_Content: Regional forestry institutions must be guided in their activity by these Instructions, must provide for its distribution within their subordinate forestries and must ensure the study of these Instructions by forest officers. The present Instructions regulate the activity of state forest service and its officials as regards the organization and carrying out state inspection. The Regulation consists of 4 Sections and contains 11 Annexes. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 regards organizational measures concerning state management. Section 3 determines competence of state inspectors of all levels. Section 4 establishes the standards for drawing up of the documents as a result of state inspection. Annex 1 contains the list of issues subject to study, analysis and verification in the process of carrying out state control over state, use, reproduction, protection and safeguard of forests. The issues include: 1) state of forest resources; 2) the use of forests; 3) the reproduction of forests; 4) forestry protection measures; 5) the protection of forests from pests and diseases.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Root Crop General Order (Regulation 198/94).
Policy_Content: Each producer of a root crop shall, on or before the 30th day of June in each year, apply to this Board for certification of all land on which that producer intends to grow or harvest a type of root crop during that year. Each application shall be in writing and shall be signed by the applicant. No producer shall market a type of root crop unless that type of root crop was grown or harvested on land certified by this Board for the growing of that type of root crop pursuant to an application made by that producer. No person shall market a root crop unless it has been graded and inspected as required by the Canada Agricultural Products Standards Act and regulations made thereunder, and is packed and marked in the manner prescribed by such Act or regulations. Onions shall be classified under the following classes: (a) yellow Spanish-type onions; and (b) cooking onions. No person engaged in the marketing of a root crop shall purchase or otherwise acquire root crops except from or through this Board. No processor shall purchase or otherwise acquire a root crop grown or harvested in Manitoba expect from or through this Board, unless otherwise permitted by this Board. No person shall market a root crop unless such root crop is packed in a container, the type and class of root crop wherein weighs either 25 or 50 pounds (11.34, or 22.68 kilograms). No person shall transport or deliver for transport (except to a transporter retained by this Board) a root crop unless such person has been issued a delivery order by this Board for the root crop being transported. No person shall repack a container of a type of root crop unless such person has been licenced by the Board as a licenced repacker for that type. This Order does not apply to: (a) red Spanish-type onions; (b) white Spanish-type onions; (c) onion sets; (d) multiplier onions; (e) pickling onions; and (f) rutabagas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

The text – consisting of 8 articles – deals with the following aspects: principles, sphere of application, duties of alpine cooperatives, duties of land registry office, cantonal right of pre-emption, cottages, local courts and entry into force.

Policy: Indian Lands Open Dump Cleanup Act of 1994 (P.L. 103-399).
Policy_Content: "Indian lands" means lands within the limits of Indian reservations, dependant Indian communities, and Indian allotments (sect. 3). The Act applies also to Alaska Native Lands. The Director of Indian Health Service shall conduct an inventory of open dumps. The Director shall also be responsible for a 10-year development plan and annual reports to Congress on Indian solid waste deficiencies, progress made in addressing such deficiencies and funding (sect. 4). An inventory shall also take place on request of an Indian tribal government or Alaska Native Entity (sect. 5). The Director may establish and carry out a program providing for demonstration projects involving open dumps on Indian land (sec.7). (9 sections)
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decree No. 1.282 regulating articles 15, and 19-21 of New Forestry Code (Act No. 4.771).
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates articles 15, and 19-21 of New Forestry Code (Act No. 4.771). It consists of 27 articles concerning the requirements to be satisfied for forests' exploitation and management. It defines protected areas, listing all involved States, prohibiting forest exploitation (such as forests in which native people live, primordial forests of Amazon river basin, etc.). This Decree also specifies other types of exploitation of forests. This Decree prescribes, under the competence of Brazilian Institute for Environment - Ibama, controls, fees and sanction for offenders.

Policy: Energy Efficiency Regulations (SOR/94-651).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enforce the Energy Efficiency Act (S.C. 1992, c. 36). In particular, the Regulations lay down provisions relating to the sale and lease of appliances not complying with the prescribed efficiency standards and not meeting the prescribed labelling requirements. The text consists of 18 sections divided into 8 Parts as follows: Energy-using products (I); Energy efficiency standards (II); Labelling (III); Verification mark labelling (IV); Provision of information (V); Information pertaining to imports (VI); Exemptions from provisions of the Act and the Regulations (VII); Coming into force (VIII). Five Schedules are enclosed.

Policy: Government Decree on providing Guidance for the Implementation of the Law on Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: This text contains rules to implement the provisions of the Environmental Protection Act recently approved by the National Assembly. It spells out tasks of various authorities including the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment, which is responsible for the integrated State management on environmental protection and for organization of direct activities of environmental protection, the People's Committees of provinces and cities under Central Government, and state offices and "mass associations of people". The Decree also provides for assessment of environmental impact. Article 10 defines the scope for assessing environmental impact. Article 13 prescribes the contents of a dossier for appraising a report of assessment on environmental impact. In case of necessity, an Appraising Council shall be set up at the central level by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment and by the chairmen of the People's Committees of the provinces and cities under Central Government for Appraising Councils at the provincial level. Remaining articles regulate various matters including the import and export of discharged substances containing toxic elements or pathogenic microbes possibly causing environmental pollution are prohibited.
Subject: Environment gen.

The 64 sections of this Act are divided into 7 Parts, i.e.: Preliminary (1); Establishment and membership of the National Environment Protection Council (2); Functions and powers of the Council (3); Meetings of the Council and establishment and meetings of its committees (4); NECP service corporation, NECP executive officer and staff (5); Finance (6); Miscellaneous (7).

Policy: Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (Public Law 103-354).
Policy_Content: The Act provides a comprehensive reorganization of the United States Department of Agriculture. In addition to mandating specified reductions in personnel, the Act empowers the Secretary of State for Agriculture to establish three Assistant Secretaries and Under-Secretaries for, respectively, Farm and Foreign Agricultural Services, Rural Economic and Community Development, Food, Nutrition and Consumer Services, Natural Resources and Environment, Research, Education and Economics, and Food Safety. In addition, the Act provides for the creation of a Consolidated Farm Service Agency, with responsibility for price and income-support and agricultural credit programmes. It further empowers the Secretary of State to create a number of specialized Services, including, among others, a Natural Resources Conservation Service; and to reorganize the Forest Service. Finally, the Act provides for a National Appeals Division to hear appeals from adverse administrative decisions, and lays down detailed procedural rules for the hearing and adjudication of such appeals.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1501-1531).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Chapter is to promote the national welfare by improving the economic stability of agriculture through a sound system of crop insurance and providing the means for the research and experience helpful in devising and establishing such insurance. The Federal Crop Insurance Corporation is established under section 1503, and its administrative, legal and financial matters are provided for in detail. To qualify for coverage under a plan of insurance, the losses of the insured commodity must be due to drought, flood, or other natural disaster (as determined by the Secretary) and except in the cases of tobacco and potatoes, insurance shall not extend beyond the period during which the insured commodity is in the field. insurance shall not cover (a) the neglect or malfeasance of the producer; (b) the failure of the producer to reseed to the same crop in such areas and under such circumstances as it is customary to reseed; or (c) the failure of the producer to follow good farming practices (as determined by the Secretary).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Land Cadastre Act (1994)
Policy_Content: The Land Cadastre Act provides the bases for maintenance of the land cadastre, the objective of maintenance of the cadastre, the procedure for registration of cadastral units, the composition of cadastral data and the procedure for the processing thereof, and the procedure for the financing of the cadastre. The cadastre is a general national register. The objective of the maintenance of the cadastre is to register information in the cadastre reflecting the boundaries and spatial extent of the immovable value of land, the natural status of land and the use of land, and to ensure the quality of such information and that it is preserved and made available to the public. Cadastral data shall be the basis for the creation and development of information systems containing spatial data.

Policy: Guyana Rice Development Board Act (Cap. 72:01).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Guyana Rice Development Board as a body corporate. The functions of the Board shall be to develop the rice industry in Guyana, to promote export of rice, to enhance research on rice, to establish facilities for that purpose, and to extend results of research to farmers for their benefit. The Board shall also be responsible for the grading of rice. The Board may determine different classifications of grades of rice to be purchased, exported or sold on the domestic market. The Act gives a detailed definition of functions of the Board in respect of export of rice.

Policy: Trust Act of 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act: (A) provides for the creation of trusts, powers and functions of trusts, the registration of trusts and the appointment of trustees by court, etc.; (B)  and contains provisions regarding the validity of a trust:  and (C) defines which property may be placed in trust. A trust exists where a person holds or has vested in him or her property of which he or her is not the owner in his own right: (a) for the benefit of any person whether or not yet ascertained or in existence; or (b) for any purpose which is not for the benefit only of the trustee. Restrictions are placed on the trusts of land held in accordance with customary and traditional laws regarding ownership of land in the Marshall Islands.

Policy: Law No. 2244 settling issues regarding electricity production from renewable energy sources and from conventional fuels and other provisions.
Policy_Content: The Public Power Corporation (ΔΕΗ) has the exclusive right of electricity production from any source, including the transmission and distribution of this form of energy throughout the country. This is the general rule, unless the Minister of Development issues Decisions with which the production of electricity from power stations belonging to juridical persons or entities may be permitted. Therefore, this Law, consisting of 11 articles, provides for the arrangement of the procedures and principles regarding the activities of electric power autoproducers (generating plants of electric power covering essentially their own needs). The autoproduction of energy is allowed if generated by renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind and geothermal, water resources (capacity up to 2MW). Furthermore, the co-generation of electricity with conventional fuels by autoproducers is allowed, provided that the relevant conditions, set forth in article 1, are respected. The distribution of electric power derived by autoproducers is regulated in article 2. A license for the installation and operation of such power plants is required. This matter is regulated in articles 3 and 4 (penalties for plants operating without a license). The rest of the articles provide for the general and transitional provisions.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decision enters into force on the date of publication in the Official Gazette unless otherwise indicated in individual sections.

Policy: Presidential Order No. 346 on reports of vessels bound for or leaving national ports and carrying dangerous or polluting goods.
Policy_Content: This Order implements Council Directive 93/75/EEC of 13 September 1993. The rules established by this Order shall apply to all kind of vessels (except from warships and other official ships used for non-commercial purposes) bound for or leaving a national port and carrying dangerous or polluting goods in bulk or in packaged form. The operator of a vessel leaving a national port shall notify before departure of the vessel all information listed in Annex I to the competent port authority.

Policy: Ley Nº 9/1994 - Usos del suelo en el medio rural.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 5 capítulos, 16 artículos y 1 disposición final, entiende por suelo no urbanizable aquel que figura clasificado como tal en los planes generales o normas subsidiarias y, en defecto del plan, aquellas áreas del territorio que no reúnan las condiciones objetivas para ser clasificadas como suelo urbano o urbanizable (art. 1º). Las categorías del suelo no urbanizable son las siguientes: a) suelo no urbanizable de especial protección; b) suelo no urbanizable de interés agrario o paisajístico; c) suelo no urbanizable de protección de la costa; d) suelo no urbanizable no edificable por riesgos; e) suelo no urbanizable de protección de las infraestructuras; f) núcleo rural soporte de ocupación residencial tradicional; g) suelo no urbanizable genérico (art. 2º). Corresponde a la Comisión Regional de Urbanismo el otorgamiento de las autorizaciones que, con carácter previo a la concesión de licencia, vienen exigidas por la Ley del Suelo de 1992 para actuaciones en terrenos clasificados como no urbanizables (art. 12).

Policy: Measures of the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region for implementation of the Soil and Water Conservation Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to prevent and control water and soil loss, protect and rationally utilize water and soil resources, reduce floods, droughts, wind and sand disasters, improve the ecological environment, build ecological security barrier, and ensure the sustainable development of economy and society. The Text consists of 54 Articles divided into 7 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Planning (II); Prevention (III); Control (IV); Monitoring and Supervision (IV); Legal Liabilities (V); Supplementary Provisions (VI). The Measures provide for the preparation of water and soil conservation plans made based on the results of water and soil loss investigation and delimitation of key prevention areas and key control areas. The people's governments at or above the county level shall delimit and announce key prevention areas and key control areas according to the results of water and soil loss investigation. Where production and construction projects need to formulate water and soil conservation scheme in accordance with the law, the competent environmental protection authority shall, in the approval of the environmental impact assessment document, check the approval procedures of the water and soil conservation scheme. The People's Government of the Autonomous Region shall set up the ecological compensation mechanism for soil and water conservation. The Measures further provide for the monitoring and supervision of water and soil conservation and for legal liabilities.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Disasters,Flood,Policy/planning,Inspection,Liability/compensation,EIA,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Water conservation zone,Water shortage/drought

Policy: Law on subsoil.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to regulate relations originating from ownership, use and disposal of subsoil (mining relations) in an effort to ensure rational, complex use of subsoil in order to meet the demands in mineral resources, groundwater, protection of subsoil and protection of the right to use subsoil. Subsoil pertains to exclusive national property (art. 3). The targets of state regulation of mining relations are: 1) ensuring the development of mineral resources; 2) determination of the amount of mineral extraction; 3) setting environmental fees; 4) setting norms and regulations as regards exploration of subsoil (art. 6). Subsoil shall be granted for the following purposes: 1) geological study; 2) mineral extraction; 3) construction and running of works destined for subterranean storage of oil, natural gas, burial of hazardous substances, radioactive and industrial waste (art. 10). The managers of subsoil shall be legal and natural persons (art. 11). Management of subsoil shall be open-ended and fixed-date (in conformity with the terms established by licence) (art. 12).  Subsoil shall be conceded for the purpose of mineral extraction in conformity with special permits (licences) (art. 14). The projects regarding works related to subsoil management and processing of minerals shall be subject to environmental audit (art. 16). Environmental fees shall be collected for the use of subsoil (art. 22). Geological study and exploration activity shall be subject to compulsory state registration (art. 40). The Law consists of 10 sections composed of 51 articles.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Energy Law (No. 559-1s).
Policy_Content: This Law: (a) places the power industry among the leading components of Georgia’s fuel and energy complex in the national economy, forming the legal economic, social and organizational bases of its functioning; (b) regulates relationships between producers and consumers of electric and thermal energy as well as foreign economic relations; (c) determines the rights and obligations of relevant state administrative organs; and (d) ensures the normal functioning and rational development of the sector under the conditions of full state independence of Georgia and a market-oriented economy. The energy sector includes the complex of industrial enterprises, facilities and buildings that produce, transmit and distribute electric and thermal energy, research, project, constructions with their production infrastructure. The energy sector is managed by the state pursuant to this Law and regulations promulgated by the Cabinet of the Ministers of the Republic. Georgia’s extraction of its thermal and energy resources and priority development of renewable energy sources shall be the basis of the country’s development of its energy sector and of its international integration. The Cabinet of the Ministry of the Republic shall, inter alia, issue permits for the use of thermal, fossil and other resources necessary for the construction and operation of new power plants.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Environmental Protection Protocol- Implementation Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act implements the Protocol on Environmental Protection to the Antarctic Treaty of 4 October 1991. Objectives of the present Act are the comprehensive protection of the Antarctic environment and the dependent and associated ecosystems, as well as the preservation of the Antarctic being a natural reserve dedicated to peace and science. Any activity according to article 2, paragraph 1 No. 2 of the Protocol carried out by: 1) German nationals, 2) other natural persons resident or ordinarily resident in the Federal Republic of Germany, 3) legal persons established in the Territory of the Federal Republic of Germany, 4) foreign legal persons, requires a permit. The Federal Environment Office is the competent authority to grant authorizations. The text – consisting of 42 articles – deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: definition of terms, rules and bans, authorisation proceedings, prevention of marine pollution, research activities, environmental impact assessment, public display, notification of the parties to the environmental protection committee, survey and monitoring, protection of fauna and flora of the antarctic, brining animals and plants to the Antarctic, avoidance principles and removal of waste, permits and administrative plans.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: International agreement-implementation,Ecosystem preservation,Climate change,EIA,Monitoring,Protected area,Environmental planning,Sustainable use,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control

Policy: Reglamento para la concurrencia al mercado agropecuario.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución Conjunta de los Ministerios de Agricultura y de Comercio Interior, en base al Decreto Nº 191, de 19 septiembre 1994, que crea el Mercado agropecuario, reglamenta la concurrencia al mercado agropecuario a partir del cumplimiento de la cifra mensual contratada y del total de las producciones no contratadas. El contrato se hará sobre la base de un por ciento, analizable en cada caso, de posibilidades productivas iguales o superiores a los ya existentes para los productos seleccionados en cada territorio (art. 1º). El artículo 3º excluye algunos productos de la venta en el mercado agropecuario, como carne, leche fresca, tabaco, cacao y el arroz de los complejos arroceros que será contratado al Estado en su totalidad. Podrán concurrir al mercado agropecuario, entre otros, las empresas y granjas estatales, las unidades básicas de producción cooperativa no cañeras, las cooperativas de créditos y servicios, los agricultores pequeños, los productores en áreas entregadas para el autoabastecimiento (art. 5º). El Reglamento aprobado consta de 2 capítulos, 9 artículos y 1 disposición transitoria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Internal trade,Agricultural commodities,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Financial agricultural measures,Smallholders/peasants
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal concernant l'utilisation de fertilisants organiques dans l'agriculture.
Policy_Content: Ce règlement vise à réduire la pollution des eaux provoquéé ou induite par les nitrates à partir de fertilisants organiques et prévenir toute nouvelle pollution de ce type; réduire ou prévenir les nuisances causées par l'épandage de fertilisants organiques. L'article 2 contient la définition de certains termes employés comme, parmi d'autres, "composé azoté", "animaux", "engrais chimique", "effluent d'élevage". L'article 3 indique les autorités competentes. Les ministres de l'agriculture et de l'environnement font établir un code de bonnes pratiques agricoles que sera fourni à tous les exploitants agricoles. L'article 5 contient les interdictions et restrictions spéciales applicables dans les zones de protection des eaux potables. En outre, ce règlement modifie l'article 4 du règlement du 14 avril 1990 relatif aux boues d'épuration. Le règlement comprend 11 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Farming,Fertilizers/nutrients,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Potable water,Effluent waste water/discharge,Water conservation zone

Policy: Decreto Nº 191 - Crea el mercado agropecuario.
Policy_Content: El Decreto, que consta de 7 artículos y 4 disposiciones finales, crea el mercado agropecuario como una entidad que funcionará sobre la base de su autogestión económica y financiera, organizada por las direcciones de comercio -que establecerán su número y ubicación en cada municipio-, y destinado a la compra, venta y prestación de servicios para que los productores o sus representantes puedan vender los productos agropecuarios naturales o elaborados (art. 1º). En el mercado agropecuario se comercializarán los productos agropecuarios que excedan a la producción contratada y aquellos de la producción no contratada (art. 2º). En todo caso, regirá el principio básico de que a mayor producción, más podrán vender los productores en el mercado agropecuario, una vez que hayan satisfecho sus necesidades básicas y sus deberes con la sociedad (art. 3º). Los precios de venta de los productos que se comercialicen en los mercado agropecuarios serán acordados libremente entre vendedores y compradores (art. 4º). Los vendedores estarán obligados a abonar al Estado el impuesto establecido y otros pagos por el uso de locales y servicios (art. 5º). El artículo 7º prevé la imposición de una multa al productor que teniendo los productos para cumplir las entregas contratadas en el mes las incumpla.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Internal trade,Agricultural commodities,Fiscal and market measures
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decreto Nº 23.616/MIRENEM - Reglamenta el uso de energía eléctrica para iluminación en los edificios públicos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que se prescindirá del uso de energía eléctrica para efectos de iluminación externa e interna en los edificios públicos, de las veinte horas a las seis horas del día siguiente, salvo en el caso de jornadas con horario nocturno y lo absolutamente imprescindible.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 94-279 portant organisation de la lutte contre les pollutions marines et institution de plans d'urgence.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet, en application des dispositions de la loi n°83-03 du 5 février 1983 relative à la protection de l'environnement, l'organisation de la lutte contre les pollutions marines résultant d'un évènement maritime, terrestre aérien qui entraîne ou peut entraîner le déversement massif en mer d'hydrocarbures ou de tous autres produits ou substances pouvant constituer un danger grave et imminent ou engendrer des dommages au milieu marin, aux fonds des mers, sur le littoral ainsi qu'aux intérêts connexes.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Environmental planning
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Carib Reserve (Amendment) Act 1994 (No. 8 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Carib Reserve Act in relation with procedures of election of the Carib Reserve Council.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Arrêté n° 29/MDRET/MDR/DGDR portant création d'un comité technique national.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte création d'un comité technique national, chargé de suivre l'élaboration, le choix et la mise en oeuvre des plans de restructuration des institutions rurales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Regulations of Shenzhen Special Economic Zone on Environmental Protection(1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are enacted in order to protect and improve people’s environment and ecological environment, prevent and control environment pollution and other public hazards, safeguard human health and facilitate the coordinated development of environmental protection and economic construction.  The Regulations contain 58 Articles divided into 7 Chapters: General Provisions; Supervision and Administration on the Environment; Administration on the Environment of Construction Projects; Protecting and Improving the Living and Ecological Environment; Preventing and Controlling Environmental Pollution and other Public Hazards; Legal Liabilities; Supplementary Provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Environmental fees/charges,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Pollution control,Ecosystem preservation,EIA,Authorization/permit,Offences/penalties,Inspection,Noise pollution,Radiation,Soil pollution/quality,Solid waste,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Waste disposal,Waste domestic sources,Waste management,Waste non-domestic sources

Policy: Regulation on the order of compensation of land-users of losses and losses of agricultural production in connection with withdrawal of lands from agricultural production and use of forestry purposes (No. 463 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made in conformity with articles 127 to 131 of the Land Code and makes provision for the compensation of economic loss resulting from (temporary) withdrawal of lands from cultivation or production of timber or other restrictions on land use rights, or damage to the quality of land caused by the State for the public interest or by private entities. It established the priority of compensation, defines means of evaluating damage, and gives directions regarding the use of funds obtained from compensation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Land Acquisition (Amendment) Enactment 1994 (No. 7 of 1994).
Policy_Content: According to section 2, section 21 of the Land Acquisition Ordinance is hereby amended by substituting a colon for the semi-colon appearing at the end of the proviso to paragraph (a) and inserting immediately thereafter the following new further proviso: Cap. 68: "And provided further that the fact that the land is held under Part IV of the Land Ordinance or any other written law in the State relating to native land tenure shall by disregarded in determining the value of the land;".
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Decreto Nº 160/1994 - Reglamento de Manejo del Fondo Nacional de Desarrollo Forestal (FONADEFO).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de Manejo del Fondo Nacional de Desarrollo Forestal (FONADEFO), creado mediante Decreto Nº 127/1990 que prueba y establece el Plan de Relanzamiento de la Producción Forestal, y que tiene por finalidad financiar estudios, programas y proyectos orientados a desarrollar las actividades de repoblación forestal, mantenimiento de carreteras nacionales donde transitan camiones madereros, agrosilvicultura, reforzamiento de la Administración Forestal y del manejo sostenido de los recursos forestales.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Special fund,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Sustainable use,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Agro-forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic

Policy: Rural Adjustment Authority Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the creation of the Queensland Rural Adjustment Authority to assist rural production; it consists of 51 sections and is divided into seven Parts. Under section 3, the objectives of the Act include: The objective of this Act is to establish a body, the Queensland Rural Adjustment Authority, to deliver financial and other assistance primarily targeted at fostering the development of a more productive rural sector. Part 2 concerns the establishment, functions and powers of the Authority. Part 3 provides for financial assistance schemes, Part 4 concerns the operation of the Authority and Part 5 its staff. Part 6 contains miscellaneous provisions and Part 7 contains provisions on savings, transition and validation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Décret nº 94-59 portant transfert au Ministère de l'Equipement du Service national des pistes rurales.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte transfert au Ministère de l'Equipement du Service national des pistes rurales.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Forests Law.
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to all kind of forests in the Canton of Thurgau. Article 2 contains the definition of “forest”according to which it must have an area of 500 m2, a width of 12 m and a minimum age of 15 years. The text consists of 41 articles divided into 7 Parts as follows: Sphere of application (I); Organization of forestry (II); Forest conservation (III); Forestry management (IV); Vocational training and administrative proceedings (V); Financial contributions (VI); Transitional and final provisions (VII).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Public forest,Private forest,Subsidy/incentive
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 April 1996.

Policy: National Environment Protection Council (Queensland) Act 1994.
Policy_Content: The Commonwealth, the States, the Australian Capital Territory, the Northern Territory and the Australian Local Government Association have entered into an Agreement known as the Intergovernmental Agreement on the Environment setting out certain responsibilities of each party in relation to the environment. That Agreement provides that the Commonwealth and States will make joint legislative provision for the establishment of a body to determine national environment protection measures. This Act provides for Queensland for the establishment, membership, operation, management, powers and other matters of the National Environment Protection Council. The Council shall make national environment protection measures in accordance with Division 2 of Part of this Act and assess and report on the implementation and effectiveness, in Queensland and other participating jurisdictions, of national environment protection measures (sect. 12). Powers of the Council are set out in section 13.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 15 September 1994.

Policy: Constitución de la Provincia de Buenos Aires.
Policy_Content: La Constitución de la Provincia de Buenos Aires fue adoptada en 1994, en el marco de lo establecido por la Constitución nacional. El texto introduce los principios que rigen la forma de gobierno a nivel provincial y además reconoce y garantiza los derechos y libertades individuales. La provincia de Buenos Aires, como parte integrante de la República Argentina, constituida bajo la forma representativa republicana federal, tiene el libre ejercicio de todos los poderes y derechos que por la Constitución Nacional no hayan sido delegados al Gobierno de la Nación. El texto consta de un Preámbulo y las siguientes Secciones: Declaraciones, derechos y garantías; Régimen electoral; Poder Legislativo; Poder Ejecutivo; Poder Judicial; Régimen municipal; Reforma de la Constitución.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances, General
Keyword: Civil and political rights,Constitutional law,Consumer protection,Economic/social/cultural rights,Local government,Public health,Social protection,Indigenous peoples,Pollution control,Right to clean/healthy environment,Ecosystem preservation,EIA,Human rights,Soil pollution/quality,Transfer,Traditional rights/customary rights,Solid waste,Radiation,Waste management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Management/conservation,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.099 - Reglamento general de la Ley de Desarrollo Agrario.
Policy_Content: El Reglamento consta de 9 capítulos, 63 artículos, 4 disposiciones transitorias y 1 final. INDICE: Fomento, desarrollo, protección y perfeccionamiento de la Reforma agraria integral (I); Capacitación agraria (II); Crédito agrario (III); Estímulos (IV); Plan de uso, manejo y zonificación de suelos (V); Obligaciones del Estado (VI); Administración de la política agraria (VII); Expropiación (VIII); Adjudicaciones de tierras del Instituto Nacional de Desarrollo Agrario (INDA) (IX); Derecho de uso y aprovechamiento de aguas (X); Disposiciones transitorias (XI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Credit,Capacity building,Extension,Gender,Indigenous peoples,Transfer,Land reform,Expropriation,Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Irrigation,Water rights
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Order No. 809-D/94 on Regulating the Forestry Development Programme.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the Forestry Development Programme. It consists of 3 anexes dealing with the incentive regime for projects on reforestation of deserted or non-deserted areas, elucidating the purposes of this Regulation. Annex I lists the geografical areas benefiting from such incentives. Annex II lists type and maximum level of incentives. Annex III establishes financial amounts for investment projects.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolution concerning the alienation of real property within the boundaries of the Master Plan of Baghdad (No. 157 of 1994).
Policy_Content: Transfer of real estate within the boundaries of the Master Plan for Baghdad or the boundaries of the main master plans of Aqdiyas and Nahiyas attached to the Baghdad Governate of a certain type shall not be registered unless the person to whom the property is transferred was recorded in the 1957 census or any previous census in one of the regions mentioned or regions attached to the Baghdad Governate before the creation of the Sallah Al-din Governate. This rule shall not apply to transfer of property because of death. (3 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: From the date of publication on the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decreto Nº 23665-MO-MIRENEM ─ Crea la Comisión sobre la Zona Marítimo Costera.
Policy_Content: El Decreto establece que la Comisión tendrá la responsabilidad de brindar asesoria al Estado en materia marino costera, así como instar y coordinar con las entidades públicas y privadas involucradas la planificación y ejecución de proyectos y actividades. La Comisión estará integrada así: un representante del Estado que fungirá como presidente de la misma, un especialista en biología marina designado por el Estado, un especialista en derecho ambiental propuesto por el Ministerio de Recursos Naturales, un representante del sector privado, un representante del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería y un representante del Instituto de Turismo.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Regulations of Beijing Municipality on leasing rural barren hills and wastelands with collective ownership.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to speed up the development and utilization of barren hills and wastelands, promote rural economic development, and protect the legitimate rights and interests of lease parties of barren hills and wastelands. The Regulations consists of 30 articles divided into 5 Chapters: General provisions (I); Rental and lease (II); Rights and obligations of the parties (III); Lease contract (IV); Supplementary provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations come into effect on 1 October 1994.

Policy: Decreto Supremo 23858 - Reglamentación de la Ley 1551 de Participación Popular.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación de la Ley Nº 1551 del 20 de abril de 1994 de Participación Popular, en los aspectos relacionados con las Juntas Vecinales, Comunidades Campesinas y Organizaciones Indígenas reconocidas como Organizaciones Territoriales de Base, en su relación con los órganos de la administración pública central, municipal y las organizaciones de la sociedad civil. A los efectos de la Ley 1551 de Participación Popular, se entiende por Organización Territorial de Base, la unidad básica de carácter comunitario o vecinal que ocupa un espacio territorial determinado, comprende una población sin diferenciación de grado de instrucción, ocupación, edad, sexo o religión y guarda una relación principal con los órganos públicos del Estado a través del Gobierno Municipal de la jurisdicción donde está ubicada.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1034 regarding validation of the Regulation on interdepartmental forestry and ecological commission of experts.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to approve the proposal of the Federal Forest Service, the Ministry of Economy and the Ministry Environmental Protection and Natural Resources on setting up of the interdepartmental commission of experts and to validate the respective Regulation. This Regulation determines the modalities of examination of the planning documentation as regards organization of forest management, the use of forestry resources, reproduction of forests and other aspects economic activity related to forestry on the plots of forestry granted on lease. Interdepartmental forestry and ecological commission is set up for the purpose of securing coordinated activity of the Federal Executive Bodies and the Regional Executive Bodies concerned in the field of forest management based on the principles of permanent use. The main task of the Commission is the examination of the planning documentation as regards the plots of forestry granted on lease for the purpose of securing uninterrupted and inexhaustible use of forestry resources, timely and qualitative reproduction of forests in accordance with the requirements of the Basic Forestry Legislation.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Lands Acquisition Act 1994.
Policy_Content: An interest in land, which may be acquired under this Act by agreement or by compulsory process, can be a legal or equitable estate or interest in land or any other right (including a right under an option and a right of redemption), charge, power or privilege over, or in connection with, land or an interest in land. Those interests include an interest of the Territory, a State or another Territory in land; an interest that did not previously exist in relation to particular land; and a restriction on the use of the land, whether or not annexed to particular land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Mines Law (the State Law and Order Restoration Council Law No 8/94).
Policy_Content: The Law provides for all the activities related to mining and exploiting the mineral resources, be them gemstone (ruby, diamonds, opal, sapphire etc.), metallic mineral (iron, gold, silver, zinc, copper, aluminium etc.), industrial mineral (coal, asbestos, etc.) and stone (marble, limestone, quartz, granite etc.). Large scale-production is encouraged as the exportation of mineral products. Permits to mine gemstone and other mineral resources are granted by the Ministry of Mines that shall also supervise all mining activities in order to guarantee the correct exploitation of the resources, their protection as well as the protection of the environment. Land and water utilization are allowed under the provisions of the present Law and, furthermore, the acquisition of land by the State in order to conduct mining operations is provided for. Producers and traders shall pay royalties to the State for all the mineral production sold , at fixed rates. Mineral Reserve Areas shall be declared by the State where mining activities and operations may be carried over and any existing rights on the area shall be compensated for to the land tenants. Mineral resources are property of the State, regardless of the owners of that parcel of land.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Lands Commission Act, 1994 (No. 483).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Lands Commission, defines the functions of and assigns powers to the Commission and makes provision with respect to its composition and administration and the qualification and appointment of members of the Commission.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: European Communities (Common Agricultural Policy) (Scrutiny of Transactions) Regulations, 1994  (S.I. No. 274 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision with respect to the scrutiny of transactions forming part of the system of financing by the Guarantee Section of the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund as required by Council Regulation (EEC) No. 4045/89 and provide for the establishment of an Audit Committee to monitor the application of this Regulation. The Regulations require every person who carries out any transaction to which these Regulations apply, i.e. any transaction referred to in Article 1 of the Council Regulation, to keep records relating to each such transaction. These records are open to inspection by an authorized officer to carry out a systematic scrutiny of the particulars of the transaction in order to ensure that the transaction has been carried out and executed correctly.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.094 - Adiciona la estructura interna del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto adiciona la estructura interna del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente con la Dirección General de Enlace con las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales, cuyas funciones son las siguientes: 1) analizar, proyectar y recomendar las políticas de desarrollo de las Corporaciones; 2) asesorar a los directivos de las Corporaciones en la implantación de políticas que en aspectos técnicos y de desarrollo haya definido el Ministerio; 3) coordinar con las diferentes dependencias del Ministerio las acciones encaminadas a solucionar oportunamente los requerimientos de las Corporaciones; 4) proponer, en coordinación con el Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA), los sistemas de información interinstitucional que deban adelantar las Corporaciones.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 419/94 - Reglamento para la entrega de tierras en usufructo y el mayor aprovechamiento de las áreas de las cooperativas de producción agropecuaria y de agricultores pequeños, destinadas al cultivo del cafe.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento consta de 5 capítulos y 35 artículos. INDICE: Disposiciones generales (I); Entrega de tierras estatales en usufructo (II); Tierras de agricultores pequeños (III); Tierras de cooperativas de producción agropecuaria (IV); Control y registro (V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Smallholders/peasants,Common property,Land consolidation,Land tenure,Cooperative/producer organization,Land reform
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.589/94 - Decreto reglamentario de la Ley Nº 11.469, Creación del Instituto Provincial del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación de la Ley Nº 11.469, mediante la cual fue creado el Instituto Provincial del Medio Ambiente. En particular estas disposiciones tienen por objeto las funciones del Instituto, su control de gestión, régimen financiero y administración.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Mines Law 1994.
Policy_Content: The objectives of this Law include:  (a) to implement the Mineral Resources Policy of the Government; (b) to fulfil the domestic requirements and to increase export by (c) producing more mineral products; (d) to promote development of local and foreign investment in respect of mineral resources; (e) to supervise, scrutinize and approve applications submitted by person or organization desirous of conducting mineral prospecting, exploration or production; (f) to carry out for the development of , conservation, utilization and research works of mineral resources; (g) to protect the environmental conservation works that may have detrimental effects due to mining operation.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Countryside Access Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 2349 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for payment of aid to farmers who undertake for five years to permit members of the public to have access to an area of set-aside land. They implement in part Council Directive (EC) No. 2078/92 on agricultural production methods compatible with the requirements for protection of the environment and maintenance of the countryside. Requirements in relation to the access area are set out in regulation 4. The land shall be managed in accordance with management requirements as set out in the Schedule. Such requirements include making access available to the public, the exclusion of bulls over ten months of age and those of recognised dairy breed, the marking of ways and signposting, the mowing of the whole cover of the access route, and abstaining from giving permission to the public to camp, light fires, carry firearms, use vehicles, etc. (12 regulations)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 1.235 amending article 5 of Decree No. 98.161 (regulating the National Fund for the Environment).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends article 5 of Decree No. 98.161 (regulating the National Fund for the Environment). It lists new composition, competencies and duties of a Commitee regulating the aforementioned financial administration.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the date of publication.

Policy: Decree No. 34/94 creating the National Service for Navigation Management and Control (SAFMAR).
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the National Service for Navigation Management and Control (SAFMAR). It approves the Statute of this institution divided into 4 chapters, the aim of which is the control on navigation in order to prevent marine pollution. It specifies composition, responsibilities and duties of the aforementioned institution.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Coastal Protection (Non-Local Government Areas) Regulation 1994.
Policy_Content: This Regulation implements the Coastal Protection Act 1979 by preventing any person (including a public authority) to carry out development on land within such part of the coastal zone as is not within a local government area, and as is not subject to an environmental planning instrument within the meaning of the Environmental Planning and Assessment Act 1979.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regulation commences on 1 September 1994.

Policy: Order No. 89 delegating Ibama competencies to State Authorities in the field of the forestry register.
Policy_Content: This Order delegates Ibama competencies to State Authorities in the field of forestry register. It consists of 3 articles establishing that Ibama competencies regarding the suspension of forest exploitation authorization shall be under competencies of State Authorities.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on the date of publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 6.747 - Se establece el sistema de contralor de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley provincial establece en el territorio de la provincia de Salta el sistema de contralor de hidrocarburos referidos a la producción, almacenamiento, transporte, industrialización y comercialización del gas y petróleo y gestión de los recursos provenientes de su explotación.
Subject: Mineral resources
