Policy: Decreto Nº 1.540/94 - Creación del Ente Regulador Nuclear.
Policy_Content: Al fin de reorganizar las funciones hasta la fecha a cargo de la Comisión Nacional de Energía Atómica, el presente Decreto dispone la creación del Ente Nacional Regulador Nuclear como entidad autárquica en jurisdicción de la Presidencia de la Nación. El mismo desempeñará funciones en materia nuclear en todo lo referente a los temas de seguridad radiológica y nuclear, protección física y fiscalización del uso de materiales nucleares, licenciamiento y fiscalización de instalaciones nucleares y salvaguardias internacionales.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Resolución Nº 108/DGF/MIRENEM - Manual de procedimientos técnico-administrativos para el manejo y aprovechamiento forestal.
Policy_Content: El propósito fundamental del presente Manual es el de ordenar las normas y procedimientos de carácter técnico y administrativo para el manejo y aprovechamiento forestal que ejecuta el Departamento de Manejo y Aprovechamiento Forestal de la Dirección General Forestal del Ministerio de Recursos Naturales, Energía y Minas (MIRENEM). Las funciones del Departamento de Manejo y Aprovechamiento Forestal, previstas en el presente Manual, son de dos tipos: de manejo forestal y de supervisión y control.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ordinance on public land.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance enforces the Law on public land of 18 March 1986. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to detailed enforcement procedures, such as specific tasks of competent executive authorities. Article 1 establishes that the Territory Office shall be responsible for the execution of the afore-mentioned Law. The text - consisting of 16 articles – deals with the following aspects: boundaries of lakes and rivers, demarcation of the boundaries of public waters, extinction of state owned land, legal fees and costs, construction and existing works, entry into force.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Public land,Mountain area,Tax/levy,Subsidy/incentive,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: National Development Planning (System) Act, 1994 (No. 480).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for a decentralised national system of planning and development. The Act defines planning duties of various local authorities established under the Local Government Act, 1993 and specifies procedures for the preparation and adoption of local development plans. The system shall be coordinated by the National Development Planning Commission, established under the National Development Planning Commission Act, 1994. In addition to the Commission, the system shall also comprise district planning authorities, regional coordinating councils, sector agencies and ministries.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n° 94-1744 du 29 août 1994, relatif aux modalités de contrôle technique à l'importation et à l'exportation et aux organismes habilités à l'exercer.
Policy_Content: Conformément aux dispositions des articles 8, 9 et 10 de la loi n° 94-41 du 7 mars 1994 relatif au commerce extérieur, les produits importés ainsi que ceux destinés à l'exportation et dont les listes seront fixées par arrêté du Ministre chargé du commerce, sont obligatoirement soumis à un contrôle technique. Le présent décret fixe les modalités de ce contrôle ainsi que les organismes habilités à l'exercer. Le contrôle technique à l'importation s'effectue aux points d'entrée terrestres, maritimes ou aériens établis aux frontières nationales et pourvus d'un bureau de douane. Tout importateur de produits soumis à un contrôle technique systématique, est tenu de déposer, avant l'arrivée de la marchandise et au plus tard avant d'entamer les formalités douanières, un dossier auprès du service technique compétent afin d'obtenir soit l'autorisation de mise à la consommation soit l'autorisation provisoire d'enlèvement prévue à l'article 5 du présent décret. Enfin, le contrôle technique à l'exportation est effectué, selon la nature du produit, par les différents services techniques de l'Administration tel que prévu au tableau B annexé au présent décret ou par tout autre organisme agréé par l'Administration à cet effet.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Sea, General
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Complementary Act No. 7 on the Environmental Protection Code of Roraima State.
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, composed of 249 articles and six Annexes, is structured in five main Titles and several Chapters. The Law regulates the Environmental Protection Code of Roraima State. The objective of the Code is to improve environmental quality administration, environmental protection and control. Moreover, the Law aims at granting sustainable use of natural resources. It is divided in five main Titles dealing with, respectively: Roraima environmental policy and main institutions; Main instruments for environmental policy (such as, for instance, environmental planning and zoning, protected areas, EIA, environmental licensing and monitoring,); Environmental sectors (flora, fauna, land management and conservation, solid waste, groundwater, mineral resources, environmental pollution, industrial and urban management, hazardous waste, sanitation); Guidelines for natural resources’ use (with special regards to air, water, soil, noise, and pollution); and, finally, the Environment State Fund (FEMA).

Policy: Northern Great Plains Rural Development Act (P.L. 103-318).
Policy_Content: The Northern Great Plains Rural Development Commission, established under this Act, shall prepare a development plan for the Northern Great Plains of North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Iowa, and Minnesota. The Commission shall provide a forum for the consideration of the problems of the rural Northern Great Plains and seek and encourage to the maximum extent possible the participation of citizens and interested organizations. The Commission shall submit a report to the Secretary of Agriculture and identify and determine the most effective measures to promote economic development and which express maximum respect for the preservation of the natural beauty and habitat of the Northern Great Plains. (12 sections)

Policy: Auburn Indian Restoration Act (P.L. 103-434).
Policy_Content: An Act for the recognition of the United Auburn Indian Community in California, for the restoration of rights of this tribe, and for the economic development of the tribe. Section 204 provides for the transfer of lands for the benefit of the tribe to be held in trust by the Secretary of the Interior. Nothing in this Act shall expand, reduce, or affect in any manner any hunting, fishing, trapping, gathering, or water right of the tribe or its members (sect. 202). The Secretary of the Interior shall enter into negotiations with the governing body of the tribe with respect to establishing a plan for economic development for the tribe (sect. 203). (9 sections)

Policy: Eritrea Investment Proclamation No. 59/1994.
Policy_Content: This Eritrea Investment Proclamation (1994) establishes the following objectives: to encourage investments so as to develop and utilize the natural resources of the country; to expand export and encourage competitive import-substituting businesses; to create and expand employment opportunities; to encourage the introduction of new technology in order to enhance production efficiency and thereby optimize resource exploitation; to encourage equitable regional growth and development; and to encourage small and medium scale enterprises. Without in any way limiting other provisions of this Proclamation, all areas of investment shall be open to investors. Domestic retail and wholesale trade, import and commission agency shall be allowed to foreign investors when Eritrea has bilateral agreement of reciprocity with the country of the investor. However, this precondition may be waived by the Government. The size, location, purpose, terms and conditions of allocation of land/or water shall be determined by the relevant Eritrean laws and regulations.

Policy: Ordinance No. 874-r of 1994 of the mayor-president of the government of St. Petersburg regarding regulation of land tenure of physical persons.
Policy_Content: The Mayor-President of the Government of St.Petersburg, for the purpose of ensuring the right of citizens to allotment on condition of ownership of the plots of land for individual housing, gardening and summer cottage construction orders as follows : 1). Chiefs of district administration are authorized to validate the measures and the boundaries of the plots of land with due regard for urban planning documentation at the presentation of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey. 2). Legalisation of the right of ownership of the plots of land or land shares must be carried out as common property or common share-holding property of the owners of constructions situated on them at the request of a single owner or the total number of owners with handing-in of the ownership certificates in accordance with the legislation currently in force. Size ceiling of a plot of land to be transferred on conditions of property to a single physical person - owner of the construction must be defined in proportion to his ownership share of the construction if other options are not envisaged by the current legislation. Size ceiling of the plot of land to be transferred free-of-charge to a single physical person must not exceed 0,12 hectares.

Policy: Act No. 737 relative to compensation for environmental damage.
Policy_Content: This Act deals with the indemnities provided by the Central Government for damage to the environment. It also provides measures for environmental protection and refers in particular to the Water Act No. 26/20. Compensation is paid for a loss defined as an environmental damage. Damage can be caused by activities carried out in a certain area and can result from pollution of water, air or soil, etc. Compensation is paid for environmental damage in accordance with this At if it is shown that there is a probable causal link between the activities and the loss. The responsible party will pay the costs of environmental damage to people or property, or economic losses. Additionally, the Act requires compensation for the costs of reasonable measures taken to prevent or limit environmental damage and for clean-up and restoration of the environment to its previous state.
Subject: Environment gen.

"Protected areas of basic farmland" means areas delimited in accordance with the legal procedures for implementing the special protection of basic farmland. The Regulations regard in particular:

Policy: Complementary Law No. 0005 on the Environmental Protection Code of Amapá State.
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, consisting of 124 articles is structured in nine main Titles and several Chapters. The State Environmental Policy comprises the set of administrative and technical directives with the purpose of guiding governmental actions for the rational use of environmental resources, as well as for the preservation, improvement and recovery of environmental quality conducive to life, ensuring conditions for socio-economic development, security interests and protection of the dignity of human life, observing the following basic principles: governmental action in maintaining the ecological balance, considering the environment as a public patrimony to be necessarily secured and protected, with a view to collective use; rational use and exploitation of natural resources so as not to jeopardize the ecological balance; plan and monitor the use of natural resources; protect of ecosystems, including specially protected territorial areas and their representative components through planning, zoning and control of potentially or effectively degrading activities; monitoring the state of environmental quality; recovery of degraded areas; protection of areas threatened with degradation; promote environmental education at all levels, etc.

Policy: Dangerous Substances Regulations (Registration of Pesticides) 5754-1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, of 18 Sections and One Annex, make provisions and establish procedures for the correct registration of Pesticides in Israel. Section (1) gives definitions. Section (2) prohibits from a person to produce, to sell, to import and to hold pesticides unless they are registered pesticides. Secs. (3) and (4) regard registering request procedures. Section (5) deals with labelling conditions. Section (6) prohibits any inappropriate usage of a pesticide. (7) prohibits the marketing and commercializing of a pesticide unless it is a registered pesticide. Section (8) obliges the presence of “poison” and “flammable” symbol on the pesticides label. Section (9) establishes the appointing of a “Professional Committee for Pesticide Registrations” that shall have the duty to advise the Minister of Environment for new pesticide registration requests. Secs. (10) to (13) regard registration procedures. Section (14) establishes a period of Six months within which the Minister shall notify if a request of registration has been accepted. Section (15) prohibits the selling of pesticide unless in their original package and container. Secs. (16) and (17) set transgressors penalties.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Environmental Assessment Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 119).
Policy_Content: This Act is composed of 8 parts, creating a legal framework for environmental impact assessment (EIA). Among the purposes of the Act, section 2 lists the following: to provide an open, accountable and neutrally administered process for the assessment of reviewable projects, and to activities that pertain to the environment and land use; to provide for participation by the public, proponents, first nations (native populations), local, provincial and federal government. The Act does not apply to "forest practice", as defined in the Forest Practices Code of B.C. (sect. 3). Whereas the Lieutenant Governor in Council has the power to make regulations prescribing what constitutes a reviewable project (sect. 3), the Minister has the power to designate a project as reviewable if satisfied that it has or may have a "significant adverse effect" and that it is in the public interest to do so (sect. 4), thus applying the precautionary principle. Persons must apply for Project Approval Certificates, issued by the competent Minister, before undertaking "reviewable projects". These will be examined by a Project Committee composed of representatives from the sectors mentioned above (sect. 9) and a Public Advisory Committee (at the discretion of the Executive Director of the Environmental Assessment Board). The rest of Part 2 elaborates the environmental assessment process. Guidelines for review and category assessment requirements (Part 3); Environmental Assessment Board (Part 4); Administration (Part 5); Sanctions (Part 6); General provisions (Part 7); Regulations and transitional provisions (Part 8).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.827 – Establece regulaciones cuarentenarias para la internación de maderas aserradas y en trozas.
Policy_Content: Al fin de prevenir el ingreso y la dispersión en el país de plagas forestales exóticas, la presente Resolución introduce regulaciones cuarentenarias relativas a la internación de maderas aserradas y en trozas. En particular, la internación de las mercaderías peligrosas para los vegetales que se detallan en la presente Resolución deberá efectuarse por los puertos habilitados, venir amparadas por el certificado fitosanitario oficial del país de origen, transportarse en medios que aseguren las condiciones tendientes a evitar una reinfestación durante el trayecto, ser sometidas a inspección en el puerto de ingreso y cumplir las  condiciones especiales que para cada una de ellas se especifican.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law on Investment (1994).
Policy_Content: This Law is enacted to govern all Qualified Investment Projects and define procedures by which any person establishes a Qualified Investment Project. Only Qualified Investment Projects are entitled to the benefits subject to the scope of this Law. In this Law, “Qualified Investment Project” or “QIP” means an investment project which has received a Final Registration Certificate; “Export QIP” means a Qualified Investment Project whose production is exported to be determined by Sub-Decree.

Policy: Act No. 55 on protection against infectious diseases.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for protecting the population from infectious diseases. Its goal is to prevent the occurrence of infectious diseases and their transmission to the population, and to prevent such diseases from being introduced into Norway or carried from Norway to other countries. The Act shall ensure that health authorities and other authorities implement the necessary infection prevention measures and coordinate their activities.

Policy: Arrêté du Ministre de l'agriculture et de la mise en valeur agricole nº 3073-94 fixant les attributions et à l'organisation des services extérieurs du Ministère de l'agriculture et de la réforme agraire.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté fixe les attributions et l'organisation des services extérieurs du Ministère de l'agriculture et de la réforme agraire, à savoir: les directions provinciales de l'agriculture; les directions régionales des eaux et forêts; la direction du contrôle et de la qualité aux postes de Casablanca; les services vétérinaires aux postes frontières de Tanger et d'Agadir; les services de la protection des végétaux du contrôle des semences et des plants aux postes frontières de Tanger et d'Agadir; les conservations foncières; les services du cadastre; les services cartographiques régionaux; le laboratoire national de contrôle vétérinaire de Rabat; le laboratoire national d'épidémiologie et des zoonoses de Rabat; les laboratoires régionaux d'analyses et de recherches vétérinaires, les Haras régionaux, les centres régionaux d'insémination artificielle; le centre de production des semences pastorales de "Khmis Mtouh" à El-Jadida; le centre national d'hydrobiologie et de pisciculture d'Azrou; les établissements d'enseignement agricole et de recherche.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Livestock, Cultivated plants

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.866 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 160 de 1994, en lo relacionado con la adjudicación de terrenos desecados a campesinos o pescadores.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que para que se pueda proceder a la adjudicación de terrenos desecados a campesinos o pescadores en los casos a que se refiere la Ley 160 de 1994, es preciso que la desecación se haya producido por retiro de las aguas, ocurrido por causas naturales, y que tal retiro haya sido definitivo e irreversible y que se haya delimitado la franja protectora del respectivo cuerpo de agua.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.768 - Desarrolla la Ley Nº 99, en lo relativo al establecimiento, organización o reforma de las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto desarrolla parcialmente el literal h) del artículo 116 en lo relacionado con el establecimiento, organización o reforma de las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales y de las Corporaciones de régimen especial, creadas o transformadas por la Ley Nº 99 de 1993. Las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales y las de Desarrollo Sostenible son entes corporativos de carácter público, creados por la ley, integrados por las entidades territoriales que por sus características constituyen geográficamente un mismo ecosistema o conforman una unidad geopolítica, biogeográfica o hidrogeográfica, dotados de autonomía administrativa y financiera, patrimonio propio y personería jurídica, encargados por la ley de administrar, dentro del área de su jurisdicción, el medio ambiente y los recursos naturales renovables y propender por su desarrollo sostenible, de conformidad con las disposiciones legales y las políticas del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1865 - Planes regionales ambientales de las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales y de las de Desarrollo Sostenible, y su armonización con la gestión territorial.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto regula los planes regionales ambientales de las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales y de las de Desarrollo Sostenible, y su armonización con la gestión territorial. Las Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales y las de desarrollo Sostenible elaborarán planes de gestión ambiental regional, en armonía con la planificación en la gestión ambiental de los departamentos, distritos y municipios. El periodo de los planes de gestión ambiental regional se harán mínimo para periodos de cinco años.

Los representantes de los gobernadores, alcaldes, comunidades indígenas, comunidades negras, gremios de la producción agrícola, gremios de la producción industrial, gremios de la producción minera, gremios de exportadores, organizaciones ambientales no gubernamentales, universidades, gremios de la actividad forestal, serán elegidos para un período de cuatro años.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.811 - Reglamenta parcialmente la Ley Nº 41, que organiza el subsector de adecuación de tierras y se establecen sus funciones.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que se cobrarán tarifas a los usuarios para financiar los costos reales de administración, operación y mantenimiento de los distritos, gastos de reposición de maquinaria y equipos y los de protección y conservación de las respectivas cuencas, así como el consumo de agua y, que, en desarrollo de lo establecido en el artículo 1º de la Ley Nº 41 de 1993, le corresponde a las asociaciones de usuarios de distritos de adecuación de tierras, en coordinación con la autoridad ambiental respectiva, velar por la defensa y conservación de las cuencas hidrográficas, aportantes, circunscritas al área de un distrito de adecuación de tierras. Los usuarios de un distrito de adecuación de tierras, requieren estar constituidos o constituirse en asociación de usuarios con personería jurídica debidamente reconocida para poder administrarlo, operarlo y mantenerlo. El Fondo Nacional de Adecuación de Tierras (FONAT) se destinará al financiamiento del subsector de adecuación de tierras en lo concerniente a los estudios, diseños y construcción de las obras de riego, avenamiento y defensa contra las inundaciones.

Policy: Federal Agriculture and Food Institute Act.
Policy_Content: The Federal Institute for Agriculture Marketing and the Federal Institute for Nutrition and Forestry are joined and a new Federal Institute is established whose name is "Federal Institute for Agriculture and Food"; it is part of the Ministry for Food, Agriculture and Forestry. Its tasks are, inter alia, regulation of agriculture markets and implementation of EU regulations, provisions of credits, improvement of marketing procedures, etc. Its organs are the president and the board of directors; the latter is composed of 28 members. Article 6 indicates the powers and responsibilities of this body. Finally, it deals with the statute of the Institute, its budget and staff, the election of board members. The Act consists of 16 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Act on Special Accounts for the Structural Improvement of Agricultural and Fishing Villages.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to establish special accounts for the structural improvement of agricultural and fishing villages and to prescribe matters concerning the operation thereof in order to efficiently promote projects for the structural improvement of agricultural and fishing villages and projects financed by the special rural development tax. Article 3 establishes that the accounts shall be classified into the account for projects for the structural improvement of agricultural and fishing villages, the account for projects for the promotion of forestry, and the account for projects financed by the special rural development tax. The text consists of 14 articles.

Policy: Law No. ZR-115 on foreign investments.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal, economic and organizational basis for the realization of foreign investment on the territory of the Republic of Armenia and is aimed at ensuring protection of rights, legal interests and property of foreign investors, creation of pre-requisites for drawing in foreign material and financial resources, introduction and efficient use of advanced technologies of managerial and organizational experience. Foreign investments can be realized in the form of rights for prospecting, extraction, processing or management of natural resources. Foreign investments can be realized through purchase of the right of land tenure and concessions for management of natural resources. The document consists of IV Secs. that contain 25 Arts. Section I (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Section II (Arts. 6- 11) regards state guarantees of protection of foreign investments. Section III (art. 12- 13) regards setting up and cessation of activity of the enterprises with foreign investment. Section IV (Arts. 14- 25) specifies the conditions for functioning of enterprises with foreign investments and operation of foreign investors.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 7853 amending and supplementing Law No. 7746 on petroleum.
Policy_Content: This Law lays down several amendments and addenda to Law No. 7746 of 1993 on petroleum. In particular, it adds a specific provision concerning the validity of the Albpetrol Agreement, according to which the competent ministry will issue a licence to Albpetrol to explore, produce and develop petroleum in the area defined in the contract pursuant to the terms and conditions stipulated therein. Further to the Ministry’s approval, the Albpetrol may transfer its rights to other financial international institutions or legal persons, local or international. It may enter into agreements with these bodies, authorizing the other party to explore, develop, and produce petroleum in the areas defined in the contract.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Law No. 7855 concerning some additions to Law No. 7501 on the land.
Policy_Content: Articles 5a and 23a are hereby added to Law No. 7501 on the land. Upon division of the land, the Land Commissions at the villages shall deposit the documentation on land distribution with the cadastre office of the competent district. Article 23a concerns the penalty to be applied to Land Commissions in case of violation of the criteria established by the Law for compiling documentation on land distribution.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Agricultural Inputs Trust Fund Act, 1994 (Act No. 9 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The Fund shall be under the management and control of a Board of Trustees established by this Act. The Board of Trustees shall be a body corporate and shall also advise the Minister on the policy of the Fund. The Fund shall: (a) make available loans, on such terms and conditions as the Board may determine, to finance the importation and distribution of agricultural inputs; (b) finance consultancy services or technical assistance in relation to aquisition, distribution and use of agricultural inputs; (c) pay for the costs of administering the Fund (sect. 5). (13 sections and a Schedule)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ley General de Sociedades Cooperativas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley general de sociedades cooperativas, que consta de 4 títulos, 94 artículos y 4 transitorios, tiene por objeto regular la organización y funcionamiento de las sociedades cooperativas. Sus disposiciones son de interés social y de observancia general en el territorio nacional. La sociedad cooperativa es una forma de organización social integrada por personas físicas con base en intereses comunes y en los principios de solidaridad, esfuerzo propio y ayuda mutua, con el propósito de satisfacer necesidades individuales y colectivas, a través de la realización de actividades económicas de producción, distribución y consumo de bienes y servicios. Para los efectos de esta Ley, se entiende por organismos cooperativos, a las uniones, federaciones y confederaciones que integren las sociedades cooperativas; y por sistema cooperativo, a la estructura económica y social que integran las sociedades cooperativas y sus organismos. El sistema cooperativo es parte integrante del Movimiento Cooperativo Nacional, que comprende al sistema cooperativo y a todas las organizaciones e instituciones de asistencia técnica del cooperativismo a nivel nacional. Su máximo representante será el Consejo Superior del Cooperativismo.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Constitution of the Republic of Moldova.
Policy_Content: All citizens of the Republic of Moldova are equal before the Law indifferent on their origin, their origin, their social and patrimonial state, their race and nationality, their sex, education, language, religion, occupation, place of residence and other circumstances (Article 4). The Republic of Moldova assumes an obligation to respect the Charter of the United Nations and in the relations with other states to observe the principles as follows: sovereign equality; mutual renouncement to an application of force or threats with force; territorial inviolability of states, peaceful settlement of litigations, non-interference into the internal affairs of other states, observance of human rights and liberties of a person; equality of rights of nations and the right to determine their destiny, cooperation between states; implementation of the commitments implied by the unanimously recognized principles and norm of the International Law, by the International treaties (agreements) to which the Republic of Moldova is a party (Article 8). The Constitution consists of 142 Articles divided into VII Sections: General Principles (I); The Individual, the State, the Society (II); The Public Authorities (III); The Economy and the Public Finances (IV); The Constitutional Court (V); The Revision of the Constitution (VI); and Final and Transitional Statements (VII). The fundamental principles regarding the property. The goods can be either public property or private. The economic life of the Republic of Moldova is based on an equality of rights of all types and forms of ownership (Article 9). The duty of the State will be to protect and to guarantee the human rights, to undertake measures of the economic development and social protection adequate to ensure a decent living standard for people, to ensure the protection of environment and the ecological equilibrium and to undertake measures ensuring the public hygiene and health (Article 10). The constitutional indications regarding the rights and liberties of citizens are interpreted and treated in conformity to the Universal Declaration of Human rights, to the Pacts and other treaties to which Moldova is a Party (Article 16). The private property is protected by the Law indifferently on the position of a person. The foreign citizens and the apatrides will not acquire a right to ownership over a plot of land. No person can be expropriated except in cases when the social welfare is in question which is to be determined legally and when a proper indemnity is paid in advance. The right to inheritance of the private property is guaranteed (Article 38). The right to the health protection is guaranteed (Article 44). The State is obliged to take action aimed at ensuring that every person has a decent standard of living, whereby good health and welfare, based on available food, clothing, shelter, medical care, and services are secured for that person and his/her family (Article 47). The protection of the environment and the protection of the monuments. Each person is obliged to protect the environment, to contribute to the conservation and preservation of the monuments of history and culture (Article 55). The state will have to ensure the rehabilitation and the protection of the environment and preservation of the ecological balance (Article 123).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Cultural heritage,Public health,Ownership,Right to clean/healthy environment,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Human rights,Constitutional law,Soil rehabilitation,Social protection,Property rights,Expropriation,Inheritance,Foreign land tenure,Management/conservation
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: The Constitution enters into force on the date of its adoption.

Policy: Measures on the Certification Management of Products Bearing Environmental Labels.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to develop the certification of products bearing environmental labels, guarantee the quality of such products and promote international trade. The Measures consist of 42 articles divided into 8 Chapters: General provisions (I); Determination of varieties of products bearing environmental labels (II); Application requirements for certification (III); Certification procedures (IV); Use of the certificate and environmental label (V); Post-certification supervision (VI); Appeal (VII); Supplementary provisions (VIII). A certificate of a product bearing environmental labels shall be issued according to the product's conformity with standards and environmental protection requirements.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Lower Austria Sewage Sludge Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to sewage sludge. The soil on which for the first time sewage sludge is applied has to be classified according to Annex A laying down soil suitability according to certain classes. Moreover, the soil on which sewage sludge is to be applied must be previously analyzed as to its composition. Seven Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation Regulations.
Policy_Content: These Rules implement provisions of the Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation Act 1987 in relation with conditioning, managing and storage of radioactive materials and radioactive waste. They list specified persons for purposes of paragraph 5 (1) (ba) of the Act. That provision concerns duties of ANSTO in respect of radioactive materials and waste of other persons.

Policy: Decree of 28 July 1994 defining the powers and functioning of the Central Institute for the Technological and Scientific Research of the Sea (ICRAM).
Policy_Content: The Institute is engaged in the scientific and technological research and provides technical assistance in matters pertaining to the following: (a) evaluation of the productivity of the biological resources of the sea; (b) protection, development and improvement of the fisheries resources; (c) marine pollution; (d) dissemination of information; (e) professional training. The Decree establishes also the functions of the different organs of the Institute.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Act LV of 1994 on Arable Land.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is the establishment of market oriented conditions in the agricultural sector based on private ownership. Land transfer and the use of land as guarantee for land-based credit should promote the efficient operation of new businesses. This Law basically regulates the use of arable land and aims to create landed properties suitable for competitive agricultural production, avoiding to burden land with the effects of excessive subdivision. The reduction of agricultural land should remain within reasonable limits and the conservation of land quality should have legal backing. In Chapter I introductory provisions regarding the effect of the Law and definition of terms are set forth. The Law applies to all arable land in the national territory, to the utilization and conservation of land, to the acquisition of landed property and its restrictions and to the creation of plots. The provisions apply to urban land, whether under agricultural or forestry cultivation. Chapter II deals with the acquisition of ownership of arable land by Hungarian and foreign private persons or legal entities. EU citizens enjoy the same rights as Hungarians if they have been living and operating in the field of agriculture for at least 3 years in Hungary, and if they meet certain requisites and undertake some obligations. The Law covers acquisition under any form except: legal inheritance, adverse possession, construction over others' property, expropriation and through auction for compensation purposes. Use of arable lands is provided for in Chapter III. Use rights are regulated in the Civil Code as is the lease of arable land, unless this Law provides otherwise. Chapter IV deals with procedures for the creation of estates (general land reform, voluntary exchange of lands). Provisions on the utilization and protection of arable land are set forth in Chapter V. Cultivation profiles should be respected. Changes in cultivation profiles are to be authorized, otherwise penalties are foreseen. In the light of these purposes, soil conservation has an important role and aims to maintain the productivity and quality of the soil. Soil conservation is provided for in Chapter VI which sets forth State duties, the obligations of land users and provides for soil conservation authorities and their duties. Soil conservation penalties shall be applied to offenders.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land tenure,Land reform,Subdivision of land,Foreign land tenure,Right of use,Lease,Ownership,Land valuation,Use restrictions,Urban land,Agricultural development,Authorization/permit,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Classification/declassification,Soil pollution/quality,Smallholders/peasants,Offences/penalties,Size

Policy_Content: This Regional Law shall be aimed at the development of land relations and improvement of the mechanism of state regulation of payment of land charges. It establishes that the amount of payment for agricultural land allotted to agricultural enterprises, peasant farms, cooperatives and subsistence farms for agricultural production shall not exceed the amount of taxes applicable to land parcels allotted on lease.

Policy: Ley Nº 3.964 - Régimen De Preservación y Recuperación del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la preservación, recuperación, conservación, defensa y mejoramiento del ambiente en todo el territorio de la Provincia del Chaco, para lograr y mantener la biodiversidad y una óptima calidad de vida. En el marco de estos objetivos, la Ley establece disposiciones para: a) la organización paisajista provincial y la sistematización de las formas de urbanización, ocupación, actividades primarias y secundarias, diferentes explotaciones y expansión de fronteras productivas en relación con niveles ecológicos adecuados; b) el aprovechamiento racional del suelo, agua, flora y fauna, fuentes energéticas y otros recursos naturales; c) la prohibición y eliminación de actividades degradantes o con posibilidades de degradar el ambiente; d) el seguimiento, disminución o eliminación de factores, actividades o elementos del medio que provoquen o puedan provocar daños al medio ambiente, a la salud humana y otros seres vivos; e) la inserción en la enseñanza sistematizada de planes educativos y culturales a fin de promover la preservación, recuperación, conservación, mejoramiento y defensa del medio ambiente; f) la promoción y desarrollo de investigaciones ambientales, la estimulación y desarrollo de la participación de la comunidad en toda iniciativa relacionada con el ambiente; g) el aesoramiento y coordinación de obras y acciones públicas y particulares en tanto tenga vinculación con el medio ambiente; h) la creación de un banco de datos en este sector. El artículo 6º prevé la realización de una Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental en determinadas circunstancias. Se crean el Consejo Provincial del Ambiente (art. 16) y el Fondo Ambiental (art. 17).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 7848 on land expropriation for public reasons.
Policy_Content: This Law gives the State the right to expropriate or temporarily use real property for public use or interest. The State may expropriate only in the following cases: for constructing roads, railroads, airports, ports, hydropower stations, or reservoirs; constructing or improving electrical, gas, steam, waterworks, waters channels or telecommunications; networks; constructing oil or gas transport networks, mines, oil or water wells; constructing schools, hospitals, parks, sport facilities or housing blocks built with State founds; protecting and preserving historical or archaeological landmarks through means of national defence and public order. The Law lists specific documents and their content that must be prepared and given to affect property owners and the Council of Ministers, which must approve each expropriation. The application of expropriation procedures includes appeals by the affected owner and methods for calculating compensation. This gives the State the right to temporarily use property in order to provide relief following natural disasters, for national defence and when constructing facilities on expropriated land. The prefect has the right to issue a decision to use property temporarily. Necessary documents and their contents are described. Compensation is based on evaluation made by three experts.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law shall enter into force 15 days after publication.

Policy: Subsoil Code (No.132/94-VR of 1994).
Policy_Content: Subsoil is the part of earth’s crust that is situated under the surface of the dry land and under the bottom of the water basins and reaches the depth accessible for geological study and exploration. Subsoil is the exclusive property of the Ukrainian people and is provided only for use. Agreements or actions that directly or implicitly violate the property rights of the Ukrainian people to subsoil are invalid (Art. 4). State Fund of Subsoil and State Fund of Mineral Deposits include both subsoil areas used and subsoil areas not involved in use, including the continental shelf and the exclusive (marine) economic zone (Art 5). Minerals by their importance are classified into minerals of national and local significance (Art 6). Subsoil users can be enterprises, institutions, organizations, citizens of Ukraine, as well as foreigners and stateless persons, foreign legal entities (Art. 13). Subsoil shall be allotted for permanent or temporary use. Subsoil use without a pre-established term is considered permanent. Temporary subsoil use can be short-term (up to 5 years) and long-term (up to 50 years). If necessary, the term of temporary subsoil use may be extended (Art. 15). The document consists of IX Sections that contain 69 Articles. Section I (arts. 1-36) lays down general provisions. Section II (Arts.37-41) regards geological study of subsoil. Section III (Arts.42-47) regards state registration of deposits, stock and exposure of minerals and the plots of subsoil conceded in use for the purposes not connected with the extraction of minerals. Section IV (Arts.48-50) regards projecting, construction and putting in operation of mining and extracting objects not connected with extraction of minerals. Section V (Arts.51-55) regards use of subsoil for the purpose of exploitation of mineral deposits and for the purposes not connected with extraction of minerals. Section VI (Arts.56-59) regards protection of subsoil. Section VII (Arts.60-63) regards state control and survey over carrying out work on geological study of subsoil, its use and protection. Section VIII (art. 64) regards dispute settlement and establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on subsoil. Section IX (Arts.68-69) regards international cooperation.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création de l'Institut togolais de recherche agronomique (ITRA), ayant pour objet de mener des activités de recherche visant la promotion du développement agricole .
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Loi nº 94-86 relative aux circuits de distribution des produits agricoles et de la pêche.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte régime relatif aux marchés de production, aux marchés de gros et aux marchés de distribution au détail des produits agricoles et de la pêche, y compris les points de vente mobiles. Les unités de calibrage et de conditionnement ainsi que les entrepôts de stockage frigorifique sont aussi réputés circuits de distribution au sens de la présente loi. La loi porte définitions et modalités de gestion des marchés de production, de gros, de distribution au détail et des entrepôts frigorifiques. Elle porte aussi création de l'observatoire national de l'approvisionnement et des prix, ayant pour objet de traiter et de suivre les données statistiques et les informations commerciales relatives à la production, au stockage, à la transformation, à la distribution et à la consommation des produits agricoles et de la pêche, dans le but de fournir les données nécessaires en vue de la régulation du marché dans le temps et dans l'espace et le renforcement de la transparence des transactions commerciales. Les articles de 21 à 26 établissent les obbligations professionnelles relatives à ces produits, à savoir: la conformité aux conditions d'hygiène et de sécurité prévues par la législation en vigueur; l'interdiction d'utiliser des casiers en bois non jetable; l'utilisation des instruments de pesage et des moyens matériels nécessaires à la facturation; les diverses limitations et interdictions inhérentes aux transactions effectuées par les producteurs, les coopératives de services et les commissionaires mandataires; la carte d'accès au marchés de production et de gros. Sont aussi indiquées les autorités compétentes pour le contrôle de ces transactions et les sanctions prévues pour les différentes infractions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Internal trade,Agricultural commodities,Fish products,Vending,Processing/handling,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Food quality control/food safety

Policy: Décret nº 664/PR/MEFE portant réglementation de la commercialisation des bois en République gabonaise.
Policy_Content: La commercialisation du bois à l'achat et à la vente est libre sur toute l'étendue du territoire national, à l'excéption de l'okoumé et de l'ozigo placés sous le monopole de l'Etat. En contrepartie des missions assurées ( défense des marchés des bois du Gabon, suivi du commerce, promotion de l'industralisation de la forêt gabonaise, etc..) le ministère des eaux et des forêts prélève une redevance de martelage, perçue par la Société nationale des bois du Gabon sur la base des déclarations mensuelles des exportateurs de bois. La commercialisation des bois est assujettie aux obligations suivantes: agréage préalable des bois, communications des statistiques aux administrations concernées, paiement des taxes et redevances. Les articles de 11 à 32 du ce décret portent les dispositions relatives au monopole de l'Etat sur le commerce de l'okoumé et de l'ozigo, et notamment, celles inhérentes au contenu du monopole, à l'homologation des producteurs, à la régulation de la production, au classement des grumes, à la perception des taxes et redevances, à l'achat aux producteurs des grumes et à leurs commercialisation, au comité de marché auprès de la Société nationale des bois du Gabon.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Internal trade,Forest species,Royalties/fees,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Third part of the Article 16 must be supplemented with the following wording “upon presentation by the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Tajikistan.”

Policy: Law No. 987 on the state sanitary supervision.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 7 Sections composed of 39 articles dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1, arts. 1-4); 2) the rights and the duties as regards sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population (sect. 2, arts. 5-10); 3) requirements for the ensuring regards sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population (sect. 3, arts. 11-25); 4) liability (sect. 4, arts. 26-27); 5) the state sanitary and epidemiological supervision and public control (sect. 5, arts. 28-31); 6) the state sanitary and epidemiological service (sect. 6, arts. 32-38); 7) international agreements (sect. 7, art. 39). The Law regulates public and legal relations as regards ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being and radiation safety of the population securing the right of the citizens to favourable environment. Sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population is the state of public health and environment ensuring the absence of negative and hazardous impact on human organism (art. 2). The citizens shall be granted the right to favourable natural environment and healthy nutrition. The citizens shall be granted access to the following information: 1) the state of environment; 2) quality and safety of foodstuffs and potable water (art. 5). The enterprises and the organizations shall have the duty to elaborate and carry out hygienic and sanitary procedures aimed at the prevention of environmental pollution and the prevention of spreading of the infectious diseases (art. 8). Land use planning provisions and project must envisage favourable environment (art. 11). The quality of foodstuffs and alimentary raw materials, packages and storage premises must comply with the established sanitary requirements. The elaboration and manufacturing of the new foodstuffs, packages and food additives shall be authorized after the approval by the hygienic and sanitary inspection (art.13). Water quality used for centralized and decentralized water supply must comply with the established sanitary requirements (art. 16). Manufacturing, utilization, storage, transport and disposal of the radioactive substances and the sources of ionizing radiation shall be carried out in conformity with prior authorization by the bodies of the State sanitary and epidemiological service (art. 20).
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Radiation,Land-use planning,Access-to-information,Food quality control/food safety,Food additives,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Packaging/labelling,Transport/storage,Water supply,Water quality standards,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Potable water

Policy: Law No. 983 on subsoil.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 7 Sections composed of 52 articles dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1, arts. 1-6); 2) management of subsoil (sect. 2, arts. 7-22); 3) rational use and protection of subsoil (sect. 3, arts. 23-35); 4) the state regulation of subsoil management (sect. 4, arts. 36-42); 5) charges for the use of subsoil (sect. 5, arts. 43-48); 6) liability for the infringement of the subsoil legislation (sect. 6, arts. 49-51); 7) international agreements (sect. 7, art. 52). Subsoil shall be exclusive property of the state that can grant concession thereto on fixed term or open-ended possession (art. 2). All subsoil on the national territory including the plots of subsoil in and out of use shall constitute the stock of subsoil (art. 3). The Government shall be entitled with the task of issuing authorization (permit) for the prospecting and mining of mineral deposits, and also of the state supervision in this sphere (art. 5). Subsoil can be conceded for the following purposes: 1) research; 2) mining; 3) creation of protected geological areas and complexes of cultural importance (art. 7). The owners of the plots of land can at their own discretion carry out mining and extraction of common minerals without the use of explosives to the depth of no more than five metres (art. 15). All the plots of subsoil conceded for mining and extraction of minerals shall be subject to compulsory state registration (art. 29). The subsoil management shall be charged (art. 43).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 979 “On mortgage”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the main provisions on mortgage. Property connected with land and classified by the legislation as immovable property can be object of mortgage in accordance with mortgage agreement. When edifices, buildings and structures are mortgaged, the right of usage of land plot, on which above‑said object are located, becomes the subject of mortgage simultaneously. In such cases the right of usage of land plot is transferred simultaneously to an acquirer (buyer) of edifice, building or structure when compensation from the subject of mortgage is claimed. Mortgaging rights for land plot as well as of right for other natural resources is permitted within and on conditions specified by the legislation. If the state body of mortgager and management decides to cease the right of property over mortgaged  property or to cease the mortgaged  rights which are not related to the direct confiscation of the mortgaged property or mortgaged  rights including decision to confiscate the land plot where mortgaged house, other structures, edifices or plantations are located, the losses caused by this decision to the mortgagee should be compensated to the mortgagee in the full volume by this state body at the expense of means which are at his disposal. Disputes about compensation of losses are settled by court or arbitrary court.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decreto Nº 19 - Crea la Secretaría Ejecutiva del Medio Ambiente (SEMA).
Policy_Content: La Secretaría Ejecutiva del Medio Ambiente (SEMA) es una institución adscrita al Ministerio de Planificación y Coordinación del Desarrollo Económico y Social (MIPLAN). Tendrá como objeto primordial la coordinación y seguimiento de la gestión ambiental, entendida ésta como la integración dentro de un solo enfoque de todas las acciones sectoriales de gestión del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales, así como de la elaboración, desarrollo y cumplimiento de la estrategia nacional del medio ambiente; adicionalmente será la autoridad máxima en materia técnico ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Maritime Code (No. 674 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules for maritime navigation and relative to the nationality of ships, to property and other rights in respect of ships, and to liability in relation to shipping practice. The Act applies to all vessels and if a vessel is not used for the transport of passengers or goods all rules other than those specifically made for those for vessels destined for the transport of passengers or goods shall apply. A ship is considered to be of Finnish nationality and may carry the Finnish flag if it is owned, at least for 60 percent, by a Finnish national (sect. 1 of Chapter 1). The text of the Code is divided into 22 Chapters each of which is divided into sections.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Code will enter into force on a date to be appointed by Order.

Policy: Ley Nº 152 - Ley Orgánica del Plan de Desarrollo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica del Plan de Desarrollo, tiene como propósito establecer los procedimientos y mecanismos para la elaboración, aprobación, ejecución, seguimiento, evaluación y control de los planes de desarrollo, así como la regulación de los demás aspectos contemplados por el Artículo 342, y en general por el artículo 2 del Título XII de la Constitución Política y demás normas constitucionales que se refieren al plan de desarrollo y la planificación.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Basic legislation,Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Institution,Sustainable development,Financial agricultural measures,Fiscal and market measures,Governance
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.329 of 1994 regarding validation of the Regulation on allotment of the plots of land for state and public needs.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the modalities of the institution and examination of the applications of enterprises, institutions and organizations, and also of citizens regarding concession of the plots of land out of all categories of land irrespectively of the type of ownership except for cases envisaged by the legislation. Concession of land shall be carried out in the form of allotment in accordance with decree of the Government or of the respective organ of executive power. The document consists of 6 sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 establishes the modalities of preliminary concordance of the location of the construction site. Section 3 establishes the modalities of preparation and registration of the materials for expropriation of a plot of land. Section 4 regards the particulars of the concession of land for agricultural purposes. Section 5 regards re-distribution of lands between tenants or their breaking up into smaller plots. Section 6 regards concession of land for the increase of the area of subsidiary small-holding.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.333 of 1994 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another and low-yield land into unproductive land.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the modalities of forwarding application and legalization of materials for the purpose of transfer of land from one category into another and low-yield land into unproductive land. Reduction of the area of irrigated land, arable land, perennial plants and other high-yielding areas, including transfer of land from one category into another and low-yield land into unproductive land shall not be allowed except for cases of necessity and exclusively in accordance with the Ministerial Decrees. Transfer of irrigated land into the category of non-irrigated land shall be carried out in the following cases: 1. reduction of debit of water in the sources of irrigation; 2. loss of communication with the source of irrigation; 3. new construction of irrigation systems on the formerly irrigated land; 4. wreck of the irrigation system if it cannot be restored. Transfer of perennial plants shall be authorized in the following cases: 1. thinning out and impossibility of reforestation; 2. damage caused by pests, disease, disasters; 3. loss of production importance as a result of expiration of the period of exploitation and depreciation; 4. expropriation of land for state and public needs. The document consists of II sections. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II establishes the modalities of forwarding application and legalization of materials for the purpose of transfer of land from one category into another.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Loi portant création du Comité d'attribution du label écologique européen.
Policy_Content: L’article 1er établit qu’il est créé auprès du Ministre qui a l'Environnement dans ses attributions, un Comité d'attribution du label écologique européen. Le Roi fixe, sur la proposition des Ministres qui ont l'Environnement et les Affaires économiques dans leurs attributions, la composition, l'organisation et le mode de fonctionnement du Comité. Le texte comprend 7 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation on the order of transfer of lands from one category into another and the transfer of less productive lands into unproductive.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes principles and procedural rules relative to the transfer of land from its assigned category to another category. The transfer is carried out by district executive committees and the Cabinet in accordance with the Land Code. The Regulations sets out the conditions under which transfer of irrigated land, arable land, plantations, etc. into another (specified) category may take place. Applications shall be made to the commissions of the district executive committees. Decisions are taken by various district or regional authorities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Federal Act on Federal Institutes and Offices dealing with agriculture.
Policy_Content: An Act to regulate the establishment of agricultural institutes. The Act lists at the outset the various Institutes involved: they are monitored by the Minister for Agriculture and Forestry. Their tasks relate, inter alia, to the collection of data, the setting up of libraries, the improvement of agricultural methods, the preparation of reports, of statistics, etc. Article 5 governs the internal organization of the said Institutes. The main part of the Act deals with the various agricultural Institutes, such as the Federal Institute for Agriculture, the Federal Office for Biology, the Federal Institute for Viticulture and Fruit, the Federal Office for Alpine Dairy Products. The Act consists of 30 articles divided into 4 Parts.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the New Delhi Municipal Council and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto. The Act consists of 419 Sections divided into 23 Chapters: Preliminary; The Council; Functions Of The Council; The Chairperson; Procedure; Municipal Officers And Other Municipal Employees; Revenue And Expenditure; Taxation; Borrowing; Property And Contracts; Water Supply, Drainage And Sewage Collection; Electricity Supply; Streets; Building Regulations; Sanitation And Public Health; Vital Statistics; Public Safety And Suppression Of Nuisances; Markets, Trades And Occupations; Improvement; Powers, Procedure, Offences And Penalties; Rules, Regulations And Bye-Laws; Miscellaneous.

Policy: Taxation on waste and raw materials Act (No. 335 of 1997).
Policy_Content: This Act ensures that anyone who professionally extracts commodities covered by the Mineral Resources Act, is subject to taxation. A fee of DKK 5 is based upon each cubic meter and any commercial extraction or import of less than 200 mq. of yearly raw materials is exempt from taxes. Commodities listed under Appendix 1 are subject to taxation and registered by authorities. Raw materials extracted for sand improvement use are exempt from taxation if they are seabed materials resulting from dredging  and recovered as raw materials; if residues and waste products are recovered from already established deposits; if soil is produced with no over-burned and topsoil not produced for revenue. Waste which is exempt from taxations are: straw fed into incinerators, clean wood chips and other clean wood waste from timber processors to the addition of incinerators; landfills and clean soil supplied for landfills; compost meeting the requirements for utilization without permit in adherence to the Environmental Protection Act’s article 19; waste that is removed from closed landfill sites not covered by article 11 section 6; hazardous waste including clinical waste added to incinerators.  A fee of DKK 335 is applied to waste delivered to landfills. A fee of DKK 210 is applied to waste delivered to incineration for power and heat generation, provided that electricity production is at least 10% of the plant's total energy production in a given a taxation  period. Companies that import for disposal or incineration must also be registered with the tax authorities, with the exception of installations for the incineration of clinical waste, of special facilities for disposal of hazardous waste, for installations for the storage of oil, chemicals or heavy metal contaminated soil and clean sediments, and landfills for residues from power plants, based solely on fossil fuels or biomass.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Basic legislation,Tax/levy,Internal trade,International trade,Mining,Soil rehabilitation,Waste management,Hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy_Content: This Goa Panchayat Raj Act, 1994 is enacted to replace the enactment relating to Panchayats by a comprehensive legislation. Policy: Genetic Technology Act.
Policy_Content: A piece of basic legislation regulating the handling of and bringing into circulation genetically modified organisms, and the use of genetic analysis and genetic therapy for human beings. The aim of this Act is to protect human beings and the environment from harmful effects of genetically manipulated organisms in order to grant a high degree of safety. The text consists of 111 articles divided into 12 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Works on genetically manipulated organisms in closed systems (II); Spreading of genetically manipulated organisms and marketing of such products (III); Genetic analysis and genetic therapy used for human beings (IV); Genetic Technology Commission and Genetic Technology Regulations (V); Competent authorities and controls (VI); Study on safety (VII); Provisional coercive measures (VIII); Expiry of entitlements; (IX); Confidentiality of data and data handling (X); International exchange of information (XI); Transitional, penal and final provisions (XII). Two Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Il s'agit de la coupe, réservée exclusivement aux personnes physiques gabonaises résidant en permanence en milieu rural, attribuant un maximum de cent arbres sur pied. Policy: Ley Nº 145 - Ley Forestal.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como finalidad fomentar y asegurar el aprovechamiento del recurso forestal, en procura de un desarrollo de la actividad, compatible con la condición de patrimonio natural y bien social heredado y transmisible a las generaciones venideras, en el marco de los principios del desarrollo sustentable. Asimismo, propiciará una mayor elaboración de los productos forestales, acrecentando su procesamiento por empresas radicadas en la Provincia e incrementando la capacidad industrial presente. Prohíbe la enajenación por cualquier concepto de tierras fiscales ocupadas por bosques naturales.

Policy: Action Plan for the National Policy on Natural Resources and the Environment of 1994 (Volume IV).
Policy_Content: This Action Plan for the Ethiopian National Policy on Natural Resources and the Environment is a nationwide document that presents a plan of prioritized actions within the framework of 11 cross-sectoral and 11 sectoral programs,  which translate the broad strategies outlined in Volume II into specific activities. The prioritization distinguishes three periods of time within which the implementation of the activities is expected: (i) immediate priorities, include the activities to be accomplished within a period of two years; (ii) medium term priorities, include those actions which can be completed within a period of five years; and (iii) long term priorities, include actions which require the completion of immediate and/or medium term actions and which will take a period of much more than five years to complete. The cross-sectoral programs link the interventions directed to the management of natural resources and the environment to a series of other themes, such as (i) population strategies, (ii) community involvement and benefit, (iii) rural land tenure and access rights, (iv) land use planning, (v) integration of social, cultural and gender factors in resource use and management, (vi) economic planning, (vii) environmental information systems; (viii) environmental research, (ix) environmental impact assessment process, and (x) environmental education and awareness.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Community management,Land tenure,Gender,Sustainable development,Integrated management,Land-use planning,Crops/grasses,Irrigation,Poverty,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Cultural heritage,EIA,Education,Disasters,Emissions,Forest management/forest conservation,Ecosystem preservation,Access right,Animal feed/feedstuffs,Animal production,Pastoralism,Rainwater,Water supply

Policy: National Policy on Natural Resources and the Environment 1994 (Volume II).
Policy_Content: This National Policy on Natural Resources and the Environment is an overall comprehensive cross-sectoral and sectoral policy framework developed by the Transitional Government to guide natural resources and  environment sustainable development, use and management. The overall policy goal is to improve and enhance the health and quality of life of all Ethiopians and to promote sustainable social and economic development through the sound management and use of natural, human-made and cultural resources and the environment as a whole so as to meet the needs of the present generation without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. To achieve this overall goal the document lays out the following specific objectives as follows (i) ensure that essential ecological processes and life support systems are sustained, biological diversity is preserved and renewable natural resources are used in such a way that their regenerative and productive capabilities are either restored or maintained and where possible enhanced; (ii) ensure that non-renewable resources are exploited and managed in a sustainable manner, minimizing the negative impacts of their exploitation; (iii) identify and develop natural resources that are currently under-utilized; (iv) incorporate the full economic, social and environmental costs and benefits of natural resource development into the planning, implementation and accounting processes; (v) improve the environment of human settlements to satisfy the physical, social, economic, and cultural needs of their inhabitants on a sustainable basis; (vi) prevent the pollution of land, air and water in the most cost effective way, and disallow that interventions whose costs exceed the benefits; (vii) conserve, develop, manage, and support Ethiopia's diverse cultural heritage; (viii) ensure the empowerment and participation of the people and their organizations at all levels in environmental management activities; and (ix) raise public awareness about the essential linkages between environment and development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sustainable development,Range,Crops/grasses,Community management,Gender,Traditional rights/customary rights,Pollution control,Ozone layer,Cultural heritage,Ecosystem preservation,Genetic resources,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Animal production,Authorization/permit,Poverty,Local government,Management/conservation,Minerals,Mining,EIA,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Biodiversity

Policy: Environment Information Act.
Policy_Content: An Act dealing with information on the environment: 1. available from the federal state, the "Länder", or local authorities, or associations of local authorities or other legal persons under public law specified in article 3, paragraph 1, or 2. available from natural or legal persons under private law who perform public law tasks in the field of environmental protection and are subject to supervision from authorities. Its purpose is to ensure free access to the information on the environment possessed by authorities and the distribution of this information, as well as to lay down the fundamental prerequisites according to which information of this nature is to be made available. Article 3 contains the definition of certain terms such as "Authority" and "Information about the environment". The text consists of 11 articles dealing with following aspects: Entitlement to information about the environment (4); Making an application, deciding upon applications (art. 5); Representatives for identical applications (6); Exclusion and restrictions of the entitlement to protect the public interest (7); Exclusion and restrictions of the entitlement to protect private interests (art. 8); Responsibility (9); Costs (10): Informing the public about the environment (11).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Quality of Shellfish Waters Regulations, 1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations give effect to give effect to Council Directive 79/923/EEC by prescribing quality standards for shellfish waters and designate the waters to which they apply, together with sampling and analysis procedures to be used to determine compliance with the standards. Where shellfish waters do not conform with the quality standards prescribed in these Regulations, the Minister shall, in consultation with the local authority or sanitary authority, establish as far as possible the reasons for nonconformity, whether due to chance, natural factors or to discharges of trade effluent, sewage effluent or other polluting matter and shall adopt an action programme comprising necessary measures where appropriate to ensure conformity with the standards. Local authorities shall do anything in their power to comply with prescribed standards. The Minister may grant departure from the quality standards prescribed  in the event of exceptional weather or geographical conditions.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Building Law.
Policy_Content: The Law is composed of 11 Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Independent technical functions in building industry (sect. 2); Rights and duties of building process members (sect. 3); Proceedings preceding start of building works (sect. 4); Building and permitting for use of building objects (sect. 5); Keeping building objects (sect. 6); Building accident (sect. 7); Organs of architectural-building administration and building inspection (sect. 8); Criminal provisions (sect. 9); Professional liability concerning building industry (sect. 10); Transitional and final provisions (sect. 11). The Law lays down the general principles of activities concerning designing, building, keeping and demolition of building objects. In particular the following basic requirements have to be fulfilled: construction safety, fire safety, safety of use, hygienic and sanitary conditions and environment protection, prevention from noise and vibration, power safety and appropriate thermal isolation of partitions.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Pollution control,Land-use planning,Noise pollution,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Urban land

Entry into force notes: The Regulation entered into force on 1 January 1995.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.907 - Disposiciones relativas a la protección, conservación y control de los bosques naturales y manglares.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto consta de 8 capítulos y 33 artículos. INDICE: Guardia forestal (I); Declaratoria de tierras de uso exclusivo forestal (II); Sistemas de manejo sustentable de los bosques (III); Sistemas de control (IV); Participación comunitaria y de las organizaciones no gubernamentales (V); Protección de manglares (VI); Plan de forestación (VII); Disposiciones finales (VIII).
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
