Policy: Presidential Decree No.1470 of 1994 regarding natural resources of the sea-coast of the Black sea and the Sea of Azov.
Policy_Content: President, for the purpose of conservation and restoration of natural resources of the sea-coast of the Black sea and the Sea of Azov, decrees to approve the initiative of the regional administration of the Krasnodar Territory regarding attribution some natural resources of the sea-coast of the Black sea and the Sea of Azov to federal natural resources. The Government of the Russian Federation is entitled with the task of validation of the list of the aforesaid natural resources and to determine federal executive bodies authorized to carry out jointly with the regional authorities management functions. Delimitation of the boundaries of the plots of land pertaining to protected areas that can not be transferred in private ownership, must be delimited immediately. The Government of the Russian Federation must determine the use of health resorts and recreational areas, taking into consideration their natural and medical qualities.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulations of Guangdong province on Environmental Management of Construction Projects.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to strengthen the environmental management of the construction projects, effectively control environmental pollution and ecological damage, protect the environment, safeguard the people's health, and promote social and economic sustainable development in Guangdong province. The Regulations consist of 35 Articles divided into 6 Chapters: General provisions; Management responsibilities; Environmental protection management in project establishment phase; Environmental protection management in project construction phase; Zone development construction project environmental protection management; Legal liabilities; Supplementary provisions. Construction projects may be involved in industry, hospitals, hotels, water conservancy, transportation, slaughtering, city sewage treatment, garbage (waste) processing, warehouses of dangerous goods and materials, etc. (Art.2).  The construction of projects as listed in Article 2 must follow the submission, examination and approval procedures of construction project environmental impact statements. Construction projects that deal with toxic and hazardous wastes must be approved by the environmental protection competent authority.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation of the Law on Development of Tourism Industry.

Policy: Energy Act (C.C.S.M. c. E112).
Policy_Content: The objects and purposes of this Act are: a) to promote and facilitate the orderly development of energy resources in the province; b) to ensure a reliable supply of energy to consumers at the least possible cost; and c) to promote the conservation and efficient use of energy in accordance with the principles of sustainable development. The text – consisting of 16 sections – deals with the following matters: principles of sustainable development, functions of the department, duties of director, report on energy in Manitoba, appointment of inspectors, powers of inspectors, false information or document, information to be kept confidential, advisory committees, public consultation and offence and penalty.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Antarctic Act (Cap. 15 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the protection of the Antarctic environment by, among other things: providing for permits for entering and remaining in Antarctica and for and for exploration and exploitation of mineral resources by British citizens; by placing restrictions on the taking of fauna and flora and introducing non-native animals and plants into Antarctica by British citizens; providing for the application of criminal law to British citizens operating in the Antarctic.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,International agreement-implementation,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Marine protected areas,Offences/penalties

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 753 validating the Model Regulation on protected areas.
Policy_Content: The state protected areas shall be declared plots of land, subsoil, waterbodies including natural ecosystems within of particular environmental, scientific, ecological, educational and aesthetic value for the purpose of conservation of typical, rare or unique landscapes, study of natural processes and phenomena, and also for the purpose of elaboration of the scientific bases for environmental protection. Natural resources and land of the protected areas shall be the state property. Land, subsoil, water and natural resources of the protected areas shall be withdrawn from economic activity and shall be conceded to the administration of the protected areas in permanent use. Land of the protected areas shall not be used for any public, personal and social needs and cannot be conceded on lease. The state protected areas shall be exempted from payment of land charges. The protected areas classified as biosphere reserves shall be registered at the international biosphere reserves system and shall be subject to global environmental monitoring. The state protected areas shall carry out the following functions: (a) protection of territory; (b) research; (c) participation in environmental audit; (c) organization of ecological tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the protected areas: (a) land and water disturbance; (b) mining; (c) grazing and timber extraction; (d) construction; (e) hunting and fishing except for cases envisaged by the national legislation; (f) introduction of alien species; (g) gathering of zoological and botanical collections.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Biosphere reserves,Monitoring,Public land,Tourism,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No.60/cp on the Right of Property on Premises and Land Use Right.
Policy_Content: A Decree to provide for ownership, allotment, use, registration of residential land and houses by citizens of Viet Nam and leasehold by foreigners, and in relation to this the assignment of title, the issue of certificates, settlement of disputes and other matters. The State recognises and protects the lawful title to residential houses and lawful right to the use of residential land. All residential houses and land must be registered. The lawful owners are issued the certificate of residential house title and residential land use right. The State does not admit the claiming back of residential land which in the past was allotted to other users by the State as a result of implementation of policies of the present State and its predecessors. Residential houses and residential land must be registered with the People's Committee of the urban ward and provincial town. (27 articles)
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Ownership,Lease,Public land,Cadastre/land registration,Foreign land tenure,Dispute settlement

Policy: Order No. 208 of 1994 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources on addenda to Order No. 116 of 1994.
Policy_Content: The Minister, in connection with the signature of Agreement between the Ministry and the Russian Ecological Federal Information Agency (REFIA) on cooperation in the field of environmental protection and rational use of natural resources information and educational programs, orders to add the following wording to the paragraph 10 of the afore-named Order: "... within the framework of the Agreement between the Ministry and the Russian Ecological Federal Information Agency (REFIA) on cooperation in the field of environmental protection and rational use of natural resources information and educational programs." The document contains 1 Annex that supplements the full text of the Agreement. The Agreement consists of 7 Articles. Article 1 establishes the purpose of the Agreement. Article 2 determines the directions of the joint activity. Article 3 concerns the forms of cooperation. Article 4 determines the commitment of the Parties. Article 5 establishes the modalities of financing, accountability and liability of the Parties regarding the programs carried out by REFIA at the request of the Ministry. Article 6 establishes special conditions. Article 7 determines the modalities of entry into force of the Agreement.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law of the People's Republic of China on administration of the urban real estate.
Policy_Content: This Law aims at strengthening the administration of the urban real estate, maintaining the order of real estate market, protecting the legitimate rights and interests of real estate obligees and promoting the development of real estate business. To these ends it regulates the land-use right for development of real estate, the engagement in development of real estate and transactions of real estate, and the exercise of the administration of real estate in the State-owned land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Urban Real Estate Administration Law of the People's Republic of China
Policy_Content: This Law is enacted for the purpose of safeguarding the real estate market order, protecting lawful rights and interests of real estate owners and promoting healthy development of the real estate industry through a strengthening of urban real estate administration. The Law consist of 7 Chapters: General Provisions (I);  Land for Real Estate Development (II);  Real Estate Development (III); Transactions of Real Estate (IV); Registration of Real Estate Title (V); Legal Liabilities (VI); 	Supplementary Provisions (VII).

Policy: Regulation relative to restrictions on the use of fertilisers as a requirement of environment protection (No. 23 of 1994).
Policy_Content: In order to lessen the infiltration of organic substances and fertilizing compounds in ground and surface water, restrictions are placed by this Regulation on the keeping of livestock and the use of fertilizers. Table 1 included in section 1 contains an indication of the maximum allowed number of animals on a hectare of land for farmers keeping 5 or more animal units. If a cattle breeder has concluded valid contracts with other farmers for the sale of manure and has sufficient storage capacity, a larger number of animals to be kept on a hectare of land may be allowed on the condition that only a permitted amount of manure is spread on his own land. Farmers keeping more than 5 animal units shall maintain a manure storage. Certain requirements are given for the construction of such storage, which shall in any event not be constructed in the so-called coastal belt (sect. 3). (8 sections)
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

In particular, the Law lays down provisions relating to the efficient enforcement of the afore-mentioned Federal Act. The text consists of 5 articles as follows: Pollution protection authorities (1); General competences(2); Administrative provisions (3); Application of the Hazardous Incident Ordinance and the Federal Emission Act in operational areas (4); Entry into force (5).

Chapter 3 deals with general and special requirements, conditions and regulations for awarding loans to fishermen and farmers. Policy: Law No.74/94-BP of 1994 on energy saving.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal, economic, social and ecological basis of energy saving for all enterprises, associations and organizations situated on the territory of Ukraine and single citizens. The document consists of VI sections that contain 29 articles. Section I (arts. 1-9) lays down general provisions. Section II (arts. 10-17) establishes economic mechanism of energy saving. Section III (arts. 18-20) establishes standards and rate setting in the sphere of energy saving. Section IV (arts. 21-24) regards expertise of energy saving. Section V (arts. 25-27) regards control in the sphere of energy saving and establishes liability for the infringement of the present Law. Section VI (arts. 28-29) regards international cooperation of Ukraine in the sphere of energy saving.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Native Title (National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land Fund) Regulations.
Policy_Content: "Fund" means the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Land Fund established by subsection 201 (1) of the Native Title Act 1993. The fund is a Trust Account for the purposes of section 62A of the Audit Act 1901. Money that is: (a) appropriated by an Act for the purchase and management of land for Aboriginals and Torres Strait Islanders for social, cultural or economic purposes; and (b) expressed by that Act to be for payment to the relevant trust account; is to be paid into the fund.

Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations, which shall apply to all ships navigating in the Straits and the Sea of Marmara, is to regulate the maritime traffic in order to ensure safety of navigation, life and property and to protect the environment in the Region.

Policy: Nitrate Sensitive Areas Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 1729 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations comply with Council Regulation (EC) No. 2078/92 on agricultural methods compatible with the requirements of protection of the environment and the maintenance of the countryside. They allow the Minister of Agriculture to make payments to farmers in nitrate sensitive areas. The nitrate sensitive areas are defined in maps deposited at the Ministry of areas listed in Schedule 1. Schedule 2 sets out undertakings concerning mainly the application of nitrogen fertilizer which a farmer must give for at least five years in all cases in order to be eligible for aid. Schedules 3 to 5 set out additional undertakings. The Minister may vary the terms of the undertakings in each individual case provided that the Minister is satisfied that the undertakings are compatible with the EC Regulation. Regulation 4 specifies qualifying conditions for land and farmer. Regulation 5 specifies which land is eligible for aid. (16 Regulations completed by 7 Schedules)
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic.
Policy_Content: The authorized representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic have agreed on the following: 1) The Kabardino-Balkarian Republic shall execute the authority in the following fields: a) management of state property; b) external trade. 2) The following issues are within the joint jurisdiction of the Russian Federation and of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic: a) relating to possession, use and disposal of land, subsoil, water and other natural resources, including the right of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic to establish private property on land; b) delimitation of state property; c) nature management, environmental protection and ensuring ecological safety, protected areas, conservation of historical and cultural monuments; d) protection of primordial natural habitat of indigenous inhabitants and traditional way of life of scanty ethnic communities. 3) The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation: a) federal state property and its management; b) establishment of the basis for federal policy and federal programs in the field of governmental, economic, environmental, social, cultural and national development of the Russian Federation; c) federal power systems, nuclear energy, fissile materials, federal transport, traffic, communication pathways, information and communication systems; d) status and defence of state borders, territorial waters, air space, the exclusive economic zones and continental shelf of the Russian Federation; e) meteorological service, standards, gauges, metric system and time calculation, geodesy and cartography; f) Federal State Service.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Disasters,Environmental planning,Cultural heritage,Navigation,Continental shelf,Land reform,Land tenure,Public land,Land-use planning
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret n°94-368 du 1er juillet 1994 portant réforme de l'exploitation forestière modifiant le décret  n°66-421 du 15 septembre 1966 réglementant l'exploitation des bois d'œuvre et d'ébénisterie, de service, de feu et à charbon.

Il s’agit notamment de l’article 11 (Permis temporaires d’exploitation), de l’article 12 (Détermination géographiques des périmètres), de l’article 13 (Conditions d'exploitation des bois d'œuvre et d'ébénisterie de chaque périmètre), article 14 (Attribution d'un périmètre d'exploitation), article 15 (Règlement d'exploitation, d'un plan d'aménagement ct d'un cahier des charges), et l’article 16 (Retrait des périmètres d’exploitation).

Policy: State Borders Act (1994)
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the definition of the Estonian state border, the determination and marking of the location of the state border, the border regime, and the liability for violation of the border regime and illegal crossing of the state border. Regulation (EC) No 562/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Community Code on the rules governing the movement of persons across borders (Schengen Borders Code) (OJ L 105, 13.04.2006, pp. 1–32) shall be applied to crossing of the internal borders between the Member States of the European Union and the external borders of the European Union. This Act shall be applied to the extent not regulated by the Schengen Borders Code. The Act further provides for Estonian territorial waters and inland waters and airspace. The Estonian territorial sea is deemed to be the Estonian territorial waters. The sovereignty of the Republic of Estonia extends to the bottom of the territorial waters and the earth’s crust below it. The Estonian airspace is the airspace above the territory, territorial waters and inland waters of Estonia and above the parts of transboundary water bodies which belong to Estonia. For the purposes of this Act, a transboundary water body is a river, lake or artificial water body along which the state border runs.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea, Water
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Ley del Catastro Inmobiliario del Estado de Baja California.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece las normas que rigen el catastro inmobiliario del Estado de Baja California, cuyo objeto consiste en: a) identificar y deslindar los bienes inmuebles, los derechos de vía y espacios públicos; b) integrar y mantener actualizada la información relativa a los registros, padrones y documentos referentes a las características cualitativas y cuantitativas de los bienes inmuebles y aspectos asociados a ellos; c) determinar los valores catastrales de los bienes inmuebles; d) integrar la cartografía catastral de los bienes inmuebles en el territorio del Estado; e) aportar la información técnica en relación a los límites del territorio del Estado, de sus Municipios, de los centros de población y demás localidades. La Ley define las competencias de las autoridades catastrales municipales y define los factores que deben considerarse para proceder a la zonificación del suelo.  Por último se establece el correspondiente régimen sancionatorio.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.339 - Reglamenta el porcentaje del impuesto predial a favor de las corporaciones autónomas regionales.
Policy_Content: El Decreto, que consta de 11 artículos, reglamenta el porcentaje del impuesto predial a favor de las corporaciones autónomas regionales en desarrollo de lo previsto en el artículo 44 de la Ley Nº 99, de 1993, estableciendo que los concejos municipales y distritales deberán destinar anualmente a las mencionadas corporaciones, para la protección del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales renovables, el porcentaje ambiental del impuesto predial, que se podrá fijar como: a) sobretasa que no podrá ser inferior al 1,5 por mil ni superior al 2,5 por mil sobre el avalúo de los bienes que sirven de base para liquidar el impuesto predial; o b) porcentaje del total del recaudo por concepto del impuesto predial que no podrá ser inferior al 15 por ciento ni superior al 25,9 por ciento del recaudo.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif au subventionnement du boisement de terres agricoles en exécution du Règlement (CEE) 2080/92 du Conseil du 30 juin 1992 instituant un régime communautaire d'aides aux mesures forestières en agriculture.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif au subventionnement du boisement de terres agricoles en exécution du Règlement (CEE) 2080/92 du Conseil du 30 juin 1992 instituant un régime communautaire d'aides aux mesures forestières en agriculture est formé par 11 articles. D'abord, sont définis certains termes comme, parmi d'autres, "administration forestière", "division de la Nature", "zone de protection pour oiseaux", "zone Ramsar", "zone vallonneuse", "producteur à titre principal". L'article 2 spécifie que le Ministre accorde des subventions pour le boisement des terres agricoles. Ensuite, l'arrêté traite des matières telles que les conditions pour obtenir les subventions, le calcul des subventions, la demande de subventionnement du boisement de terres agricoles. Cinq annexes sont jointes à cet arrêté: Liste des espèces d'arbre principales admises aux subventions pour couvrir les coûts de boisement (I); Liste des espèces d'arbres et d'arbrisseaux d'accompagnement admises à une subvention complémentaire (II); Tableau "Terres agricoles marginales" (III); Subvention unique par demande pour agrandir la superficie de l'aménagement forestier (IV); Subventions annuelles pour les coûts d'entretien au cours de 5 premières années (V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agricultural land,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest species,Subsidy/incentive,Zoning,Forest service/forest officers,Protected area,Forest management/forest conservation,Wetlands,Birds

Policy: Ley Nº 1.097 - Normas para la preservación de los recursos del aire.
Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Ley, la Provincia de Formosa se adhiere a la Ley Nº 20.284 sobre contaminación atmosférica. Además, sustituye, a nivel provincial, las sanciones establecidas por el artículo 26 de la mencionada Ley Nº 20.284.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 23 - Ley del Fondo Ambiental de El Salvador.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Fondo Ambiental de El Salvador, cuyo objeto será la captación de recursos financieros y la administración de los mismos para el financiamiento de planes, programas, proyectos y actividades tendientes a la protección, conservación, mejoramiento, restauración y uso racional de los recursos naturales y del medio ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Délibération de l’assemblée de la province Sud n° 19- 94/APS du 24 juin 1994 habilitant le bureau de l’assemblée de province à se prononcer sur les mesures de protection du patrimoine architectural de la province en cas de désaccord du patrimoine.
Policy_Content: Le bureau de l’assemblée de la province est habilité à prononcer le classement au titre des monuments historiques ou l’inscription à l’inventaire supplémentaire aux monuments historiques d’un immeuble, lorsque le propriétaire n’a pas fait connaître son accord explicite ou lorsqu’il s’est déclaré opposé aux mesures de protection envisagées, conformément à l’article 10 de la délibération n°14-90/APS du 24 janvier 1990.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Act No. 39 of 1994 concerning marine navigation (Maritime Code).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the registration of sea-going ships, ownership and other matters regarding the legal status of ships, and various other matters relative to marine navigation and use of ships. It applies in part also to fishing and whaling vessels. Chapter 1 contains general provisions regarding ships: nationality, name and homeport of ships. Chapter 2 makes provision for registration of ships: Ships register; procedures of registration (I); Registration of rights (II); Annulment and expiry of rights (III); Ships under construction (IV); Miscellaneous provisions (V). Installations for the research of natural phenomena (VI). Section 137 concerns contracting of fishing gear. Various provisions concern liability for transported goods including oil (sect. 191) and living animals (sect. 277).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 8/1994 - Evaluación del impacto ambiental y auditorías ambientales de Castilla y León.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 4 títulos, 36 artículos, 3 disposiciones adicionales, 1 transitoria, 4 finales y 4 anexos, tiene por objeto regular la realización de las evaluaciones de impacto ambiental (EIA), las evaluaciones estratégicas de planes y programas, y las auditorías ambientales de la Comunidad Autónoma de Castilla y León. Quedan sometidos al procedimiento de EIA los proyectos, públicos o privados, consistentes en la realización de obras, instalaciones o de cualquier otra actividad comprendida en los anexos I y II de la presente Ley (art. 1º). A los efectos de la presente Ley el órgano administrativo de medio ambiente es la Consejería de Medio Ambiente y Ordenación del Territorio de la Junta de Castilla y León (art. 2º). La presente Ley entiende por EIA el procedimiento basado en un conjunto de estudios, sistemas técnicos y administrativos, encaminados a estimar y prevenir las consecuencias o efectos ambientales que determinadas acciones o proyectos puedan causar a la salud y bienestar humanos y al entorno (art. 7º). Se establecen dos tipos de EIA: la evaluación ordinaria y la evaluación simplificada (art. 8º). La evaluación ordinaria es el procedimiento aplicable a las actividades que tienen o pueden tener gran incidencia en el medio ambiente (art. 12). La evaluación simplificada es el procedimiento aplicable a las actividades que tienen o pueden tener una incidencia moderada en el medio ambiente (art. 14). La auditoría ambiental es un proceso de evaluación sistemática, objetiva, independiente y periódica del sistema de gestión ambiental de una empresa, encaminado a la realización de un diagnóstico de la situación actual en lo que se refiere a la emisión de contaminantes, producción de residuos consumo de materias primas, energía y agua, análisis de riesgos y evaluación del grado de cumplimiento de la legislación vigente, así como de los sistemas de protección y gestión ambiental internos existentes en una instalación industrial en funcionamiento (art. 21).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: EIA,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Waste management,Waste prevention,Monitoring

Policy: Regulations of Hainan Special Economic Zone on land administration.
Policy_Content: These Regulations aim to strengthen land management, protect land resources, utilize lands rationally, protect cultivated lands, improve ecological environment, and promote the sustainable development of social economy.  The Text is divided into 10 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Ownership and Right to the Use Land and Registration (II); Land Use Control (III); Land development and reclamation (IV); Conversion of Agricultural land into Non-agricultural Land and Land Expropriation (V); Market Management of State-owned Land Use right (VI); Market Management of Collectively Owned Land Use Right (VII); Supervision and Examination (VIII); Legal Responsibilities (IX); Supplementary Provisions (X).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret relatif à la création et à l'exploitation des aéroports et aérodromes relevant de la Région wallonne.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte la réglementation relative à la création et à l'exploitation des aéroports et aérodromes relevant de la Région wallonne. Les dispositions concernant le quota de bruit global maximum se réfèrent aux aéroports et aérodromes suivants: 1° l'aéroport de Charleroi-Bruxelles Sud; 2° l'aéroport de Liège-Bierset; 3° l'aérodrome de Saint-Hubert; 4° l'aérodrome de Spa; 5° l'aérodrome de Cerfontaine. Le texte comprend 6 articles.

Policy: Sahtu Dene and Metis Land Claim Settlement Act (S.C. 1994, c. 27).
Policy_Content: The present Act approves, gives effect to and declares valid the Agreement between Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada and the Dene of Colville Lake, Déline, Fort Good Hope and Fort Norman and the Metis of Fort Good Hope, Fort Norman and Norman Wells, as represented by the Sahtu Tribal Council. In particular, section 5 establishes that for the purposes of carrying out its objectives, the Renewable Resources Board established by the Agreement has the capacity, rights, powers and privileges of a natural person. The text consists of 7 sections.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ordonnance sur la radioprotection (ORaP).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance porte la réglementation relative à la radioprotection. Elle s’applique aux substances, objets et déchets dont l’activité, la concentration, la contamination, le débit de dose ou la masse excèdent les valeurs indiquées à l’annexe 2. Elle s’applique en outre: a. aux installations génératrices de rayonnements ionisants; b. aux appareils et installations pouvant émettre des rayonnements ionisants parasites. Le texte comprend 142 articles répartis en 11 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales et principes de la radioprotection (1er); Qualifications techniques, experts, formation et perfectionnement des connaissances (2); Applications médicales de rayonnements (3); Protection des personnes exposées aux rayonnements (4); Utilisation d’installations et de sources radioactives (5); Déchets radioactifs (6); Défaillances (7); Surveillance de l’environnement et des denrées alimentaires (8); Protection de la population en cas d’augmentation de la radioactivité (9); Autorisations et surveillance (10); Dispositions pénales et finales (11). Six annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Radiation,Institution,Food quality control/food safety,Waste disposal,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Waste management
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act on electricity fees (No. 896 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act sets rules for taxation on national electricity supply in Denmark. Exception is made for energy production in facilities whose capacity is less than 150 kW. The Act applies to energy produced and consumed on trains, ships, aircraft or other vehicles; energy produced through wind power, hydropower, biogas or other renewable energy; and energy produced for emergency power in case normal electricity supply fails.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Hazardous Substances Regulations (Importation and exportation of Hazardous Substances) -1994
Policy_Content: These regulations give definitions and make provisions for the importation and exportation of hazardous substances in Israel. Section (1) gives definitions. Section (2) deals with importation and exportation limitations. The Minister of Environment can authorize importation or exportation of hazardous substances according to the list in this section. Section (3) regards limitations in the ministers’ authorization. Section (4) provides with reporting procedures.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Act on carbon dioxide taxation on certain energy products (No. 718 of 1993).
Policy_Content: The Act sets taxation rules for carbon dioxide-based energy production and applies to commercial suppliers. The Act sets prices and regulations on the taxation of certain carbon dioxide-based energy products by commercial energy suppliers. For specific periods, these companies shall be liable to payment of specific percentages of energy consumption.

Policy: Law No. 7836 on pricing of agricultural lands for compensation.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for the pricing of agricultural lands when compensating former owners according to Law No. 7699. Compensation rates are set in Law No. 7501, "for land".
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Law governing taxes on land use right assignment.
Policy_Content: With a view to strengthening the State management of the land, encouraging efficient land use, ensuring equity in tax obligations and supplementing the State budget with part of the income of the land user who assigns his/her land use rights, a tax on the transfer of land rights is introduced by the present Law. Organizations, family households or individuals that have the right to use land, including the land on which there is a house or an architectural object, shall pay a tax on the assignment of land-use rights when they assign such rights in accordance with law, except for cases provided for in article 2 of this Law. The cases set out in article 2 are exempt from the tax. The bases for calculating the tax on land-use right assignments are the acreage of the land, the value of land and the tax rate (art. 5). Transfer of rights of use on land for agriculture, forestry, aquaculture and salt production is taxed at ten percent. If the change is from non-agricultural to an agricultural purpose, the tax shall be zero percent. (29 articles)
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Loi-cadre nº 94-018 relative à l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte régime de base en matière d'environnement. Elle vise, notamment, à: préserver la diversité et l'intégrité de l'environnement; créer les conditions d'une utilisation quantitativement et qualitativement durable des ressources naturelles; garantir à tous les citoyens un cadre de vie écologiquement sain et équilibré. Les citoyens sont tenus à participer collectivement pour la sauvegarde de l'environnement. La loi est formée par 90 articles répartis en 8 titres, à savoir: Définitions, objectifs et principes (I); Compétences et attributions administratives (II); Etudes d'impact (III); Fonds pour la gestion de l'environnement (IV); Environnement naturel (V); Environnement humain (VI); Dispositions pénales (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII). Le Ministre chargé de l'environnement est l'autorité compétente à prendre toutes les dispositions d'application de cette loi-cadre et à donner son avis sur tout projet du gouvernement susceptible d'avoir une incidence sur la politique de l'environnement. Les associations agréées par ce Ministre peuvent participer à l'action des organismes publics. Un décret pris en conseil des Ministres fixera la liste des travaux soumis à l'Etude d'impact préalable et les modalités de mise en oeuvre de cette procédure. Le fonds pour la gestion de l'environnement contribue au développement des programmes de la direction générale de l'environnement et à la mise en oeuvre des activités des associations agréées. Le titre V porte différentes mesures de prévention, de gestion et de contrôle aptes à préserver les différentes composantes naturelles de l'environnement, à savoir: le sol et le sous-sol; les cours d'eau, les sources et les eaux souterraines; les eaux maritimes; l'atmosphère; la faune et la flore; les forêts et les aires protégées. Le titre VI fixe les mesures relatives à l'environnement humain, c'est à dire celles nécessaires à l'amélioration du cadre de vie des populations. Sont donc fixées les normes en matière de collecte et gestion des déchets, de gestion des substances chimiques nocives, des établissements dangereux ou insalubres ainsi que les dispositions relatives à l'élaboration de plans d'urgence à mettre en être en cas d'accidents graves ou de catastrophes d'origine naturelle.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Protection of environment,Pollution control,Framework law,Basic legislation,Institution,Environmental planning,EIA,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Marine area,Protected area,Special fund,Disasters,Waste management,Forest management/forest conservation,Freshwater resources management,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Ecosystem preservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Carib Reserve Council (Dissolution) Order (S.R.O. No. 37 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Order, made under the Carib Reserve Act, provides for the dissolution of the Carib Reserve Council, which is responsible for administration of an area of Dominica set apart under this Act as a reserve and known as the “Carib Reserve”. In the period of transition following the dissolution and until new Council is elected, all powers relative to real and personal belonging to or vested in the Council shall vest in the outgoing Chairman and Clerk of Council. These Officers shall also discharge all duties of the Council in the period of transition.

Policy_Content: En application de l'article 7 du décret nº 89-1047, tel que modifié par le décret nº 93-2447, cet arrêté fixe la liste des cultures qui peuvent être irriguées par les eaux usées traitées, à savoir: les cultures industrielles (coton,tabac, lin, jojoba, ricin, carthame), les cultures céréalières, les cultures fourragères, les arbres fruitiers qui ne sont pas irrigués par aspersion, les arbustes fourragèrs, les arbres forestiers, les plantes florales.

Policy: Resolución Nº 236/94/PE - Elaboración del programa de adecuación y manejo ambiental de la actividad de procesamiento pesquero.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, considerando que la décima disposición transitoria del Reglamento de la Ley General de Pesca, aprobado mediante el Decreto Supremo Nº 001-94-PE, dispone que para los fines de cumplir con la presentación del Programa de Adecuación y Manejo Ambiental (PAMA) de la actividad de procesamiento pesquero, aprueba los Lineamentos para la Elaboración del PAMA de la Actividad de Procesamiento Pesquero que constan de los siguientes apartados: 1) resumen; 2) antecedentes; 3) introducción; 4) objetivos; 5) caracterización ambiental del área de influencia de la planta; 6) diagnóstico ambiental de las operaciones de procesamiento pesquero; 7) programa de manejo ambiental; 8) programa de inversiones y cronograma de aplicación de la tecnología seleccionada; 9) identificación de parámetros para auditorías ambientales (vigilancia y control); 10) plan de abandono del área al cese de la actividad.

Policy: Ley Nº 139 - Crea el certificado de incentivo forestal.
Policy_Content: La Ley, que consta de 17 artículos, crea el Certificado de Incentivo Forestal (CIF) con el fin de promover la realización de inversiones directas en nuevas plantaciones forestales de carácter protector-productor en terrenos de aptitud forestal, y podrán acceder a éste las personas naturales o jurídicas de carácter privado, entidades descentralizadas municipales o distritales cuyo objeto sea la prestación de servicios público de acueducto y alcantarillado y entidades territoriales que se comprometan a cumplir un plan de establecimiento y manejo forestal (art. 1º). La presente Ley crea también el Comité Asesor de Política Forestal con el fin de coordinar la ejecución de las políticas relacionadas con el subsector forestal y presidido por el Ministro de Medio Ambiente o su delegado (art. 16).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.277 - Organiza y establece el Instituto de Hidrología, Meteorología y Estudios Ambientales (IDEAM).
Policy_Content: El Decreto consta de 7 capítulos y 36 artículos. El Instituto de Hidrología, Meteorología y Estudios Ambientales (IDEAM) es un establecimiento público de carácter nacional adscrito al Ministerio del Medio Ambiente, con autonomía administrativa, personería jurídica y patrimonio independiente (art. 1º). El IDEAM tiene como objetivos, entre otros: 1) suministrar los conocimientos, datos e información ambiental que requieren el Ministerio del Medio Ambiente y demás entidades del Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA); 2) realizar el levantamiento y manejo de la información científica y técnica sobre los ecosistemas que forman parte del patrimonio ambiental del país; 3) establecer las bases técnicas para clasificar y zonificar el uso del territorio nacional para los fines de la planificación y el ordenamiento ambiental del territorio; 4) realizar estudios e investigaciones sobre recursos naturales, en especial la relacionada con los recursos forestales y la conservación de suelos; 5) dirigir y coordinar el sistema de información ambiental (art. 2º).
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Regional Decree No. 410-PP/13 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Kutsa”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve “Kutsa” shall be classified as complex (environmental and zoological) protected area. The scope of constituting the aforesaid state nature reserve of regional significance shall be conservation and reproduction of precious natural complexes, including wetlands and nesting areas of migratory aquatic bird species, feeding grounds of aquatic mammals and protected plants and soil. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems and landscapes; (b) conservation of rare and endangered wild fauna species; and (c) protection of migratory routes and habitats, including wetlands. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) timber extraction and procurement on non-timber forest products; (b) mining and use of explosives; (c) drainage and land reclamation; (d) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and pesticides; and (e) passage and movement of motor vehicles outside of roads of general use.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Endangered species,Protection of habitats,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Instruction regarding improvement of pastures.
Policy_Content: The Instruction provides guidelines for the General Directorate of Afforestation and Erosion Control staff of the Ministry of Environment and Forestry on the principles and techniques of grass improvement, and preparation and implementation of grazing related projects. The instruction first provides definitions of meadow, graze lands, summer pastures, winter pastures, artificial pastures, meadow improvement, grazing capacity, decreasing phylum, increasing phylum, invading phylum, etc. During the improvement process close coordination will be ensured between the beneficiary villagers and service provider agencies. Grazing plans should be prepared and implemented together with the local village population. Improvement methods shall focus on timing out the grazing schedule. Number of animals to be grazed and timing should be considered. Grafting, fertilizing, cleansing of harmful plants, implementing erosion controlling measures, and erecting animal pens are some of the techniques that could be used.
Subject: Forestry, Livestock, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agro-forestry,Grazing,Community management,Pastoralism,Forest management/forest conservation,Herd book,Policy/planning,Crops/grasses,Fertilizers/nutrients,Soil conservation/soil improvement

Policy: Decreto Nº 296/994 - Modifica el Decreto Nº 457/989.
Policy_Content: El Decreto Nº 457/989 dispone la exoneración del pago de la tasa global arancelaria y del pago del IVA a las importaciones que realicen los productores y empresas rurales, industriales o agroindustriales dedicadas a la forestación, explotación o industrialización de maderas de producción nacional. El presente Decreto modifica el plazo previsto por el artículo 7º para la transferencia o cesión de los bienes de activo fijo importados al amparo del Decreto Nº 457/989, reduciéndolo a 3 años y con la excepción de aquellos que constituyen garantía de préstamos.

Policy: Law No. 13 of 1994 amending provisions of Law No. 4 of 1981 on the creation of the Permanent Committee for Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: The amendments of articles 1, 2, 7, and 15 concern the following: the Committee is to be subordinate to the Ministry of Municipality Affairs and Agriculture instead of the Cabinet (art. 1); the President is the Minister of Municipality Affairs and Agriculture instead of the Minister of Health (art. 2); the implementing regulation will be issued by the Minister of Municipality Affairs and Agriculture (art. 15); articles 4 and 13 of Law No. 4 of 1981 are now abrogated.

Policy: Law No. 7 of 1994 on Forestry.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 4 Parts, 7 Sections divided into 57 articles. Part I deals with terms and definitions. Part II provides for public forests. Exploitation of public forests and their products (sect. 1). Transport and storage of public forest products (sect. 2). Definition of public forests for exploitation (sect. 3). Exploitation's rights in public forests (sect. 4). Exploitation licences (sect. 5). Public forests protection (sect. 6). Creation of protected areas and natural reserves (sect. 7). Part III deals with the exploitation and management of private forests. Part IV contains offences and penalties.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Basic legislation,Public forest,Private forest,Protection forest,Timber extraction/logging,Forest management/forest conservation,Transport/storage,Offences/penalties,Authorization/permit
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Decree No.5246 of 1994 on the organization of the Ministry of Agriculture and identifying its organogram and recruitment conditions in some of its positions and the salaries scale of the technical staff.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 133 articles aims at organizing the Ministry of Agriculture. At political and management level it consists of: 1. Directorate General; 2. Coordination and Planning Authority; 3. Agricultural Supreme Council.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Crops/grasses,Apiculture/sericulture,Pastoralism,Internal trade,International trade,Marine fisheries,Inland fisheries,Business/industry/corporations,Nutrition,Food quality control/food safety,Afforestation/reforestation,Agro-forestry,Forest management/forest conservation,Animal production,Quarantine,Animal health,Plant protection,Packaging/labelling,Hunting/capture

Policy: Décisions portant abrogation de l'ancienne législation et réglementation sur l'exportation du bois et concernant la création du Comité d'enquête et contrôle des bois ronds coupés et sciés.
Policy_Content: La première de ces deux décisions, la nº 65, porte l'abrogation de l'ancienne législation et réglementation sur l'exportation de bois et établit que toute demande d'exportation du bois devra être soumise à l'accord direct du premier ministre et du deuxième premier ministre, qui sont aussi compétents pour accorder l'autorisation à l'exportation des bois déjà coupés mais qui ne sont pas encore sortis du territoire. A cette fin la deuxième décision, qui constitue le complément de la décision nº 65, porte la création d'un comité charger de contrôler les bois ronds déjà coupé et sciés qui sont encore sur le territoire du Cambodge et d'établir des rapports sur les résultats des travaux accomplis.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Small Enterprises Development Act (Cap. 15.05).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to government assistance for enterprises approved under section 3 of this Act by the Governor as a small enterprise. The Governor shall appoint a registrar of small enterprises and the Governor shall appoint a Small Enterprise Incentives Committee. Only registered enterprises shall receive incentives. The Registrar shall monitor and inspect the operations of all small enterprises that have been granted incentives.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, European Union Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Kibondo District Council (Cultivation of Agricultural Land) By-laws 1994 (G.N. No. 280 of 1994).
Policy_Content: Each resident who holds land in accordance with local customary law relating to land tenure shall, unless otherwise directed in writing by an authorized officer, cultivate and maintain an area of not less than three acres out of which two acres shall be planted with cash crops and the remaining acre shall be planted with food crops (By-law 3). Residents holding land shall keep their lands free from weeds and report on pests and diseases occurring on their land (By-law 5). (8 By-laws)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal portant abrogation du règlement grand-ducal du 3 juin 1993 fixant les prescriptions générales pour les établissements agricoles de la classe 3.
Policy_Content: L’article 1er du règlement susvisé établit que le règlement grand-ducal du 3 juin 1993 fixant les prescriptions générales pour les établissements agricoles de la classe 3 est abrogé.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Catchment and Land Protection Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act sets up the framework for the integrated management and protection of catchments in Victoria, it encourages community participation in the management of land and water resources, and creates a system of controls on noxious weeds and pest animals.
Subject: Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: Policy/planning,Land-use planning,Monitoring,Data collection/reporting,Environmental planning,Institution,Mining,Weeds,Basin/catchment/watershed,Community management,Water users' associations,Sustainable development

Policy: Decree-Law No. 377 providing emergency measures to deal with forest fires throughout the national territory.
Policy_Content: In view of the urgent need to mobilize every means available to combat forest fires during the summer throughout the country, this Decree-Law authorizes a total of 65 billion liras to be spent for the year 1994 to enable the relevant authorities to deal with the serious threat to life and property posed by these fires. Thirty billion lire is allocated under this measure to finance the work of the National Fire Service, and the same amount is allocated to units of the Ministry of Agricultural, Food and Forest Resources (for ground and aerial fire-fighting equipment). The balance of five billion lire is to be used to launch a forest fire inventory plan jointly by the Ministry of the Environment and the Ministry of Agricultural, Food and Forest Resources.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Special fund,Forest fires,Subsidy/incentive,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 232/94/PE - Elaboración de los estudios de impacto ambiental para la acuicultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, considerando que el artículo 118 del Reglamento de la Ley General de Pesca, aprobado mediante el Decreto Supremo Nº 001-94-PE, establece que para los efectos del otorgamiento de concesiones de áreas para el desarrollo de la acuicultura los solicitantes deberán presentar la memoria descriptiva del respectivo proyecto y su correspondiente Estudio de Impacto Ambiental (EIA), establece que las personas naturales o jurídicas que inicien actividades de acuicultura, así como para la siembra, introducción de nuevas especies al territorio nacional y el traslado de especies hidrobiológicas, deberán presentar el EIA de acuerdo a los lineamentos de los 3 anexos de la presente Resolución. Los lineamentos para la elaboración del EIA para la acuicultura (anexo 1) prevén los siguientes apartados: 1) resumen; 2) antecedentes; 3) introducción; 4) objetivos; 5) descripción general del proyecto; 6) características básicas del área de estudio; 7) EIA de la actividad; 8) programa de manejo ambiental; 9) plan de abandono del área al cese de la actividad. Los lineamentos para la elaboración del EIA para la siembra, introducción y traslado de especies hidrobiológicas (anexo 2) prevén los siguientes apartados: 1) marco global; 2) especie: información bioecológica; 3) ambiente de origen; 4) ambiente de destino; 5) efecto sobre el ambiente de destino y biodiversidad acuática; 6) medidas para reproducir y controlar impactos negativos. Los lineamentos para la elaboración de Programas de Adecuación y Manejo Ambiental (PAMA) para la acuicultura (anexo 3) prevén los siguientes apartados: 1) resumen; 2) antecedentes; 3) introducción; 4) objetivos; 5) caracterización ambiental del área de influencia de la unidad acuicola; 6) descripción de la actividad; 7) identificación y cuantificación de los impactos potenciales y relevantes; 8) programa de manejo ambiental; 9) plan de abandono del área al cese de la actividad.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Effluent waste water/discharge,Water quality standards,Waste disposal,Mariculture,EIA,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Cartilaginous fishes,Biodiversity,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law amending Law “On grain market and state grain reserve”.
Policy_Content: Article 8 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Each wholesale trader of grain and grain products and derivates and also intermediaries, independently from the form of entrepreneurial activity, except for grain producers trading grain produced thereby, shall transfer three percent of the sum of transaction to the regional fund of levelling of grain production”.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Cereals/grains/rice,Transport/storage,Consumer protection,Fiscal and market measures,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Internal trade,Food security,Processing/handling

Policy: Governmental Order on payment for mining reservation and on payment for mined minerals.
Policy_Content: This Order implements the Mining Act by providing specifications on the payment of fees related to mining reservations and of royalties related to minerals extracted. The Order is completed by two annexes, one on the manner for calculating fees for minerals of exclusive deposits and one on the amount of payment rate for mined minerals by type of minerals.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on 1 July 1994.

Policy: Arrêté n° 2592/94 portant création des commissions régionales de réorganisation foncière et du remembrement et fixant leur composition et leurs règles de fonctionnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte création, dans chaque Fivondronam-pokontany,des commissions régionales de réorganisation foncière et du remembrement et fixe leur composition et leurs règles de fonctionnement.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 1229 on federal health resorts of the Caucasian Mineral Waters.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of carrying out state policy in the sphere of development of federal health resorts, conservation and renewal of natural health factors of protected area of ecological region and health resorts of the Caucasian Mineral Waters, decrees that the Government must ensure beginning from 1994 priority financing of the Federal Special Program (FSP) “Development of protected area of ecological region and health resorts of the Caucasian Mineral Waters”. President decrees to establish that till the validation of the Federal Law regarding the modalities of management of state property on natural resources, management of natural areas (including the plots of land, natural health resorts) situated on protected area of ecological region and health resorts - the Caucasian Mineral Waters must be carried out by the administration of the Caucasian Mineral Waters.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Presidential Decree enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Ley Nº 8 - Ley que promueve las actividades turísticas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el establecimiento de un proceso simple, rápido y racional para el desarrollo de actividades turísticas, otorgar incentivos y beneficios a las personas que se dediquen a actividades turísticas y adoptar mecanismos necesarios para lograr la conjunción y coordinación de la acción del sector público y del sector privado en el área del turismo.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Building Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Land Use Planning Act of 22 June 1976. The purpose of the present Law is to achieve a balanced and economical use of land with a view to the natural living conditions, protection of nature and cultural heritage. The text consists of 68 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Planning law (II); Planning regulations (III); Legal protection (IV); Penalties (V); Transitional and final provisions (VI).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,Agricultural land,Subsidy/incentive,Protected area,Pollution control,Environmental planning,Dispute settlement,Court/tribunal,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Resolution No. 64 of 1994 promulgating Law No. 9 of 1994 concerning the Aba'a Centre for Agricultural Research.
Policy_Content: For the purpose of furthering the aims of agricultural research in general, the Aba'a Centre for Agricultural Research is established as a body with legal personality and financial autonomy. It shall be active in applied research, in particular, and implement temporary development projects. The Centre shall be managed by its Head who is vested with extensive powers outlined in section 6. The latter shall also be responsible for approval of contracts between farmers and both domestic and foreign companies. (12 articles)
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 611 regarding the validation of the Regulation on the modalities of concession of land share in the process of privatisation of the state agricultural enterprises.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation and the form of the land share certificate. The General Meetings of the collective farmers are recommended to be guided by this Regulation in the process of reformation of their collective farms. In the process of privatisation of the state agricultural enterprises, their workers are authorized to sell or transfer property shares and to let other members of the work collective have the proper land share on bilateral contractual basis for the use of these shares in agricultural production. Each worker of privatised agricultural enterprise is issued land share certificate without the allotment of the plots of land. Land share certificate testifies the right of the worker to the plot of land (land share). The district committees on land relationship and land survey issue land share certificates. Concession of land share is possible only on condition that the worker of the state agricultural enterprise holds land share certificate. The document contains the form of the land share certificate.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Act to amend the Private Forests Act (No. 479 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This one section amendment concerns environment impact assessment statements in accordance with Act 468 of 1994. If the provisions of this Act shall apply to the cutting of forests, than there shall be a felling and afforestation plan be drawn up as foreseen in paragraph 3 of section 2 of the amended Act. The Forestry Office shall not take any decision on the approval of the felling and afforestation plan if they do not have also have in their possession the environment impact statement mentioned in it.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 1 September 1994.

Policy: Act relative to procedures of environmental impact assessments (No. 468 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The aim of the Act is to enhance the assessment of environmental impact of human activities, to enhance environmental decision-making and to provide access of the public to environment information.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 1 September 1994.

Policy: Act to amend the Forest Improvement Act (No. 480 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The principal Act provides, in order to secure improvement of forests, that financial support is available to private persons in the form of loans or grants. The minor amendments of the principal Act concern environment impact assessment for forest improvement projects proposed under the Act. No Forestry Office shall approve a project for financing unless it has at its disposal the environment impact assessment statement drawn up in accordance with provisions of Act No. 468 of 1994 relative to environment impact statements in general. Section 27 of the same Act shall apply as far as implementation of the present Act is concerned.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 1 September 1994.

Policy: Décret nº 94-484 modifiant le décret nº 77-1133 pris pour l'application de la loi nº 76-663 du 19 juillet 1976 relative aux installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement et du titre 1er de la loi nº 64-1245 relative au régime et à la répartition des eaux et à la lutte contre leur pollution et modifiant le livre IV du Code de l'urbanisme.
Policy_Content: Ce décret modifie le décret qui porte dispositions réglementaires prises en application de la loi nº 77-663 relative aux installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement ainsi que le livre IV du Code de l'urbanisme. Il comprend 42 articles répartis en 6 titres, à savoir: Dispositions prises pour l'application aux installations classées de certaines dispositions du titre 1er de la loi nº 92-3 sur l'eau (I); Dispositions relatives à l'étude d'impact et à l'étude de dangers (II); Dispositions relatives à l'information du public (III); Dispositions applicables aux installations susceptibles de donner lieu à servitudes d'utilité publique (IV); Dispositions diverses (V) et transitoires (VI).
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regional Act No. 16 on the interventions for the protection of forests against fires.
Policy_Content: The Piemonte Region guarantees the protection of forests by implementing the Regional Plan for the Protection of Forests against Fires. For this purpose, the Region shall promote studies and research in matter of fire-fighting methods and equipment, encourage the development of formative courses and undertake initiatives for the restoration of destroyed or damaged forests. Furthermore, the regional authority shall: a) periodically review and update the above-mentioned Regional Plan; b) draw up contracts with voluntary organizations, public entities and private enterprises in matter of fire-fighting aerial equipment. The regional territory is divided into Basis Areas determined by the Regional Plan for the Protection of Forests against Fires. The State Forestry Body is in charge of the management and coordination of operations for preventing fires (art. 3). Article 4 makes provision in matter of agreements between the Region and voluntary organizations. Article 6 deals with the measures and interventions to be undertaken by the Local Entities for the prevention of fires. Article 11 concerns reafforestation following fires. Monitoring shall be performed by the State Forestry Body (art. 12). Article 13 lays down penalties.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Forest fires,Contract/agreement,Policy/planning,Monitoring,Offences/penalties,Non-governmental entity,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Marine Act (1994:1009).
Policy_Content: Swedish vessels may be deemed so when more than half is owned by Swedish citizens og residents, and shall not be considered such if registered in other country than Sweden in the European Economic Areas (including commercial vessels). Criteria of identification defines vessels of max. 12 meters of length and a maximum width of 4 meters by registration in the national Vessel Registry. Ship's gross tonnage is calculated in accordance with the provisions in Annex 1 of the International Convention on Tonnage Measurement (SÖ 1979:6) and Act (2012:353). In case of oil spill by Swedish vessels, this Act implements provisions related to the compensation by the 1992 International Oil Pollution Compensation Fund and the 2003 International Oil Pollution Compensation Fund under Act (2005:253) for reimbursement from the International Oil Pollution Compensation Fund. Swedish ships carrying more than 2 000 tons of oil in bulk, shall be covered by insurance or other satisfactory liability under the provisions of this Act. Foreign vessels with greater tonnage of 1 000 entering or leaving  Swedish ports or other Swedish territorial waters will hold an insurance or other adequate security to cover its liability under the provisions set out in Chapter 9, article 5.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Navigation,Marine pollution,Basic legislation,Internal trade,Registration,Oil pollution,Liability/compensation,Special fund,Transport/storage
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG404/1994 validating Basic provisions for land reclamation.
Policy_Content: Basic provisions for land reclamation shall be as follows: (a) enterprises, institutions and organizations performing work related to the disturbance of soil cover, are obliged at the end of the term of use of land plots to bring them into a condition suitable for use in agriculture or forestry; the aforesaid work is carried out at the expense of institutions and organizations that have been allotted land plots; (b) enterprises, institutions and organizations carrying out work related to disturbance of soil cover, are obliged to remove and transport to established places or store and preserve (or apply to reclaimed areas) fertile soil layer; (c) restoration of the fertility of disturbed land is carried out at the expense of organizations, who performed work related to the disturbance of soil cover; (d) the conditions for bringing land, soil cover of which was disturbed when performing construction work or the development of minerals, in a state suitable for use in agriculture or forestry, and the procedure for use of removed fertile layer are established on the basis of relevant projects by the bodies allotting land plots for use; and (e) allotment of land plots for work related to the disturbance of soil cover is made after bringing the previously allotted land into a condition suitable for use for intended purpose.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Decree No. 10.459 regulating Environmental Law No. 261/91.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates Environmental Law No. 261/91. It specifies the Regulation to be applied in order to implement the aforementioned Law and establishes the legal framework for the pollution control within the State of Tocantins. It consists of 7 parts and 1 annex concerning the requirements to be satisfied for obtaining a licence for performing potentially polluting activities. It is divided as follows: General provisions (Part 1); Licensing (2); Council for the Environmental Policy (3); Offence and penalties (4); Control (5); Administrative procedures (6); Final provisions (7). The Annex specifies polluting activities and residues.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Act on the Greenland Institute of Natural Resources (No. 6 of 1994).
Policy_Content: The present Act establishes the Greenland Institute of Natural Resources, whose objective is to provide Greenland with the scientific basis for a sustainable use of living resources in and around the country, as well as to protect the environment and biological diversity. It contains detailed rules regarding the Institute's duties, management, and functioning.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 1 July 1994.

Policy: Order No. 123 of the Federal Forest Service validating scheme of standard design of the organization of main felling and forestry on allotted plots of forest stock.
Policy_Content: Standard design elaborated in conformity with the present shall be put at the basis of contract between the owner of the forest stock and forest manager and shall be compulsory for forestry and forest organization on allotted plots of forest stock. Standard design shall be elaborated for all types of forest management specified in the forestry licence. Standard design is a normative technical document ensuring inexhaustible and rational forest management and observation of silvicultural and ecological requirements set for forest management on the allotted plots of forest stock. Standard design shall be elaborated in conformity with the forest organization materials. In case of five years’ prescription of forest organization actualization of forest organization materials shall be carried out by removal of cutover and shifting areas in conformity with age classification with the consideration of prescription of forest organization.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 029-94-EM ─ Reglamento para la protección ambiental en las actividades eléctricas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento de protección ambiental en las actividades eléctricas, el cual establece que durante el ejercicio de las actividades eléctricas de generación, transmisión y distribución, los Titulares de las concesiones y autorizaciones, tendrán la responsabilidad del control y protección del medio ambiente en lo que a dichas actividades concierne. A tal fin, los Titulares de concesiones y/o autorizaciones, contarán con un Auditor Ambiental Interno, responsable del control ambiental de la empresa, quien tendrá como función identificar los problemas existentes, preveer los que puedan presentarse en el futuro, desarrollar planes de rehabilitación, definir metas para mejorar y controlar el mantenimiento de los programas ambientales.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Transport/storage,Environmental standards,Hydropower generation,Emissions,Business/industry/corporations,Environmental audit,Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,EIA,Protection of environment,Protection of habitats

Policy: Geophysical Regulation (Man. Reg. 110/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Oil and Gas Act. In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to the geophysical explorations for oil and gas purposes. The text consists of 24 sections divided into 4 Parts as follows: Interpretation (1); Licensing and approvals (2); Field operations (3); Submission of information and reports (4). One Schedule is enclosed.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Drilling and Production Regulation (Man. Reg. 111/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Oil and Gas Act. In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to the granting of licences for drilling activities and production procedures. The text consists of 126 sections divided into 14 Parts as follows: Definitions (1); Well and battery names (2); Well licence (3); Spacing units, target areas and off-target penalties (4); Equipment registration (5); Drilling, completing servicing and abandonment (6); Production operations (7); Flow line (8); Spills - environmental protection (9); Measurement (10); Well data (11); Records and reports (12); Release of information (13); Review (13.1); Repeal and coming into force (14). Four Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Crown Royalty and Incentives Regulation (Man. Reg. 109/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Oil and Gas Act. The Regulation applies to oil and gas produced from a spacing unit or unit tract in which the Crown holds all or part of the oil and gas rights. Section 3 establishes that every holder shall pay a royalty to the Crown on oil and gas produced from a lease area as listed in this section. The text consists of 4 sections.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Crown Disposition Regulation (Man. Reg. 108/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is enacted under the Oil and Gas Act. In particular, the Regulation provides for public sales by sealed tender of Crown oil and gas rights in Manitoba. There are two types of agreements relating to Crown oil and gas rights in Manitoba: "exploration reservations" and "Crown oil and gas leases". The text consists of 28 sections divided into 2 Parts as follows: Dispositions (1); Registration of transfers and instruments (2). Two Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley sobre régimen especial de inversiones, en aspectos relacionados con la maximización de los incentivos y garantías en materia de inversiones extranjeras.

Policy: Working Hours Act
Policy_Content: The German Working Hours Act regulates working time/hours in all sectors of employment. Generally, work should not exceed 8 hours, which may be extended to 10 hours, provided the average amount of 8 hours is not exceeded (§3). It is not permissible to engage persons in work for more than 6 hours without a break. Employees are entitled to a break of min. 30 mins for 6-8 work shifts. For over 9 hours, the employee is entitled to a 45 min break (§4). There should be an 11-hour period after a daily shift that is free from work (§5). Work is prohibited on Sundays and public holidays (§ 9). § 22 and 23 regard fines and criminal sanctions where these provisions are disregarded or wrongly applied.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 27/94 - Crea la Comisión Nacional de Educación Ambiental.
Policy_Content: La Comisión Nacional de Educación Ambiental tendrá las siguientes funciones: llevar a efecto acciones que concienticen y eduquen a la población nacional sobre la importancia y necesidad de conservar el medio ambiente; fomentar a nivel escolar y comunitario actividades idóneas; desarrollar campañas en favor de la conservación del medio ambiente; presentar a la Presidencia la propuesta de la Estrategia Nacional de Educación Ambiental (art. 1º). En cada región la Comisión impulsará la formación de Consejos de Educación Ambiental (art. 5º).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific
