Policy: Rules of Shenzhen Special Economic Zone on Control  and prevention of Flood, Wind (2001).
Policy_Content: These Rules are formulated in order to prevent the calamities of flood and typhoon, protect people’s life and the property of the state, collectives and individuals, and promptly organize the salvage and disaster relief. The Text consists of 39 Articles divided into 7 Chapters: General provisions; Salvage and Disaster Relief Organizations and Their Duties; Flood Monitoring and Precautionary Warning;  Salvage and Disaster Relief;  Maritime Salvage; Legal Liability; Supplementary Provisions.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto implementa el Sistema Ambiental del Distrito Capital (SIAC) y reestructura el Departamento Técnico Administrativo del Medio Ambiente (DAMA). El SIAC es el conjunto de orientaciones, normas, actividades, recursos, programas e instituciones que regulan la gestión ambiental del Distrito Capital.

Policy: Native Title (New South Wales) Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 108 sections divided into eleven Parts and completed by two Schedules, concerns native titles on land and water resources in New South Wales and aims at ensuring that the law of New South Wales is consistent with the standards set by the Commonwealth Native Title Act.

Policy: Allowable Annual Cut Proportionate Reduction Regulation (B.C. Reg. 156/94).
Policy_Content: This Regulation has one section in which it sets out the allowable annual cut that is prescribed for the purposes of sections 63, 173 and 176 of the Forest Act. "Allowable annual cut" means (a) in respect of a tree farm licence area or a timber supply area, the rate of timber harvesting determined for the area as increased or reduced under the Forest Act, and (b) in respect of an agreement entered into under the Forest Act specifying an allowable annual cut, the rate of timber harvesting specified in the agreement, as increased or reduced under the Forest Act. Section 63 of the Forest Act deals with proportionate reduction. Section 173 of the Act sets out the allowable annual cut and allowable harvest in a designated area. Section 176 deals with Nisga's Final Agreement Implementation.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 54 - Ley de Desarrollo Agrario.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el fomento, desarrollo y protección integrales del sector agrario. Para la ejecución de la política agraria (cap. IV), mediante el artículo 23, se crea el Instituto Nacional de Desarrollo Agrario (INDA), como entidad de derecho público, con ámbito nacional, personalidad jurídica y patrimonio propio, adscrito al Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería. El INDA substituye en sus funciones al Instituto Ecuatoriano de Reforma Agraria (IERAC). Esta Ley, cuyo objetivo general es promover el desarrollo sostenido del sector agrario, dispone, entre otras cosas, que el Gobierno realice programas de capacitación para pequeños agricultores y comunidades indígenas (arts. 4º y 5º) y que los bancos y sociedades financieras del país participen en un plan nacional de concesión de crédito agrícola (art. 9º). La Ley se ocupa también de diferentes cuestiones relativas a la tenencia de tierras rústicas. Se garantiza la propiedad de la tierra que sea eficazmente trabajada, cumpliendo así su función social (art. 17) tal como la define la Ley (art. 18). Está terminantemente prohibida toda forma de trabajo precario en el cultivo de la tierra o formas que impliquen pagos en especie por el uso de la tierra (art. 20). Las tierras así cultivadas podrán expropiarse previo pago de una justa indemnización. Podrán también expropiarse las tierras que se hayan mantenido inexplotadas por más de tres años consecutivos (siempre que no concurran circunstancias atenuantes), así como aquéllas en las que se empleen prácticas de cultivo que atenten gravemente contra la conservación de los recursos naturales renovables (art. 30). Las tierras rústicas de propiedad comunitaria podrán ser objeto de fraccionamiento y de partición entre sus miembros previa resolución adoptada por la mayoría de éstos (art. 22). La transferencia de propiedad de tierras rústicas de dominio privado es libre y no requiere autorización alguna (art. 33). Sin embargo, al objeto de aplicar un control sobre el fraccionamiento de los predios, el Gobierno deberá: (a) establecer el tamaño de "unidades de producción" familiar y (b) promover la integración cuando se haya verificado un fraccionamiento excesivo alentando la organización de formas asociativas tanto de servicios como de producción (art. 34). Salvo algunas excepciones (principalmente el INDA) se prohíbe terminantemente a las entidades del sector público ser propietarias de tierras rústicas debiendo enajenar las que ingresaren a su patrimonio en el futuro (art. 35). Sin embargo, el INDA adjudicará tierras que posea o adquiera quedando el adquiriente sujeto al pago de un justo precio (art. 38). Son nulos y de ningún valor los gravámenes constituidos sobre tierras del Estado por quienes para hacerlo se han arrogado falsamente la calidad de propietarios. También lo son las trasmisiones de dominio de dichas tierras fundadas en "derechos y acciones de sitio" (art. 35). Se adjudicarán gratuitamente a las poblaciones indígenas las tierras del Estado que han estado en su posesión ancestral. En ellas se respetarán las costumbres vernáculas pero deberán incorporarse los elementos que, según el Gobierno, puedan contribuir a mejorar los sistemas tradicionales de producción (art. 36). Quienes hayan ejercido una tenencia ininterrumpida mínima de cinco años sobre tierras del Estado podrán solicitar al INDA la adjudicación de esas tierras previo pago de un precio justo (art. 37). Para la administración de estas disposiciones se crea el INDA, con personalidad jurídica y patrimonio propio. El Instituto está compuesto por un Consejo Superior que tiene funciones normativas, supervisoras y casi judiciales; un Director Ejecutivo que actúa como jefe ejecutivo del Instituto; y las dependencias auxiliares y el personal que se establezcan a su debido tiempo (arts. 23-29). Mientras las controversias en materia agraria serán de competencia de los tribunales ordinarios se dispone que la Corte Suprema podrá contratar jueces itinerantes para tramitar los procesos a nivel local (art. 46).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Institution,Agricultural land,Policy/planning,Irrigation,Family farming,Smallholders/peasants,Concession,Dispute settlement,Gender,Indigenous peoples,Water supply

Policy: Forest Renewal Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 160).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act, as stated in section 2, is to "renew the forest economy of British Columbia, enhance the productive capacity and environmental value of forest lands, create jobs, provide training for forest workers and strengthen communities". The Forest Renewal Corporation is continued (sect. 3). In order to implement this Act the Corporation may enter into contracts with individuals, first nations (native communities), businesses, institutions, local governments and other organizations, provide financial assistance, enter into agreements with the Government of Canada, provincial governments, etc. (sect. 4). The Board may establish committees in relation to the following objectives: increasing investment in forest land and resources, forest industry diversification, processing of wood supply, increased manufacture of wood products, investment in the "environmental values of the forest", fostering forest employment opportunities and job training, supporting community development (sect. 5). The remaining provisions concern administrative matters relating to the Corporation's functions, revenue and investment.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Contract/agreement,Forest management/forest conservation,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 27 June 2002.

Policy: Ley Nº 136 - Normas tendientes a modernizar la organización y el funcionamiento de los municipios.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley dicta normas tendientes a modernizar la organización y el funcionamiento de los municipios, con la finalidad de administrar los asuntos municipales y prestar los servicios públicos que determine la ley, ordenar el desarrollo de su territorio y construir las obras que demande el progreso municipal, promover la participación comunitaria y el mejoramiento social y cultural de sus habitantes, y planificar el desarrollo económico, social y ambiental de su territorio, de conformidad con la ley y en coordinación con otras entidades.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 137 - Ley por la cual se regulan los estados de excepción en Colombia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley por la cual se regulan los estados de excepción en Colombia, tiene por objeto regular las facultades atribuidas al Gobierno durante los estados de excepción. Estas facultades sólo podrán ser utilizadas cuando circunstancias extraordinarias hagan imposible el mantenimiento de la normalidad mediante los poderes ordinarios del Estado. La Ley también tiene por objeto establecer los controles al ejercicio de las facultades excepcionales del Gobierno así como las garantías para proteger los derechos humanos de conformidad con los tratados internacionales. De conformidad con el artículo 93 de la Constitución Política, los tratados y convenios internacionales sobre derechos humanos ratificados por el Congreso de Colombia prevalecen en el orden interno (Artículo 3º).
Subject: General
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Human rights,Constitutional law,Disasters,Public health,Social protection,Protection of environment

Policy: Resolution No. 49 of 1994 issuing the Implementing Regulation for Law. No. 6 of 1993 establishing the Fund for Fish and Agricultural Production Incentive.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 5 Sections divided into 43 articles. Section I deals with terms and definition. Fund’s objectives and fields are given in Section II which are to: support and encourage the agricultural, plant, animal and fish products; reduce costs of agricultural production instruments, fish gear and irrigation modern instruments; support and encourage the exportation of agricultural and fish products; increase the capacity of  basic structures of agricultural sector; support and encourage  studies and research; and to contribute in the establishment of basic structures for agricultural and fish marketing.  Fund’s accounts and incomes are given in Section III. Fund Management is contained in Section IV. General provisions are refered in Section V.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Cultural Endowment of Estonia Act (1994)
Policy_Content: The Cultural Endowment of Estonia is a legal person in public law the objective of the activities of which is to support the arts, folk culture, physical fitness and sport and the construction and renovation of cultural buildings by the purposeful accumulation of funds and distribution thereof for specific purposes. For the purposes of this Act, folk culture includes folk art including the traditional (folkloric) areas of folk art, the activities of societies and informal education. The functions of the Cultural Endowment are to support projects which promote, introduce and popularise the arts and sport, artistic associations, research related to culture and sport, and to further the development of the arts, folk culture, physical fitness and sport; support outstanding figures in the arts and sport, and their families upon their death; support talented persons with development potential in various areas of culture and sport and to facilitate their individual development; support the commemoration of deceased figures in the arts and sport; and support the construction and renovation of cultural buildings which are of national importance.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Act on Protected Natural Objects.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the procedure for designating protected natural "objects", the nature of the protection, and the rights and obligations of land-owners, land-holders and others with respect to those objects. Natural objects subject to being protected under this Act fall into three categories: protected areas (such as national parks, etc), protected natural monuments, or protected species, fossils or minerals. Natural objects may be publically or privately owned, but in either case they are accorded the same protection (art. 4). The Act specifically names national parks and Category I protected species. Other protected objects are to be designated in accordance with procedures to be established by the Government of Estonia (art. 5). The protection order will designate a manager for the protected object (art. 6), who has the duty of compiling a "Statement of Protection Obligations" (art. 7) that governs management of the object. Various restrictions concerning the use of real property within a protected area or containing a protected object are set forth in article 9, including an obligation on the part of owners to allow public access, a right of preemption and expropriation by the State, and restrictions on changes in land use without approval of the manager. Part II of the Act deals with Protected Areas, and defines different categories, such as strict nature reserves, special management zones, limited management zones, national parks, protected landscapes and others.
Subject: Forestry, Mineral resources, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.802 - Políticas básicas ambientales.
Policy_Content: Las Políticas Básicas Ambientales del Ecuador reconocen como su principio fundamental la promoción del desarrollo sustentable, que se puede alcanzar únicamente cuando los elementos social, económico y ambiental son tratados armónica y equilibradamente en cada acción. Además, se dispone la coordinación de la gestión ambiental por parte de la Comisión Asesora Ambiental de la Presidencia de la República (CAAM). Asimismo, se establece como instrumento obligatorio previamente a la realización de actividades susceptibles de degradar o contaminar el ambiente la preparación de un estudio de impacto ambiental (EIA) y del respectivo programa de mitigación ambiental (PMA).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific
Entry into force notes: A partir de su publicación.

Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the minimum conditions to be fulfilled by persons registered to carry out works in forests or forestry related works, here defined as contractors.

Policy: Instruction on state control over biological pollution of soil.
Policy_Content: This Instruction is destined for state environmental protection bodies carrying out state control over land tenure and protection of soil. Protection against biological pollution of soil shall be subject land of residential areas, recreational areas, irrigated agricultural land and other plots of land. Assessment of the degree of pollution shall be carried out with the consideration of sanitary and microbiological indices in accordance with sanitary regulations and methodological instructions. Persons responsible for biological pollution of soil shall be subject to liability through payment of compensation and compulsory polluted soil cleanup.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Agricultural land,Liability/compensation,Soil rehabilitation

Policy: Décret nº 94-259/PM portant création d'une Commission nationale consultative pour l'environnement et le développement durable.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de la Commission nationale consultative pour l'environnement et le développement durable. Cette Commission est chargée de l'élaboration de la politique nationale relative à l'environnement et au développement durable et de la coordination et du suivi de ladite politique, en veillant en particulier sur la réalisation des activités découlant de l'Agenda 21. Le décret comprend 13 articles, répartis en 3 chapitres, et un annexe qui fixe les domaines de compétence des 5 Comités qui forment la Commission, notamment: le développement et la croissance économique durables, la conservation et la gestion des ressources aux fins de développement, le renforcement du rôle des principaux groupes, la communication et l'éducation, les moyens d'exécution.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Directive 94/22/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the conditions for granting and using authorizations for the prospection, exploration and production of hydrocarbons.
Policy_Content: Member States retain the right to determine the areas within their respective territories to be made available for the exercise of the activities of prospecting, exploring for and producing hydrocarbons. On the other hand, Member States shall ensure that authorizations to carry out the activities above-mentioned are granted following a procedure in which all interested entities may submit applications (principle of non discrimination). Further provisions regard the overall conditions under which the authorizations shall be granted.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Resolución Nº 119 - Diagnóstico ambiental y sanitario de todas las instalaciones petroleras.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución exige a todas las empresas petroleras y de gas que adelanten proyectos de explotación, en cualquiera de sus etapas, la elaboración y presentación ante el Ministerio del Medio Ambiente, de un diagnóstico ambiental y sanitario de todas y cada una de las instalaciones petroleras y de gas existentes en Colombia.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law No.1561-XII of 1994 on specially protected areas.
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates relations in the field of the organization, protection and use of especially protected territories with a view of preservation of benchmarking and unique natural complexes and objects, noteworthy natural formation, genetic fauna and flora fund, studying of natural processes in biosphere and the control over changes of its conditions. The document consists of X Sections that contain 25 Articles. Section I (arts. 1 – 6) lays down the general provisions. Section II (Arts. 7 – 10) regards national reserves. Section III (Arts. 11 – 13) concerns the state natural national parks. Section IV (Arts. 14 – 15) state game reserves. Section V (Arts. 16 – 17) deals with state nature sanctuaries. Section VI (Arts. 18 – 19) deals with state botanical gardens, dendrology parks, and zoological parks. Section VII (Arts. 20 – 21) regards natural recreational territories. Section VIII (Arts. 22 – 23) concerns the organization of especially protected natural territories protection. Section IX (art. 24) establishes responsibility for the infringement of specially protected natural territories regime. Section X (Art 25) regards international agreements.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: The Law provides for the institution of the protected Cultural Zones in the Siem Reap/Angkor Region and it promulgates the Guidelines for their management.

Policy: Décret portant création d’un Fonds rural cantonal.
Policy_Content: L’article 1er du décret susvisé établit qu’il est institué un Fonds rural cantonal, destiné à l’octroi de prêts à un intérêt réduit ou sans intérêt et pour une durée limitée, en vue: a) d’encourager une infrastructure rationnelle des constructions rurales et de leurs équipements; b) de favoriser l’adaptation des exploitations aux conditions nouvelles de production et de commercialisation; c) d’encourager la mise en valeur des productions agricoles; d) de promouvoir et de favoriser l’innovation. En outre, les prêts peuvent être octroyés en particulier pour: a) des constructions ou des rénovations de bâtiments liées à l’exploitation agricole, y compris l’habitation; b) des acquisitions d’équipements de ferme; c) des constructions, des rénovations ou des acquisitions de bâtiments ou d’équipements de mise en valeur des productions agricoles; d) des innovations; les projets encouragés doivent être conformes au bien-être  des animaux.Les prêts sont octroyés soit aux propriétaires d ’entreprises agricoles qui les exploitent personnellement à titre principal, soit à des entreprises de mise en valeur des productions agricoles, qu’elles soient organisées de manière individuelle ou collective (chap. II). Le texte comprend 27 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Order No.160 of 1994 of the Ministry of Natural Resources regarding validation of the Instructions on the organization and carrying out state control over the use and protection of land by the bodies of the Ministry.
Policy_Content: The Minister orders to validate the Instructions. Structural bodies of the central office of the Ministry and its territorial agencies must adopt for guidance and application the aforesaid Regulation. The present Instructions regulate the activity of the bodies of the Ministry of Natural Resources as regards the organization and carrying out state control over the use and protection of land. Territorial agencies of the Ministry in addition to the present Instructions can validate the necessary instructive and methodical documents and give clarifications as regards carrying out state control over the use and protection of land taking into account the peculiarities of legal and normative acts of the subjects of the Russian Federation. The document consists of 12 Sections and contains 17 Annexes. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the rights and the duties of the officials carrying out state control. Section 3 regards the organization of state control over the use and protection of land. Section 4 regards legalization of the documentation in case of exposure of the infringements of land legislation. Section 5 deals with examination of cases of the infringement of land legislation. Section 6 establishes the modalities of appeal against administrative sanction for the infringement of land legislation. Section 7 concerns execution of sanctions regarding imposition of fine. Section 8 establishes the modalities of forwarding materials regarding the decision-making about penal prosecution or disciplinary liability of the infringers of land legislation. Section 9 establishes the modalities of appeal against illegitimate decisions regarding expropriation and concession of the plots of land. Section 10 establishes the modalities of reimbursement of damages caused by the infringement of land legislation. Section 11 establishes the modalities of forwarding materials regarding the infringement of land legislation to courts and arbitration tribunals. Section 12 regards record keeping and drawing up reports regarding carrying out state control over the use and protection of land.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Leasing Law.
Policy_Content: This Law governs lease agreements, including the rights, obligations and performance of the Parties. Leases shall comprise contracts for the temporary and paid tenure and use of land or other natural resources for the purpose of establishing an independent business, or for other purposes stipulated by law. Any owner of property or his representative may lease the property. Any natural person or group of persons or legal entity may be the lessee. Lease agreements shall determine the method of leasing the property, such as competition or auction. The lease agreement shall determine: (a) the cost and the content of the property; (b)  use of property; (c) lease term, cost and method of payment; (d) the rights and obligations of the Parties; (e) the conditions of the lease and for returning the property after its expiration.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan regarding the delimitation of authority in the sphere of agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan have agreed as follows: 1) The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan will interact in all the main issues regarding the development of agro-industrial complex. 2) The Government of the Russian Federation: shall carry out coordination of the elaboration and realization of federal programs, introduction of large-scale scientific and technical innovative arrangements in all branches of agro-industrial complex; shall include the Republic of Bashkortostan into the Common Russian centralised program for the prevention and liquidation of quarantine and dangerous animal disease, carrying out veterinary scientific research, provision with national and imported preparations and veterinary equipment, their standardization and certification, authorization for manufacturing and trade of the aforesaid preparations and equipment, delivery of pedigree cattle in accordance with the request of the Republic of Bashkortostan; shall elaborate common Regulation on agricultural inspections, improve State Standards, branch standards, technical requirements and other technical and normative documentation in the sphere of agro-industrial production; shall carry out the program of state support of the producers of agricultural commodities; shall contribute to the delivery of raw materials, additives and components for the processing industry. 3). The Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan: shall provide for stable development of agro-industrial complex and the increase of the manufacturing of agricultural commodities under conditions of market economy, creation of the necessary organizational and economic conditions for more efficient functioning of agro industrial complex on the basis of development of various forms of property and economic activity; shall carry out delivery of agricultural commodities (grain, meat and dairy products), to the federal fund on contractual basis at free market prices; shall ensure rational use of finances and resources transferred from federal sources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Agreement No. of 1994 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan regarding economic development.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan have agreed as follows: 1). The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan, coming out in favour of broadening mutual ties, confirm the necessity of carrying out joint special complex programs in the field of ecology. Regulation of financial issues pertaining to financing of the aforesaid programs is carried out by mutual agreement between the Parties. 2). The Parties recognize that the Republic of Bashkortostan is entitled to exercise control on its territory over extraction and trade of natural resources in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation. 3). The Parties, proceeding from the integrity and indivisibility of environment, shall co-ordinate the arrangements for the prevention of ecological disasters, shall jointly elaborate common complex approach to the valuation of the state of environment, shall undertake measures for the its stabilization and protection and shall render mutual assistance for the liquidation of the consequences of ecological and other types of disaster.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy_Content: This Decree-Law approves the assistance program for the development of agricultural and forestry sectors. It consists of 17 articles specifying the requirements for obtaining financial subsidies in order to modernize the aforementioned sectors.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan regarding the delimitation of authority and mutual delegation of powers in the sphere of environmental protection and management of natural resources.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan, recognizing their responsibility in the field of environmental protection and ensuring rational use of natural resources have agreed as follows: 1). The Parties shall carry out co-ordinated policy in the field of environmental protection and ensuring ecological safety. 2). In particular the Parties shall elaborate and carry out jointly programs and projects in the field of environmental protection, ensuring rational nature management and ecological safety; improve legislation, normative legal acts and standards in the field of environmental protection and regulation of management of natural resources; to determine scientifically grounded limits of involvement of natural resources into economic activity and limits of admissible of their irretrievable withdrawal; carry out state ecological expertise of the programs of development of productive forces, investment projects and decisions regarding economic activity; to make arrangements regarding repopulation of wildlife and plant species and reproduction of biodiversity; keep state Red Books (registers of protected species). 3). State executive bodies of the Republic of Bashkortostan in accordance with federal and regional legislation and specific agreements determine the modalities of management of specific natural resources, their protection, including rate setting, quota setting, licensing, environmental fees, registration and valuation of the stock of natural resources.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret nº 94-1165 portant approbation des statuts-types des groupements interprofessionnels dans le secteur agricole et agro-alimentaire.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte approbatipon des statuts-types des groupements interprofessionnels dans le secteur agricole et agro-alimentaire. Il s'agit de personnes morales d'intérêt économique public, dotées de la personnalité civile et de l'autonomie financière, auxquelles adhèrent les producteurs agricoles et les transformateurs ou exportateurs de produits agricoles ou agro-alimentaires. Les missions spécifiques de chaque groupement ainsi que son organisation administrative et financière et les modalités de son contrôle sont fixées par des statuts qui doivent être conformes aux statuts-type fixé par ce décret. Le décret est formé par 23 articles répartis en 6 chapitres: Dispositions générales (I), fixant la durée, le siège et les missions spécifiques du groupement; Adhérents, fixant les obligatios et les droits des membres (II); Organisation administrative(III); Dispositions financières (IV); Contrôle et tutelle (V); Dispositions diverses (VI).

Policy: Law on Local Governments (1994)
Policy_Content: This Law sets out the general provisions and economic basis for the activities of the local governments of Latvia, the competence of local governments, the rights and responsibilities of city or municipality councils and their institutions, as well as of the chairpersons of city or municipality councils, the relations of local governments with the Cabinet and ministries, as well as the general provisions for relations among local governments. A local government is a local administration which, through bodies of representatives elected by citizens – city or municipality council – and authorities and institutions established by them, ensures the performance of the functions prescribed by law, as well as the performance of tasks assigned by Cabinet according to the procedures specified by law, and local government voluntary initiatives, observing the interests of the State and of the residents of the relevant administrative territory. The Law further provides for competence of local governments; city or municipality councils; organisation of the work of city or municipality councils; standing committees; chairpersons of city or municipality councils; local government administration; control of local government financial and economic activity; economic basis; local governments and the cabinet; dismissal of a city or municipality council and its chairperson; and co-operation among local governments.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Local government,Public land,Land-use planning,Governance,Procedural matters,Urban land,Land tenure,Lease,Agricultural land
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi n° 23/94/ADP portant Code de la Santé publique
Policy_Content: La présente loi définit les droits et les devoirs inhérents à la protection et à la promotion de la santé de la population. Notamment, le Code prévoit que les mesures destinées à prévenir la pollution des eaux potables sont déterminées par arrêté conjoint des Ministres chargés de la Santé, de l’Eau, de l’Environnement et des Forêts. Il peut être pris notamment un arrêté portant déclaration d’utilité publique, à l’effet de déterminer en même temps que les terrains à acquérir en pleine propriété, un périmètre de protection contre la pollution d’une source, d’une nappe d’eau souterraine ou superficielle ou d’un cours d’eau fournissant de l’eau potable. Les Communes peuvent également demander l’établissement d’un périmètre de protection pour les ouvrages existants de captage et pour les installations d’amenée et de distribution des eaux servant l’alimentation. Quiconque offre au public de l’eau en vue de la boisson ou de l’alimentation humaine, à titre onéreux ou à titre gratuit et sous quelque forme que ce soit y compris la glace alimentaire, est tenu de s’assurer que cette eau est conforme aux normes de potabilité réglementaire. Est interdite, pour la préparation et la conservation de toutes denrées et marchandises destinées à l’alimentation, l’utilisation d’eau non potable.
Subject: Livestock, Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Cultivated plants, Water, Waste & hazardous substances, General

Policy: Accord de coopération entre les Régions bruxelloise, flamande et wallonne en matière de surveillance des émissions atmosphériques et de structuration des données.
Policy_Content: Un accord de coopération entre les Régions bruxelloise, flamande et wallonne en matière de surveillance des émissions atmosphériques et de structuration des données. Il a pour but d'organiser sur une base permanente la coopération interrégionale et notamment: la concertation dans la gestion des réseaux de mesure Air; le maintien d'une base scientifique commune en ce qui concerne l'enregistrement, l'interprétation des données et l'élaboration de rapports en matière de pollution atmosphérique; le développement et la gestion d'une structure permanente de collecte des données régionales. Le texte comprend 20 articles répartis en 3 chapitres comme suit: Principes (Ier); Coopération interrégionale (II); Dispositions finales (III). Deux annexes sont jointes.

Policy: Decree No. 39 Of The Government on the system of organization, the tasks and powers of the Forest Ranger Service.
Policy_Content: The Forest Ranger Service is the specialized body to enforce legislation on the management and protection of forests. It is organized as follows: the Forest Ranger Department is directly attached to the Ministry of Forestry; in a woodland province, the Forest Ranger Sub-Department is directly attached to the Provincial People's Committee; in the woodland districts, towns and cities directly attached to the province the Forest Ranger is placed directly under the Forest Ranger Sub-Department. The Forest Ranger Department has the following tasks and powers: to monitor the implementation of the forestry management and conservation laws, policies, regimes, and regulations; to elaborate legal documents, policies, regimes, regulations, rules; to advise the Minister of Forestry on the management and preservation of the protection forests, the special-use forests and the production forests; to guide and help the localities to effect the management and preservation of the above said forests; to assist in enforcement of the laws, and some other tasks relating to enforcement and education. Remaining provisions concern internal organization, financial arrangements, etc.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 7/1994 - Ley de protección ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley responde a una doble componente de tutela ambiental y de asignación de los objetivos de calidad del medio ambiente para el desarrollo económico y social de Andalucía. Esta Ley es un texto innovador ya que atribuye a los poderes públicos la función de tutela ambiental y garantiza la capacidad de intervención de éstos en la modificación de situaciones no deseables estableciendo a la vez un marco de referencia de la responsabilidad de las organizaciones colectivas y de los propios ciudadanos a fin de garantizar su necesaria cooperación para conseguir un medio ambiente sano y adecuado a los intereses sociales. La Ley potencia la gestión de las Corporaciones Locales facultándolas para una acción más actualizada y eficaz en defensa del medio ambiente. La Ley garantiza la asignación competencial y la adecuada intervención tanto de la Administración de la Comunidad Autónoma como de las Corporaciones Locales en su ámbito territorial, instituyendo los necesarios mecanismos de cooperación y de fomento en materia de riesgos ambientales y de prestación de servicios a los ciudadanos. La Ley se estructura en cuatro títulos relativos respectivamente a las disposiciones generales, la prevención ambiental, la calidad ambiental y la disciplina ambiental. El título II dedicado a la prevención ambiental, fija el régimen de las actuaciones a desarrollar por las Administraciones públicas andaluzas en la aplicación de procedimientos y técnicas que permitan una adecuada valoración anticipada de los efectos ambientales de un conjunto de actividades. Los cuatro capítulos del título II establecen tres procedimientos para la consideración de los efectos ambientales de las actividades indicadas en los tres anexos de la Ley: Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental, Informe Ambiental y Calificación Ambiental. El título III, dedicado a la calidad ambiental, se refiere a la calidad del aire, a los residuos y a la calidad de las aguas litorales, y contiene los objetivos de gestión para mejorar y corregir los factores y los efectos que alteran o modifican la situación ambiental en los tres ámbitos. Merece especial atención la regulación del ruido como agente contaminante en las ciudades y pueblos de Andalucía así como especial elemento perturbador de la tranquilidad y el sosiego de los ciudadanos. El texto legal establece además el Plan Director Territorial de Gestión de Residuos, en el que se integrarán los Planes Directores Provinciales, y que permitirá fomentar mediante la cooperación institucional una gestión adecuada de los residuos. Se articula el canon de vertido con carácter progresivo y finalista. Un elemento esencial de la presente Ley es la protección del litoral mediante el ejercicio de las atribuciones en el ámbito de la mejora de la calidad de las aguas litorales.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Institution,Protection forest,EIA,Environmental planning,Environmental fees/charges,Coastal zone management,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Waste prevention,Waste management,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge

Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Hidrocarburos tiene como propósito desarrollar, promover, regular y controlar la exploración y la explotación de los depósitos de petróleo y de cualesquiera otras sustancias hidrocarburadas, sin importar el estado físico en que se encuentren; además, se propone preservar y proteger el ambiente, a fin de asegurar su uso racional y garantizar los intereses del Estado. Se exceptúan de las disposiciones de esta Ley, la exploración y la explotación del carbón mineral.

Policy: Ley Nº 4 - Sistema de intereses preferenciales al sector agropecuario. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece que los préstamos locales destinados al sector agropecuario calificado y al sector  agroindustrial exportador de productos no tradicionales tendrán derecho a un descuento en  la tasa de interés pactada con el banco o entidad financiera prestamista, los que serán  reembolsados aplicándoles las retenciones que efectúen los bancos o entidades por acciones  que dispone la ley. Los Beneficiarios son personas naturales y jurídicas que tengan la condición de productores  agropecuarios, y productores y procesadores de sal del mar nacional. La aplicación de la presente Ley será determinada por una comisión integrada por el ministro de Economía y Finanzas, el ministro de Desarrollo Agropecuario y el superintendente de Bancos o por la persona en quien se delegue la representación.

Policy: Safety, Health and Welfare at Work (Biological Agents) Regulations, 1994 (S.I. No. 146 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Council Directives 90/679/EEC of 26 November, 1990, and 93/88/EEC, on the protection of workers from risks related to exposure to a biological agent at work. The Regulations define biological agents. Biological agents thus include bacteria, viruses and fungi. The Regulations draw a distinction between incidental exposure to a biological agent and exposure arising from their deliberate use. Employers must identify the biological agent to which workers are, or may be, exposed. They must assess the risk, making use of the classification referred to in regulation 2 and the Fourth Schedule, and proceed in accordance with the remaining Regulations where appropriate. Specific Regulations set out action to be taken in Veterinary and Health Care facilities and in industrial processes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 366 providing subsidies for forest plantations.
Policy_Content: This Order institutes a system of subsidies to promote the qualitative development of forests, biological diversity and forest plantations. It also deals with the reforesting and rejuvenation of old forests. It repeals Order No. 337 of 1991.

Policy: Ley Nº 5/1994 - Ley de fomento de montes arbolados.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 3 títulos, 20 artículos y 2 disposiciones finales, tiene como finalidad la conservación, protección, restauración y mejora de los terrenos y recursos forestales de la Comunidad Autónoma de Castilla y León. La presente Ley se propone: a) aumentar la superficie arbolada de los montes e incorporar terrenos al uso forestal; b) incentivar e impulsar la participación de la administración y de los propietarios en la conservación, aumento de los bosques y en la promoción de sus funciones económicas, sociales y ecológicas; c) interesar a propietarios y beneficiarios de bosque mediante incentivos adecuados; d) promover las asociaciones de propietarios forestales para la conservación y defensa de los montes arbolados, especialmente en lo que se refiere a la lucha contra los incendios forestales (art. 1º). La presente Ley prevé el uso del Indice de Protección al Bosque (PAB), que cuantifica su función social (art. 14). Corresponde a la Consejería de Medio Ambiente y Ordenación del Territorio la concesión, inspección y control de las actividades derivadas de la aplicación de la presente Ley (art. 19). El objetivo prioritario de esta Ley es incrementar las actividades de reforestación, manteniendo la diversidad genética. La Ley prevé la subvención de la etapa de "bosque joven", tras la repoblación inicial, con el fin de estimular su tratamiento y conservación hasta conseguir el nivel esperado de "bosque maduro", entendiéndose por tal: 1) aquel con edad superior a 30 años, una fracción de cabida cubierta superior al 75 por ciento y cuyo grado de espesura y estado de tratamiento sean adecuados a la edad y especie; 2) el monte arbolado con proyecto de ordenación aprobado por la Administración y en ejecución, el monte bajo y el monte medio cuando la edad de los pies arbóreos sea superior a 30 años y tenga una fracción de cabida superior al 75 por ciento. Se prevén ayudas por el simple hecho de la existencia de los bosques. Estas ayudas responden a uno o varios de los siguientes objetivos: i) compensar las obras de instalación y adecuado tratamiento del bosque; ii) subvencionar al propietario del bosque; iii) fomentar el asociacionismo de los propietarios forestales; y iv) asegurar la defensa de los montes contra los incendios forestales.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Afforestation/reforestation,Non-governmental entity,Protected area,Subsidy/incentive,Policy/planning,Mountain area,Forestry protection measures,Forest fires,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Forest management/forest conservation

In particular, every producer shall pay to the Commodity Board, for all wood marketed in interprovincial and export trade, the applicable levies fixed or imposed by the Board. The text consists of 4 sections.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Resolution of 1994 of the Baltic Assembly on energy.
Policy_Content: Baltic Assembly proposes that the Governments of the Baltic States, together with experts of the Nordic Council, organize a seminar on Baltic energy issues which could be held in conjunction with a regular meeting of the Energy Ministers of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. Possible topics for discussion to include: electric energy tariff coordination which takes into account the ecological characteristics of the region, coordination of laws on regulating energy production and consumption, alternative energy resources, shelf resource utilization, energy safety and the protection of the environment of the Baltic Sea, and other issues.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Environmental standards,Renewable energy,Hydropower generation
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Agreement on friendship and cooperation.
Policy_Content: The Parties, taking into consideration the mutual interest in strengthening cooperation in the ecological sphere have agreed as follows: 1) To abstain from any action that may cause ecological damage to each other. 2) To carry out joint ecological programmes. 3) To render assistance to each other in ecological emergencies and environmental disasters.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Methodical Instruction on projecting state biosphere reserves.
Policy_Content: This Methodical Instruction establishes that state biosphere reserves make part of the network of protected areas that shall be managed by either by federal government or by regional authority. Basic functions of the protected areas shall be: (a) maintenance of the regional ecological balance; (b) conservation of biological diversity; (c) conservation of natural heritage; (d) resource enrichment and resources reproduction; (e) conservation and reproduction of genetic fund; (f) conservation of environment; (g) information (research); and (g) education. The first stage of projecting shall be to search for territory suitable for protected area. The second stage shall be to elaborate and obtain approval of state protected area (biosphere reserve) in accordance with the scheme contained in the Annex 3. Decision on selection of the plots of land for protected area shall be made by the local self-government.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 966 - Reglamenta el Consejo Técnico Asesor de Política y Normatividad Ambientales del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el Consejo Técnico Asesor de Política y Normatividad Ambientales del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente. Las decisiones adoptadas por el Consejo no son obligatorias para el Ministro del Medio Ambiente y, por tanto, no constituyen pronunciamientos o actos del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente. El Consejo podrá invitar en cualquiera de sus sesiones a personas del sector público o privado que considere necesarias para el cumplimiento de sus funciones.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law of Georgia on Soil Protection (No. 490–IIS of 1994)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for soil protection. The Law consists of 13 articles: General provisions (Article 1) Purpose of the Law (Article 2); Soil protection measures and methods (Article 3); Use of amelioration systems (Article 3(1)); Prohibitions imposed for soil protection (Article 4); Objectives of state institutions in the field of soil protection (Article 5); Local government institutions in the area of soil protection (Article 6) Financing of soil protection measures (Article 7); Soil protection control (Article 8); Liability for violation of this Law (Article 9); Applicability of foreign legislation and international agreements (Article 10); Definition of terms used in the Law (Article 11); and Transitional provisions (Article 12). The Law states that soil protection is the state-level problem since correct and rational use of all types of soil, including barren soil, saline soil, swamped soil, salt marsh soil, alkali soil and wetland soil are the main reserve of dynamic development of agriculture and of the national economy as a whole. The purposes of the Law are to ensure the integrity of soil surface, and conservation and rise of soil fertility; to establish the rights and the duties of landholders, landowners and the state in the field of soil protection and creating conditions for ecologically clean production; to prevent the negative impact of methods for improving soil fertility which may pose a risk to the soil, human health, flora and fauna; to ensure the conservation of endemic plants to high mountainous regions and conservation of the fertile layer of soil by protecting sub-alpine and alpine meadows; and to support coordination of amelioration services in order to achieve larger and more stable harvest yields. The Law also adopts the standards for permissible concentrations of contaminants in soil.
Subject: Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Agricultural land,Basic legislation,Soil rehabilitation,Drainage/land reclamation,Local government,Financing,Sustainable use,Agricultural development,Public health,Public land,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Fertilizers/nutrients,Protection of environment,Erosion,Farming,Hazardous substances,Mountain area,Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Private land,Plant protection,Irrigation,Wetlands,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for a wide variety of matters relating to oil pollution by ships in waters of Barbados and oil pollution of any navigable waters by Barbadian ships.

Policy: Instruction of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding the modalities of reporting marine pollution (1994).
Policy_Content: This Instruction implements the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL Convention), Convention on the Prevention of Marine Pollution by Dumping of Wastes and Other Matter, the Convention on the Protection of the Marine Environment of the Baltic Sea Area and the Convention on the Protection of the Black Sea Against Pollution. Instruction establishes general rules of reporting, envisaged by the Russian legislation and international agreements concluded by the Russian Federation, regarding discharge or possible discharge of oil and hazardous substances from ships and other objects (floating objects, artificial islands, plants and constructions), infringements of the regulations on the prevention of marine pollution and disclosed pollutant spills irrespectively of their origin. The document consists of 6 Secs. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section II establishes general requirements and principles of reporting marine pollution. Section 3 regards reporting from ships and other floating objects. Section 4 regards reporting from airplanes. Section 5 regards reporting from artificial islands, plants and constructions. Section 6 regards further reporting.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Habitat (Salt Marsh) Regulations (S.I. No. 1293 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement in part Council Regulation (EC) No. 2078/92 on agricultural production methods compatible with requirements of environment protection and the maintenance of the countryside. they provide for payment to eligible persons who, in respect of an area of eligible land, undertake not to use such land for a period of at least twenty years and to manage the land with the objective of establishing an area of salt-marsh in accordance with management requirements as set out in the Schedule. These requirements include: (a) management of the land in accordance with a programme agreed with the Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food; (b) where the benificiary is responsible for coastal defence, the undertaking of a programme of inundation to be agreed with the Minister; (3) the beneficiary shall not use organic or inorganic fertilizers; (4) the beneficiary shall not use herbicides, insecticides, or fungicides or do anything that in the opinion of the Minister would prejudice the establishment of a salt-marsh vegetation. (11 regulations completed by one Schedule)
Subject: Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Farming,Subsidy/incentive,Inland waters,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Habitat (Former Set-aside Land) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 1292 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Community legislation on agricultural production methods compatible with the requirements of the protection of the environment and the maintenance of the countryside. The Regulations provide for the payment of aid to eligible persons who in respect of eligible land undertake not to use such land for agricultural production for a period of 20 years and to manage the land in accordance with the requirements set out in the Schedule to the Regulations with the purpose of maintaining, improving or protecting a wildlife habitat. Requirements include: (a) the beneficiary of the aid shall agree with a management plan for the land; (b) the beneficiary shall abstain from the use of any inorganic or organic fertilizers or pesticides; (c) the beneficiary shall abstain from planting trees; and (d) the beneficiary shall not install new drainage systems and maintain all existing watercourses, ditches, ponds, etc. (11 Regulations and a Schedule)
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Act No. 34 laying down provisions in matter of land reclamation.
Policy_Content: Land reclamation activities represent a permanent instrument intended for the development, the protection and the improvement of agricultural production as well as for soil conservation and the protection of the environment and its natural resources (art. 1). To this end, the present Regional Act sets out new provisions for delineating the land reclamation districts falling within the regional territory. In addition, the Act regulates the establishment and functioning of Reclamation Consortia, which shall draw up projects and provide for the execution and management of reclamation works. The Act is divided into eight Titles. Title I contains general provisions. Article 4 defines the obligations of landowners. The latter shall contribute to the execution of reclamation works, under the conditions established therein. Title II concerns the territorial arrangement and planning on interventions to be undertaken. The regional territory shall be subdivided into reclamation districts to be demarcated by the Regional Council. Such delineation may be modified by following the procedures regulated under article 5. The General Reclamation Plan (to be approved by the Regional Council) referred to in article 8 shall specify the interventions to be undertaken on each district as well as the reclamation works to be executed and shall define the directives to be followed by private landwoners to improve their lands. The administrative functions in matter of land reclamation pertaining to the Region are entrusted by Title III to the Provinces, including the inspection and control functions to be exercised on reclamation consortia and related activities. Title IV, on the other hand, lays down detailed rules regarding the establishment, the organisms, the Statute and functioning of the above-mentioned reclamation consortia. Title V concerns financial planning. Title VI makes provision in matter of execution and management of reclamation interventions to be undertaken by consortia.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Upper Austria Building Law 1994.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Directive 98/34/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down a procedure for the provision of information in the field of technical standards and regulations of 22 June 1998. In particular, the Law lays down provisions relating to building technology and building equipment, as well as to special environmental, health and energy requirements of buildings. Furthermore, the Law also applies to parcel of lands and other constructions and facilities subject to requirements of the present Law. The text consists of 60 articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Land tenure (II); Omissis (III); Construction permit, notification and actual construction (IV); Existing buildings and structures (V); Land registration, real rights, extension of deadlines (VI); Own and transferred field of action authorities (VII); Penalties (VIII); Transitional and final provisions (IX).

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment Notification, 1994.
Policy_Content: The Notification states that new project or expansion or modernisation of any existing industry or project listed in Schedule 1 are subject to the submission of an application and of an Environmental Impact Assessment report to the Ministry of Environment and Forests. Specific provisions are made with respect to the following projects: 1) mining; 2) pit-head thermal power stations; 3) hydro-power, major irrigation projects and/or their combination including flood control; 4) ports and harbours (excluding minor ports); 6) prospecting and exploration of major minerals in areas above 500 ha. The reports submitted with the application shall be evaluated and assessed by the Impact Assessment Agency, upon consultation of a Committee of Experts. Further provisions concern, inter alia, the inspection of the site, the recommendations by the Agency, the public hearing and the decision within thirty days thereafter.

Policy: Resolución Nº 177/94/PE - Elaboración de estudios de impacto ambiental en el sector pesquero.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, considerando que el artículo 134 del Reglamento de la Ley General de Pesca, aprobado mediante el Decreto Supremo Nº 001-94-PE, dispone que el Estudio de Impacto Ambiental (EIA) será exigido como requisito previo al inicio de cualquier actividad pesquera, aprueba los Términos de Referencia para la Elaboración de los Estudios de Impacto Ambiental en el Sector Pesquero que constan de los siguientes apartados: 1) presentación; 2) antecedentes; 3) ubicación; 4) factores ambientales; 5) factores socioeconómicos; 6) actividades a desarrollar; 7) características de los efluentes y desechos; 8) determinación de puntos críticos para el monitoreo; 9) métodos y sistemas para el control de los elementos contaminantes; 10) evaluación de resultados.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 430 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of carrying out by the state forest management institutions of state control over conditions, use, protection and reproduction of forestry resources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes, in accordance with the Basic Forestry Legislation, the modalities of carrying out by state forestry institutions of state control over conditions, use, reproduction and protection of forestry resources. These modalities are compulsory for all juridical and physical persons. The target of the state control is to provide for the observance by all the owners of forestry resources, users of forestry resources, enterprises, organizations and departments which activity influences the conditions and reproduction of forest, as well as by single citizens of the regulations regarding use of forest resources, regulations on forestry, reproduction and protection of forest, registration and accountability, and other standards and regulations established by the legislation of the Russian Federation. The Regulation consists of 3 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 determines the sphere of competence of state forest management institutions as regards state control over conditions, use, reproduction and protection of forestry resources. Section 3 determines the rights and the duties of state inspectors as regards control over conditions, use, reproduction and protection of forestry resources.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Decision by the Prime Minister on contracts for forest protection, maintenance, natural regeneration and planting (No. 202/TTg).
Policy_Content: The contracts for forest protection, natural regeneration and planting must be in compliance with the following requirements established by article 1 of the present Decision: (a) possession of a Land Tenure Certificate according to the provisions of Government Decision No. 02 of 1994; (b) submission and approval of a technical-economic plan or investment proposal; (c) availability of sufficient funds for paying all the costs of the contracts. The allocation of forest land shall be carried out in favour of "State forest owners" (e.g. State Forest Enterprises, State Farms, State Fishing Enterprises, social organizations, etc.) and "contracted households" (e.g. households, individuals, schools, social organizations, etc.). The Decision establishes the contents of the contracts as well as the duties and responsibilities of State Forest Owners and contracted households. It also makes specific provisions regarding the contracts in relation to the different types of forest to which they refer, i.e. special-use forests, protection forests, production forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Law No. I-476 amending Land Reform Law (No. I-1607 of 1991).
Policy_Content: Article 16 shall be amended to add the following wording: “When preparing the land reform plan pursuant to the implementation land reform, the layout of existing or newly designed land plots may be adjusted if it is decided by the meeting of the applicants in the area (district, suburban area, and village). The Ministry of Agriculture determines the procedure for convening a meeting and taking decisions. When adjusting the layout of the parcels of the personal holding or marking these parcels in a new location, the parcels of the personal holding, if they so wish, shall be formed on the holding of the land in which they reside and reclaim the land.” Article 19 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Land reform and land management projects are being prepared and land management work is carried out with public funds. Schedules for their preparation shall be approved by the Ministry of Agriculture.”
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1091/94 laying down certain detailed rules for the implementation of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 3528/86 on the protection of the Community's forests against atmospheric pollution.
Policy_Content: Council Regulation 3528/86/EEC of 17 November 1986 has provided for the institution of a scheme intended for the protection of Community’s forests against pollution. On such basis, this Regulation provides for the establishment of permanent observation plots in order to conduct continuous and intensive surveillance of forestry ecosystems. Surveillance shall comprise the continuous inventory of the crown condition, the inventory of soil and foliar condition as well as measurements on increment changes, deposition of rates and meteorology. The following Annexes are attached: (I) Common methods for the establishment of a network of permanent observation plots for intensive continuous monitoring; (II) Applications for aid from the Community in respect of the measures to be carried out pursuant to article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No. 3528/86 and its amendments; (III) Common methods for the inventory of the crown condition on the permanent observation plots; (IV) Common methods for the soil inventory on the permanent observation plots; (V) Common methods for the foliage inventory on the permanent observation plots; (VI) Common methods for increment change measurements on the permanent observation plots; (VII) Common guidelines for the reporting of the results of the surveillance on the permanent observation plots and their interpretation; (VIIa) Submission of data per permanent plot in a digital format; (VIIb) Details for the submission of background information and interpretation of the permanent plots.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Forestry
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Monitoring,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Inventory,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Subsidy/incentive,Data collection/reporting
Entry into force notes: This Regulation came into force on 21 May 1994.

Policy: NOM-062-ECOL-1994: Especificaciones para mitigar los efectos adversos sobre la biodiversidad que se ocasionen por el cambio de uso del suelo de terrenos forestales agropecuarios.

Las Secretarías de Agricultura y Recursos Hidráulicos y de Desarrollo Social por conducto de la Procuraduría Federal de Protección al Ambiente, en el ámbito de sus respectivas competencias, vigilarán el cumplimiento de la presente Norma.

Policy: Mines Regulation (B.C. Reg. 126/94).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Mines Act. In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to investigation by inspectors. In this connexion, section 2 establishes that an inspector may, during the exploration, development, operation, closure or abandonment of a mine, investigate any matter relating directly or indirectly to the health and safety of any person or the public. The text consists of 1 section.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Law on land taxes (1994).
Policy_Content: The taxpayers for land are the landowners, the permanent of temporary users of State land. The taxes for rented land provided for use is charged from the tenant. The taxable object of agricultural land is the net income from the land defined by an evaluation carried out by the land cadastre. The taxable object of non-agricultural land is the price of the land defined by an evaluation carried out by the land cadastre. The amount of the land tax does not depend upon the result of the economic activity of the taxpayer and is calculated according to defined prices on land surface measurement units that are paid annually. The document consists of 5 chapters that contain 20 articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-2) classifies the categories of taxable objects and tax-payers. Chapter 2 (arts. 3-9) regards land taxation quotas and assessment procedures. Chapter 3 (arts. 10-11) regards land taxation exemptions. Chapter 4 (arts. 12-17) establishes the procedure for the calculation and payment of land tax. Chapter 5 (arts. 18-20) lays down final provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Act No. 292 of 1994, on access to information relating to the environment (Environment Information Act).
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the access of the general public to official documents regarding the environment, i.e. (a) the environment i.e. the state of water, air, soil, fauna, flora, land and natural sites; (b) activities (including those which give rise to nuisances such as noise) or measures adversely affecting, or likely so to affect the environment; (c) activities or measures designed to protect the environment, including administrative measures and environmental management programmes. A request for access to information relating to the environment shall be dealt with in accordance with the rules of section 16(1) and (2) of Act on Public Access to Documents in Administrative Files.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Act amending the Act on the administration of EU regulated organization of agricultural markets (No. 290 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the title from "European Economic Comunity" to "The European Community" and from "EEC" to " EU". It also adds articles related to the Minister of Agriculture's powers to set regulations in the monitoring of analysis results, and in the financial subsidy and payment of administrative fees thereof.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Council Regulation (EC) No. 1017/94 concerning the conversion of land currently under arable crops to extensive livestock farming in Portugal.
Policy_Content: Portugal is hereby authorized for a period of eight years to carry out in the regions referred to in the Annex attached a programme for the conversion of land currently under arable crops to extensive livestock production, up to a maximum of 200 000 hectares. To this end, Portugal shall be allotted a specific autonomous national reserve. Further provisions describe the procedure for obtaining premium rights. The Portuguese authorities must guarantee the compliance with these provisions by adopting measures such as verification of the eligibility of declared areas and checks to ascertain that arable crops are no longer produced on the declared areas which have been duly destined to extensive livestock production.
Subject: Land & soil
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 10 May 1994.

Policy: Law on land (No. 1-446).
Policy_Content: This Act lays down basic provisions on land tenure, both urban and rural. land can be owned only by Lithuanian citizens, or by the State (art. 3). Private ownership of land conveys certain standard rights and privileges, amounting to the free and unimpeded enjoyment and disposition of the owner's property (art. 7). Usufructury rights accrue to the leaseholders of private and State-owned land (art. 8). All "land users" are subject to a number of obligations of general import, including, in particular, the obligation to "rationally utilise and preserve farming land areas of economic significance" (art. 9 and 39), and to make good any damage to the environment (art. 34). Furthermore, the use of the land and changes in land use are made subject to the over-riding restrictions of land use plans (art. 10, 31 and 39). The Act provides for the registration of real estate property and the issuing of written title (art. 12); the types of transactions in land -which must be made in writing- including sale, inheritance, mortgage (art. 13-20); the undivided ownership of land held in common (art. 25-29); the expropriation of private land for public purposes, in exchange for fair compensation calculated at local market prices, and apaid in cash or in kind (art. 32); the future mixing of the maximum allowable size of agricultural landholdings (art. 35, last paragraph); land survey and cadastering services (arts. 46-51); the responsibility of land users -including criminal liability- for failure to abide by legal provisions (art. 53); and the powers of the ordinary courts to hear and adjudicate land disputes (art. 56).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Basic legislation,Land tenure,Foreign land tenure,Ownership,Common property,Right of use,Lease,Agricultural land,Urban land,Cadastre/land registration,Expropriation,Smallholders/peasants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Governmental Ordinance No. 575-r regarding trade of fuelwood on preferential terms.
Policy_Content: The Premier, for the purpose of sanitary state of forests and better provisions of the population with fuelwood recommends regional executive bodies by agreement with the bodies of the local self-government to carry out trade of fallen trees, twigs and branches, and dead standing wood on preferential terms. Federal Forestry Committee is authorized to establish the modalities of the aforesaid fuelwood and carry out control over the observance of forestry regulations in the process of logging and transportation of fuelwood.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 375 of 1994 regarding the validation of the Statute of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Statute. The Ministry is a Federal Executive Body entitled to exercise state management and coordination of activity in the field of environmental protection, regulation of the use of natural resources, guaranteeing ecological security and is responsible for the improvement and the recreation of environment. In regulating the use of natural resources the Ministry co-ordinates and validates the standards and the regulations as regards the use of natural resources and establishes the modalities of economic and other types of activity that may have impact on environment.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Declaration of protected natural environment:  Atherstone (A.N. 124 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Notice, made under section 16 of the Environment Conservation Act, 1989, declares the area described in the Schedule to be a Protected Natural Environment and specifies directions that shall be applicable to the area: properties in the area shall be managed and controlled in accordance with section 16 and 17 of the Act as a collaborative nature reserve and general objectives of the Act shall be pursued on the properties which shall be managed as a reserve with exclusion of any normal or conventional agricultural activities.

Policy_Content: This Andhra Pradesh Panchayat Raj Act, 1994 consists of 278 Sections divided into 8 Parts: Preliminary (I); Gram Panchayat (II); Constitution and Incorporation, Composition, Powers, Functions, Etc., of Mandal Parishads (III); Constitution, Incorporation, Composition, Powers, Functions, Etc., of Zilla Parishads (IV); Conduct of Election  and Election Officers (V);  Finance Commission (VI); Miscellaneous (VII); Rules, Bye-Laws and Penalties (VIII).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 421 validating the Regulation on the state forest service.
Policy_Content: The state forest service shall be the authorized institution in the sphere of forest management empowered to prevent and suppress offences regarding forest protection, conservation, management and use, and also other offences causing damage to forests. The main tasks of the state forest service shall be: (a) to carry out forest conservation and protection arrangements; (b) to enforce forest fire safety regulations; (c) to enforce regulations regarding the allotment of standing timber, other types of forest management and protection of the forest estate; (d) supervision over reproduction, conservation and protection of the forest resources of the agricultural enterprises.
Subject: Forestry
