Policy: Décret relatif à la planification en matière d'environnement dans le cadre du développement durable.
Policy_Content: Décret relatif à la planification en matière d'environnement dans le cadre du développement durable. L'article 1er établit que la planification en matière d'environnement vise: 1º la préservation des ressources naturelles et des écosystèmes; 2º la prévention et l'atténuation des nuisances à l'environnement provoquées par les activités humaines; 3º la prise en compte à l'échelle de la Région de la dimension de développement durable. Le texte comprend 23 articles divisés en 3 chapitres: La planification en matière d'environnement (Ier); Le Conseil wallon de l'environnement pour le développement durable (II); Dispositions modificatives et abrogatoires (III).

Policy: Order No. 116 of 1994 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding setting up of the Russian Ecological Federal Information Agency.
Policy_Content: The Minister, for the purpose of ensuring openness in the functioning of the system of environmental protection, the right of citizens to access to indispensable and trustworthy information as regards the state of environment and its protection, formation of the common policy in the field of spreading of ecological information, decrees to set up the Russian Ecological Federal Information Agency (REFIA) as a Federal State Department attached to the Ministry and to validate the Regulation on it. The document consists of IV Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the tasks of REFIA. Section 3 regards the sphere of competence and the modalities of functioning of REFIA. Section 4 establishes hierarchical structure of REFIA.

Policy_Content: These Regulations of the Council of Ministers provide rules relative to large-scale and small-scale mining operations. Policy: Decree No. 21/94 establishing the requirements to be satisfied by Medium-Agricultural Farms.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the requirements to be satisfied by agricultural farms applying in order to be considered as Medium-Agricultural Farms (i.e. the agricultural land extension must be between 10 hectars and 50 hectars). It consists of 2 chapters establishing classification criteria and request to be submitted to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. Controls on exploitation shall be carried out by the competent service during the first 5 years of farm concession.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Land Amelioration Law, 1994.
Policy_Content: "Land amelioration" is defined in section 2 as "the drainage, irrigation or double-purpose regulation of water conditions, also the application of agromeliorative or land cultivation measures". Another key term used in this Law, "Amelioration System" (abbreviated "AS") is defined as "the complex of buildings and constructions for drainage, irrigation or double regulation of water conditions". This Law makes provisions in 25 sections for the construction, ownership, use and maintenance of Amelioration Systems and the creation of Amelioration Associations. The owner of the Amelioration System is the owner of the land on which the main part of the AS lies. The owner can be a private natural or legal person or a public entity (sect. 3). A State Amelioration Service shall be created pursuant to section 4. Amelioration Associations may be created by landowners or users for the purpose of realizing amelioration programs and for the maintenance of Amelioration Systems (sects. 5 and 6). Sections of Chapter II provide for the construction of Amelioration Systems on one's own land or on land belonging to another owner. Provisions of Chapter III provide for maintenance of the Amelioration Systems which shall be done in principle by the owner of the system (sect. 16). Provisions of the last Chapter (IV) regulate the transfer of Amelioration Systems from the State to landowners or Amelioration Associations.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Land tenure,Right of use,Non-governmental entity,Drainage/land reclamation,Irrigation,Waterworks
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Government Decision No. 181 On approval of the model contract on lease without the right to purchase the property, 1994.
Policy_Content: The Decision contains a model agreement on lease without the right to purchase the property.

Policy: Ley 1551 – Ley de Participación Popular.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce, promueve y consolida el proceso de Participación Popular articulando a las comunidades indígenas, campesinas y urbanas, en la vida jurídica, política y económica del país.  Su objetivo es mejorar la calidad de vida de la mujer y el hombre boliviano, con una más justa distribución y mejor administración de los recursos públicos.  También busca fortalecer los instrumentos políticos y económicos necesarios para perfeccionar la democracia representativa, facilitando la participación ciudadana y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en los niveles de representación a mujeres y hombres.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Arrêté du 20 avril 1994 relatif à la classification, l'emballage et l'étiquetage des substances dangereuses
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté concerne la classification, l'emballage et l'étiquetage des substances dangereuses. Le présent arrêté a pour objet : de définir les informations à fournir dans le cadre des essais et de l'évaluation des propriétés des substances ; de définir les règles de classification des substances dangereuses ; et de fixer la liste et les conditions d'emballage et d'étiquetage des substances dangereuses. Les essais de substances réalisés dans le cadre du présent arrêté sont effectués conformément aux prescriptions de l'article 13 du règlement (CE) n° 1907 / 2006 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 18 décembre 2006 concernant l'enregistrement, l'évaluation et l'autorisation des substances chimiques, ainsi que les restrictions applicables à ces substances (REACH), et instituant une agence européenne des produits chimiques.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regulation No. 25 of the State Tax Service regarding the modalities and terms of payment of the fees for standing timber.
Policy_Content: The use of the forest stock is charged. The system of payment of environmental fees shall include: 1) payment for reproduction, conservation and protection of forests; 2) rent; 3) forest taxes (payment for the use of forest stock). This Regulation consists of 9 Sections composed of 50 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-15) lays down the general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 16-17) specifies the payers of the forest fees for standing timber. Section 3 (arts. 18-20) establishes the sphere of application of forest fees. Section 4 (arts. 21-27) fixes the rates of forest fees for standing timber. Section 5 (arts. 28-33) deals with the modalities of payment of forest fees for standing timber. Section 6 (arts. 34-41) fixes the terms of payment of forest fees and the modalities of calculation thereof. Section 7 (art. 42) concerns the accountability issues. Section 8 (arts. 43 and 44) regards keeping up by the tax inspections of personal accounts of forest users. Section 9 (arts. 45-50) regards the modalities of auditing of payments for timber.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Act No. 31 on organic agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act was enacted to contribute towards the protection of consumers' health, to encourage organic and biodynamic production methods in agriculture, the latter forming part of the former, in accordance with EC Regulation 2092/91 of 24 June 1991, as subsequently amended. In its definition of organic products, the Act refers to article 1 of the EC Regulation and to articles 6 and 7 with regard to production standards. The organic farmer is defined as the natural or legal person who produces, prepares or imports organic products for marketing. Production means the operation designed to produce agricultural products in the state in which they are normally grown on a farm; preparation means the operations of processing, preserving, and packaging agricultural products grown organically; importing means the activities used to acquire supplies of products from third countries. A regional Register of organic farmers is instituted at the Department of Agriculture and Woodlands of the Regional Executive Council. Regional Associations of Organic Farmers comprising at least 80 farms using organic production methods and with an annual aggregate turnover of two thousand million lire, are also recognised. The Act also sets up the Regional Commission for Organic Agricultural Activities within the Regional Executive Council, whose functions include encouraging the development of organic farming, issuing opinions on the recognition of Associations and laying down penalties for them and for farmers, proposing methods to be adopted by the Regional Executive Council to control the Associations, etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 526 laying down provisions governing the Environmental Impact Assessment relative to the prospection, exploration and cultivation of liquid and gaseous hydrocarbons.
Policy_Content: The prospection, exploration and cultivation of liquid and gaseous hydrocarbons are to be subjected to prior environmental impact assessment (art. 2 of Act No. 9 of 1991). The present Regulation makes detailed rules relating to the environmental impact assessment procedure and particularly the application for issue of the permit and concession required to carry out the above-mentioned activities (information, cartographies and reports to be submitted by the applicant to the Ministry of the Environment).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 484 regulating the proceedings for the issue of licences for the exploration and mining of hydrocarbons at land or sea.
Policy_Content: The Decree lays down rules governing the procedure to be followed to issue the exploration and mining licences which are required to search for and exploit hydrocarbons, whether at land or sea. Title II is entirely devoted to exploration licences, whilst Title III regards mining licences. The procedure includes the performance of an environmental impact assessment.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Décret nº 94-903 portant organisation administrative et financière de la régie du matériel de terrassement agricole.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte organisation administrative et financière de la régie du matériel de terrassement agricole, établissement public à caractère admininistratif chargé notamment: de la réalisation des travaux de conservation des eaux et du sol; de la construction de lacs et barrages collinaires; de l'ouverture et de l'entretien de pistes agricoles et forestières; de la réalisation de travaux de défrichement, de sous-solage, de défonsage, de nivellement, de reboisement, d'aménagement hydro-agricoles, de lutte contre les inondations et les incendies; de la vulgarisation des nouvelles techniques en matière de travaux mécaniques de conservation des eaux et du sol.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decree-Law No. 27/94 of 18 April 1994 creating the Rural Credit Bank (CCR- "Caixa de Crédito Rural").
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law creates the Rural Credit Bank (CCR- "Caixa de Crédito Rural") whose competence shall be to increase and facilitate financial assistance to agricultural and fisheries development entities. This Decree-Law is divided into 12 articles approving the CCR's constitution. Article 4 deals with technical and economic agreements between ministries responsible for agriculture and fisheries, specifying the cases in which such agreements should be carried out. The constitution is divided into 5 chapters. Chapter I deals with the objectives of the CCR which include: granting financial assistance to fishing and agricultural cooperatives, as well as credit to third parties. Chapter II deals with the kind of incentives and financial assistance in these areas by facilitating credit for construction, renovation, or any other improvement (art. 6). Article 7 defines cooperatives which may benefit from such credits. CCR must guarantee for the fulfillment of contract obligations of third parties (art. 12). Chapter III lists the CCR competent authorities, specifying their duties and composition.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Urban Planning and Land Disposal Act of 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 64 articles aims at laying out the procedures and institutional responsibilities for urban planning, including the delimitation of town and village boundaries. It establishes that Government land means every land registered in the name of the Government of the Sudan, or any other land not registered in the name of any person, in any of the states of the Sudan. Article 5 estabishes a National Council which shall be subject to the supervision of the Prime Minister, constituted by the Minister of the Urban Planning, and representatives from the Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Finance, and the Supreme Council for Decentralized Governance. The Council has functions and powers regarding urban planning for (i) setting out the national strategies; (ii) coordination between the different concerned bodies; (iii) studies and research, in particular on the use of land for residential, transport, municipal services, and rural reasons; (iv) ratifications of the change of use. While the Ministry of Urban Plannig has the following powers (i) lay down, upon approval of the state Council of Ministers, the housing plans projects, in accordance with the national urban plans; (ii) demarcate the boundaries of any town or village and modify such boundaries from time to time; and (iii) recommend change of the use of public spaces and squares to any purpose, whenever necessary. Article 10 establishes the formation of governorate Committee, assisted by local comitees, for the development of spatial planning at the local level, in harmony with national plans, in particular cities and villages. Article 13 states that the ownership of land may be acquisitioned for public interest under the Land Acquisition Act, 1930.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural land,Irrigation,Urban land,Public land,Registration,Research,Private land,Procedural matters,Ownership,Survey/mapping,Institution,Land commission,Abandoned land/unoccupied land
Geographical_area: Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden, Sahel

Policy: Loi relative à la protection de la population et de l'environnement contre les dangers résultant des rayonnements ionisants et relatives à l'Agence fédérale de Contrôle nucléaire.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte la réglementation relative à la protection de la population et de l'environnement contre les dangers résultant des rayonnements ionisants et relatives à l'Agence fédérale de Contrôle nucléaire. L’article 2 établit qu’il est constitué un établissement public doté de la personnalité juridique, dénommé "Agence fédérale de Contrôle nucléaire", en abrégé A.F.C.N. Son siège est établi dans l'arrondissement administratif de Bruxelles-Capitale. Le texte comprend 54 articles répartis en 8 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Autorités compétentes (II); Des missions de l'Agence (III); De la délégation de certaines missions par l'Agence (IV); Des ressources, du budget et des comptes (V); De l'administration de l'Agence (VI); Dispositions pénales (VIII); Dispositions finales (VIII).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Land Title Regulation 1994.

It specifies the location of offices of the land registry, the forms to be used in the office of the land registry and the fees payable under the Act. The regulation is completed by two schedules, one on offices of the land registry and one on fees.

Policy_Content: This Act provides in 62 articles divided into 13 Parts the principles of environment protection and the instruments to carry out an environment protection policy in the Gambia.

Policy: Government Decision on the use of Sewage Sludge in Agriculture (No. 282 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Decision of the Cabinet Council regulates the use of sewage sludge in agriculture in order to prevent harmful impacts on the environment and health while promoting the appropriate use of sludge. It shall not apply to fertilizer products prepared from sludge, the preparation, quality and delivery of which are provided for in or under the Fertilizer Act (232/1993). Sewage sludge for purposes of this Decision is sludge generated in municipal sewage treatment plants, other sludge of comparable quality and sludge mixtures prepared from these. Sludge shall be treated before agricultural use with digestion or lime stabilization or with some other method capable of significantly reducing its pathogen content and odours and harm to health or the environment arising from the use of sludge. the Decisions provides rules for the composition of sludge, its use in cultivation, sludge and soil analyses, information for users, and the duty of record-keeping of holders of a sewage treatment plant.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Sachsen-Anhalt Forestry Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down provisions relating to forestries in the Land Sachsen-Anhalt. With a view to achieve a sustainable development, the purpose of the present Law is to conserve forests because of their economic utility, their importance for the environment, and in particular as living space for wild living animals and wild growing plants, for the climate, water resources, pollution of the air, fertility of the soil, the image of the country, the agriculture on the whole and their infrastructures and, finally, because of their importance for recreational purposes of the public. Furthermore, a harmonization between the interests of the forest owners and the interest of the public shall have to be achieved. The text consists of 33 articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Conservation and management of forests (II); Protection of forests (III); Special protected forest areas (IV); Special provisions concerning the management of forests (V); Organization and tasks of forest services (VI); Violations and penalties (VII); Final provisions (VIII).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Framework law,Recreational forest,Public forest,Forest service/forest officers,Forest management/forest conservation,Private forest,Climate change,Offences/penalties

Policy: European Communities (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Amendment) Regulations, 1994.
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for the amendment of the Local Government (Planning and Development) Acts, 1963 to 1993; the European Communities (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations, 1989 and the Environmental Protection Agency Act, 1992, for the purpose of giving effect to Council Directive 85/337/EEC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment. The amendments arise principally from the coming into operation of integrated licensing function of the Environmental Protection Agency which includes a role in relation to environmental impact statements for licensable activities concerned.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Nº 23.214/MAG/MIRENEM - Metodología para la determinación de la capacidad de uso de las tierras.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, que consta de 13 artículos, establece la Metodología para la determinación de la capacidad de uso de las tierras de Costa Rica, que es de aplicación obligatoria en la elaboración de todas las estrategias, políticas, proyectos, programas, planes y ejecución de actividades específicas que se lleven a cabo en el territorio nacional por instituciones nacionales e internacionales de carácter público o privado. Se crea un comité de coordinación con el objeto de poder dar un seguimiento, evaluación, modificación y actualización a la presente metodología.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Normas para la importación de tarimas de madera nuevas o usadas.
Policy_Content: Este Acuerdo regula sanitariamente la importación de tarimas de madera nuevas o usadas. Los importadores de tarimas de madera nuevas o usadas para uso temporal en la zona fronteriza, deberán satisfacer los siguientes requisitos: a) inspección ocular antes de ingresar al país por personal autorizado de la Secretaría, la cual se hará constar de manera escrita; b) en caso de detectarse daños por insectos u otros patógenos, que no sean de importancia cuarentenaria, el producto se someterá a tratamiento profiláctico a costa del propietario o importador. En caso de detectarse insectos de importancia cuarentenaria, el producto será reexportado dando aviso a la autoridad competente del país exportador. La importación definitiva de tarimas de madera nuevas o usadas cuyo destino sea la zona fronteriza o más allá de ésta, deberán cumplir con el certificado fitosanitario expedido por la autoridad competente de la Secretaría.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Internal trade,International trade,Forestry protection measures,Pests/diseases,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Expropriation Law – Sachsen-Anhalt.
Policy_Content: The present Law is applicable to expropriation of general property proceedings and related compensation payments in so far as the federal legislation is not applicable. According to the present Law expropriation is authorized only for the purpose of carrying out projects aiming at creating or modifying facilities or institutes for the well-being of the community. The text consists of 41 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Compensation (2); Proceedings (3); Restitution proceedings (4).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 212 validating the Regulation on state environmental audit.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that state environmental audit shall be carried out with a view of control of compliance of economic and other activities with ecological safety requirements. State environmental audit shall carry out the following functions: (a) environmental and socio-economic analysis and evaluation of the documentation regulating economic and other activities; (b) substantiation of the issuance of licences and certificates; (c) coordination of export and import documentation; and (d) preparation of documentation by the results of environmental audit for decision-making by the competent authorities. State environmental audit shall be based upon the principles of legality, scientific substantiation, objectivity, independence and openness.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regional Act No. 28 on forest interventions and the improvement of the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act pursues the protection and restoration of forests and forest areas. To this end, the Region shall undertake the initiatives defined under article 2, which cover, inter alia: (a) drafting of the Regional Forestry Plan and of the Regional Forestry Inventory; (b) phitosanitary fight for the protection of forests and forest plants; (c) equipment and infrastructures intended for the prevention of forest fires and fire-fighting activities; (d) creation of enterprises and forest cooperatives for the maintenance of existing forests; (e) restoration of existing forests intended both for timber production and fruit production. Moreover, the Region encourages the production, processing, transformation and marketing of minor fruit products, such as raspberries and redcurrant. Article 9 prohibits the cultural transformation of areas which have been reforested in accordance with the provisions of this Act. On the other hand, such areas may not be destined to uses which are incompatible with forest uses.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regional Act has entered into force on 28 April 1994.

Policy: Commission Regulation (EC) No. 804/94 laying down certain detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 2158/92 as regards forest-fire information systems.
Policy_Content: With a view to attaining the objectives pursued by Regulation (EEC) No. 2158/92 in matter of protection of forests against fires, Member States shall collect a set of information on forest fires as per article 1 of the present Regulation. Such set of information shall contain at least the “minimum core of information on forest fires” as set out in Annex I. The common-core data shall thereafter be submitted annually to the Commission. Such essential data refer to details of forest fire outbreaks (for instance, date of first alert, date of first intervention, date on which the fire was extinguished, location of outbreak). Annex II indicates the supporting documents for applications for Community aid under article 2 (1) of this Regulation.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest fires,Data collection/reporting,Subsidy/incentive,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Entry into force notes: This Regulation came into force on 19 April 1994.

Policy: Act on subsidy for farming structural development of organic agriculture (Act No. 715 of 1995).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the improvement of agricultural structures, the effectiveness of environmentally- and ecologically-friendly production methods in agriculture and environmental conservation. It applies to investment subsidies granted to farmers for the development of agricultural products. Projects entitled to these grants shall direct them for the improvement of existing methods and agreements between farmers for common agricultural activities and gains. Private owners may receive support for agriculture areas where there is a requirement of afforestation through  improvement of existing forests, including the alleviation of extraordinary damage caused by storms, drought, insect attack or similar.

Policy: Decree No. 194 of the Cabinet of Ministers setting up State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes.
Policy_Content: The Premier, with a view of increase of man-induced technogenic impact caused by mining in mountainous and submontane areas, intensification of dangerous geological processes, in particular of landslides, for the purpose of protection of the population and national economic assets, decrees to set up State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes. The aforesaid Service shall perform the following tasks: (a) identification of dangerous geological processes and forecast of their intensification; (b) monitoring of dangerous geological processes and early warning of the population and state bodies; (c) enforcement of the provisions issued by State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes; and (d) recommendations for rational management of the territory and prevention of intensification of dangerous geological processes.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources

Policy: Order No.41 of 1994 of the State Committee on Nuclear Survey regarding validation of the Regulation on the organization and carrying out audit of projects, other materials and documentation substantiating safety of dangerous nuclear and radioactive sites (products) and production sites (technologies).
Policy_Content: Objects of audit shall be projects, other materials and documentation substantiating safety of nuclear and /or radioactive sites (products) and production sites (technologies). The purpose of audit shall be valuation of the available information on safety of nuclear and radioactive sites (products) and production sites (technologies) at all stages of vital cycle for compliance with legislative requirements of the Russian Federation, criteria, regulations and norms in the sphere of nuclear and radiation safety, instructions of the State Committee on Nuclear Survey. The results of audit shall be used by the State Committee on Nuclear Survey in the process of decisions-making regarding issuing or refusal of authorization (licence) for the respective activity or change of its terms and conditions. In case of negative conclusions of audit the decision on issuing of authorization (licence) or change of its terms and conditions shall not be made. The document consists of 3 sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards organization of audit. Section 3 regards carrying out audit. Annex contains requirements for audit findings.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

The associations issue membership certificates representing not only the interest in the assets of the association but also the voting right and use rights over forests used or owned by the association. Membership rights may be transferred or inherited together with the ownership right only.

Policy: Act on compensation for environmental damage (No. 994 of 2014).
Policy_Content: This Act applies to environmental damages caused by pollution of air, water, soil or subsoil as part of a commercial or public activity listed in Appendix to this document (also disturbance by noise, vibration or similar), which may cause loss of financial and cost amounts and therefore requiring compensations. The Act’s provisions do not limit compensation to injured parties under the general law of tort, contract, or under the rules laid down in or pursuant to other legislations. The Act does not apply to damages covered by Act No. 332 of 19 June 1974 on compensation for nuclear damage.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Act on coastal protection (No. 78 of 2017).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect national coasts to avoid flooding and degradation of land from the sea, fiords and other territorial sea areas. Coastal protection methods take into consideration the following: economic consideration, coastal protection measures of technical and environmental quality, coastal landscape conservation and restoration, recreational use of the coast, ensure the maintenance of existing access to the coast, and other issues of significant importance for coastal protection. The Minister for Transportation shall regulate the Act’s guidance in adherence to sea territory environment protection international conventions laid out by the EU. On beach-shores  and other coastal areas with no coherent turf or other contiguous land vegetation, and on land within a distance of 100 meters from where vegetation begins, the Minister of Transport shall grant authorization of performing coastal protection measures and fixed installations, such as digging, drilling, pumping, suction, or any terrain change methods.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea, Water

Policy: Politique générale du Zaïre sur les catastrophes naturelles.
Policy_Content: La présente Politique Générale du Zaire sur les catastrophes naturelles s'inscrit dans le contexte de la Décennie Internationale de Prévention des Catastrophes Naturelles (IDNDR) et vis à la adoption des mesures pour la réduction et la prévention des effects des catastrophes naturelles et à renforcer la capacité de réaction et intervention des acteurs impliqués. Dans le cadre du IDNDR et pour résoudre les problèmes identifiés dans le texte, le gouvernement se fixe les objectifs spécifiques suivants: mettre sur pied un organe fonctionnel de gestion des catastrophes naturelles, le Programme National de Prévention et d'Assistance Humanitaire aux Victimes des Catastrophes Naturelles (PRONAPLUCAN); procéder à l'identification systématique des toutes les zones à risque; constituer une banque des données fiables sur les catastrophes naturelles; éduquer toutes les populations des zones à risque; et mettre en place, dans toutes les zones à risques identifiées, des moyens de surveillance, d'alerte et d'intervention appropriés.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Arrêté nº 29 MTC/D-CAB/DCI/SACPA définissant la compétence de l'acheteur de produits agricoles.
Policy_Content: L'achat des produits agricoles autres que le coton auprès des producteurs ne peut être effectué que par les acheteurs de produits agricoles, personnes physiques ou morales de nationalité béninoise qui, ayant la qualité de commerçants, procèdent habituellement à la collecte primaire des produits agricoles. L'exercice de cette profession est subordonné à l'obtention de la carte professionnelle de commerçants, option acheteur de produits agricoles.

Policy: Order No. 70 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on main use felling in the forests of the Eastern Siberia.
Policy_Content: The Regulation is a normative act applicable to main use felling in the forests of the Eastern and is compulsory for all owners of the forest stock and loggers irrespectively of their departmental subordination and for inspecting authority. The Regulation is applicable to the forests of the regions of the Eastern Siberia except for the forests of the Baikal lake basin. The forests of the Eastern Siberia are sub-divided into mountain forests and flat land forests requiring autonomous regime of forest management. The present Regulation envisages a system of felling ensuring: a) continual, inexhaustible and rational use of forest resources; b) conservation of forestation conditions necessary for timely and efficient reforestation with precious species on cutting areas; c) conservation of water protection and soil protection properties of forests, prevention of soil erosion on mountainsides. In the forests of the Eastern Siberia depending on natural particulars and end use of forests shall be carried out three systems of main use felling: 1) selection felling; 2) gradual felling; 3) clear felling.
Subject: Forestry, Water

Policy: Law on Nature Protection.
Policy_Content: According to this Law the nature is an important part of environment and is under particular protection by the State. The text consists of 61 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General Provisions (1), Protected Parts of Nature (2), Control (3), Penalties (4) and Transitional and Final Provisions (5). The purpose of this Law is to provide for protected parts of nature, to preserve the exploitability of nature's resources maintaining its balance, to safeguard the conditions for its conservation and development, to prescribe planned actions for preventing any form of destruction. Protected parts of nature are the following: national parks, nature parks, integral or special reserves, forest's park, protected landscape, cultural and natural monuments, protected species of flora and fauna (arts. 3-12). The Parliament declares national or nature parks by issuing separate acts and the minister of Nature Protection and Environment declares protected plant and animal species (arts. 13-16). Main duties of management and administration are assigned to the public institutions under the supervision of the Government or the municipality of the city of Zagreb (arts. 17-27). Protected or endangered plants and animals may not be exported or imported from Croatia (art. 35), as well as new plant or animal species cannot be introduced unless the permission of the Ministry is obtained (arts. 34-36). The main duties of supervision are assigned to the Ministry of Nature Protection and Environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Pollution control,Basic legislation,Management/conservation,Protected area,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Inspection,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 23 April 1994.

Policy: Decreto Nº 150 – Fija Reglamento sobre organización y funcionamiento del Registro Público de Tierras Indígenas.
Policy_Content: En el marco de la Ley Nº 19.253, este Decreto tiene por objeto reglamentar la organización y el funcionamiento del Registro Público de Tierras Indígenas. La Corporación Nacional de Desarrollo Indígena es la autoridad responsable de abrir y mantener dicho registro, en el cual se inscribirán todas las tierras indígenas a que se refiere el artículo 12 de la mencionada Ley.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land tenure,Indigenous peoples,Cadastre/land registration,Traditional rights/customary rights
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Order No. 69 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on examination of applications for transfer of forest land to the category of unforested land for the purposes not related to forest and forest fund management.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the list of requested technical documentation and the modalities of transfer of forest land to the category of unforested land for the purposes not related to forest and forest fund management. The aforesaid transfer can be carried out by initiative of legal and natural persons and requires authorization of the competent state forest institution by agreement with the organizations concerned. In the process of transfer shall be decided also allotment of the plots of land, conditions of expropriation thereof and payment therefore. The Government shall issue final decision on transfer of the forests of I category and the regional executive body shall issue final decision on transfer of forests of II and III categories.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 68 validating the Regulation on classification of protection forests.
Policy_Content: Application for the classification of forest estate by the category of protection and transfer of protection forests from one category to another shall be filed by the ministries concerned, state institutions and public associations and regional forest management institutions. Federal Forest Service shall examine the application and shall make decision within two months from the date of submittal. Protection forests shall be classified in the following categories: (a) bank protection forest belt; (b) spawning area protection belt; (c) gorge forest; (d) public protection forest belt; (e) sanitary protection forest; (f) urban forests; and (g) forests of protected areas.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 940-XII on daykhan farm.
Policy_Content: The present Law determines the basic principles of setting up daykhan farm and establishes the legal basis for its functioning.  Daykhan farm is household-based association regarding association of family members jointly engaged in production f agricultural commodities. Daykhan farm can own land, vegetation, cattle, poultry and bees necessary for autonomous production of agricultural commodities on condition of private ownership (art. 2). Daykhan farm can be set up on conditions of the availability of land stock, water resources and other production means pertaining to agriculture (art. 5). Section 1 (arts. 1-4) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 5-9) regards organization of daykhan farm. Section 3 (arts. 10-15) establishes the rights and the duties of daykhan farm. Section 4 (arts. 16-23) establishes the basis of activity of daykhan farm. The Law consists of 4 Sections composed of 23 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Land Act, 1965 (Additional Categories of Qualified Persons) Regulations, 1994 (S.I. No. 67 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These Regulations exclude from the provisions of section 45 of the Land Act, 1965, the "Counties" of Dublin South, Fingal and Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown as specified in the Local Government (Dublin) Act, 1993, the boundaries of these having been fixed by the said Act. Section 45 places restrictions on vesting of interests in land not situated in a county borough, borough, urban district or town. It prescribes that no interest in land to which section 45 applies shall become vested in a person who is not a qualified person except with the written consent of the Land Commission and subject to any conditions attached to the consent.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Forestry Conservation, Development and Utilization Proclamation No. 94/1994.
Policy_Content: The 18 sections of this Proclamation are divided into 4 Parts: General (I); Conservation and development of forests (II); Utilization of forests (III); Miscellaneous provisions (IV).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Basic legislation,Forest management/forest conservation,Private forest,Public forest,Protected area,Forest service/forest officers,Offences/penalties

Policy: Rules for the Implementation of the Mineral Resources Law of the People's Republic of China.
Policy_Content: These Rules are formulated, in accordance with the Mineral resources Law of the people's Republic of China, in an effort to strengthen the administration of mineral resources exploration, safeguard the lawful rights and interests of exploration licensees, maintain the exploration order, and promote the wise development of the mining industry. The Text consists of 44 Articles.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 011/94/AG - Texto único de procedimientos administrativos (TUPA) del Proyecto Especial de Titulación de Tierras y Catastro Rural (PETT).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, que consta de 5 artículos, aprueba el Texto único de procedimientos administrativos (TUPA) del Proyecto Especial de Titulación de Tierras y Catastro Rural (PETT) del Ministerio de Agricultura.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Act No. 7 of 1994 on insurance and compensation for damages caused by natural events (Nature  Damage Act).
Policy_Content: The Act consists of 26 articles, divided into 4 Chapters: The Norwegian National Fund for Natural Damage Assistance (I); Compensation for Natural Damage (II); Measures to Prevent Natural Damage (III); Entry into Force. Amendments to Other Acts (IV).
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Act No. 7 on the protection against damages due to natural disasters.
Policy_Content: The present applies to the prevention of damages caused by natural disasters, including by events such as slides, storms, floods, storm surges, earthquakes, and volcanic eruptions. The Act obliges Municipalities to take preventive measures against damages caused by natural disasters. For this purpose, the municipality may require the sale of real estate or direct rights over real estate, including the right to prohibit logging or other use, when it is necessary to implement measures to protect against damages caused by natural disasters. The Municipality may also decide to prohibit building and subdivision activities on properties or parts of properties located in areas where there is a risk of damages caused by natural disasters.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: 1 January 1995.

Policy: Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals Code Act 1994.
Policy_Content: This Act introduces the Agricultural and Veterinary Chemicals Code.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Act on Special Rural Development Tax.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to secure financial resources necessary to strengthen the competitiveness of agriculture and fishery, expand the infrastructure in the agricultural and fishing industries, and facilitate local development projects for agricultural and fishing villages.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Keyword: Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Fishery management and conservation,Tax/levy

Policy: Land Bank Act.
Policy_Content: "Bank" means the bank established under section 3 of the Land Bank Act, 1912. The Land and Agricultural Bank is a body corporate and shall be controlled by a Board of Directors appointed by the Minister (sects. 3 and 4). The Board may appoint executive committees under section 7 or advisory committees under section 8. Business of the Bank shall be to advance money to farmers on mortgage or other security and to advance money to other owners for waterworks and other constructions. Money may also be lent to partnerships and joint ventures and the bank may invest in enterprises (sect. 21). Section 34 makes provision for borrowing of farmers for ongoing farming operations. Section 47 concerns money lending to agricultural unions and similar bodies. (75 sections completed by 4 Schedules)
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Order No. 82 of 1994 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding setting up Co-ordinating council of the system of state ecological expertise of the Ministry.
Policy_Content: The Minister, for the purpose of improvement of functioning of the system of state ecological expertise and co-ordination of the activity of expert units of territorial branches of the Ministry, orders to set up Co-ordinating council and to validate the Regulation on it. Co-ordinating council is set up for the purpose of securing cooperation between expert units of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources as regards organization and realisation of state ecological expertise, exchange of experience and elaboration of proposals concerning the improvement of functioning of the system of state expertise. The document consists of 3 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 determines the tasks of Co-ordinating council. Section 3 deals with organization of the proceedings of the Co-ordinating council.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Law on Forest Management and Utilization (No. 60 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the management and utilization of the Latvian "forest fund" which is composed of (1) forest and non-forest land allocated for use or transferred for ownership for forestry purposes; (2) forest land situated on land allocated for use or transferred into ownership for other purposes. Chapter 2 sets out the conditions for the transfer into ownership or for use (lease) of the forest fund. Land users may lease their land for forest or non forest purposes. If land is leased for forest management or utilization purposes, the lease holder is granted non-transferable rights of priority for various activities (listed in art. 32), including producing timber, hay, cattle grazing, collection of forest produce (berries, etc.). A licence to fell trees must be obtained before cutting trees on land leased for non-forest purposes. Forests are divided into 3 categories: (1) Protected forests (nature reserves, parks, etc.); (2) Restricted management forests (protected landscape areas, environmentally-sensitive areas); (3) Exploitable forests (all other forest). Specially protected forests may be designated within categories 2 and 3.
Subject: Forestry, Water
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Basic legislation,Protected area,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Inventory,Classification/declassification,Afforestation/reforestation,Timber,Non-timber products,Timber extraction/logging,Forest service/forest officers,Authorization/permit,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 152 of 1990 promulgating Detailed Rules for the Implementation of Law of the People's Republic of China on Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 7 Chapters divided in 45 articles, promulgates the State implementation of a permit system for prospecting and mining of National mineral resources. The right of prospecting means the right to prospect mineral resources within the boundary delineated in the prospecting permit which is obtained according to the enforcing Legislation. The Decree is divided as follows: General Provisions (Chap. I); Mineral Resources Prospecting Registration and Mining Consideration and Approval (Chap. II); Mineral Resources Prospecting (Chap. III); Mineral Resources Mining (Chap. IV); Mine Enterprises under Collective Ownership, Private Mine Enterprises and Individual Miners (Chap. V); Legal Responsibility (Chap. VI) and Supplementary Provisions (Chap. VII).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Rules enters into force on the date of promulgation.

Policy: Thuringia Agriculture Promotion Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to place agriculture, forestry and horticulture within the economy on the whole, to fulfil its social-political tasks for the well-being of the community and to promote the development of the rural space. To this end it is important: 1) to ensure an efficient agriculture, forestry and horticulture; 2) to promote products of agriculture and forestry, as well as products of horticulture and a wholesome food production; 3) to conserve the rural space intact; 4) to promote the education of people in the rural area. The text consists of 17 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Promotion of measures (II); Promotion of special measures (III); Implementing and final provisions (IV).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Thuringia Expropriation Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law applies to all expropriations where federal legislation or special regional legislation is not applicable. According to the present Law expropriation is only authorized if it serves for the well-being of the community, and in particular: 1) to carry out projects for which other Laws expressly authorize expropriation; 2) to carry out other projects which serve: i) the well-being of the community; ii) schools or universities or other cultural institutions, science or research; iii) the public water supply or long-distance heating; iv) the public waste or waste water disposal; v) the protection of soil, water, air, climate or landscape; vi) the sanitation of polluted soil and water; vii) pipelines to transport raw materials or products in huge amounts or dangerous to the environment; viii) the maintenance of public order. The text consists of 51 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Compensation in general and hard-ship compensation (II); Proceedings (III); Legal action (IV); Transitional and final provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 140-94-AG ─ Procedimiento para el reconocimiento de organizaciones agrarias en el sector agrario.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Procedimiento para el reconocimiento de las organizaciones agrarias (OAs)ante el sector público agrario. El Ministerio de Agricultura reconoce como OAs a aquellas personas jurídicas constituidas por productores agrarios que tengan por objeto promover el desarrollo y protección de las actividades comunes y afines que realicen sus afiliados, así como ser interlocutores ante los organismos públicos y privados. Es productor agrario la persona natural o jurídica que se dedica a la producción, transformación y comercialización de productos y servicios agropecuarios, independientemente de las demás actividades económicas o profesionales que realice. Se reconocen como OAs, las siguientes: a) comités de productores que se organizan en una zona; b) asociación de productores conformada por un mínimo de 3 comités de productores; c) asociación departamental de productores conformada por la reunión de 2 o más asociaciones del nivel anterior.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Erosion Control Work Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to the promotion of the public interest and the development of industries by effectively executing erosion control work in order to prevent devastation of national land and conserve the national land. Article 23 deals with erosion control work by local governments. Article 24-2 lays down provisions relating to international cooperation establishing that the state or local governments may strengthen international cooperation on land erosion control, such as international exchanges on erosion control technology and information, nurturing of human resources specialized in international business and international joint research and development, and provide necessary support therefor. The text consists of 28 articles.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 632 - Disposiciones para la transición institucional originada por la nueva estructura legal bajo la cual funcionará el Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto establece disposiciones necesarias para la transición institucional originada por la nueva estructura legal bajo la cual funcionará el Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA), que se adelantará en forma gradual y coherente, de modo que no se causen traumatismos institucionales que afecten a los recursos naturales o al medio ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 79 of 1994 issuing Regulations for noise pollution control in the public environment.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision is composed of 16 articles. Article 1 defines terms such as public noise, tonal noise, decibel, etc. Article 2 classifies sources of external noise into 4 categories: (a) industrial plants and public works, (b) road traffic, (c) airports and (d) airborne operations of commercial and general aviation. Article 3 defines public noise. For the purposes of this Regulation, the week is separated into 3 time periods: workdays, workday evenings, and holidays/nights. Noise limits for each of these different time periods are given in a table found in Articles 7-10, with each article focusing on a category referred to in Article 2. Further differentiation is made according to location, with acceptable noise limits higher in industrial and commercial zones than in rural residential and recreational zones. Articles 12-16 deal with the taking of sound measurements. Article 13 requires that measurements of noise are made according to the international Standard ISO 1996-1.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decision enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 80 of 1994 issuing Regulations for noise pollution control in the work environment.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision is composed of 6 articles and attached Regulations. Article 1 states that the provisions of the attached Regulations shall come into force. Work stations shall be given a period of grace to rectify their status, according to the attached Regulations, and the Ministry officials shall define a suitable grace period for each station which shall not exceed one year from the date of enforcement of the Regulations (art. 2). Environmental Permits which are issued to new industrial projects shall include noise abatement measures in accordance with the attached Regulations (art. 3). The Minister may exempt the Armed Forces and Visiting Forces from the provisions imposed by the attached Regulations for a limited period, and the health risk for persons to whom the exemption relates, shall be assessed (art. 4).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decision enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decree of the State Minister of Environment No. KEP-15/MENLH/3/1994 on the establishment of the Commission for Integrated Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: The Decree establishes the composition of the Commission, which shall consist of permanent and non permanent members. The duties of the Commission are relevant to the drawing up of guidelines and programmes for the environmental impact assessment of integrated/multisectoral activities. Further provisions establish the criteria to be followed by the Commission for the fulfilment of its duties.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Decree of the State Minister for Environment No. KEP-14/MENLH/1994 on general guidance for drawing up the analysis of impact on the environment.
Policy_Content: The Decree formulates the general principles relevant to the environmental impact assessment and to the conservation of the environment. To these ends, the Decree makes provisions for the assessment at different levels. At a preliminary stage experts and other parties concerned shall lay down a general framework ("KA-ANDAL"), for the purpose of formulating the scope of the environmental impact assessment and assuring its effectiveness in accordance with the human and financial resources available. The KA-ANDAL shall be formulated on the basis of the most significant data collected relevant to the environmental impact assessment. The Decree makes further provisions for the performance of a detailed technical study ("ANDAL"), aiming at identifying the business or activities that may pose a hazard to the environment. The results of said study shall be taken into account for the evaluation of the feasibility of a project and for the formulation of plans on environmental protection. On a more general level, an Environmental Management Plan ("RKL") shall be drawn up, in order to provide main directives, principles and requirements for a proper environmental management. The Plan may be considered under the following approaches: (a) technological approach, which aims at the control of hazardous and toxic substances; (b) socio-economic approach, to monitor environmental impact through social and economic activities (participation of the inhabitants to the environmental management, recruitment of skilled local workers, reduction of import duty on pollution-controlling equipment, etc.); (c) institutional approach, through the cooperation with institutions involved in environmental protection. Further provisions concern instructions for the compilation of the RKL. Attachment IV of the Decree is devoted to the Environmental Monitoring Plan ("RPL"), which may be formulated either for specific situations or systematically on the basis of data regularly collected.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: EIA,Environmental planning,Data collection/reporting,Ecosystem preservation,Hazardous substances,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Decree of the State Minister of Environment No. KEP-11/MENLH/3/1994 on the types of business or activity subject to an environmental impact analysis.
Policy_Content: The Decree lists the following activities that are subject to the environmental impact analysis: (a) activities included in Annex I; (b) business or activities located in a protected area or in a place bordering a protected area; (c) business capable to interfere with the function and/or appropriation of a protected area. The business listed in Annex I shall be wholly or partly subject to a review at least once every five years.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: EIA,Environmental planning,Mining,Pollution control,Radiation,Effluent waste water/discharge,Irrigation,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Decree of the State Minister of Environment No. KEP-13/MENLH/3/94 on the line up and working system of the Commission for Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: The Decree establishes the composition of (a) the Central Commission for Environmental Impact Assessment, and (b) the Regional Commission for Environmental Impact Assessment, whose members shall consist of permanent and non-permanent members. The Decree establishes the consultations to be held by the above-mentioned commissions for the assessment of the environmental impact of business or activity which are under the authority of the Minister or Head of non Departmental State Institution or under the authority of the Governor/Head of First Level Region.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Decree of the State Minister of Environment No. KEP-12/MENLH/3/1994 on the General Guidance for Environmental Management and Monitoring Efforts.
Policy_Content: According to the provisions of article 1, "any plan for a business or activity which has no significant impact and/or whose significant impact can be technologically managed shall be subject to an Environmental Management Effort (UKL) and an Environmental Monitoring Effort (UPL) as required in its licence in accordance with the regulation in force". The UKL and the UPL are not part of an Environmental Impact Assessment, therefore they shall not be assessed by the "ad hoc" Commission, but by the technical institution in charge of and responsible for the development of the planned business or activity. The UKL and UPL shall be made in order to assess the potential impact that a certain business or activity may have on the environment, and shall be a binding instrument for any person involved in the management and monitoring of the environment. Final provisions establish the information to be provided and the aspects to be considered in the UKL and UPL.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Regulation on permitted quantities of hazardous and harmful substances in soil and water for irrigation and methods of their testing.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the maximum permitted quantities of hazardous and harmful substances in soil and in irrigation water.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Orden de 17 de marzo de 1994 - Catálogo nacional de materiales de base para los materiales forestales de reproducción relativo a las especies Quercus robur L. y Quercus petraea Liebl.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden, que consta de 1 artículo y 1 anexo, publica el Catálogo nacional de materiales de base para los materiales forestales de reproducción de las especies Quercus robur L. procedentes de las regiones de Galicia, Cordillera Cantábrica Central y Región Vasco-Navarra y Queercus petraea Liebl. procedentes de las regiones de la Cordillera Cantábrico Meridional, litoral vasco-navarro, Pirineo Navarro y litoral catalán.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 274 validating the Regulation on recreational forest.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates the allotment of the plots of forest for recreational purposes and it shall be compulsory for natural and legal persons and foreign nationals. Plots of recreational forest shall be allotted in the whole forest estate except for protected areas, nature reserves and national parks. The use of forest for recreational purpose can be restricted for fire safety, selection and seed growing, research, nuts collection and timber extraction reasons. Citizens staying in forests for recreational purposes shall have the right to collect wild fruits, nuts, mushrooms, berries and other non-timber products for proper consumption free-of-charge except for areas destined for the organized tourism. Allotment of the plots of forests for recreational purposes shall be granted on charged basis by the local executive bodies for the period from one year to 50 years with issuing of forestry licence.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Recreational forest,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Authorization/permit,Forest management/forest conservation,Tourism
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Patents Act (1994)
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the relations which arise in connection with the legal protection of patentable inventions in the Republic of Estonia. Patent protection is provided for by this Act, other Acts and regulations issued by the Government of the Republic or ministers on the basis of and for the implementation of such Acts. The rights and obligations prescribed in this Act apply equally to natural and legal persons of the Republic of Estonia and of foreign states unless the legislation of the Republic of Estonia or international agreements ratified by the Riigikogu provide otherwise.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants, General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy_Content: This Order establishes auction requirements for selling seized forest products. It consists of 17 articles specifying the requirements and legal procedures for selling forest products by public auction. It establishes price of lots to be paid as well as conditions and criteria to be satisfied under the competence and control of Ibama.

Policy: Mushroom Protection Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the protection of mushrooms. Article 2 contains a list of activities which are banned in order to protect mushrooms, for example, the collection of more than 2 kg per person is prohibited, as well as the collection of mushrooms in certain protected regions is banned. The text consists of 6 articles and 1 Annex.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Orden de 15 de marzo de 1994 - Desarrolla el Real Decreto Nº 1.887/1991, sobre mejora de las estructuras agrarias.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden desarrolla el Real Decreto Nº 1887/1991, de 30 de diciembre, sobre mejora de las estructuras agrarias, en lo relativo a los montos de la renta de referencia, al importe máximo de las inversiones previsto en el Real Decreto Nº 1318/1992, de 30 de octubre, y a lo que se entenderá como inversiones de diversificación de naturaleza agrícola o ganadera que traigan como consecuencia la disminución de la producción final de la explotación en alguno o algunos de los productos incluidos en las organizaciones comunes de mercado reguladoras de producciones excendentarias y no supongan incremento de ninguna de éstas.

Policy: Energy Security Competence Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Energy Security Act 1975 of 20 December 1974 ((BGBl. I S. 3681). In particular, the Law lays down provisions relating to competences of authorities in the Land Baden-Württemberg in view of the enforcement of the afore-mentioned Act. The text consists of 2 articles.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Loi nº 5-94 portant institution d'une taxe unique sur les produits pétroliers (TUPP).
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte institution d'une taxe unique sur les produits pétroliers (TUPP).
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Decree of the Prime Minister concerning the Appointment of the Land Remanagement Committee (Decree No. 42/PM).
Policy_Content: The present Decree establishes the composition of the Land Remanagement Committee as well as its main duties, which cover the establishment of the policy for the management and use of the land and the organization of the activity of the Committee at the province and municipality level.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Law on Environmental Protection and Development of March 1994.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 10 Sections divided into 46 articles. Section I deals with definitions and terms. Section II provides forthe following materials: environmental media protection; water protection water standards and criteria suitable for various uses; air pollution control; allowed limits of noise and vibration; land classification; classification of pollutants; protection of plants and animals, creation of nature reserves; environmental impact assessment of industries; pesticide use control; and waste  treatment. Section III concerns with licences and environmental impact assessment. Section IV relates to disasters. Section V addresses liability and compensation for damages. Section VI deals with legal and administrative procedures. Section VII  provides for environment and development. Section VIII relates to the Fund for Environmental Protection and Development. Section IX contains offences and penalties. Section X contains general provisions.
Subject: Livestock, Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
