Policy: Act No. 549 laying down measures for the protection of the ozone layer and the environment.
Policy_Content: The Act aims at preventing the use of substances that deplete the ozone layer and determine adverse effects on the environment. It regulates the different stages of collection, recycling and disposal of such substances, in compliance with the international agreements and the relevant Community legislation referred to in article 1. Moreover, the Act makes provision applicable to the production, consumption, importation, exportation, keeping, collection, recycling and placing on the market of the substances that deplete the ozone layer mentioned in tables A and B hereto. No authorization shall be granted in respect of installations where the use of the substances mentioned inn table A is envisaged. Chapter II of the Act deals with disposal and recycling. Article 5 determines the functions to be exercised by the National Agency for Environmental Protection (ANPA). The Ministry of the Environment shall plan and implement information and education campaigns as per article 11. Article 13 regards the monitoring of the levels of the ozone and ultraviolet radiation. In case of violation of the provisions hereby laid down, consumers’ associations as well as environmental protection associations are entitled to resort to the competent tribunal in order to obtain the seizure or destruction, as the case may be, of those products that have been manufactured or placed on the market unlawfully (art. 14).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Law on standardization.
Policy_Content: This Law requires the standardization of products to ensure their safety for human health and the environment, conserve resources, improve product quality and provide consumers with reliable information on the product. The State Committee on Environmental Protection shall be the state institution responsible for the management of natural resources and prevention of environmental pollution and standardization in the aforesaid sphere. In Uzbekistan the following standards shall apply: (a) international standards; (b) national state standards; (c) branch standards; (d) technical conditions; (e) industrial standards; (f) national foreign standards; and (g) administrative and territorial standards. The Act consists of four sections: (1) general provisions; (2) normative requirements for standardization; (3) state supervision over standards; and (4) financial issues.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No.905 of 1993 on environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The present Law, together with organizational, legal, economic and educational arrangements is aimed at promoting formation and strengthening of ecological legislation and regulations, environmental protection in the interests of the present and the future generations and ensuring ecological safety on the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan. The document consists of XVI Sections that contain 89 Articles. Sec.I (arts. 1-9) lays down general provisions. Sec.II (Arts.10-13) regards the right of citizens to healthy and favourable environment. Sec.III (Arts.14-22) establishes economic mechanism of environmental protection. Sec.IV (Arts.23-32) regards environmental standards. Sec.V (Arts.33-37) regards state ecological expertise. Sec.VI (Arts.38-42) establishes ecological requirements for distribution, projecting, construction, re-construction and putting into operation of enterprises, constructions and other objects. Sec.VII (Arts.43-53) establishes ecological requirements for running enterprises, constructions, other objects and carrying out other types of activity. Sec.VIII (Arts.54-57) regards ecological emergencies. Sec.IX (Arts.58-63) regards protected areas. Sec.X (Arts.64-68) regards control in the field of environmental protection. Sec.XI (Arts.69-72) regards participation of the population in the field of environmental protection. Sec.XII (Arts.73-77) regards ecological upbringing, education and research. Sec.XIII (art. 78) regards dispute settlement. Sec.XIV (Arts.79-81) establishes liability for the infringement of environmental legislation. Sec.XV (Arts.82-87) regards compensation of damage. Sec.XVI (Arts.88-89) regards international cooperation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Basic legislation,Disasters,Education,Environmental audit,Environmental standards,Protected area,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Dispute settlement,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Liability/compensation

Policy_Content: The Decision provides for the Regulation of the Environment Protection when discarded raw materials (steel, copper, aluminium, zinc, glass, cardboard, paper, plastic etc.) is imported and used in the country as secondary materials not considered waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources

Policy: Official Letter No.04-25/61-5678 of 1993 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding the modalities of calculation of damage caused by soil pollution with chemicals.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the modalities of calculation of damage caused by soil pollution with chemicals, determines the modalities of calculation of charges for the compensation of damage caused by soil pollution with chemicals, including soil pollution caused by unauthorized dumping of industrial, domestic and other categories of waste and covers all categories of land irrespectively of their situation and forms of property. The document consists of 3 sections and contains 4 Annexes. Section I regards the sphere of application. Section 2 lays down general provisions. Section III establishes the modalities of calculation of damage caused by soil pollution with chemicals.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Waste domestic sources,Waste non-domestic sources

Policy: Loi nº 93-120, portant promulgation du Code d'incitations aux investissements.
Policy_Content: Le titre V de ce code est relatif aux investissements qui sont encouragés au titre du développement agricole, et notamment ceux qui se rapportent à: l'utilisation des ressources naturelles disponibles en vue d'augmenter la production agricole et de la pêche; la modernisation de ces secteurs et l'amélioration de leur productivité; la première transformation des productions agricoles et de la pêche et leur conditionnement et les activités de services liés à ces productions. Ces investissements sont classés en 3 catégories: petits, moyens et grands investisseurs. L'article 30 du Code arrête les divers types d'incitations fiscales qui peuvent être accordés et les articles de 31 à 35 portent des ultérieurs bénéfices prévus pour certains investissements, parmi lesquels, entre autres, des primes spécifiques pour les investissements réalisés dans les régions à climat difficile, pour ceux relatifs à l'aménagement des zones destinées à l'aquaculture et des crédits fonciers pour l'achat de terres agricoles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy_Content: This Law amends some provisions prescribed by the Law stimulating the agriculture development (Official Gazette 24/1992, 32/1992 and 83/1992).

Policy: Ministerial Decree № 636 on financial liability for activities that cause forest degradation.
Policy_Content: This Decree shall apply to businesses, organizations, collective farms, related legal entities and citizens. It sets forth provisions on financial liability arising from illegal logging, deforestation, use of chemical materials and waste, construction and grazing. The funds received from penalties shall be transferred to the “Forest Conservation and Reforestation Fund”.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.1346 of 1993 regarding validation of the Regulation on federal system of seismological observation and earthquake forecasting.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. Federal system of seismological observation and earthquake forecasting (FSSN) is set up for the purpose of coordination of activity of state managing bodies in the sphere of ensuring protection of the population, works and territories form earthquake impact and functions as sub-system of the Russian system of forecasting and action in case of emergencies. FSSN is entitled to carry out the following principal tasks: 1. elaboration of earthquake forecasts (including those causing tsunami) on the basis of carrying out and analysis of the results of seismological observation; 2. efficient determination of the place, time and parameters of the earthquakes that have taken place; 3. efficient supply of the federal executive bodies with information regarding earthquakes and their possible consequences; 4. organization of central database of the FSSN and ensuring inter-regional and international exchange of geophysical information.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Interim Instruction of the procedure for the conduct of an environmental impact assessment (EIA) of a planned economic activity.
Policy_Content: The present Instruction establishes that the purpose for the conduct of EIA shall be to determine the economic, environmental and social consequences of the various economic and management decisions under consideration, to elaborate recommendations for the prevention of degradation of the environment or on ways of reducing to a minimum adverse impacts on that environment. An EIA  shall be conducted on the following principles: 1) the social, technical, technological (in the case of a specific EIA), economic and other decisions and indicators of projects decisions should be considered in their interconnectedness; 2) there should be alternative project decisions; 3) the EIA may be used at the very earliest stages of the organization of economic activity and planning (beginning with agreements, contracts, etc.) as an instrument for the decision-making; 4) access to information should be granted to the public at all stages of planning; 5) the commissioner (initiator) of a planned economic activity should be responsible for the consequences of the implementation of project decisions. EIA shall envisage the following stages: 1) review of the state of environment; 2) preliminary impact assessment; 3) impact assessment comprising an analysis of the situation that has come into being, proposals relating to a comprehensive range of nature protection measures and forecasts and concluding with a Statement on environmental consequences (SEC); 4) environmental protection evaluation. The Instruction shall determine the general procedure for the conduct of an EIA in the process of preparation and decision-making on the conduct of economic activities. It shall be mandatory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regulation on the leasing of agricultural land and farms.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Food lays down procedures and criteria for the leasing of agricultural land and farms owned by the Republic of Slovenia and managed by National Farm Land and Forest Fund, the content and duration of the lease. This Regulation applies to farms and agricultural land which can be used for agricultural production. Land may be leased only to nationals of the Republic of Slovenia and domestic legal entities with the majority share of domestic capital. Duration of the lease depends on the type of intended use. This Regulation is composed of 23 articles divided into the following Sections: Introduction (Sec. 1); Subject to lease (Sec. 2); Duration of lease (Sec. 3); Management of leased land (Sec. 4); Procedures of leasing (Sec. 5); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 6).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 24 December 1993.

Policy: Native Title Act 1993.
Policy_Content: The main objects of the Act are: (a) to provide for the recognition and protection of native title; (b) to establish ways in which the future dealings affecting native title may proceed and to set standards for those dealings; (c) to establish a mechanism for determining claims to native title; and (d) to provide for, or permit, the validation of past acts invalidated because of the existence of native title (sect. 3).

Policy: Letter of Instructions No. NP-4-02/200n of 1993 of State Tax Service regarding taxation of sale of the plots of land and other transactions with land.
Policy_Content: The first deputy minister of State Tax Service elucidates that calculation of taxes of sale of the plots of land or shares of the plots carried out by physical persons to enterprises, departments and organizations is done by the latter while in case of sale of the plots of land to the physical persons the calculation of taxes is done by tax inspections that must deliver payment notification to the sellers. By the end of the calendar year the aforesaid physical persons must submit to tax inspections in the place of the fixed abode income declaration. The authorized institutions entitled to certify buying and selling contracts for the plots of land of shares of the plots of land must notify tax inspections of such transactions.

Policy: Ley Nº 100 - Ley de la seguridad social integral.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Sistema de seguridad social integral tiene por objeto garantizar los derechos irrenunciables de la persona y la comunidad para obtener la calidad de vida acorde con la dignidad humana mediante la protección de las conringencias que la afecten.

Policy: Instruction of the Federal Forest Service on secondary forest management.
Policy_Content: This Instruction regulates relations between forest owners and forest managers for the multiple, continuous and sustainable use of non-timber products, and for the reproduction and protection of forests. Secondary forest management includes: (a) haymaking and grazing; (b) apiculture; (c) procurement of sap; (d) growing fruits and edible nuts; (f) growing medicinal plants; and (g) gathering moss, reeds and dry foliage. Natural persons and domestic or foreign legal persons shall have the right to carry out secondary forest management by permit. Citizens shall have the right to use forests for the following purposes: (a) recreation; (b) gathering wild fruits, edible nuts, mushrooms and other foods; (c) gathering medicinal plants; and (d) tourism.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law on the leasing of land (No. I-354).
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the procedure for leasing land to natural and legal persons of the Republic of Lithuania and foreign states as well as to joint ventures and firms with foreign capital, and regulates the relations between the lessee and the lessor. The Law describes in article 2 the concept of lease, prescribes in article 3 the form of a lease contracts, whereas article 4 prescribes the contents of a lease contract. Article 6 provides for the leasing of state-owned land by competitive bidding. Lessees shall meet requirements set out in article 7. Article 12 and 13 specify obligations of lessees including to repair land reclamation facilities, roads, bridges and other engineering facilities and the obligation to preserve the soil and its quality, and to keep land reclamation facilities, roads, bridges, other engineering facilities and green plantations in good order. Article 16 concerns sub-lease of land whereas article 21 prohibits leasing of mortgaged land. The remaining provisions deal with termination of contracts, disputes, and control over compliance with provisions of this Law. (28 articles)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 101 - Ley General de Desarrollo Agropecuario y Pesquero.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley se propone proteger el desarrollo de las actividades agropecuarias y pesqueras, y promover el mejoramiento del ingreso y calidad de vida de los productores rurales, mediante las siguientes acciones: 1) otorgar especial protección a la producción de alimentos; 2) adecuar el sector agropecuario y pesquero a la internacionalización de la economía, sobre bases de equidad, reciprocidad y conveniencia nacional; 3) promover el desarrollo del sistema agroalimentario nacional; 4) elevar la eficiencia y la competitividad de los productos agrícolas, pecuarios y pesqueros mediante la creación de condiciones especiales; 5) impulsar la modernización de la comercialización agropecuaria y pesquera; 6) procurar el suministro de un volumen suficiente de recursos crediticios para el desarrollo de las actividades agropecuarias y pesqueras, bajo condiciones financieras adecuadas a los ciclos de las cosechas y de los precios, al igual que a los riesgos que gravitan sobre la producción rural; 7) crear las bases de un sistema de incentivos a la capitalización rural y a la protección de los recursos naturales; 8) favorecer el desarrollo tecnológico del agro, al igual que la prestación de la asistencia técnica los pequeños productores, conforme a los procesos de descentralización y participación; 9) determinar las condiciones de funcionamiento de las cuotas y contribuciones parafiscales para el sector agropecuario y pesquero; 10) establecer los Fondos de Estabilización de Precios de Productos Agropecuarios y Pesqueros. Para efectos de esta Ley la explotación forestal y la reforestación comerciales se consideran actividades esencialmente agrícolas. La presente Ley a través de los capítulos III (Provisión de crédito para el sector agropecuario y pesquero), IV (Incentivo a la capitalización rural) y XI (El seguro agropecuario), dispone que el Estado subsidiara el crédito para pequeños productores, incentivara el crédito para la capitalización rural y garantizará la adecuada disponibilidad de recursos crediticios para el sector agropecuaria (cap. III); creara el Certificado de Incentivo a la Capitalización Rural al cual tendrá derecho toda persona natural o jurídica que ejecute proyectos de inversión en el sector agropecuario (cap. IV); y concurrirá al pago de las primas que los productores agropecuarios deban sufragar para tomar el seguro a que se refiere el articulo 1º de la Ley Nº 69 de 1993.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Framework law,Special fund,Credit,Subsidy/incentive,Agricultural commodities,Internal trade,Financial agricultural measures,Smallholders/peasants,Basic legislation,Fish products,Aquaculture,Marine fisheries,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,International trade,Animal production,Plant production

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1362 of 1993 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of carrying out state control over the use and the protection of land.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. This Regulation establishes the modalities of carrying out state control over the use and the protection of land. This Regulation is obligatory for execution by all physical persons, officials and juridical persons. The competent legislative and executive bodies and authorized state institutions carry out state control over the use and the protection of land in accordance with the legislation currently in force. The task of state control is to provide for the strict observance by all physical persons, officials and juridical persons of the requirements of the legislation on land for the purpose of efficient use and protection of land. The authorized state institutions that carry out state control over the use and the protection of land are 1). State Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey and its territorial (local) branches. 2). Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and its territorial (local) branches. 3). State Committee of Sanitary and Epidemiological Survey, institutions and departments of State Sanitary and Epidemiological Inspection. 4). State Committee on Architecture and Construction and its territorial (local) branches. The document consists of IV Sections that contain 19 Articles. Section I lays down the general provisions. Section II determines the functions of authorized institutions for carrying out state control over the use and the protection of land. Section III establishes the rights and the duties of officials that carry out state control over the use and the protection of land. Section IV establishes the modalities of imposition of a fine for the infringement of land legislation.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Order No. 273 of the Ministry of Natural Resources regarding validation of the Provisional Regulation on the modalities of issuing licences for the complex environmental management.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 6 Sections and contains 3 Annexes. Licence for the complex environmental management is a document establishing ecological requirements, maximum limits of extraction of natural resources and environmental pollution, and sets the conditions for environmental management. Complex environmental management is the exploitation of natural resources of a given territory in which extraction of a single kind of natural resources must cause minimum damage to other natural resources while the economic activity of an enterprise shall have minimum environmental impact. Licence for the complex environmental management shall contain the following data: 1) data regarding the enterprise in possession of licence; 2) the purpose of activity connected with environmental management; 3) mapping of the plot of land conceded for activity connected with environmental management; 4) the list of natural resources, the limits of extraction or management thereof; 5) the list, norms and limits of emissions (discharge) of pollutants and waste disposal; 6) environmental pollution levels before the beginning of the economic activity and maximum permissible environmental pollution levels; 7) plan of environmental protection arrangements; 8) special ecological requirements on condition of the observance of which the economic activity shall be authorized; 9) terms and conditions of licence and ecological restrictions set by it; 10) liability.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Urban Lands Lease Holding Proclamation No. 80/1993.
Policy_Content: A Proclamation to provide for the utilization of urban land. Urban land is defined as all land within the boundaries of a town (sect. 2). The Proclamation shall not apply to land previously utilized for the construction of dwellings (sect. 3). Section 4 provides for applications of persons who desire to hold urban land in lease. Such applications shall be submitted to the town administration. The town administration shall issue the leaseholding permit and a title document in accordance with provisions city master plans or, where such a plan does not exist, in accordance with regional self-government directions. Also shall the permit be subject to competitive public tendering (sects. 5 and 6). Section 7 pescribes the duration of leases in various areas. The rates of rent shall be determined by a law issued by the appropriate national/regional council (sect. 8). Section 10 makes provision for the transfer of mortgage of use rights, section 11 for the termination of lease agreements. (17 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Decree-Law No. 414/93 approving the Statute of the Institute for Financial Assistance to Agricultural and Fisheries Development (IFADAP).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law approves the Statute of the Institute for Financial Assistance to Agricultural and Fishery Development (IFADAP). The Statute of such Institute is composed of 5 chapters and is attached to the text, specifying requirements to be met by cooperatives in agricultural and fisheries sectors for obtaining financial assistance. It lists in particular duties, competencies and composition of IFADAP.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Ley de Navegación.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 7 títulos y 140 artículos, tiene por objeto regular las vías generales de comunicación por agua, la navegación y los servicios que en ella se prestan, la marina mercante mexicana, así como los actos, hechos y bienes relacionados con el comercio marítimo; quedan exceptuadas de las disposiciones de esta ley las embarcaciones y artefactos navales de uso militar pertenecientes a la Secretaría de Marina (art. 1º). La presente Ley dispone que es de jurisdicción federal todo lo relacionado con las vías generales de comunicación por agua, la navegación y el comercio marítimos en las aguas interiores y en las zonas marinas mexicanas, y que corresponde a los tribunales federales conocer de las controversias, actos de jurisdicción voluntaria y procedimientos especiales o de ejecución en asuntos relacionados con las vías generales de comunicación por agua, la navegación y el comercio marítimos, sin perjuicio de que, en los términos de las disposiciones aplicables, las partes sometan sus diferencias a decisión arbitral (art. 3º). Dispone, además, que la autoridad marítima radica en el Ejecutivo Federal, quien la ejerce a través de: a) la Secretaría, por sí o a través de las capitanías de puerto; b) los capitanes de las embarcaciones mercantes mexicanas; y c) el cónsul mexicano en el extranjero, acreditado en el puerto o lugar en el que se halle la embarcación que requiera la intervención de la autoridad marítima mexicana, para los casos y efectos que esta ley determine. Asimismo, el Ejecutivo Federal a través de la Secretaría de Marina ejercerá la soberanía en aguas territoriales, así como la vigilancia de las costas del territorio, vías navegables, islas nacionales y la zona económica exclusiva (art. 6º).
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Local Government Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 351 sections divided into 16 Parts and completed by ten Schedules, divides the State into municipal areas and electoral districts. It establishes a council in each municipal area (names of each council are specified in Schedule 3), provides for functions and powers of such authorities, for their administration and for other matters related to local authorities. It also provides for the establishment of council committees, of a Code of Conduct Panel, Standard Panels, and of controlling authorities.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 17 January 1994.

Policy: Decree No. 619 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on environmental fees for environmental pollution and waste disposal.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates the issues of determining the payment for environmental pollution and waste disposal and mandatory compliance with its requirements applicable to enterprises, institutions, organizations, regardless of ownership, as well as citizens, performing any type of activities on the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan related to the use of natural resources, and provides for the collection of fees for the following types of hazardous environmental impact: (a) emissions of pollutants into the atmosphere from stationary and mobile sources; (b) discharge of pollutants into surface and underground waterbodies; and (c) waste disposal. Basic standards are established for payment for emissions, pollutant discharges, and waste disposal within the established limits for each pollutant, taking into account the degree of hazard to the environment and public health. Coefficients to basic payment standards are established for districts, cities and river basins, taking into account environmental factors, natural and climatic features of the territory, and the importance of natural and socio-cultural facilities. Differentiated payment rates are determined by multiplying the basic payment standards by coefficients that take into account environmental factors.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Environmental fees/charges,Pollution control,Polluter pays principle,Air quality/air pollution,Waste management,Waste disposal
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Governmental Instruction No.96-rz of 1993 regarding application of the Basic Regulations on mortgage of immovable property.
Policy_Content: Deputy Premier orders to forward the Basic Regulations for registration and application by the ministries and institutions entitled to elaborate normative acts regarding mortgage. Mortgage can be applied to the plots of land, including agricultural land. Till enactment of legislative acts the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey and its territorial branches must carry out regarding the modalities of state registration of immovable property registration of the plots of agricultural land. Mortgage of the plots of agricultural land is permitted exclusively for execution of credit agreements related to agricultural development. Valuation of the plot of land specified in the mortgage must not be lower than normative price of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Act for Greenland relative to hydropower (No. 1075 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Act decrees that the home government of Greenland shall be responsible for issuing rules for the exploration and exploitation of hydropower resources in Greenland. It also concerns the concession of a specific plant already in use.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Délibération de l’assemblée de la province des îles Loyauté n° 93-57/API autorisant le président de la province des îles Loyauté à signer des autorisations de coupe de certains bois dans la province des îles Loyauté.
Policy_Content: Le président de la province des îles Loyauté est autorisé à signer des autorisations de coupes au bénéfice de personnes physiques et morales pour assurer à la fois la protection, la conservation et l’exploitation rationnelle des bois et forêts de la province. Ces autorisations fixent, en accord avec les autorités coutumières, pour une période donnée, les conditions d’exploitation relatives au lieu et éventuellement à la surface à exploiter, à la nature et aux quantités des bois à couper ou à préserver, et aux moyens à mettre en oeuvre pour effectuer la coupe, les engagements de la collectivité propriétaire, et de l’exploitant.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, European Union Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Proclamation on radiation protection (No. 79/1993).
Policy_Content: The provisions of this Proclamation shall be applicable to all sources of ionising radiation above the exemption level (sect. 1). There is hereby established a National Radiation Protection Authority as an autonomous public authority having its own legal personality. The Authority shall be accountable to the Ethiopian Science and Technology Commission. The objectives of the Authority shall be: to render radiation protection services; to regulate, control and supervise radiological work and all activities relating to the acquisition, use, transportation and disposal of radioactive substances, x-ray equipment and other machines capable of emitting ionising radiation; and to promote and encourage research and development in radiation protection. The Authority shall formulate radiation protection policies and submit to the government for approval; issue guidelines, rules, and directives for the implementation of policies concerning radiation protection and follow up their implementation, and have licensing and other powers in the field of radiation protection (sect. 7). Within the Authority a Radiation Protection Board shall be established and a Chief Radiation Protection Officer appointed. The importation, exportation, manufacture, possession, sale, use, storage, transportation or disposal of radioactive materials or devices emitting ionising radiation shall only be based on licenses issued by the Authority (sect. 17). Duties and responsibilities of license holders and other concerned parties are described in section 21. (28 sections)
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Pollution control,Radiation,Food quality control/food safety,Treated food
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel
Entry into force notes: This Proclamation shall come into force on the date of its publication in the Negarit Gazeta.

Policy: Ley Nº 99 - Crea el Ministerio del Medio ambiente y los recursos naturales renovables y se organiza el Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA).
Policy_Content: La Ley consta de 16 títulos y 118 artículos INDICE: Fundamentos de la política ambiental colombiana (I); Min. del Medio Ambiente y Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA) (II); Estructura del Min. del Medio Ambiente (III); Consejo Nacional Ambiental (IV); Apoyo científico y técnico del Min. (V); Corporaciones autónomas regionales (VI); Rentas de las corporaciones autónomas regionales (VII); Licencias ambientales (VIII); Funciones de las entidades territoriales y la planificación ambiental (IX); Modos y procedimientos de participación ciudadana (X); Acción de cumplimiento en asuntos ambientales (XI); Sanciones y medidas de policía (XII); Fondo nacional ambiental y Fondo ambiental de la Amazonía (XIII); Procuraduría delegada para asuntos ambientales (XIV); Liquidación del Instituto Nacional de los Recursos Naturales Renovables y del Ambiente (INDERENA) (XV); Disposiciones finales (XVI).
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: La Ley consta de 16 títulos y 118 artículos INDICE: Fundamentos de la política ambiental colombiana (I); Min. del Medio Ambiente y Sistema Nacional Ambiental (SINA) (II); Estructura del Min. del Medio Ambiente (III); Consejo Nacional Ambiental (IV); Apoyo científico y técnico del Min. Policy: Decree No. 5475-1 of the Supreme Soviet regarding amendments to the Decree No. 3020-1 of the Supreme Soviet.
Policy_Content: Supreme Soviet decrees to give a new wording to the issue 15, that reads as follows: «Government of the Russian Federation can transfer the following plenary powers to the ministries and institutions as regards the objects of federal property, including plenary powers as reads subordinate enterprises: concluding contracts with the heads of enterprises, organizations, institutions, contracts on lease and constitutive agreements in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.’’
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Decree enters into force from the date of issue.

Policy: State Ordinance on Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance provides rules for ships flying the flag of Aruba aiming at the prevention of pollution of marine waters by such ships. In general, it shall be prohibited to discharge a polluting substance from a ship as provide for by the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL). This rule shall also apply to foreign ships in territorial and inland waters of Aruba. The Ordinance also, among other things: requires ports to have certain port waste reception facilities; provides for certification of ships that fulfil MARPOL requirements; defines obligations of captains or masters of ships; and provides for enforcement and inspections.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Inspection,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Enforcement/compliance,International agreement-implementation,Offences/penalties,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, European Union Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decree to prohibit production, importation, exportation, sale and use of growth prevention substances which contain organotine (No. 1216 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment places restrictions on the trade in and use of substances which prevent the growth of micro organisms of plants and animals in marine or freshwater and which contain organotine. In doing so it implements Council Directive 89/677/EC which forms part of Chapter XV of Annex II of the Agreement establishing a European Economic Area. Substances which contain organotine may be used for vessels of length of 25 metres or more. Production of or trade in substances which contain organotine shall be done only with a permit of the State Pollution Control Agency. Substances containing organotine shall be sold for professional use in packings of 20 litres or more. (10 sections)
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: 1 October 1994.

Policy: Decision No. 599 on the setting up of regional agencies for protection of the environment at the prefectures.
Policy_Content: The present Decision provides for the establishment of regional agencies which shall be entrusted with functions and tasks in the field of environmental protection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Native Title (Queensland) Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the title of native people, Aboriginal people and Torres Strait Islanders, to land in Queensland. It consists of 146 sections and is divided into five Parts. Part 2 is dedicated to validation and its effects, Part 3 concerns the confirmation of certain rights, in particular the ownership of certain natural resources and certain water and fishing access rights and public access to and enjoyment of beaches and certain other places. Part 4 covers the confirmation of total or partial extinguishment of native title by previous acts and the fifth Part contains miscellaneous provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Traditional rights/customary rights,Access right,Registration,Indigenous peoples,Land tenure
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: Ss 1-2 of this Act enter into force on 17 December 1993. Remaining provisions from 28 November 1994.

Policy: Reglamento del Sistema Nacional de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento tiene como objetivo organizar, coordinar y regular el Sistema Nacional de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental (SINEIA), estableciendo los nexos entre la Secretaría del Ambiente, las entidades de los sectores públicos privados e internacionales.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Order No.268 of 1993 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding validation of the Regulation on specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area.
Policy_Content: The minister orders to validate the Regulation. Specialized marine inspection of Koryak autonomous region is a sub-division of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources established for the purpose of protection, regulation and control over the use of marine area and natural resources (including stock of fish) of internal sea, territorial sea, continental shelf and EEZ of the Russian Federation adjoining the territory of Koryak Autonomous Area, and, as regards the stock of anadromous fish, forming in the rivers of the Russian Federation, also outside EEZ of the Russian Federation, prevention of marine pollution from foreign and Russian vessels. The document consists of 7 Sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 establishes the main tasks of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area. Section 3 determines function of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area. Section 4 establishes the rights of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area. Section 5 regards material and technical basis of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area. Section 6 regards management of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area. Section 7 regards cessation of activity of specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Koryak Autonomous Area.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Continental shelf,Inspection,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,Territorial sea,Diadromous fish
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Order No. 264 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of cooperation of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and its territorial (local) branches in the sphere of organization of protected areas.
Policy_Content: Territorial branches of the Ministry of Environmental Protection at the regional level shall set up specialized units for the purpose of organization and management of protected areas. Setting up of new protected areas, nature reserves and national parks shall be carried out in conformity with the regional schemes validated by the regional executive bodies of RF subjects. The Regulation consists of 7 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the modalities of carrying out cooperation in the sphere of setting up new national parks and protected areas. Section 3 determines the modalities of carrying out cooperation in the sphere of management of protected areas. Section 4 determines the modalities of carrying out cooperation in the field of control over the functioning of national parks and protected areas that do not make part of the system of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources. Section 5 establishes the modalities of cooperation in the field of keeping up cadastre of protected areas. Section 6 regards the modalities of ensuring legal foundations for the functioning of protected areas. Section 7 establishes the modalities of carrying out cooperation in the field of professional preparation and raising the level of professional skill of the personnel.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Forestry Agency Act (No. 1169 of 1993).
Policy_Content: The Forestry Agency is established within the administration of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry. As far as matters of environment protection and nature conservation are concerned, the Agency will report to the Ministry of Environment (sect. 1). The Agency shall in general take all possible measures to protect natural resources and biodiversity and shall in particular carry out all tasks entrusted to it by various laws including the Fisheries Act (286/82), the Act regulating hunting (615/93) and the Water Act (264/61) (sect. 2). The Agency holds in property national reserves and other public areas (sect. 6). The Agency shall be led by a Board of Directors (sect. 11). Section 11 regulates the transfer of rights and obligations from the old Agency to the Agency established under the present Act. (17 sections)
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 January 1994.

Policy: Genetic Technology Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is: 1) taking into account ethical values to protect the life and health of people, environment, animals, plants against harmful effects resulting from genetic manipulations; 2) to allow that products, in particular foodstuffs and feedstuffs, be produced and put on the market traditionally and ecologically, or, as the case may be, using genetically modified organisms; 3) to create the legal framework for the exploration, development, use and promotion of the scientific, technical and economic avenues of genetic technology. The text consists of 42 articles divided into 7 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Genetic engineering works in special facilities (II); Releasing and placing on the market (III); Common provisions (IV); Provisions concerning liability (V); Penalties (VI); Transitional and final provisions (VII).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Loi d'application de la loi fédérale sur le droit foncier rural.
Policy_Content: La présente loi met en exécution la loi fédérale du 4 octobre 1991 sur le droit foncier rural. L’article 7 établit que tout morcellement d'immeubles situés en zone agricole qui a pour effet de créer des parcelles d'une superficie inférieure à 25 ares est interdit. Cette surface est réduite à 15 ares pour les parcelles incorporées dans le cadastre viticole.(1) Des autorisations exceptionnelles peuvent toutefois être accordées par l'autorité compétente pour justes motifs, au sens des articles 59 et 60 de la loi fédérale, et si aucun intérêt prépondérant de l'agriculture n'est lésé. Le morcellement d'immeubles situés en zone agricole ayant fait l'objet d'un remaniement parcellaire est soumis aux prescriptions de l'article 89 de la loi sur les améliorations foncières, du 5 juin 1987. L’article 10 spécifie que la commission foncière agricole est compétemte pour: a) accorder les exceptions aux interdictions de partage matériel et de morcellement (art. 60 de la loi fédérale); b) autoriser l'acquisition d'une entreprise ou d'un immeuble agricole (art. 61 à 65 de la loi fédérale);c) fixer la charge maximale et requérir son inscription au registre foncier;  d) autoriser les prêts qui dépassent la charge maximale. Le texte comprend 15 articles répartis en 3 chapitres.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Farming,Agricultural development,Land consolidation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Court/tribunal,Land tenure,Subdivision of land,Cadastre/land registration,Smallholders/peasants,Size
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente loi entre en vigueur le 12 février 1994.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 2162 of 1993 regarding reinforcement of the State control over the use and the protection of land for the period of land reform.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that for the period preceding the adoption of the basic land legislation, physical and juridical persons and public officials are committed to civil liability for the following offences in the field of land administration: for the infringement of legal and administrative procedures in urban construction documentation that caused land squatting; for the infringement in the use of land destined for environmental protection, national parks and recreational purpose; for irrational use of agricultural land and lack of protective measures for soil conservation; for dodging the fulfilment of the regulations of the land institutions. The Government establishes the competence of public administration in imposing sanctions against infringers.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land reform,Land consolidation,Land tenure,Transfer,Public land,Subdivision of land,Right of use,Policy/planning,Traditional rights/customary rights,Ownership,Cadastre/land registration,Land commission,Institution,Agricultural land,Urban land,Use restrictions,Vested rights/existing rights,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 2144 regarding federal natural resources.
Policy_Content: The President decrees, in accordance with the legislation currently in force, to introduce the differentiation of the state property on natural resources by designation of federal natural resources. Federal natural resources include land, water, forest, subsoil, wildlife species and plant variety of national importance.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Classification/declassification,Public forest,Public land,Water rights,Wild flora,Wild fauna
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Presidential Decree enters into force on the date of signature.

Policy: Act No. 1614 on the Antarctic.
Policy_Content: This Act is designed to protect the environment of the Antarctic and the eco-systems dependent upon, or linked to it. It applies to Swedish nationals and foreign nationals living in Sweden, who carry out expeditions or perform activities requiring authorization in the Antarctic. For the purposes of protecting wildlife, flora and the eco-systems in the Antarctic, the Act prohibits (i) prospecting, extracting or processing mineral resources, except for properly authorized scientific research; (ii) carrying out atomic explosions and disposing of nuclear waste; (iii) collecting or damaging wild fauna and flora, except for scientific purposes and only under licence. The Act also regulates activities which are not wholly prohibited. For example, permits are made compulsory for importing plants and animals, and lays down provisions to control marine pollution. It also makes provision for the future adoption of legislation governing waste treatment, authorizing visits to protected areas, issuing permits, and conducting environmental impact assessments.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Marine pollution,Ecosystem preservation,Protected area,Marine area,EIA,Management/conservation,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Return of and Compensation for Land Expropriated for USSR Military Bases Act (1993)
Policy_Content: The Act regulates return of and compensation for land expropriated for USSR Military Bases in Estonia. It stipulates that the land expropriated by the Republic of Estonia during the period between September 1939 and 23 July 1940 for USSR military bases shall be returned or compensated for to the persons whose land was expropriated or to the successors thereof, regardless of the manner in which the land was expropriated. Such land must be returned with all the buildings and structures situated on the land at the time of expropriation, if they have preserved.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Act No. 15 setting up the Regional Agency for Agricultural Development and Services (ARSSA).
Policy_Content: This Regional Act has provided for the establishment of the Regional Agency for Agricultural Development and Services (ARSSA), a regional body which shall operate to pursue the modernization and enhancement of the agricultural production system in the Calabria Region. In particular, the ARSSA shall undertake initiatives to promote the use of organic production techniques, experimentation, creation of research centres. It shall also provide technical assistance as well as arrange and coordinate the agricultural development services envisaged by Regional Act No. 11 of 1992.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regional Act entered into force on 18 December 1993.

Policy: Environmental Bill of Rights, 1993 (S.O.1993, c. 28).
Policy_Content: The purposes of the present Act are: a) to protect, conserve and, where reasonable, restore the integrity of the environment; b) to provide sustainability of the environment; and c) to protect the right to a healthful environment. In particular, it aims at: a) the prevention, reduction and elimination of the use, generation and release of pollutants that are an unreasonable threat to the integrity of the environment; b) the protection and conservation of biological, ecological and genetic diversity; c) the protection and conservation of natural resources, including plant life, animal life and ecological systems; d) the encouragement of the wise management of our natural resources, including plant life, animal life and ecological systems. The Act consists of 121 articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: Definitions and purposese (I); Public participation in government decision-making general (II); The Environmental Commission (III); Application for review (IV); Application for investigation (V); Right to sue (VI); Employer reprisals (VII); General (VIII).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Framework law,Pollution control,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Liability/compensation,Air quality/air pollution,Biosphere reserves,Cultural heritage,Soil pollution/quality,EIA,Dispute settlement,Education,Emissions,Institution,Offences/penalties,Protected area,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Joint Regulation No. NP-4-02/199n of the Ministry of Finance, Federal Treasury Service and Federal Forest Service regarding the main provisions on the modalities and conditions of collecting forest taxes.
Policy_Content: Forest taxes are imposed on all users of forestry resources except for lease-holders. Forest taxes on preferential terms are established by the Article 73 of the Basic Forestry Legislation. Forest taxes are the fees collected for: standing timber; harvest of soft resin, non-timber products, haymaking, pasturage, industrial harvest of arboreal juices, picking of wild fruits, berries, mushrooms, medicinal herbs, technical raw materials, placing of bee-hives and apiaries and other types of secondary forest use; use of forestry resources for hunting; use of forestry resources for recreation, tourism and sport. Forest taxes include the fees for the use of land of the forest stock.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Joint Official Letter No.11-31/627 of Chief State Expertise attached to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and No.12-04-02/523 of the Federal Fisheries Committee regarding interaction and differentiation of functions of expert divisions of the Ministry for Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and the Federal Fisheries Committee in the process of expertise of pre-projecting documentation of economic and other types of activity.
Policy_Content: Fisheries expertise of pre-projecting documentation of economic and other types of activity is aimed at ensuring maximum conservation of aquatic biodiversity and is integral part of state ecological expertise. Fisheries institutions carry out fisheries expertise or take part in the process of carrying out state ecological expertise as regards development schemes and the distribution of productive forces, territorial complex schemes of environmental protection, schemes of complex use of water, land and other natural resources and pre-projecting documentation of economic and other types of activity. Expert resolutions of the fisheries expertise must be forwarded to Chief State Expertise attached to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources or its territorial branches for subsequent examination with the participation of fisheries inspection that had submitted expert resolution and must be taken into account in the process of elaboration of the summary resolution of state ecological expertise.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 328 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on reforestation and afforestation in forest-steppe, steppe, dryland steppe and semi-desert areas of the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: The main protection and conservation arrangements in forest-steppe, steppe, dryland steppe and semi-desert areas shall be to create protection forests on agricultural land and creating plantations on sand and pastures. This Order establishes the basic arrangements for natural and artificial afforestation and reforestation in the cleared spaces, fire-sites, light forests and glades, methods and technology of forest plantations on non-forested land of forest estate and protection forest on agricultural land. The purpose of the Order shall be to ensure afforestation, reforestation and creation of protection forest belts on in accordance with scientifically substantiated methods with the consideration of local climatic conditions, category of forest species and landscape.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ordonnance sur les prescriptions relatives aux gaz d’échappement des moteurs de bateaux dans les eaux suisses (OEMB).
Policy_Content: L’article 1er de la présente ordonnance établit que la présente ordonnance contient les prescriptions sur les émissions des gaz d’échappement et la construction des moteurs à allumage commandé et des moteurs diesel pour la navigation. Ses prescriptions sont aussi valables, par analogie, pour les moteurs à combustion qui ne fonctionnent pas avec de l’essence ou de l’huile diesel. Le texte comprend 16 chapitres comme suit: Champ d’application (1); Définitions (2); Prescriptions générales (3); Demande d’approbation de type des gaz d’échappement (4); Conditions pour le classement en familles de moteurs (5); Contrôle des émissions (6): Valeurs limites d’émissions (7); Autres prescriptions (8); Approbation du type quant aux gaz d’échappement (9); Signe distinctif (10); Modification de moteurs homologués (11); Conformité de la production (contrôle de la production) (12); Contrôle périodique subséquent des gaz d’échappement (13) ; Emoluments (14); Dispositions pénales (15); Dispositions finales (16).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Water
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret nº 93-2447 modifiant le décret nº 89-1047 du 28 juillet 1989, fixant les conditions d'utilisation des eaux usées traitées à des fins agricoles.
Policy_Content: Ce décret abroge et remplace les articles 1, 4, 5, 7 et 12 du décret nº 89-1047 du 28 juillet 1989. Il s'agit notamment des dispositions relatives: à l'autorisation nécessaire pour l'utilisation des eaux usées à des fins agricoles; aux analyses, qui sont à la charge des organismes distributeurs; à l'interdiction d'utiliser ces eaux pour l'irrigation des cultures maraîchères dont les produits sont susceptibles d'être contaminés ou sont consommables crus; à la liste des cultures pour lesquelles ces eaux peuvent être utilisées qui sera fixée par arrêté et au cahier des charges qui fixera les modalités et les conditions particulières applicables à chaque utilisation. Les Ministres de l'agriculture, de l'environnement et de l'aménagement du territoire et de la santé publique sont chargés, chacun en ce qui le concerne, de l'exécution de ce décret.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Provisional Regulations of the People's Republic of China on land appreciation tax.
Policy_Content: The Regulations aim at standardizing the order of land and real estate market transactions, at reasonably adjusting the benefit from land appreciation and safeguarding the rights and interests of the State. According to article 2, all units and individuals receiving income form the transfer of state-owned land use rights, shall pay a land appreciation tax in accordance with these Regulations. Further provisions concern the following: (a) appreciation of the amount to be paid; (b) deductible items; (c) exemptions; (d) collection of the tax by tax authorities.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1272 of 1993 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of carrying out land tenders, land auctions and other land transactions.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. Regional executive authorities must fix maximum size ceilings of the plots of land for various purposes that can be owned by a single physical or juridical person. The fixed size ceilings cannot be smaller than standard size ceilings for the plots of land currently in force. This Regulation establishes the modalities of carrying out land tenders, land auctions and other land transactions for the cases envisaged by the legislation currently in force. In the presence of preferential purchasers in accordance with the legislation currently in force a closed tender or auction is carried out, otherwise the seller is entitled to sell the plot of land either independently or by open tender or auction. The seller of the plot of land not less than 10 days before striking a contract of sale of the plot of land must send a notice to the district (city) committee on land resources and land survey declaring his intention to sell and indicating the conjectural price of the plot of land in question. Buying and selling contracts for the plots of land are prohibited if as a result of them a single physical or juridical person will own plot(s) of land which total area exceeds the fixed maximum size ceilings. The document consists of 24 Articles.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

A nivel institucional, se definen las atribuciones de las autoridades competentes ya existentes y se crea el Instituto Catastral del Estado de Sinaloa.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1235 on the plots of forest estate destined for research.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be applicable to all categories of forests and shall be compulsory for the state executive bodies, forest managers and forest owners using forests for scientific research purposes. Scientific research includes research and experimental activity in the sphere of forestry, botany, soil, zoology and forest pathology. Plots of forest estate can be conceded for research on the following conditions: (a) lease; (b) usufruct without expropriation of the forest owner. Forest use for scientific research without expropriation of land of the forest owners shall be authorized by the forest service on the whole territory of the forest estate in accordance with the application containing substantiation of scientific research activity. Felling and other experimental activity in the water protection zones shall be carried out by agreement with the authorized state environmental institution, forest service, water basin institution and the state executive bodies. Expropriation of the forest resources for scientific research purposes shall be carried out in accordance with forestry licence. Forest management for scientific research purposes shall be charged.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 3/1993 - Ley forestal.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley es de aplicación a todos los montes o terrenos forestales de la Comunidad Valenciana. Los montes o terrenos forestales son catalogados sobre la base de las características intrínsecas de las distintas áreas territoriales, incluyendo aquellos terrenos que cumplan o puedan cumplir funciones ecológicas, paisajísticas o recreativas. Los montes son tratados de modo integrado atendiendo conjuntamente al medio físico, la flora y la fauna con el fin de preservar la diversidad biológica y asegurar el mantenimiento de los principales procesos ecológicos. La Ley establece como objetivos principales la potenciación de los ecosistemas forestales en cuanto referencia cultural; valorar y gestionar los matorrales como etapas de desarrollo del ecosistema; mantener, proteger y ampliar las cubiertas vegetales que pueden preservar y contrarrestar los procesos de erosión de los suelos, y compatibilizar el monte con la realización de otros aprovechamientos tales como los cinegéticos, el pastoreo y la recogida de productos. La Ley pretende, además, fomentar el uso recreativo y lúdico de los espacios forestales en tanto que sea compatible con los objetivos de la misma. La Ley crea el Consejo Forestal de la Comunidad Valenciana, como órgano consultivo en materia forestal. La Ley es respetuosa con la autonomía municipal, fomenta la intervención de las corporaciones locales en la administración y gestión de sus recursos forestales. La Ley regula los instrumentos de política forestal estableciendo un Plan de Ordenación Forestal que fija los criterios fundamentales de la misma y determina la ordenación a largo plazo de las distintas demarcaciones forestales. La Ley otorga a la Administración instrumentos para poder intervenir en los montes de los particulares para su repoblación. Asimismo, la Ley prevé la posibilidad de establecer regímenes especiales para proteger especies forestales en peligro y árboles singulares y aprobar planes que hagan compatible el bosque con la caza. Se regula el derecho a la expropiación forzosa por parte de la Generalidad Valenciana.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ley Nº 26258 - Prohíbe la tala de árboles en bosques de los departamentos de La Libertad, Lambayeque, Piura y Tumbes.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, que consta de 8 artículos, prohíbe por un período de 15 años la tala de los árboles de los bosques naturales ubicados en los departamentos de Tumbes, Piura, Lambayeque y La Libertad, así como la producción, transporte y comercialización de leña y carbón de los mencionados árboles (art. 1º). La Dirección General Forestal del Instituto Nacional de Recursos Naturales (INRENA) es la autoridad competente y dictará las medidas complementarias (art. 3º). No son sujeto de sanción quienes dentro del área señalada produzcan leña o carbón de los árboles secos por acción natural para su uso doméstico, quedando prohibida su comercialización (art. 6º).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Joint Regulation of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and the Federal Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey regarding the modalities of issuing licences for the exposure of degraded and contaminated soil.
Policy_Content: In accordance with this Regulation the licensed activity is sub-divided in two groups: a) inspection of agricultural land for the purpose of the exposure of the eroded, saline, swamped soils; desertified soils, sedimentary soils, as a result of mining, reindeer pastures with the soil and vegetation damaged; b) soils contaminated by industrial waste and nuclear substances. The Regulation consists of 4 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the modalities of issuing licences. Section 3 determines the rights and the duties of the holders of licence. Section 4 regards the modalities of control over the execution of licence.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 2118 of 1993 on taxation of sale of the plots of land and other transactions with land.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of strengthening state control over the use and protection of land, increasing liability of citizens, officials and juridical persons for the infringement of land legislation for the period of carrying out land reform, decrees that till the promulgation of Basic land legislation citizens, officials and juridical persons are liable to administrative fines in the following cases: 1) For the infringement of urban planning documentation as regards the allotment of land, illegal actions of officials that cause unauthorized seizure of land. 2) For the infringement of the regulations regarding the use environmental protection land, protected areas, sanitary zones, recreational land, other types of land destined for special uses and contaminated land. 3) For the irrational use of agricultural land, non-fulfillment of the obligatory measures as regards amelioration of land, land protection against wind and water soil erosion and non-prevention of other processes that cause soil deterioration, systematic non-payment of land charges. 4) For the evasion or tardy execution of orders issued by officials of land institutions regarding the elimination of the violations of land legislation. The total amount of fines for the infringement of land legislation is destined for the formation of special funds of the committees on land resources and land survey. The basic unit of measure for the calculation of the amount of fine is minimum monthly salary.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Dispute settlement,Public land,Institution,Agricultural land,Use restrictions,Special fund
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 8.742 providing for the National Social Protection.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 42 articles divided into six Chapters, provides for the National Social Protection. It establishes that the social assistance is a citizen's right and a duty of the State, which ensure that basic needs are met. Social assistance has the following objectives: I - social protection, which aims to guarantee life, reduce damage and prevent the incidence of risks, especially: a) protection of the family, maternity, childhood, adolescence and elders; b) support for vulnerable children and adolescents; c) promoting integration into the labour market; d) qualifying and rehabilitating people with disabilities; and e) the guarantee of one monthly benefit salary to the person with disability and to the elderly who prove that do not have the means to provide for their own maintenance; II - social assistance surveillance, aims to carry out territorial analysis of the protective capacity of families and in it the occurrence of vulnerabilities, threats, victimization and damage; III - the rights' protection, which aims to guarantee full access to rights in the set of social assistance provisions. Law No. 14.171 of 10 June 2021 amends Law No. 13.982 to establish protection measures for women providing a single-parent family in relation to receiving emergency aid referred to in art. 2.
Subject: Food & nutrition, General
Keyword: Social protection,Basic legislation,Less favoured areas,Rural employment,Monitoring,Agricultural land,Public health,Poverty,Offences/penalties,Food security
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Act No. 491 re-defining the powers of the regions and the Government as regards agriculture and forestry and establishing the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Forestry Resources.
Policy_Content: The Act states the abolition of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry and the establishment of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Forestry Resources. Moreover, it sets out the powers of the Regions and the Ministry in matter of agriculture and forestry. The duties of the Ministry shall cover inter alia: (a) international relations; (b) definition of the national policy; (c) coordination of the procedures and collection and dissemination of information; (d) duties in matter of aquaculture and maritime fisheries previously pertaining to the Ministry of the Merchant Marine according to Acts No. 963 of 14 July 1965 and No. 41 of 17 February 1982. Other activities not relevant to the above are entrusted to the Regions. Furthermore, the Act concerns the establishment of: (a) the Committee for veterinary science and zootechnics under the Ministry of Health; (b) the permanent Committee for the processing of agriculture and forestry products. Subsequent articles concern other duties of the Ministry in coordination with the Forest Officers and the State Agency for Interventions in the Agricultural Market (AIMA).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Decree-Law No. 496 laying down urgent measures for the reorganization of environmental checks and for the establishment of the National Agency for Environmental Protection - ANPA.
Policy_Content: The Decree identifies scientific and administrative activities relevant to the protection of the environment. In particular, they include: (a) the promotion of research for the protection of the ecosystems against pollution; (b) the collection of data and dissemination of information; (c) the establishment of standards and limit values with regard to the quality of air, water and soil; (d) the development of scientific knowledge; (e) technical assistance in matter of prevention of disasters and environmental impact assessment, etc. The Decree concerns also the establishment of the National Agency for Environmental Protection (ANPA), in charge of providing technical assistance and coordinating all activities in matter of environmental protection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Règlement sur les mesures financières visant à favoriser une utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie (RURE).
Policy_Content: L’article 1er du règlement susvisé établit que l'Etat encourage l'utilisation économe et rationnelle de toute énergie et le recours à des énergies renouvelables. A cet effet, il peut accorder des aides financières ou des dégrèvements fiscaux à des particuliers, à des personnes morales ou à des collectivités publiques, pour autant que les projets permettent: a) l'expérimentation d'énergies renouvelables; b) l'utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie; c) la récupération d'énergie; d) l'économie d'énergie;  e) la substitution d'énergies visant à une meilleure répartition de la consommation; f) la mise en valeur d'énergies renouvelables ou de rejets de chaleur.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 1994.

Policy: Regulation to protect old forests (No. 1115 of 1993).
Policy_Content: In order to protect the biodiversity and natural riches of old forests this Regulation indicates various areas in Finland as nature protection areas in accordance with section 2 of the Nature Protection Act of 1923. It is prohibited to construct roads, catch or kill any vertebrate animals, excavate or otherwise damage the soil, and to damage plants (art. 3). A conservation and management plan shall be approved for each area by the Ministry of Environment (art. 6). Article 7 provides for the incorporation of other areas in nature protection areas. The areas shall be property of the Forestry Agency (art. 10). The Ministry of Environment shall issue further directives to implement the present Regulation and the Land Survey Office shall give directions regarding the delimitation of protection areas. (12 articles)
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Protected area,Timber extraction/logging,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Biodiversity
