Policy: Decree establishing a public agricultural service for the development and improvement of production, processing and testing of the quality of milk and dairy products.
Policy_Content: This Decree, based on the provisions of the Law on Agricultural Service (published in the Official Gazette of Republic of Serbia 61/1991) and still in force under the terms of the Law on agricultural advisory and professional activities (Official Gazette 30/2010), states the following: A public agricultural service is established in order to develop and improve the production, processing and testing of the quality of milk and dairy products. This kind of organization shall operate under the name “Dairy Institute”, with full legal responsibility and physical headquarters in Serbian capital city-Belgrade. The Institute shall perform the following tasks: 1) actions aimed at the improvement of production, processing and marketing of milk and dairy products in order to increase the volume and improve quality, introduction of new products in the dairy industry as well as research and development in the field of production and processing of milk and dairy products; 2) control of milk and dairy products, testing of health safety of foodstuffs and objects of general use as well as production and supply of dairies with bacterial starter cultures; 3) testing of technological properties of equipment, devices and means used in the process of production, trade, processing and marketing of milk and dairy products; 4) organizing an information system on the condition, capacities and measures for the improvement of milk production and processing; 5) monitoring of scientific knowledge and transfer of knowledge and technology of milk production and processing to companies and other entities; 6) education in the form of specialization in dairy microbiology, physics and chemistry of milk and other forms of mass information on technological innovations in milk production and processing. The Institute organizes services for milk quality control and provides professional assistance to regional agricultural services, milk producers and processors in milk production and processing on the territory of the Republic of Serbia.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 11 December 1993).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.1254 of 1993 regarding arrangement for the organization of carrying out the provisions of the Convention on the protection of the Black sea against pollution.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees as follows: 1. To entitle the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and the Committee on Water Management attached to the Council of Ministers, with the participation of the ministries, departments, regional governments concerned, territorial and provincial administrations of the Black sea basin, with the task of fulfilment of the obligations of the Russian Federation originating from the Convention on the protection of the Black sea against pollution. 2. To set up Inter-departmental commission on the Black sea for the purpose of coordination of activity of the ministries, departments and regional executive bodies of the Russian Federation as regards realization of the provisions of the Convention on the protection of the Black sea against pollution.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Act containing rules relative to the moving of production of organic fertilizers (Act Transfer Organic Fertilizer Production).
Policy_Content: The term "moving" is intended in this Act as "with the use of a non-tied fertilizer production right in accordance with provisions of this Act and in deviation of provisions of the Fertilizer Act, move to another location to produce organic fertilizer" (art. 1). Moving of production is only allowed in accordance with provisions of this Act. Moving to certain areas in the Netherlands is restricted by article 4. The Act provides also for the notification of moving and the registration of non-tied production rights. The non-tied production right is the part of the production in excess of 125 kg per hectare per year. (22 articles completed by an Attachment)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: On a date to be appointed by Royal Decree.

Policy: Energy Efficiency Standards Regulation (B.C. Reg. 389/93).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Energy Efficiency Act. In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to reduce the amount of energy required to provide products and services. Section 5 establishes that for the purpose of section 2 (1) (b) of the Act, every energy device must have affixed to it a label, containing a registered trademark, word mark or symbol of the person or organization, that verifies that the energy device complies with the energy efficiency standards required under the Act. The text consists of 10 sections as follows: Definitions (1); Energy device (2); Prescribed date (3); Persons and organizations designated to verify (4); Labels (5); Placement of label (6); Prescribed efficiency standards (7); Testing and verification of energy devices (8); Repealed (9); Exemption (10). Five Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Loi n° 93-020 du 02 Décembre 1993 portant autorisation de ratification de la Convention-cadre des Nations-Unies sur les Changements Climatiques signée le 13 Juin 1992 à Rio de Janeiro.
Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise la ratification de la Convention-cadre des Nations-Unies sur les Changements Climatiques signée le 13 Juin 1992 à Rio de Janeiro.

Policy: Resolución Legislativa Nº 26253 - Aprueba el Convenio 169 de la OIT sobre pueblos Indígenas y Tribales en países Independientes.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución Legislativa, que incluye el texto integral, aprueba el Convenio 169 de la Organización Internacional del Trabajo (OIT) sobre pueblos Indígenas y Tribales en países Independientes, adoptado en Ginebra el 27 de junio de 1989. El Convenio 169 de la OIT, se aplica: 1) A los pueblos tribales en países independientes, cuyas condiciones sociales, culturales y económicas les distingan de otros sectores de la colectividad nacional, y que estén regidos total o parcialmente por sus propias costumbres o tradiciones o por una legislación especial; 2) A los pueblos en países independientes, considerados indígenas por el hecho de descender de poblaciones que habitaban en el país o en una región geográfica a la que pertenece el país en la época de la conquista o la colonización o del establecimiento de las actuales fronteras estatales y que, cualquiera que sea su situación jurídica, conservan todas sus propias instituciones sociales, económicas, culturales y políticas, o parte de ellas.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems, General

Policy: Sarawak Cultural Heritage Ordinance, 1993.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance is enacted to make better provisions for the preservation of antiquities, monuments and sites of cultural, archaeological, architectural, artistic, religious or traditional interest or value for the benefit of the State and as a heritage of the people and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1198 regarding the public forest register.
Policy_Content: The public forest register shall be kept for the purpose of the rational use of the state forest estate, conservation, reproduction and protection of forests, and also for granting access to legal and natural persons to forest data. The public forest register contains information on the legal status of forests, forest ownership, qualitative and quantitative state of the forest estate, classification of forests and other data required for forest management. The public forest register is composed of: (a) forest inventory; (b) reports by forest owners and forestries with explanatory notes. The state forestry institution shall carry out registration of forest owners, keeping of forest data and validating regulations and instructions for keeping the public forest register.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

The text consists of 5 articles as follows: Publications (1); Competence and proceedings (2); Fees (3); Omissis (4); Final provisions (5).

Policy: Instruction No. 315 of the Federal Forest Service on sanitary felling in the forests of the Far East.
Policy_Content: This Instruction establishes the basic requirements, types and technologies of sanitary felling. The purposes of sanitary felling are to grow highly productive precious forest species, and to preserve and strengthen its protective functions (soil erosion prevention, water conservation, sanitary and hygienic protection) thereof and use of timber. Sanitary felling shall be carried out by removing unfavourable tree species to create favourable growing conditions for precious main tree species. The following types of sanitary felling shall be authorized: (a) first cleaning; (b) early thinning; (c) isolation; and (d) advanced thinning. Standard requirements for sanitary felling shall include: (a) start and end dates; (b) intensity; and (c) recurrence.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ordinance No. 958-r of 1993 regarding the modalities of transfer in private property or life-long hereditary property of the formerly allotted plots of land.
Policy_Content: The Mayor, for the purpose of improvement of legal regulation of land relationship, safeguarding inviolability and protection of the right of citizens to land ownership, formation of valuable market of the plots of land, including sale and purchase, mortgage, lease of the plots of land, as well as for the stabilisation of social and economic situation on the territory of St. Petersburg and the administrative territories under its jurisdiction, orders as follows: 1) Physical persons that have been allotted the plots of land before the date 29 October 1993 on conditions of life-long hereditary property, open-ended (permanent) use or in lease (except for lease contracted from physical persons) for individual housing, or summer cottage construction are allotted the plots of land measuring up to 0,12 hectares free-of-charge. Physical persons that have been allotted the plots of land for the same purposes after the date 29 October 1993 are allotted the plots of land charging the normative price of land applicable for this category of payers. 2)Physical persons that have been allotted more than 0,12 hectares for the above-mentioned purposes and on above-mentioned conditions retain the right at their choice either to keep the excessive land on conditions of life-long hereditary property or to purchase it at a contracted price. 3) Owners of the plots of land or land shares must use them strictly in accordance with their purpose. The change of the purpose of use entails liability in accordance with the legislation currently in force.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land reform,Land tenure,Right of use,Lease,Ownership,Inheritance,Use restrictions,Liability/compensation,Size
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No.2613-XII of 1993 on basic architectural and urban construction activity.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down foundations for legislative regulation of architectural and urban construction activity and is directed at the formation of valuable vital environment, conservation of its natural components and historical and cultural heritage, protection of rights and legitimate interests of all subjects of architectural and urban construction activity. The document consists of 7 sections that contain 29 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-4) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 5-8) regards vital environment. Section 3 (arts. 9-14) regards planning of architectural and urban construction activity. Section 4 (arts. 15-20) regards carrying out architectural and urban construction activity. Section 5 (arts. 21-24) regards regulation of architectural and urban construction activity. Section 6 (arts. 25-28) regards protection of rights of the subjects of architectural and urban construction activity and establishes liability. Section 7 (art. 29) regards international cooperation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Electricity Supply (Licensing) Regulations  (Chapter 73:01).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Electricity Supply Act in relation with the application for and the granting of licenses for the generation or supply of electricity.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ley Nº 1.060 - Ley de política ecológica y ambiental de la Provincia de Formosa.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley dicta la política ambiental con los siguientes objetivos: a) protección y saneamiento del ambiente; b) sostén del mejoramiento de la calidad de vida; c) resguardo del derecho a la existencia de vida. La protección del ambiente consiste en: a) regular las conductas de los habitantes a fin de proteger el ambiente, lograr la utilización de los recursos naturales renovables con la concepción del desarrollo sustentable; b) prevenir daños al ambiente y minimizar el impacto de las actividades humanas; c) promover la recuperación de los ambientes degradados, en particular aquellos sujetos a riesgo de deterioro irreversible; d) propiciar que los costos y beneficios de la protección ambiental sean distribuidos con justicia social: los costos deben ser soportados en primer término y en su mayor medida por los contaminadores, por quienes sean responsables por el impacto ambiental; e) establecer bases para el ordenamiento territorial y la planificación en el manejo y fiscalización del uso de los recursos naturales; f) propiciar la educación ambiental y la conciencia ciudadana para la protección del ambiente dentro de un marco de aprovechamiento racional; g) propender a la creación de un de un sistema de información sumaria de carácter provincial, regional, nacional e internacional.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Subsidy/incentive,Soil pollution/quality,Waste disposal,Soil rehabilitation,Education,Land-use planning,Protection of habitats,Sustainable development,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control,Wild flora,Biodiversity,Protected area,Protection of species

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 563 on institution of protected areas - biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: The President declares to validate the institution of land and marine protected areas included in accordance with UNESCO Program “People and biosphere” in the international network of biosphere reserves with a view of natural ecosystems conservation and performance of scientific research related to the most precious ecosystems of the Earth. In particular this Presidential Decree refers to biosphere reserves Ascania-Nova (Kherson region), the Black Sea biosphere reserve (Kherson and Mykolaiv regions) and Carpathians Mountains (Transcarpathian region).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Land & soil, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Marine protected areas,Biosphere reserves,Research,Ecosystem preservation,Management/conservation

Policy: Ley Nº 11.469 - Creación del Instituto Provincial del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Instituto Provincial del Medio Ambiente dependiente de la Secretaría General de la Gobernación, que se encargará de formular la política ambiental, coordinar su ejecución con los organismos del Estado corresponsables de la misma y velar por su adecuado cumplimiento. El Instituto ejercerá el control de gestión y coordinará a las reparticiones que actúen como organismos de aplicación de la legislación ambiental, en función de las competencias que tengan asignadas por la ley Orgánica de los Ministerios y otras disposiciones legales o complementarias vigentes.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation on the federal state institution “National park “Pripyshminskie Bory”.
Policy_Content: Federal state institution “National park “Pripyshminskie Bory” is an environmental institution, the territory/water area of which includes natural complexes of particular ecological, historical and aesthetic value and is destined for the use for environmental protection, scientific and cultural purposes. The national park shall perform the following tasks: (a) preservation of the integrity of landscapes, water areas, forest systems, vegetation and fauna, monuments of nature, history, culture, architecture and archeology; (b) creation of conditions for regulated tourism and recreation in natural conditions; (c) development and implementation of scientific methods for the preservation of natural and historical cultural complexes in conditions of recreational use; (d) restoration of damaged natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects; (e) implementation of measures for the protection of forests and care for them; (f) environmental monitoring; (g) organization of environmental education of the population; (h) control over compliance with the requirements of this Regulation; (i) implementation of measures for the protection and care of water systems and species populating them; and (j) protection and reproduction of wild fauna species, regulation of the number thereof and carrying out the necessary biotechnical measures. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the national park: (a) any activity that threatens the existence of natural complexes and taken under the protection historical and cultural sites; (b) holding mass sports and entertainment events; (c) organizing parking lots, setting up tents, making campfires outside places provided for such purposes; (d) driving and parking of motorized vehicles, passage of livestock outside roads and waterways of general purpose and outside special places provided for such purposes; (e) geological exploration and development of mineral resources; (f) activities of facilities of pulp, paper and chemical industries, metallurgy, nuclear energy and any other site particularly hazardous for environment; (g) activities that change the hydrological regime; (h) construction of trunk roads, pipelines, power lines and other communications not related to the functioning of the national park; (i) introduction of alien plant and animal species; (j) final felling and procurement of soft resin; and (k) other activities that disrupt the natural complexes of the national park or entailing a decrease in the natural and cultural value of its territory.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,National parks,Ecosystem preservation,Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Research,Cultural heritage,Monitoring,Education,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Tourism

Paragraph 2 concerns monitoring of securing industrial safety (except for the objectives under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Defence and the Ministry of Nuclear Energy). Paragraph 3 regards the implementation of Integral state system of ecological monitoring by means and systems of military equipment of double use.

Policy: Bukoba Town Council (Regulations of Planting, Maintaining and Protecting Trees) By-laws, 1993 (G.N. No. 142 of 1994).

By-law 6 provides for the duty of residents to plant trees. Policy: Bukoba Town Council (Cultivation of Agricultural Land) By-laws, 1993 (G.N. No. 144 of 1994).
Policy_Content: Every resident who holds agricultural land within the jurisdiction of the Bukoba Town Council shall cultivate and maintain that land, grow a cash crop or crops or crop(s) for food as the situation allows, or as the authorized Officer may direct (by-law 3). The Town Council may give directions in writing as to the type of cultivation, the use of fertilizers or the removal of weed (by-law 4). By-law 5 requires farmers to keep land free from weeds and to notify the authorized Officer of plant pests and diseases occurring on his land. (8 by-laws)

Policy: Resolution No. 176 of 1993 promulgating Law No. 18 of 1993 relative to the Body of Administration and Investment of AWQAF Properties.
Policy_Content: There shall be established a body with legal personality and financial and administrative independence connected with the Ministry of Awqaf and Religious affairs. The Body shall, inter alia, administer and develop real property received in endowment and act as endowment council for all matters in relation to administration of and investment in such properties. The body shall be managed by a council consisting of the Minister, several experts, three lawyers and government officials.

Policy: Décret nº 93-1260 relatif au transfert des droits à prime dans les secteurs bovin, ovin et caprin.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les modalités de transfert des droits à prime dans les secteurs bovins, ovins et caprins. Lorsqu'un producteur vend ou transfère, notamment par héritage, donation, location ou cession de bail, son exploitation, c'est-à-dire la totalité des terres qu'il met en valeur, les bâtiments d'exploitation et le cheptel correspondant, sans que la superficie agricole utile de son exploitation n'ait été réduite de plus de 15 p. 100 dans les trois ans précédant la cession, ou de plus de 50 p. 100 dans les six ans précédant la cession, les droits à prime qui lui sont rattachés peuvent être transférés au nouvel exploitant qui reprend la totalité de l'exploitation cédée pour y continuer la production correspondant aux droits à prime transférés. Dans tous les autres cas, le producteur transférant tout ou partie des droits à prime qui lui sont rattachés réalise ce transfert par l'intermédiaire de la réserve nationale dans les conditions prévues aux articles 7, paragraphes 1 et 3, 8, 9 et 10 du règlement (C.E.E) nº 3567-92 et aux articles 34, paragraphe 1, 35, 36, 37, du règlement (C.E.E.) nº 3886-92, selon les modalités définies au titre II du présent décret.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

El Fondo tiene por objeto: a) el otorgamiento de subsidios para la adquisición de tierras; b) el financiamiento de mecanismos para la solución de problemas relativos a tierras ; c) el financiamiento para la constitución, regularización o compra de derechos de aguas o financiar obras destinadas a obtener este recurso.

Policy: Law on sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population.
Policy_Content: The Law consists of 7 Sections composed of 50 articles dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1, arts. 1-6); 2) the state regulation in the sphere of ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population (sect. 2, arts. 7-12); 3) the rights and the duties of the Belarusian nationals, foreigners, stateless persons, individual entrepreneurs and organizations in the sphere of ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population (sect. 3, arts. 13-20); 4) general requirements for the ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population (sect. 4, arts. 21-38); 5) bodies, institutions and officials authorized to carry out the state sanitary supervision (sect. 5, arts. 39-45); 6) departmental sanitary supervision, industrial and social sanitary supervision (sect. 6, arts. 46-49); 7) liability (sect. 7, art. 50). The present Law establishes legal and organizational basis for the prevention and the liquidation of adverse environmental impact on human organism and regulates the activity of the state bodies, legal and natural persons as regards ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population. Human habitat shall be considered part of environment, including natural components thereof (atmospheric air, water, soil), and also potable water and foodstuffs (art. 1). Sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall be ensured by: 1) licensing of activities potentially hazardous to human health; 2) certification of produce and services potentially hazardous to human health (art. 5). Sanitary regulations shall be mandatory and shall set safety criteria for human beings (hygienic standards) of the objects of human habitats (atmospheric air, surface water and groundwater, soil), vital activity, alimentary raw materials, foodstuffs and potable water (art. 8). Projects of complex nature management and protection of water resources, rates of maximum permissible hazardous impact on human habitat, projects of sanitary protection zones around the sources of potable water supply shall be subject to the state sanitary and hygienic expertise (art. 10). Foodstuffs shall be subject to the state hygienic registration (art. 11). The socio-hygienic monitoring shall be based upon data regarding public catering and nutrition, and also the data on environmental monitoring (art. 12). The citizens shall be granted access to information regarding the state of environment, foodstuffs and potable water (art. 15). Alimentary raw materials and foodstuffs must comply with the sanitary requirements. Trade of uncertified foodstuffs shall be prohibited. Elaboration and manufacturing of new foodstuffs, packages and food additives shall be carried out in conformity with authorization issued by the state sanitary supervision bodies (art. 26). Potable water must comply with the sanitary standards (art. 30).
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Access-to-information,Monitoring,Food additives,Food quality control/food safety,Registration,Packaging/labelling,Certification,Water supply,Potable water

Policy: Order No. 63 of the Committee on Land Reform and Land Use Planning validating the Regulation on the calculation of preferential and normative value of land transferred in private ownership.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 3 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1); 2) the modalities of calculation of preferential value of land (sect. 2); 3) the modalities of valuation of agricultural land (sect. 3). The present Regulation shall be applicable for the calculation of preferential and normative value of land transferred in private ownership for subsidiary small-holding, housing and gardening.  Land charges for land transferred in private ownership shall be compulsory for all citizens. Benefits conceded to citizens for the payment of land tax shall not be taken into account in the process of land valuation of the plots of land transferred in private ownership. Preferential land value shall be equal to five times the amount of land tax that is paid for the plot of land in question. Normative land value shall be set in conformity with soil quality and location of the plot of land. Preferential value of the plots of land conceded for subsidiary small-holding within the urban boundaries shall be calculated on the basis of the average land tax for the given territory. Normative value of agricultural land shall be calculated with the consideration of climatic conditions, type of land, soil conditions and location of the plot of agricultural land.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Arrêté du 22 novembre 1993 relatif au Code de bonnes pratiques agricoles.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté porte code de bonnes pratiques agricoles prévu à l'article 2 du décret nº 93-1038 relatif à la protection des eaux contre la pollution par les nitrates d'origine agricole. Le code est formé par 10 articles répartis en 3 parties: la première porte définitions des termes employés et des types de fértilisants; la deuxième fixe les bonnes pratiques d'épandage et de stockage des fértilisants (périodes d'épandages, épandage des fertilisnats sur les sols en forte pente, sur les sols détrempés, inondés, gelés ou couverts de neige, construction des ouvrages de stockage); la troisième fixe les bonnes pratiques de gestion des terres et de l'irrigation (gestion des terres - couverture végétal du sol; plans de fumure et tenue des cahiers d'épandage).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Order No. 310 of the Federal Forest Service validating Forestry standard on clean cutting and quality assessment.
Policy_Content: This Forestry standard shall be applicable for quality assessment of clean cutting in forests: (a) liberation felling; (b) weeding; (c) thinning; (d) severance felling; (e) regeneration felling; (f) restocking felling; (g) landscape felling; and (h) selective sanitary felling. It establishes indices nomenclature, criteria and quality assessment for main works carried out in the process of felling in young stand, middle-aged stand and mature stand. Grounds for quality assessment shall be compliance of obtained indices with projected parameters and normative requirements.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ley Nº 11.078 - Tratamiento integral de la situación política, social, económica, jurídica colectiva e individual de las comuniaddes aborígenes.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley regula las relaciones colectivas e individuales de las comunidades aborígenes de la Provincia de Santa Fe, reconociendo su propia organización y su cultura, y propiciando su efectiva inserción social. El Capítulo III regula lo relativo a la propiedad de la tierra. En especial dispone que la adjudicación de tierras en propiedad se realizará cuando existan tierras fiscales, de manera gratuita, en forma comunitaria o individual según el interés de cada grupo o comunidad. Se propenderá a que dichas tierras sean aptas y suficientes para el digno desarrollo de los mismos, así como que estén ubicadas en el lugar donde habita la comunidad o zonas cercanas, siempre, con el consentimiento libre y expreso de la comunidad. Policy: Taxation on waste and raw materials Act (No. 674 of 1994).
Policy_Content: This Act ensures that anyone who professionally extracts commodities covered by the Mineral Resources Act, is subject to taxation. A fee of DKK 5 is based upon each cubic meter and any commercial extraction or import of less than 200 mq. of yearly raw materials is exempt from taxes. Commodities listed under Appendix 1 are subject to taxation and registered by authorities. Raw materials extracted for sand improvement use are exempt from taxation if they are seabed materials resulting from dredging  and recovered as raw materials; if residues and waste products are recovered from already established deposits; if soil is produced with no over-burned and topsoil not produced for revenue. Waste delivered to landfills are subject to a fee of DKK 195. Waste delivered to incineration are subject to DKK 160 fee. These are calculated upon gross weight of waste.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force of this Act shall be decided by the Minister of Environment.

Policy: Ley Nº 11.459 - Ley ambiental para establecimientos industriales.
Policy_Content: La presente ley será de aplicación a todas las industrias instaladas, que se instalen, amplíen o modifiquen sus establecimientos o explotaciones dentro de la jurisdicción de la provincia de Buenos Aires. Se entenderá por establecimiento industrial a todo aquel donde se desarrolla un proceso tendiente a la conservación, reparación o transformación en su forma, esencia, calidad o cantidad de una materia prima o material para la obtención de un producto final mediante la utilización de métodos industriales. Todos los establecimientos industriales deberán contar con el pertinente certificado de aptitud ambiental como requisito obligatorio indispensable para que las autoridades municipales puedan conceder, en uso de sus atribuciones legales, las correspondientes habilitaciones industriales.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG707/1993 validating the Regulation on land of industry, transport, communications, defense and other categories of land for specific purposes and the Regulation on the procedure for writing off reclamation systems and transferring irrigated and drained land to the category of non-irrigated land.
Policy_Content: Regulation on land of industry, transport, communications, defense and other categories of land for specific purposes regulates the procedure for the use and determination of land of industry, transport, communications, defense other categories of land for specific purposes. Land of industry, transport, communications, defense and land for other specific purposes shall be acknowledged land allotted by local government for accommodation and operation of administrative, household, auxiliary buildings and structures of industrial, mining, transport and other enterprises, institutions and organizations, construction of access roads and utilities, organization of industrial production, construction of highways, laying of communication lines and power transmission. The sizes of land plots provided for these purposes are determined in in accordance with the approved standards and design and technical documentation. Allotment of land plots is carried out with the consideration of the sequence of their development. Providing enterprises, institutions and organizations with land plots for development of minerals (mining) is carried out only with licenses for industrial development of deposits, the act of mining allotment and reclamation of waste areas. Regulation on the procedure for writing off reclamation systems and transferring irrigated and drained land to the category of non-irrigated land establishes that land shall be included in the category of irrigated or drained on the basis of acts of the state commissions for acceptance into operation and write-off of reclamation systems. The conversion (transfer) of irrigated land to the category of non-irrigated land is carried out on the basis of acts by state commission for acceptance into operation and write-off of reclamation systems and exclusively by the decree of the Government of the Republic of Moldova. Irrigated land is transferred to the category of non-irrigated land in the following cases: (a) loss of an irrigation source; (b) physical deterioration of the irrigation network, requiring its replacement or reconstruction; (c) deterioration of water quality to indicators unacceptable for irrigation of agricultural crops; (d) expropriation of agricultural land for non-agricultural and non-forestry state and public needs; (e) drained agricultural land expropriated for non-agricultural and non-forestry state and public needs shall be written off. When writing off irrigated land with an operating drainage network, it shall be written off, and the irrigated land is transferred to the drained category.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Law No. I-301 on protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Law shall specify the public relations concerning protected areas, the system of protected areas, and the legal basis for the establishment, protection, management and control of protected areas as well as regulate the performance of activities therein. Protected areas shall be established with a view to preserving territorial complexes and objects/properties of natural and cultural heritage, diversity of landscape and biological diversity, ensuring the ecological balance of landscape, well-balanced use and restoration of natural resources, providing conditions for cognitive tourism, scientific research and monitoring of the condition of the environment, promoting territorial complexes and objects/properties of natural and cultural heritage. The system of protected areas shall be made up of the following categories of protected areas: (a) areas of conservational protection priority. The following types of protected areas shall be attributed to this category: strict reserves, reserves and objects of heritage; (b) areas of restorative protection priority. The following types of protected areas shall be attributed to this category: restorative plots, genetic plots; (c) territories of ecological protection priority. Zones of ecological protection shall be attributed to this category; (d) complex protected areas. The following types of protected areas shall be attributed to this category: state parks – national and regional parts, areas of biosphere monitoring – strict biosphere reserves and biosphere grounds; (e) Protected areas of the Republic of Lithuania or their parts may, in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 241 of this Law, be included in the Natura 2000 network. The most valuable territories of Lithuania may, in accordance with the procedure be laid down by the Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage, be granted the status of an outstanding World Heritage site. The nature frame shall join protected areas of a natural type and other ecologically important areas ensuring the ecological balance of landscape into a common system balancing landscape management. In natural and complex reserves, it shall be prohibited: (a) to destroy or damage relief forms as well as protected objects; (b) to mine peat and lake sediments (sapropels), with the exception of those whose mining started prior to the establishment of a reserve; (c) to construct new quarries and mines of mineral deposits, also new bores for the reconnaissance and extraction of oil and gas, to erect the industrial facilities subject to integrated pollution prevention and control permits, airfields, wind power plants, with the exception of the wind mills being restored, to set up dumping grounds, to build other construction works polluting the environment, including those polluting it visually; (d) to collect, explode, cut or otherwise destroy the stones which exceed 0.5 cubic meters and are naturally found in reserves; (e) to dam and regulate natural rivers, to change their courses and the natural level of water in lakes. It shall be allowed to re-erect former dams, other hydrotechnical construction works, to fortify banks, to clean river beds, to set up artificial water bodies, and to carry our other works only in the cases when this is required for the restoration and management of the objects of cultural heritage (immovable heritage properties) located in a reserve and when implementing natural disaster prevention measures in cities, towns and villages; (f) to set up new water bodies not related to the purpose of a reserve and exceeding 0.1 ha; (g) to drain marshes and their adjacent areas and change them to another land use; (h) to build the construction works unrelated to objectives of the establishment of a reserve, with the exception of buildings in existing and former homesteads (when there are remnants of former construction works and/or gardens or when the homesteads are marked in plans of a site or other plans, also when establishing the legal fact), also the locations specified in reserve management plans and/or comprehensive plans, to construct buildings or to increase their volumes on the slopes whose fall exceeds 15 degrees, also at a distance closer than 50 meters away from the upper and lower edge of these slopes; (i) to plant the greenery obstructing the panoramas of historical, cultural and aesthetical value; (j) to install the external advertising unrelated to the complexes and objects/properties protected in a reserve, with the exception of territories of cities and towns; (k) to produce and propagate genetically modified organisms, plants and seeds thereof. This prohibition shall apply also to areas within a radius of five kilometers around the reserves; and (l) to pursue other activities which may harm protected complexes and objects/properties. The State Register of Protected Areas (a data system) shall be established for the purposes of organization of protection of protected areas and rational management thereof and shall include protected areas, with the exception of objects of cultural heritage, and other data required for organization of protection of protected areas and management thereof. This Law consists of X Chapters divided into 34 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes the system of protected areas and contains documents of activity regulation. Chapter III regards areas of conservational protection priority and regulation of activities therein. Chapter IV regards complex protected areas and regulation of activities therein. Chapter V regards areas of restorative and ecological protection priority and regulation of activities therein. Chapter VI regards nature frame. Chapter VII deals with establishment of, accounting for, protection and management of protected areas. Chapter VIII deals with state control of protected areas. Chapter IX regards ownership of land and rights and duties of owners, managers and users of land in protected areas. Chapter X establishes liability for the infringement of the Law on protected areas.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Framework law,Protected area,Biodiversity,Monitoring,Cultural heritage,Classification/declassification,Registration,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,Sustainable development,Water conservation zone,Groundwater
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Modification du règlement du 16 mai 1980 d'application de la loi du 5 juin 1979 forestière.
Policy_Content: Les articles suivants du susdit règlement sont modifiés: article 6a concernant la publication des demandes de défrichement. Il est établit que la demande d'autorisation de défrichement est mise à l'enquête publique en principe pendant vingt jours dans la ou les communes où le défrichement doit avoir lieu; article 6b qui prévoit que lorsque la demande de défrichement est liée à une procédure distincte d'autorisation, de planification, d'approbation ou d'octroi de concession, elle est soumise à une seule enquête publique, selon les modalités de la procédure principale; article 6c sur la décision de défrichement de compétence cantonale et, finalement, article 6d concernant la décision de défrichement de compétence fédérale. Policy: Crofters (Scotland) Act 1993 (1993 Cap. 44).
Policy_Content: This Act continues into being the Crofters Commission and provides with respect to crofting, a particular form of land tenure exercised in Scotland and related matters such acquisition of land by crofters. The Commission was established by the he Crofters (Scotland) Act 1955. The Commission shall, among other things, keep under general review all matters relating to crofts and crofting conditions such as land settlement, the improvement of land  and livestock, the planting of trees, the supply of agricultural equipment and requisites, the marketing of agricultural produce, experimental work on crofting methods, the provision of demonstration crofts, the needs of the crofting communities  for public services of all kinds, the provision of social amenities and the need for industries to provide supplementary  occupations for crofters or work for their families. For the purposes of this Act: (a) any right in pasture or grazing land held or to be held by the  tenant of a croft, whether alone or in common with others; (b) any land comprising any part of a common grazing which has  been apportioned for the exclusive use of a crofter under section  52(4) of this Act and; (c) any land held runrig which has been apportioned under section  52(8) of this Act,  shall be deemed to form part of the croft.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Land & soil

Policy: Upper Austria Agricultural Law 1994.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to: 1) secure the stock and development of agriculture and forestry and to enable them to fulfill their tasks with a view to the well-being of society; 2) to conserve and develop further a well-functioning and efficient agriculture and forestry in a well-structured rural space; 3) help families and persons working in the sector to enjoy a decent life; 4) ensure the best possible supply of high-quality agricultural commodities and products ;5) make the agricultural production, processing and marketing more competitive; 6) increase the agricultural and forestry production by means of further structural measures with a view to an environmental-friendly, socially oriented rural agriculture and forestry; 7) keep up the infrastructure by means of an environment-friendly agriculture in such a way to secure the quality of natural living basis, such as soil, water and ambient air; 8) conserve the cultural and recreational areas with a view to promote its maintenance;  9) promote an efficient waste management and waste disposal; 10) promote the development of rural agglomerations with a view to increase the efficiency of the whole area. The text consists of 15 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Different sorts of promotions and promotion guidelines (II); Promotion areas (III); Agricultural reports and Agricultural Commission (IV); Transitional and final provisions (V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Agricultural land,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Data collection/reporting,Non-governmental entity,Institution,Offences/penalties,Family farming,Recreational forest,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Order No.219 of 1993 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding setting up specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Tchukotka Autonomous Region.
Policy_Content: The Minister, for the purpose of strengthening protection, regulation and state control over the use of marine area and natural resources of territorial waters, continental shelf and EEZ of the Russian Federation, adjoining the territory of Tchukotka Autonomous Region and pertaining exclusively to the federal property, orders to set up specialized marine inspection for environmental protection subordinated to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources. Specialized marine inspection for environmental protection of Tchukotka Autonomous Region must ensure protection, regulation and state control over the use of marine area and natural resources (including stock of fish) of the internal sea, territorial sea, continental shelf and EEZ of the Russian Federation adjoining the territory of Tchukotka Autonomous Region.

Policy_Content: This Decree lays down rules for the prevention of marine pollution by ships. Policy: Decree of the Prime Minister on the Management and Use of Forests and Forest Land (No. 169/PM).
Policy_Content: Chapter I of this Decree defines forests as living natural resources "necessary for the preservation of the environment, water sources, soil, wildlife and the livelihood of the pluri-ethnical population". Forest lands are all areas under the management of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, whether covered or not by forests, if not used or defined as permanent agricultural land. Forests are declared the property of the State. Individuals, collectives or juridical entities may hold use or tenure rights only by authority of the Ministry. However, the State recognizes the right to use forest land and products in accordance with village customs, such as for the gathering of firewood and other products, hunting, and other customs set forth in detailed regulations at village level. Individuals, etc., using trees, natural forests and forest land are obliged to pay for such resources. All felling of trees is prohibited, except if specifically allowed by Forest Management Plans or authorized by the Ministry. Conversion of forest land to other purposes must be authorized by the Prime Minister, except in the case of conversion of certain degraded lands, which may be authorized by the Land and Forest Land Distribution Committee. Chapter II calls for the delineation of Forest Management Planning Areas and Forest Management Areas. The Ministry is obligated to survey and designate forests according to the following categories: Protection Forests, Conservation Forests, Production Forests, Regenerated Forests and Degraded Forest Lands. Chapter III states that the Ministry shall appoint forestry officers in charge of each forest area. The Ministry is also empowered to contract out management to other parties, such as villagers, collective organizations, individuals or juridical entities. Forest officers are required, in consultation with concerned parties, including villagers, to draw up forest management plans, subject to approval of the Ministry. Such plans must be consistent with the principles of sustainable forest management. Any forest management plan calling for exploitation in a forest area must clearly state the compensatory steps to be taken in order to norma-lize the exploited forest. Chapters IV, V and VI deal with Forest Management Contracts, which include Collective, Family and Afforestation contracts. Collective contracts are entered into with the village chief or the chief of the collective organization. Such contracts may cover any type of forest land. Family contracts are for the management and use of degraded forests or non-forest land for agriculture, forest and livestock production by a family. After three years of contract compliance, the family may obtain permanent tenure over the subject land. Various other types of contracts deal with exploitation and business uses of forests. Chapter VII deals with various management issues. Among other things, it forbids "clear cutting" except in special cases involving the conversion of land to other uses. Shifting cultivation is restricted to degraded or non-forest land, and the local administration is obligated to assist in the transformation of shifting into sedentary cultivation. While felling of trees is generally forbidden in protection and conservation forests, buffer zones are envisioned around each area to meet local needs in accordance with regulations. Chapter IX calls for establishment of a Forestry Development Fund to be used for forest management and conservation.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Right of use,Traditional rights/customary rights,Policy/planning,Inventory,Classification/declassification,Timber extraction/logging,Contract/agreement,Forest management/forest conservation,Agro-forestry,Protection forest
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Instruction by the Prime Minister on policies and methods for continued economic and social development in mountainous areas.
Policy_Content: This Instruction makes provisions for the economic development of mountainous areas through the enhancement of forests, cash crops, fruits, medical plants, and large-scale animal husbandry. It stresses the importance of establishing new systems for agricultural development and realising a reorganization of the industrial sector. In mountain areas, the main direction in industrialisation should be towards processing of local raw materials, mainly from agriculture, forestry and mineral exploitation. As for the allocation of forest lands, forests are divided into the following categories: (a) watershed forests; (b) special-use forests; (c) forest on rocky mountains; (d) poor forests which need to be protected in order to regenerate by natural means. The designation of the different kind of forests should be followed by the allocation either to State Enterprises or army units for their management or to local people for protection and assisted natural regeneration.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Decreto Nº 3.181 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 8.027, que crea el Sistema Informático Geológico Minero.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta la Ley Nº 8.027, por la cual se crearon el Sistema Informático Geológico Minero y el Registro Unico de Actividades Mineras. Se establece que las unidades de organización del Poder Ejecutivo Provincial que elaboren o procesen datos que hagan al objetivo de la presente Ley, quedan afectadas al Sistema Integral de Información (Sigemi). The Law consists of 8 Chapters: General Provisions; Rights of Consumers; Obligations of Business Operators; Protection of Lawful Rights and Interests of Consumers by the State;  Consumer Organizations; Settlement of Disputes; Legal Liability; Supplementary Provisions.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 750 on liability and compensation for damaging public forest.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes rates of payment for the damages caused to public forest by the infringement of the forest legislation in the form of the following offences: (a) damage of trees and shrubbery that does not stop growing thereof (Annex 1); (b) damage of forest species in the reforestation areas (Annex 2); (c) illegal timber extraction and destruction of trees and shrubbery (Annex 3); (d) damage of hayfields and pastures (Annex 4); (e) illegal collection of fruits and edible nuts (Annex 5); (f) damage or destruction of forestry marks (Annex 6); (g) damage or destruction of ant hills (Annex 7); (h) damage or destruction of forest drainage systems (Annex 8); (i) damage or destruction of seedlings and young plants on forest plantations (Annex 9); (j) littering of forests (Annex 10); (k) illegal apiculture (Annex 11); (l) removal or destruction of debris layer (Annex 12); (m) illegal timber processing (Annex 13).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force on 10 November 1993.

Policy: Order No. 289 of the Federal Forest Service validating Instruction on forest fire prevention arrangements and regulation of forest fire prevention service.
Policy_Content: All the forests of the Russian Federation must be protected against forest fires. Protection of forests against forest fires shall be carried out with the consideration of biological and regional peculiarities and shall include complex organizational, legal and other arrangements. Fire prevention arrangements shall be carried out by all the owners of forest stock while enterprises, institutions and organization which activity causes impact upon the state and reproduction of forests must carry out forestry protection measures. Forest fire prevention arrangements shall be carried out in conformity with forest management plans. Forest fire prevention arrangements are sub-divided into three main groups: 1) prevention of forest fires; 2) localization of forest fires; 3) organizational and technical arrangements ensuring fire resistance of forests. Dead-wood and windfall that rise the danger of forest fires, pests and disease must be destined for immediate sanitary felling.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest fires,Forestry protection measures,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 290 of the Federal Forest Service validating rates of provision with fire prevention equipment and means for combating forest fires.
Policy_Content: Quantitative and specific composition of equipment, inventory and means for combating forest fires shall be set as an average value and is calculated for vast variety of forest pyrological conditions. In the process of legalization of the materials regarding forest management shall be determined quantitative and specific composition of equipment with the consideration of conditions of the rented territory. Rates of provision with fire prevention equipment and means for combating forest fires are compulsory for all enterprises, organizations, institutions, legal and natural persons holding on lease the plots of forest stock, managing them or owning production sites, economic activities of recreational sites in the forests, and also for the owners of forest stock that have no fire-chemical stations.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Arrêté Interministériel n° 0021 du 29 octobre 1993 portant application de la réglementation sur les servitudes.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté définit les servitudes comme: - les espaces verts; - les emprises des routes d’intérêt public conformément aux plans d’urbanisme et plans cadastraux; - les rives des cours allant jusqu’au moins 10 mètres à partir de la ligne formée par le niveau le plus élevé qu’atteignent les eaux dans leur période des crues normales; - les emprises des lignes de haute tension sur une distance de 25 mètres de part et d’autre; - les emprises des chemins de fer de 5 à 50 mètres suivant catégories; - les zones de sécurité des dépôts des liquides inflammables, des aéronefs, des établissements insalubres et des explosifs; - les emprises des cimetières; - les emprises de bâtiments publics; - les périmètres REGIDESO, S.N.EL. et ONPTZ; - les zones de carrières réservées à l’extraction des produits du sous-sol. Toute occupation, toute construction et tout lotissement dans les servitudes telles que définies ci-dessus sont interdits, et  toutes constructions érigées en violation des dispositions du présent arrêté seront démolies aux frais de leurs constructeurs ou propriétaires sans aucune indemnité.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Foodstuff Speciality Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act implements the Commission Regulation No 2082/92 of 14 July 1992 on certification of special features of agricultural products and foodstuff. The Federal Agriculture and Food Institute is in charge of the registration of products in the relevant register of the European Community, as well as with all respective modifications of such registration. The Act consists of 10 articles as follows: Sphere of application (1), Certification procedures (2); Compensation procedures (3), Inspection (4); Private control organs (5); Fees and expenses (6); Violations (7); Penalties (8); Withdrawal of products (9); Entry into force (10).

Policy: Instruction No. 295 of the Federal Forest Agency concerning inspection of forest ranges.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Instruction shall be to raise responsibility of forest officers for timely and qualitative arrangements related to reforestation, protection and conservation of forest ranges entrusted thereto. The officials in the process inspection of forest ranges shall examine the following: (a) state of suppression of illegal timber extraction, unauthorized takeover of land and other violations of the forest legislation, prevention of forest fires, observance of hunting rules and regulations, rules of forest management etc.; (b) timely detection of hotbeds of pests and pathogens, and other negative impacts on forests; (c) quality of forest protection, reforestation and other forestry arrangements; (d) state of forest documentation entrusted to forest officer.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regulation No. 292 of the Federal Forest Service regarding timber extraction for sanitary purposes in the forests of Western Siberia.
Policy_Content: This Regulation contains the system of provisions governing timber extraction for sanitary purposes in the forests of western Siberia. It is binding on all forestry officials and forest industry employees that extract timber for sanitary purposes control the process. The Regulation consists of ten Sections and contains eight annexes. Section one lays down general provisions. Section two specifies the goal and objectives of sanitary felling. Section three covers sanitary felling in forests that contain different tree species. Section four addresses sanitary felling in planted forests. Section five deals with sanitary felling in protected forests where main use felling is authorized. Section six deals with sanitary felling in protected forests in which main use felling is not authorized. Section seven classifies special types of sanitary felling. Section eight covers the registration of sanitary felling. Section nine deals with quality control of sanitary felling. Section ten establishes the modalities for applying the Regulation and liability.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 1767 of 1993 regarding the regulation of land relationship and the promotion of land reform in Russia.
Policy_Content: The President decrees that the plots of land and the property connected with them must be considered real estate. The real estate contracts are regulated by Civil Code in accordance with Land, Forestry, Environmental, other specific Legislative Acts and this Decree. Physical And juridical persons, that own plots of land, have the right to sell, to bequeath, to give as a gift, to mortgage, to lease, to exchange and to render them as a share to the-joint stock companies. Each landowner is provided with land certificate that must be registered into land cadastre. This land certificate is the unique document valid for all types of land contract. This Decree validates the form of land certificate. The Government guarantees the safety and the protection of private property on land and the protection of the rights of landlords to make contracts as regards land property. The expropriation of private land for state or public purposes is authorized on the basis of compensation by mutual accord. The purchase of the plots of land for federal purposes is conducted by the Federal Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey on the basis of the Governmental Order.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Law of Property Act Implementation Act (1993)
Policy_Content: The provisions of the Law of Property Act apply to legal relations which were created before 1 December 1993 and which continue on that date unless otherwise provided for in this Act. The restitution, compensation and privatisation of property, and the retention in state ownership, municipalisation and re-nationalisation of property in the course of ownership reform is effected on the bases of and pursuant to the procedures provided for in the Principles of Ownership Reform Act and legislation arising therefrom. Ownership is protected pursuant to the provisions of the Law of Property Act as of 1 December 1993 regardless of the date of violation. The prescription period commences to run on 1 December 1993 with respect to possession which was acquired before 1 December 1993.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret nº 93-210 fixant les conditions et les modalités d'intervention du fonds de dépollution.
Policy_Content: Le fonds de dépollution (FODEP), institué par les articles de 35 à 37 de la loi nº 92-122 (loi des finances pour la gestion 1993), a pour objet d'encourager les actions concourant à la protection de l'environnement contre la pollution industrielle par la participation au financement de projets d'installations visant à réduire ou à éliminer la pollution occasionnée par les entreprises industrielles et de projets d'unités de collecte et de recyclage de déchets. Le fonds est géré par l'agence nationale de protection de l'environnement. Le décret institue aussi la commission consultative chargée de l'octroi du concours du FODEP, qui est accordé sous forme de subvention calculée par référence au coût d'investissement initialment agréé sans que son montant dépasse 20 pourcent du coût et servie en trois tranches après constat de l'avancement des travaux établi par l'ANPE. Le décret comprend 16 articles répartis en 4 chapitres: dispositions générales (I); conditions d'éligibilité (II); présentation des dossiers (III); commission consultative (IV).
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Ordinance relating to the Law implementing the Federal Act on environment protection (Implementing Environment Protection Ordinance).
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Law relating to the Federal Act on environment protection of 25 April 1992. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to environmental issues in the Canton Appenzell Innerrhoden. The Ordinance consists of 24 articles divided into 8 chapters as follows: Competent authorities (I); Delegation of implementing tasks (II); Contribution of the Canton (III); Procedures for environmental impact assessment (IV); Waste management (V); Air pollution, heat cost billing (VI); Noise protection (VII); Miscellaneous Provisions (VIII).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,EIA,Environmental fees/charges,Waste management,Soil pollution/quality,Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Hazardous substances,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties

Policy: Government Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia regarding environmental impact assessment (No. 51 of 1993).
Policy_Content: Article 2 lists businesses and activities that may have a significant impact on the environment. An environment impact statement ("ANDAL") shall be prepared for these type of operations. The significance of impact shall be determined on criteria listed in article 3. Final operating permits shall be granted only after implementation of environmental management plan and environmental monitoring plans (art. 5). Articles 7 to 14 concern procedures of ANDAL and the plans mentioned. Documents shall be submitted to the responsible Environmental Impact Assessment Commission ("AMDAL") established under articles 17 and 18. (29 articles)
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Law No. 2473-XII of 1993 on architecture and urban planning.
Policy_Content: This Law lays down the foundations for the legal regulation of architecture and urban planning, aimed at the creation of the valuable natural human habitat, it safeguards the rights and establishes liability for the subjects of architecture and urban planning relationship. This Law consists of VI Sections that contain 38 Articles. Section I lays down the general provisions. Section II establishes the rights and the liability of the subjects of architectural and urban planning activity. Section III deals with the state regulation in the sphere of architectural and urban planning activity. Section IV concerns architectural and urban planning activity. Section V regards architectural and urban planning control. Section VI establishes the liability for the infringement of architectural and urban planning legislation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No. 10 of the Federal Forest Service on forest monitoring.
Policy_Content: Forest monitoring shall be one of the main functions of the Federal Forest Service and it shall be organized and carried out thereby. The object of forest monitoring shall be the whole forest estate irrespectively of the form of property. The main purpose of forest monitoring shall be data collection and reporting on the state of forests with a view of ensuring sustainable forest management. Forest monitoring system shall be structure at three levels: (a) federal (national); (b) regional; and (c) local.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1030 validating the Regulation on forest ecosystem monitoring.
Policy_Content: Forest monitoring represents the system of regular observations, evaluation, control and forecast on the state of forests. The purpose of the forest monitoring shall be to refresh information on forest stock necessary for the decision-making as regards multi-purpose use of forest resources and forecasts of the changes in the forest ecosystems. Forest monitoring documentation shall include forest stock maps and distribution of forests among forest owners, distribution by areas, species, types of forests, textual and statistical materials on the state and the assessment of the forest stock.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Basic Environmental Law (Law No. 91 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Law comprises three chapters. Chapter 1 sets forth general provisions, including a statement of its goal to comprehensively and systematically promote policies for environmental conservation for present and future generations; a recognition of the delicate environmental balance of the eco-system and its finite carrying capacity; the need to reduce the environmental "load" of economic activities and to enhance scientific understanding in order to prevent interference with conservation. Three "basic principles" are spelled out in articles 3 through 5: the "enjoyment and future success of environmental blessings"; the "creation of a society ensuring sustainable development with reduced environmental load"; and "active promotion of global environmental conservation through international cooperation". The relative responsibilities of the state, local governments, corporations and individual citizens in relation to these "basic principals" and with respect to the reduction of environmental "loads" associated with their activities are articulated. Corporations must make efforts to use recyclable resources, and take steps to ensure proper disposal of wastes. Chapter 2 (arts. 14-40) deals with basic policies for environmental conservation. The Government is obligated to establish a Basic Environmental Plan outlining overall policies for conservation, which shall be subject to Cabinet approval and thereafter implemented without delay by the Prime Minister. The Government is also obligated to establish environmental quality standards for air, water, soil and noise.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water
Keyword: Framework law,Basic legislation,Air quality/air pollution,Marine pollution,Noise pollution,Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Ecosystem preservation,Education,Environmental planning,Recycling/reuse,Waste management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: National Agricultural Research Institute Regulations, 1993.
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for the establishment of the National Agricultural Research Institute which shall work in accordance with a research agenda formulated by the National Agricultural Research Board established under regulation 3 of the Act. The Institute shall carry out applied research in the field of: (a) agronomy; (b) livestock; (c) forestry; (d) natural resources, and carry out other research activities assigned by the Board, NGOs and private farmers (reg. 4). The Institute may generate its own funds through contracts, grants, subventions, private or public sector funds (reg. 13). (15 regulations)

Policy: Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage Act.
Policy_Content: The International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage shall form part of the Marshall islands subject to the provisions of this Chapter. An action for compensation under this Chapter may be brought in the Republic if pollution damage resulting from an incident covered under the Convention on Civil Liability has been sustained within the Republic, including its territorial sea, or if measures have been taken to prevent or minimize such damage in that area. Any such action shall be brought before the High Court. The Limitation Fund referred to in Article V (3) of the Convention on Civil Liability shall be constituted with the High Court. Certificates attesting that insurance or other financial security is in force as required under Article VII (2) of the Convention on Civil Liability, shall be issued by the Maritime Administrator. Penalties for lack of certificate are prescribed.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Oil pollution,International agreement-implementation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Liability/compensation
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Protection of the Sea (Imposition of Contributions to Oil Pollution Compensation Fund--Customs) Act 1993.

Contributions payable under the Protection of the Sea (Oil Pollution Compensation Fund) Act 1993 are imposed only so far as those contributions are duties of customs within the meaning of section 55 of the Constitution. The Act does not impose tax on property of a State.

Policy: Decreto Nº 45/93 - Reglamento Forestal.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto se ocupa del uso del suelo de vocación forestal, del manejo sostenido de los bosques y su aprovechamiento, así como de la industrialización y comercialización de los productos forestales. El Decreto trata de involucrar a la población local mediante la creación de Consejos Forestales Municipales. El órgano encargado de la administración forestal del Estado es el Instituto Nicaragüense de Recursos Naturales y del Ambiente (IRENA), que ejerce sus funciones a través del Servicio Forestal Nacional (SFN-IRENA). Se prevé un Plan de Acción Forestal que fijará las políticas y prioridades del sector que serán ejecutadas por el Servicio Forestal Nacional. Asimismo, se crea, adscrita al IRENA, la Administración Forestal Estatal (ADFOREST), para la administración y el manejo de las tierras forestales estatales, con excepción de aquellas destinadas a reservas biológicas o parques nacionales que estén bajo la administración del Servicio de Areas Protegidas y Parques Nacionales. El Decreto crea además, la Comisión Nacional de Bosques y Desarrollo Forestal o Comisión Nacional Forestal, órgano estatal de coordinación y consulta interinstitucional del sector forestal nacional. El Decreto establece dos tipos de permisos, los permisos de reconocimiento de recursos forestales y los permisos de aprovechamiento forestal; los primeros los otorga el propietario de la tierra forestal privada o ADFOREST en el caso de tierras forestales estatales; los segundos los otorga el SFN IRENA. El Decreto se refiere al registro y control del corte, transporte y procesamiento de los productos forestales y establece restricciones especiales sobre la industria forestal de primera transformación. Por último, el reglamento establece una lista de sanciones y el procedimiento administrativo a que se sujetará su imposición.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Internal trade,Timber extraction/logging,Forest service/forest officers,Land clearing,Soil conservation/soil improvement
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Protection of the Sea (Oil Pollution Compensation Funds) Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act gives effect in the Commonwealth to provisions of the International Convention on the Establishment of an International Fund for Compensation for Oil Pollution Damage 1971, the Protocol of 1976 to the 1971 Convention, and the 1992 Protocol to the 1971 Convention. The Act consists of 47 sections divided into four Chapters: Preliminary (1); The 1971 Convention (2); The 1992 Convention (3); Regulations (4). The Act is completed by 3 Schedules containing the text of the Convention and the Protocols. The Governor-General may make regulations prescribing matters (a) required or permitted by this Act to be prescribed; or (b) necessary or convenient to be prescribed for the carrying out or giving effect to this Act. The Fund has the same legal personality as a company and may intervene in proceedings for compensation arising under Part II of the Protection of the Sea (Civil Liability) Act of 24 August 1995.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
