Policy: Federal Act on Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to set up systems for (i) assessing the impact of planned activities on man, animals and plants, soil, water, air and climate, ecosystems, landscapes and cultural heritage; (ii) providing information on these activities and involving the public in the relevant decision-making processes. The Act also contains a schedule of projects that must be subjected to a sustainability test, namely an environmental impact assessment, and sets out the procedure to be followed for conducting and monitoring this test. The relevant authorities are responsible for drawing up an environmental impact research plan and to draft a list of experts qualified to carry out sustainability evaluations. The Act requires the authorities concerned to provide free public access to all the information available on the sustainability tests conducted on the planned activities, of which a list is given in the schedule. It also requires public hearings to held to debate the projects, and provides the possibility for independent experts to express dissenting opinions. The ways in which the public may participate in decision-taking are through written or oral statements, petitions and addressing the public hearings. The projects approved following an environmental impact study must be implemented in accordance with the conditions laid down in the licences issued for them. During the following three to five years, sustainability tests must be conducted on them to ensure total compliance. If not, the authorization or licence may be withdrawn.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: EIA,Basic legislation,Environmental planning,Climate change,Institution,Ecosystem preservation,Monitoring,Data collection/reporting,Precautionary principle,Transboundary effects,Land-use planning,Sustainable development,Public participation,Access-to-justice,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1021 regarding mowing and grazing on the territory of forest estate.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates the use of forest estate for mowing and grazing and it shall be compulsory for all enterprises, institutions, organizations and economic entities carrying out the aforesaid activities. Agricultural land belonging to forest estate shall be primarily allotted for mowing. Clearings and unforested areas that are not destined for reforestation can also be used for mowing. Mowing areas shall be established and allotted annually. Grazing shall be authorized on the plots of forest estate in accordance with the established grazing rates except for protected areas, nature and biosphere reserves, national parks and urban forests.  Grazing shall be prohibited: (a) on forest plantations which are not sufficiently high so as to prevent the damage of the point of trees by cattle; (b) in the natural underwood; (c) in reforestation areas; (c) in forest areas destined for procurements of fruits, edible nuts, mushrooms and medicinal plants. Grazing of goats on the territory of the forest estate shall be prohibited.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Forestry
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, que consta de 9 títulos y 34 artículos, crea el Sistema de cajas de ahorro y crédito rural como entidad privada de intermediación financiera en el área rural, con el objeto de facilitar el acceso al crédito y otros servicios financieros a los productores rurales.

Policy: Cooperatives Act of 1993.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Chapter is to promote, foster, and encourage the intelligent and orderly marketing of certain products through the formation of cooperative associations to eliminate speculation and waste in the production and marketing of certain products; to make the distribution of cooperative products between producer and consumer as direct as can be efficiently done; and to stabilize the marketing of cooperative products. Five or more persons, a majority of whom are residents of the Republic engaged in the production of cooperative products, may form a cooperative association, with or without shares of stock, under the provisions of this Chapter. The Chapter specifies the compulsory content of Articles of Association in par. 714. Each cooperative association shall within thirty (30) days after its incorporation, adopt for its government and management, a code of bylaws, not inconsistent with this Chapter. The affairs of the cooperative association shall be managed by a Board of Directors. The by-laws may provide for an executive committee and may allot to such committee all the functions and powers of the board of directors, subject to the general direction and control of the Board. Par. 742 specifies criteria for eligibility as a member of a Cooperative. A cooperative association may engage in any activity in connection with the marketing, selling, preserving, harvesting, drying, processing, manufacturing, canning, packing, grading, storing, handling, or utilization of any cooperative products produced or delivered to it by its members; or the manufacturing or marketing of the by-products thereof: or any activity in connection with the purchase, hiring, or use by its members of supplies, machinery, or equipment, or in the financing of any such activities (par. 754). Par. 765 and following provide for binding marketing contracts between the Cooperative and its members.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Copra Tax Act of 1992.
Policy_Content: This Act requires a specified public body called Tobolar, to collect a tax on the value of all copra delivered to it from within the Republic. The revenues realized from the copra tax authorized in this Chapter shall be prorated and remitted to the local governments strictly for the purposes of: (a) copra purchases within the local government area, provided that any surplus realized from cash sales of copra must be devoted to the purposes as set out in this Section; (b) economic development programs within the local government area which may include, but are not limited to, seaweed cultivation, fisheries, agriculture, land and sea transportation, communications, and education and management capabilities; and (c) contributions to Social Security on behalf of copra workers. The Minister of Internal Affairs shall, prior to the initial disbursement of funds under this Chapter, promulgate regulations that will assure appropriate accounting and use of funds by local governments.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 026-93-ITINCI ─ Norma el uso del Sistema Legal de Unidades de Medida del Perú.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo dispone que el uso del Sistema Legal de Unidades de Medida del Perú es obligatorio en todas las actividades que se desarrollen en el país y debe expresarse en todos los documentos públicos y privados. El Servicio Nacional de Metrología del INDECOPI difundirá el Sistema. Todo medio de medición utilizado en operaciones de carácter comercial, valorización de servicios de trabajos, pruebas periciales, oficinas públicas y en todas aquellas actividades que determinen los organismos competentes, deberá encontrarse aterido.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Consumer protection,Internal trade,International trade
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Arrêté conjoint Nº 93/8993/PRG/SSG fixant la nomenclature technique des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté a été pris en application du Code de l'environnement de 1987 et du décret de 1989 régissant les installations classées. En vertu de ces deux textes, les installations fixes susceptibles de générer des pollutions importantes sont classées en deux catégories, selon le degré de danger potentiel qu'elles présentent pour l'environnement. Elles sont soumises à des règles sensiblement identiques (autorisation, inspection, surveillance), mais qui diffèrent quelque peu selon la catégorie de classement, les établissements de la première classe étant en principe plus dommageables et sujets de ce fait à un contrôle plus rigoureux. L'objet du présent Arrêté est précisément de déterminer, sous la forme d'une nomenclature technique, les installations de la première classe et ceux de la deuxième catégorie. La nomenclature, qui comprend 71 types d'installations, est divisée en trois colonnes: l'une désigne les activités, l'autre mentionne leurs inconvénients et la troisième spécifie la ou les classes correspondantes (une même activité pouvant, en fonction de son envergure ou de ses caractéristiques, figurer dans la première ou la deuxième classe).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Methodical Instruction for detection and detention of the offenders of regime of protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Methodical Instruction establishes that safeguard of state biosphere reserves and enforcement of regime of protected areas shall be intended complex arrangements carried out by state inspections for safeguarding of state biosphere reserves on the territory, delimited areas of water, conservation areas of reserves and sanctuaries with a view of detection and suppression of the environmental offences. In case of necessity voluntary inspectors and law enforcement officers can be involved in safeguarding of protected areas. Regular inspectors shall detain offenders, identify him and draw reports. Hunting gear of the offender shall be confiscated in case of armed resistance to the inspectors, criminal intent of the offence, absence of firearms licence and other personal identification documentation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Arrêté relatif au rapport de la commission temporaire du développement des régions de montagne en république de Bulgarie.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté prévoit l'adoption de la part de l'Assemblée Nationale du rapport de la commission temporaire du développement des régions de montagne à titre d'objectif général à réaliser dans le cadre de son mandat.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Land Lease Commission Act of 1993.
Policy_Content: A Commission is established to review all land leases prior to execution to ensure that the interests of all relevant landowners and successors in interest are adequately safeguarded and protected. The review serves the purpose of avoiding land right disputes mainly involving foreign investors and (local) landowners and successors in interest. The Commission shall be headed by the Attorney-General. The Commission shall approve and submit to the Clerk of Court for filing, only those land leases which are in compliance with the provisions of section 404.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Law on foreign investment (1993).
Policy_Content: This Law determines legal, economic and organizational bases of realization of foreign investments on the territory of Turkmenistan and is aimed to attract in national economy foreign advanced technologies, managerial experience, material and financial resources and at the development of market economy. By foreign investment there are meant all kinds of property and intellectual values, which are invested by foreign investors into the object of entrepreneurial and other activities in the form of: right to economic activities, including exploration, extraction, output of mine or exploitation of natural resources, received by Law or agreement. The document consists of V Sections that contain 32 Articles. Sec.I (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Sec.II (Arts.6-19) regards creation of legal entities with foreign participation and their activities. Sec.III (Arts.20-26) regards state guarantees of foreign investment protection. Sec.IV (Arts.27-30) deals with labour and social relations of legal entities with foreign participation governed by law. Sec.V (Arts.31-32) regards liquidation of the legal entity with foreign participation and solution of arguments.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law on free economic zones (1993).
Policy_Content: The present Law determines general legal and economic principles of the establishment and functioning of free economic zones, regulates the relations between the subjects of economic activity operating on the territory of a free economic zone. The Law aims at ensuring the development of the regional economic and scientific-technical potential with the involvement of foreign investors and subjects of economic activity from the private sector of economy. Legal entities and physical persons of Turkmenistan and other states operating on the territory of a free economic zone shall be exempt for three years from paying rent for land starting from the moment of signing a rent agreement. Upon expiration of the exemption period the rate of the rent payment for land shall be decreased: for enterprises with a foreign share in the statutory fund not less than 30 percent the rate shall be decreased by 50 percent; for physical persons and legal entities of Turkmenistan the rate shall be decreased by 20 percent. The terms of agreements on rent of land lots, may be changed in accordance with the legislation of Turkmenistan by a mutual agreement of the parties or by the decision of Economic court (art. 12). The Annex contains the list of free economic zones which principal activities include manufacturing and processing of agricultural commodities and fish-processing industry. The Law consists of 3 Sections that contain 15 articles and the list of free economic zones in Turkmenistan. Section 1 (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 6-9) regards functioning of a free economic zone. Section 3 (arts. 10-15) deals with foreign currency and monetary mechanism of pricing.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: NOM-048-ECOL-1993: Niveles máximos permisibles de emisión provenientes del escape de las motocicletas que usan gasolina como combustible.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana establece los niveles máximos permisibles de emisión de hidrocarburos, monóxido de carbono y humo, provenientes del escape de las motocicletas en circulación que usan gasolina o mezcla de gasolina-aceite como combustible.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Oil pollution,Emissions,Environmental standards,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 33976/3189/93 amending Ministerial Decree No. 28433/2448 of 1992 which relates to the measures to be taken against air pollution by emissions from motor vehicles, in compliance with the provisions of Council Directive 93/59/EEC.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to align the Greek legislative frame with the provisions of Council Directive 93/59/EEC regarding the measures to be taken against air pollution by emissions from motor vehicles. This Decree amends Annex I, III, IV, V and IX of Ministerial Decree No. 28433/2448 of 1992 which sets out emission standards for motor vehicles.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1006 of 1993 regarding the setting up of the Governmental commission on environmental protection and the use of natural resources.
Policy_Content: For the purpose of coordination of activity of the state bodies aimed at the solution of pressing problems of the use of natural resources and environmental protection the Government decrees to set up the Governmental commission. This commission is a permanent body entitled to coordinate the activities of the Federal executive organs and of the Regional authorities for the joint realisation of environmental protection measures and Federal and International large-scale ecological programs, and exercise control over the rational use of natural resources.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on the date of issue.

Policy: Regulations of the People's Republic of China on the Exploitation of Onshore Petroleum Resources in Cooperation with Foreign Enterprises.
Policy_Content: These Regulations aim at ensuring the development of the petroleum industry and promoting international economic cooperation and technical exchange. The Text consists of 31 articles divided into 6 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Rights and Obligations of Foreign Contractors (II); Petroleum Operations(III); Settlement of Disputes (IV); Legal Responsibilities (V); Supplementary Provisions (VI).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Upper Austria Land Use Planning Law 1994.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is the economic and expedient use of the soil; the protection and care of the environment and , in particular the conservation or reinstatement of the sustainable purity of the air, water and soil, as well as the avoidance of noise; the conservation or reinstatement of a healthy nature, the protection of the indigenous fauna and flora and their natural living spaces, of the cultural heritage and, finally, in particular that of housing and recreational areas. Text consists of 40 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Land use planning in general (II); Local land use planning (III); Transitional and final provisions (IV).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,Basic legislation,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Land tenure,Land reform,Land consolidation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy: Regulations on Grassland Fire Prevention.
Policy_Content: These Regulations are formulated in accordance with the Grassland Law of the People's Republic of China for the purpose of strengthening grassland fire prevention, effectively preventing and suppressing grassland fires, protecting grasslands and ensuring safety of people's lives and property. The Regulations consist of 5 Chapters: General provisions (I); Grassland fire prevention(II); Grassland fire fighting and rescue (III); Post-disaster disposal (IV); Legal responsibilities (IV); Supplementary provisions (V).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret nº 93-2055, instituant le grand prix du Président de la République pour la protection de la nature et de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Il est institué un prix annuel pour l'encouragement à la protection de la nature et de l'environnemnt dénommé "Grand Prix du Président de la République pour la protection de la nature et de l'environnemnet". Ce prix est attribué aux personnes physiques ou aux personnes morales privées, ou aux associations de protection de la nature et de l'environnement ou aux collectivités publiques locales ayant accompli les meilleures actions visant la protection de la nature et de l'environnemnet et ayant déployé des efforts considérables pour la sauvegarde des grands espaces naturels, la lutte contre la pollution et les nuissances, la protection de la faune et de la flore, la protection des sites naturels et des paysages.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Ordonnance sur le droit foncier rural (ODFR).
Policy_Content: Ordonnance sur le droit foncier rural. Le texte comprend 8 articles divisés en 4 sections comme suit: Valeur de rendement (I); Mention au registre foncier (II); Coordination des procédures et voies de droit (III); Dispositions finales (IV).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Cadastre/land registration,Land tenure,Land consolidation,Agricultural development,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Court/tribunal
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 1994.

Policy: Clean Air Act 1991.
Policy_Content: The Act provides for control of air pollution through licensing of polluting plants and other measures to prevent and reduce air pollution. There is established a body called the Environmental Authority under section 3. No person shall commence or continue the construction of a controlled plant, except a moveable plant, unless there is a construction permit in force for the purpose. "Controlled plant" means a plant described in the First Schedule. A person shall not commence or continue the operation of a controlled plant unless there is an operating licence in force for the purpose. Permits and licences shall be issued by the Authority. The Authority may grant an operating licence subject to such terms and conditions as it may think fit, whether or not relating to the concentrations, weights or rates of emission of air contaminants referred to in regulations, or subject to such requirements as it may think fit regarding the manner in which and the frequency with which levels of concentration, density or weight of air contaminants to be emitted by the plant are to be recorded (sec 9). Permits or licences are not transferable. Section 11 defines regulation making powers of the Minister. An inspector may issue a Emission Control Order pursuant to and in accordance with section 12. The Minister may issue Stop Orders under section 13. Sections 16 and 17 provide for appeals from decisions made under this Act to the Minister or to court. Other provisions concern enforcement, prescribe penalties and grant powers to the Minister to make Rules. (29 sections completed by 3 Schedules)
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Clean Air Regulations 1993.
Policy_Content: The Regulations concern the control of open fires, releases of hazardous material or controlled chemical, i.e. a chemical listed in Schedule 3, into the air, the importation into Bermuda, or use in Bermuda, or export from Bermuda, of a controlled chemical, emission into the air of air contaminants with specified values, visibility impact control of air contaminants, fuel sulphur restrictions at controlled plants and reporting. "Hazardous material" means a material that is: (a) toxic, corrosive, ignitable or reactive; and (b) capable of harming any human being, animal, vegetation or material. Offences are prescribed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Authorization/permit,Offences/penalties,Environmental standards,Hazardous substances,Internal trade
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Clean Air Rules 1993.
Policy_Content: These Rules implement provisions of the Clean Air Act, 1991.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 499 regarding involvement of arable land in agriculture.
Policy_Content: Involvement of arable land in agriculture is one of the most important tasks of the agricultural institutions that shall contribute to rising up agricultural production. The Government decrees to validate the Regulation on organization of dehkan farms and the Regulation on the formation and concession of special land stock. Regulation on organization of dehkan farms establishes that dehkan farms shall be set up on lands of special land stocks by executive committees of the local Councils of people’s deputies, and also on lands of kolkhozes, sovkhozes and other agricultural enterprises. Dehkan farms shall be allotted lands on condition of life-long hereditable possession. Citizens engaged in dehkan farming can rent additional land plots for agricultural production. The dimensions of a plot of land shall be determined for each single case shall be determined by executive committees of the local Councils of people’s deputies in consideration of the membership of a dehkan farm and its specialization. The Regulation on organization of dehkan farms consists of 4 Sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 regards the modalities of concession of the plots of land to a dehkan farm on condition of life-long hereditable possession pertaining to special land stock. Section 3 establishes the modalities of concession of land pertaining to special stock to a dehkan farm. Section 4 establishes the modalities of concession of the plots of land to citizens coming out of kolkhozes, sovkhozes and other agricultural enterprises and allotment of the plots of land to them for the purpose of setting up dehkan farms. The Regulation on the formation and concession of special land stock establishes the modalities of the formation of special land stock by the executive committees of the district Councils of people’s deputies for its subsequent re-distribution for the purpose of ensuring equal conditions for all forms of economic activity on land. The Regulation consists of 4 Sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 establishes criteria of determination of lands out of use or not used rationally. Section 3 regards organizational activity for the formation of special land stock. Section 4 regards concession of the plots of land out of special stock.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law on foreign concessions (1993).
Policy_Content: The present Law shall define organizational, economic and legal terms and conditions of foreign concessions in Turkmenistan. A concession shall provide for the right given by the state to a foreign legal entity or a natural person – a concessionaire – to use plots of land, natural resources, enterprises and other assets on the basis of an agreement for a specified period of time and in return for a payment. Concession activity in Turkmenistan is carried out in accordance with the following principles: rational use of natural resources, ensuring ecological, sanitary and hygienic safety. The objects of concession shall be: a) plots of land and territories with their natural resources; b) water surfaces with their natural resources; c) single deposits of natural resources; d) industrial objects intended for exploration, development, production or exploitation of natural resources. The Law consists of 3 Sections that contain 20 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-6) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 7-14) regards the establishment and activity of concession enterprises. Section 3 (arts. 15-20) deals with regulation of concession relations.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law on property.
Policy_Content: The right of property in Turkmenistan is recognized and protected, the law ensures inviolability, equal protection and equal conditions for the development of all types and forms of property. Objects of property can be: land, subsoil, water resources, forests, flora and fauna, mining allotments. The following objects pertain to state property: land, industrial complexes of the national economy and state enterprises of agro-industrial complex. The Law consists of 8 Sections that contain 26 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-7) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 8-11) regards private property. Section 3 (arts. 12-13) regards state property. Section 4 (arts. 14-17) regards property of social associations (organizations). Section 5 (arts. 18-21) regards property of joint-ventures, foreign states, their legal and natural persons. Section 6 (art. 22) regards mixed (common) property. Section 7 (art. 23) regards cooperative property. Section 8 (arts. 24-26) regards ensuring and protection of property.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Irrigation,Cooperative/producer organization,Private forest,Land reform,Land tenure,Ownership,Mining,Surface water,Groundwater,Water supply,Wild fauna,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Patent Law (No. 867-12 of 1993).
Policy_Content: The Law regulates property and related private non-property issues arising in connection with  the  creation, legal protection and use of inventions, industrial patterns, trade marks and  service marks, and also issues related to the recognition of authors rights to a rationalization proposal. The objects of invention are: 1) devices; 2) processes; 3) substances; 4) micro-organic strains; 5) cell cultures of plants and animals; 6) the use of a known device, process, substance, strain in a new application. Not recognized to be patentable are inventions of varieties of plants and breeds of animals. The Act consists of 7 Sections composed of 41 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decreto Nº 199/93 - Crea el Fondo de Tierras (FONTIER).
Policy_Content: El Fonde de Tierras (FONTIER) es una asociación civil, sin fines de lucro, con personería jurídica, patrimonio y gobierno propio, de duración indefinida y con independencia administrativa, técnica y financiera (art. 1º). Tiene los siguientes fines: a) formalizar, ampliar y estructurar un esquema de financiamiento, incluyendo el redescuento de hipotecas fundamentalmente para la adquisición de tierras rurales por parte de personas que califiquen como beneficiarios de la reforma agraria; b) facilitar el acceso a la tierra, a los productos agropecuarios, con énfasis en los del sector reformado; y c) promover el conocimiento del nuevo sistema para estimular la participación (art. 3º). Tiene, entre otras, las siguientes funciones: a) crear los mecanismos financieros para la parcelación y traspaso de predios rurales destinados a la producción agropecuaria; b) establecer un mercado secundario de hipotecas; c) controlar créditos de fuentes nacionales e internacionales; d) promover y estimular la inversión de capitales públicos o privados, nacionales o extranjeros, para el financiamiento de predios rurales destinados a la producción agropecuaria; e) adquirir y enajenar créditos hipotecarios otorgados por los intermediarios; f) emitir obligaciones en formna de bonos, cédulas y cualquier otro título valor; g) subsidiar hasta en un 50 por ciento de su valor de mercado las ventas de tierras nacionales a beneficiarios de la reforma agraria, en parcelas hasta de 10 hectáreas por persona; h) financiar contratos de arrendamiento con opción a compra a favor de los beneficiarios de la reforma agraria.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Resolution Conama No. 10 implementing articles 3, 6 and 7 of Decree No. 750 of 10 February 1993 defining Atlantic forest standards.
Policy_Content: This Decision implements articles 3, 6 and 7 of Decree No. 750 of 10 February 1993 defining Atlantic forest standards. It consists of 10 articles establishing the standards and requirements to be met by the aforementioned forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the date of publication.

Policy: Law “On labor protection”.
Policy_Content: This Law is aimed at ensuring the rights of citizens to healthy and safe working conditions. Labor protection is a system of legal, socio-economic, organizational - technical, sanitary - hygienic, medical -preventive measures and means of ensuring safety, preservation of human health and performance in the workplace. The state guarantees workers the right to labor protection. Main directions of state policy in the field of labor protection are: (a) the priority of the life and health of workers in relation to the result of production activities of the enterprise, responsibility of enterprises for the creation of safe and healthy working conditions; (b) a comprehensive solution to the problems of labor protection on the basis of state and targeted programs on these issues; (c) social protection of employees, full compensation for damages, caused to workers by injury, occupational disease or other damage to health associated with the performance by them of work responsibilities; (d) establishment of uniform standards for labor protection for all enterprises; (e) use of economic methods of labor protection management, pursuing a policy of preferential taxation, participation of the state in financing labor protection measures; (f) implementation of vocational training of the population, vocational training and advanced training of employees on labor protection issues; (g) licensing of potentially hazardous industries, certification of products (works, services) for industrial purposes; (h) establishment of state statistical reporting on conditions of labor, accidents at work and occupational diseases; (i) ensuring coordination of the activities of State bodies, institutions, organizations and associations of citizens that decide various problems of health protection, hygiene and labor safety; (j) support for the activities of public organizations in the field of labor protection; and (k) international cooperation in solving problems of labor protection, use of global experience in organizing work to improve working conditions labor safety. All employees are subject to mandatory state social insurance by management (employer). This Law contains IV Sections divided into 25 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II guarantees rights of workers to labor protection. Section III regards management of labor protection. Section IV regards implementation of labor protection.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Leasehold Reform (Collective Enfranchisement and Lease Renewal) Regulations 1993 (S.I. No. 2407 of 1993).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe the procedure to be followed, unless it is agreed otherwise, in giving effect to a claim to exercise the right to collective enfranchisement or a claim to exercise the right to lease renewal under Part I of the Leasehold Reform, Housing and Urban Development Act 1993. Schedule 1 specifies the procedure to be followed by a nominee purchaser and reversioner and, where appropriate, a relevant landlord, in giving effect to an initial notice claiming to exercise the right to collective enfranchisement given under Chapter I of Part I of the Act; and makes provision for payment of a deposit by the nominee purchaser on exchange of contracts. Schedule 2 specifies the procedure to be followed by a landlord and tenant in giving effect to a tenant's notice claiming the right to lease renewal under Chapter II of Part I of the Act; and makes provision for payment of a deposit by the tenant at any time when the tenant's notice is in force.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: These Regulations entered into force on 1 November 1993.

Policy: Order No. 260 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Basic Instruction on main use felling.
Policy_Content: This Order makes the Basic Instruction binding on all the organizations, enterprises, institutions and bodies of forest service. It sets the requirements for main use felling, methods and technologies for timber extraction, and reforestation measures. Main use felling shall be carried out in a manner that ensures the continuous, sustainable and rational use of forest resources, timely and efficient reforestation and reinforcement of the environmental protection functions of forests. Main use felling shall be prohibited in: (a) national parks, recreational forests, urban forests, hazelnut plantations, urban forests, protection forests and tundra forests; and (b) nature reserves. Only intermediate felling shall be authorized in cedar forest. In boreal forests where cryosolic soil is prevalent, timber extraction methods and techniques must ensure the stability of vegetation and conserve the ecosystem to prevent thermokarst. Three types of timber extraction shall be authorized: (a) selective felling; (b) gradual felling; and (c) clear felling.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation No. 259 of the Federal Forest Service regarding main use felling in the forests of the Ural.
Policy_Content: This Regulation applies to plain land forests and mountain forests and shall be binding on all legal persons, foreign or domestic, and natural persons that undertake forestry operations or management. Felling operations must ensure: (a) the continuous, sustainable and rational use of forest resources; (b) that the water conservation and protective functions of forests is preserved and strengthened; and (c) reforestation, increased forest productivity and prevention of erosion. The type of felling and timber extraction determined according to the species, use, and age of the trees and the amount and condition of undergrowth. The following types of felling shall be authorized in the forests of the Ural: (a) selection felling; (b) gradual felling and (c) clear felling.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Noise Abatement Act (Cap. 40:99).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the control and reduction of noise in general and in particular in noise abatement zones declared as such under this Act.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Ley sobre disolución de latifundios y protección a la industria ganadera.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de utilidad pública en el Estado de Coahuila el fraccionamiento de los latifundios y el fomento o desarrollo de la industria ganadera. En este sentido la Ley prohíbe en el Estado de Coahuila el dominio de latifundios en manos de una sola persona física o jurídica (entendiéndose por latifundio toda propiedad territorial que exceda de cincuenta mil hectáreas destinadas a la explotación de la ganadería
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land reform,Subdivision of land,Agricultural development,Animal production
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 19.253 - Establece normas sobre protección, fomento y desarrollo de los indígenas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como finalidad la protección, el fomento y el desarrollo de las comunidades indígenas. El título II (arts. 12-22) se ocupa de manera particular del reconocimiento y protección de las tierras indígenas. A efectos de esta Ley son tierras indígenas aquellas que las personas o comunidades indígenas actualmente ocupan en propiedad o posesión históricamente, o bien en virtud de los títulos indicados en el artículo 12, así como las que los indígenas o sus comunidades reciban a título gratuito del Estado. Las tierras indígenas estarán exentas del pago de contribuciones territoriales. Además, no podrán ser enajenadas, embargadas, gravadas ni adquiridas por prescripción, salvo entre personas o comunidades pertenecientes a una misma etnia (art. 13). La Corporación Nacional de Desarrollo Indígena mantendrá el Registro Público de Tierras Indígenas. El artículo 18 se refiere a la sucesión de las tierras indígenas. El artículo 20 dispone la creación del Fondo para Tierras y Aguas Indígenas.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land tenure,Traditional rights/customary rights,Cadastre/land registration,Inheritance,Special fund,Gender,Indigenous peoples,Right to water,Human rights
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Styria Land Transaction Law.
Policy_Content: The objective of the present Law is to safeguard the public interest on the occasion of the transfer of land or parts thereof, taking into account the need to comply with the principles of a sustainable protection of the environment, nature and landscape. The text consists of 40 articles divided into 11 Parts as follows: Acquisition of agricultural and forestry land (I); Acquisition of building plots (II); Acquisition of land by foreigners (III); Provisions concerning civil law (IV); Competent authorities (V); Penalties and final provisions (VI).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation No. 253 of the Federal Forest Service regarding sanitary felling in the forests of the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets the requirements and types of sanitary felling and the technologies that may be used. Sanitary felling shall promote the growth of highly productive precious forest species and conserve and strengthen timber use and the protective functions of forests. Sanitary felling shall entail the removal of unfavourable tree species to create favourable growing conditions for precious main tree species. The following types of sanitary felling shall be authorized: (a) first cleaning; (b) early thinning; (c) isolation; and (d) advanced thinning. Standard requirements for sanitary felling shall determine: (a) timing and duration; (b) intensity; and (c) frequency.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Loi sur l'agriculture.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte la réglementation relative à l’agriculture. En particulier, ella a pour but de promouvoir dans le canton du Valais une agriculture adaptée au site, productive, orientée vers les besoins du marché et res-pectueuse de l'environnement. En outre, elle vise à améliorer les conditions d'existence de la population paysanne et elle encourage les exploitations de type familial à plein temps, à temps partiel, ainsi que les communautés d'exploitations. Elle favorise l'intégration harmonieuse de l'agriculture dans l'ensemble des activités socio-économiques. Elle applique et complète aussi la législation fédérale. Le texte comprend 83 articles répartis en 12 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1er); Maintien des terres agricoles et du paysage rural - Mesures en faveur de l'amélioration des structures (2); Formation - Vulgarisation et essais agricoles (3); Innovations technologiques (4); Dispositions concernant les branches de production (5); Organisations professionnelles (6); Information, promotion et mise en valeur des produits agricoles (7); Questions sociales (8); Aménagement rural (9); Dispositions diverses (10); Dispositions pénales (11); Dispositions transitoires et finales (12).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Ecological production/organic production,Agricultural land,Agricultural commodities,Crops/grasses,Offences/penalties,Family farming,Mountain area,Food quality control/food safety,Milk/dairy products,Animal production,Fruits/edible nuts,Viticulture/oenological practices,Plant protection
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 20 of 1993 regulating the Ministry of Municipality Affairs and Agriculture and defining its competencies.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree is composed of 27 articles. Articles 1 and 2 define competencies of the Ministry of Municipality Affairs and Agriculture in particular to: regulate and organize tows and villages; carry out land survey and division; lay down plans, projects, studies and researches for agricultural development; define requirements and conditions for the issuance of licences for the construction, industrial and commercial shops; expropriate lands for public utilities; propose plans for the execution of architectural urban projects; construct and maintain roads, streets, public utilities and installations; manage State lands; create gardens and parks; protect the environment against pollution; and, authorize digging of wells for ground water. Articles 3 to 6 deal with competencies of the Minister, Undersecretary of the Ministry, and Projecting and Monitoring Unit. Article 7 divides the Ministry into the following Departments: Urban Projecting; Land Management and Expropriation; Building Engineering; Civil Engineering; Environment; Agricultural Development; Fish Wealth; Agricultural Researches and Water; Mechanic Equipment; Administrative and Finance Affairs; Geographic Data System; Administrative data System; and Municipalities. Articles 8 to 21 define competencies and duties of the aforementioned Departments. Articles 23 to 27 contain general provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Legislative Decree enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation No. 253 of the Federal Forest Service regarding timber extraction for sanitary purposes in the mountain forests of the Northern Caucasus.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is destined to all forest officials and forest industry employees that are authorized to carry out timber extraction for sanitary purposes and exercise control over it. Federal Forest Service has drawn up this Regulation on the basis of the draft elaborated by Research Institute of Mountain Forestry and Forest Ecology in accordance with Pan-Russian Institute of Timber. The Regulation consists of 16 Sections and contains 14 Annexes. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 specifies the purposes and the targets of timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 3  classifies the types of trees and the methods of cutting. Section 4 specifies types of afforestation for which sanitary timber extraction is ordered. Section 5 establishes subsequency and timing of timber extraction for sanitary purposes according to seasons. Section 6 deals with the standards of timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 7 defines the technology of timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 8 regards planning and determination of dimension of timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 9 deals with allotment of afforestation for timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 10 regards land clearing in the cutting area. Section 11 regards timber extraction for different timber species. Section 12 concerns timber extraction in afforestation of different uses. Section 13 regards other kinds of timber extraction. Section 14 deals with inventory of the results of timber extraction. Section 15 regards quality control of timber extraction for sanitary purposes. Section 16 establishes responsibility for carrying out of timber extraction for sanitary purposes.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Mountain area,Timber extraction/logging,Afforestation/reforestation,Land clearing,Public forest,Inventory,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 356/93 - Autoriza los préstamos de tierras rústicas estatales ociosas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, que consta de 11 párrafos, faculta a los directores de empresas agropecuarias y forestales del Ministerio de Agricultura y directores de los complejos agroindustriales del Ministerio del Azúcar, a fin de que autoricen para autoconsumo familiar los préstamos de tierra rústica estatal ociosa en carácter de usufructo gratuito a jubilados o personas que por causas plenamente justificadas no puedan trabajar sistemáticamente en la agricultura (par. 1º). Las tierras ociosas objeto de entrega por este concepto serán las pequeñas parcelas de tierra que por ser aisladas no pueden integrarse a cooperativas de producción agropecuaria o en unidades básicas de producción cooperativa, y su extensión no excederá los 6 cordeles que se asignan para satisfacer el consumo familiar (par. 4º). En la autorización emitida se consignará, entre otras, la extensión y linderos de la tierra entregada, la prohibición de cederla o de realizar construcciones permanentes (par. 6º).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Urban and peri-urban agriculture,Family farming,Land tenure,Right of use,Public land
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Ordinance on proceeding coordination and environmental impact assessment.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Planning and Building Law of 3 December 1978, the Federal Environment Protection Act of 7 October 1983 and the Federal Impact Assessment Ordinance of 19 October 1988. In particular, the present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to material and formal coordination of various spatial environmental authorization procedures and to project management on cantonal level. The text – consisting of 18 articles – deals with the following aspects: purpose, definition of terms, exceptions, management of projects, coordination, information, deadlines, biosecurity, environmental impact assessment, entry into force.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Guidelines implementing the environmental impact assessment.
Policy_Content: The present Guidelines implement, inter alia, the Federal Environment Protection Act of 7 October 1983 and the Ordinance on proceeding coordination and environmental impact assessment of 28 September 1993. In particular, the Guidelines regulate in detail the implementation of the environmental impact assessment. The text – consisting of 15 articles – deals with the following aspects: purpose, competences of Environment Offices, plants subject to the Federal Major Accident Ordinance of 27 February 1991, repeal and entry into force.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Interim measures for administration of grain risk funds.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to protect the farmers’ enthusiasm for growing grains, ensure the stable growth of grain production, and promote the reform of the grain circulation system. The Measures consist of 10 articles. The grain risk fund is composed of the central subsidy and the provincial financial budget. The remaining articles of the Measures covers, among others, the procedures and requirements for the use of the fund, and legal liabilities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Companies Act 1993 (1993 No 105).
Policy_Content: The Companies Act is organised in 22 Parts and 13 Schedules. Part 1 contains preliminary provisions and provides for meaning of public notice, solvency test, holding company and subsidiary, etc. Part 2 lays down the incorporation discipline; it lists essential requirements, method of incorporation and affirms the separate legal personality principle under which a company is a legal entity in its own right separate from its shareholders and continues in existence until it is removed from the New Zealand register. Part 3, 4 and 5 regulate respectively capacity, powers, and validity of actions of companies, company names and company constitution. Part 6 concerns shares and debentures and provides details on legal nature of shares, rights and powers attaching to shares, types of shares, transferability of shares, contracts for issue of shares	and other rules on issuing shares, distribution to shareholders, redemption of shares, and situation where the company can acquire its own shares. Part 7 is on rights and obligations of shareholders and Part 8 encompasses powers and duties of directors. Part 9 is on enforcement. Part 10, 11 and 12 lay down rules for administration of companies, records keeping and financial reporting, and disclosure to stakeholders. Part 13, 14 and 15 regulate amalgamation and compromises with creditors. Part 15A voluntary administration. Part 16 the process of liquidation and Part 17 removal from New Zealand register. Part 18 and 19 concerns oversees companies and transfer of registration, including Registration of overseas companies as companies under this Act and Transfer of registration of companies to other jurisdictions. Part 20 regulates the role of the Registrar of Companies and the powers. Part 21 is offences and penalties, and Part 22 Miscellaneous provisions and amendments
Subject: General
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act shall come into force on 1 July 1994.

Policy: Regulations on allocation of land to households and individuals for stable and long term use for the purpose of agricultural production (issued with Decree no. 64-cp).
Policy_Content: The Decree provides the regulation for redistribution of abandoned, denuded, mountainous lands or uncultivated lands to households and families in order to increase their agricultural productions. Households and families shall be assigned with those lands the right to use them and cultivate them.

Policy: Land Transaction Law.
Policy_Content: The Act contains at the outset a definition clause relating to the various terms therein employed, such as "land", "building land", "building permit", "foreigner", "planning permission", etc. Part 3 regulates in particular the transfer of agricultural and forestry land and the requirements for its conversion into building land. Furthermore, it outlines the conditions and procedures for acquisition of land by foreigners. Part 3 establishes the competent authorities and, in particular, various Land Commissions. Finally, the Act prescribes penalties in case of non compliance and transitional provisions. The Act consists of 32 articles divided into 6 Parts.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 959 on the state hydrometeorological audit.
Policy_Content: The state hydrometeorological audit shall have as its purpose survey of atmospheric, surface water and soil pollution. It shall be compulsory and must precede decision-making in the economic sphere.  Hydrometeorological evaluation of a project shall be required for construction activity. Hydrometeorological audit shall be composed of: (a) data obtained from stationary and non-stationary observation stations regarding air, surface water and soil pollution; (b) results of hydrometeorological survey; (c) technical reports; (d) projected economic activity documentation.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental audit,Air quality/air pollution,Soil pollution/quality,Data collection/reporting,Pollution control,Surface water,Institution,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.942 of 1993 regarding validation of the Regulation on state ecological expertise.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. The document establishes that the revenues originating from ecological audit, must be used for the following purposes: 1. remuneration of consultants and state ecological expertise of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources and its territorial sub-divisions, except for official of the aforesaid institutions; 2. carrying out the necessary research, measurements and analysis; 3. provision of the members of the Council of state ecological expertise with normative and methodological documentation, including access to data bases and technologies.

Policy: Ordonnance d'introduction de l'ordonnance fédérale sur les accidents majeurs (OiOPAM).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution l’article 36, 42 et 48 de la loi fédérale du 7 octobre 1983 sur la protection de l'environnement et l'article 23 de l'ordonnance du Conseil fédéral du 27 février 1991 sur la protection contre les accidents majeurs. L’article 4 établit que l'Office de l'économie bernoise est compétent pour l'exécution de l'ordonnance sur les accidents majeurs s'agissant des entreprises utilisant des substances, des produits ou des déchets spéciaux. Le texte comprend 18 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Organisation et compétence (Ier); Mesures et émoluments (II); Voies de droit (III); Entrée en vigueur (IV).Une annexe est jointe.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 1994.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 943 of 1993 regarding especially authorised state institutions in the field of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees that the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resource and its territorial branches is especially authorized environmental institution. The Ministry is entitled to coordinate within its competence the functioning of especially authorized state institutions and their territorial branches in their respective fields: Committee on geology and the use of subsoil, Committee on land resources and land survey, Federal Fisheries Committee, Federal Geodetic and Carthographical Service, Federal Forest Service, Federal Hydrometeorological and Environmental Monitoring Service, Committee on water resources. The Ministry and its territorial branches are responsible for the recreation and the improvement of quality of environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Sea, Water

Policy: Décret n° 2-91-454 du 5 rebia II 1414 (22 septembre 1993) pris pour l'application de la loi n°24-83 fixant le statut général des coopératives et les missions de l'Office  du développement de la coopération.
Policy_Content: Le présent fixe la procédure de création des coopératives auprès de l'Office  du développement de la coopération représente, en application des dispositions des articles 7, 8, 8 de loi n°2483 fixant le statut général des coopératives et les missions de l'Office du développement de la coopération, promulguée par le dahir n° 183226 du 9 moharrem 1405 (5 octobre 1984), telle qu'elle a été modifiée par le dahir portant loi n° 193166 du 22 rebia I 1414 (10 septembre 1993). Policy: Ley Nº 24.240 - Defensa del Consumidor.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la defensa del consumidor o usuario. A estos efectos se considera consumidor a la persona física o jurídica que adquiere o utiliza, en forma gratuita u onerosa, bienes o servicios como destinatario final, en beneficio propio o de su grupo familiar o social. Se equipara al consumidor quien, sin ser parte de una relación de consumo como consecuencia o en ocasión de ella, adquiere o utiliza bienes o servicios, en forma gratuita u onerosa, como destinatario final, en beneficio propio o de su grupo familiar o social.

Policy: Ordinance on forest conservation fees.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to forest conservation fees. In particular, article 1 establishes that whoever carries out some transformations in a forest is due to pay financial compensation in form of a forest conservation fee. This amount shall be used to restore the protective and recreational function of the forest. The amount is established according to the degree of forest transformation. The text consists of 6 articles.

Policy: Decree on County Agricultural Councils (No. 900 of 1993).
Policy_Content: County Agricultural Offices are State bodies subordinated to the Department of Agriculture and Forestry. They shall be responsible for securing the natural resources for agricultural use at county level and for carrying out all such tasks conferred on them by legislation (sect. 2). Sections 3, 4, and 5 provide for meeting and decision-making procedures of the Council. Section 7 defines the relationship of the Council with other local authorities. (9 sections)

Policy: Decision No. 451 on the management of caves.
Policy_Content: All caves, both explored and non explored, falling within the territory of the Republic of Albania are protected and managed by the State as a national natural wealth. The exploration of caves by native or foreign institutions and associations, specialized in this field, is permitted after they forward their request and be provided with licence by the Committee of Environmental Preservation and Protection. For cave exploration, regarded as culture monuments, the Institute of Culture monuments also issues a permit. It is forbidden to take various objects discovered in the caves. Moreover, it is prohibited to cause any kind of pollution, to throw wastes or to mistreat the caves.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Regulation No. 450 on the re-evaluation and re-distribution of the ex-agricultural cooperative property.
Policy_Content: This Decision sets out methods for evaluating the ex-agricultural cooperatives property. Whenever the property is evaluated and distributed, or has not been distributed, the prices to be applied will be those of the evaluation period indexed at the re-evaluation time, while in cases where the property is evaluated and compensation has already been paid, the case is considered completed and no indexes shall be applied.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Land Register Act (1993)
Policy_Content: The Land Register Act provides for the procedure for maintenance of land registers. The land register is a database aimed at collecting, storing and disclosing information on the creation, transfer and encumbrance of immovable property with real rights, as well as on the transfer, encumbrance, alteration or termination of a real right encumbering an immovable. Issues not provided for in this Act shall be settled pursuant to the provisions of the Code of Civil Procedure concerning adjudicating registry matters. The provisions of the Code of Civil Procedure concerning registration application are applied to the registration application taking account of the specifications provided for in this Act. The controller of the land register is the Ministry of Justice and the processors are the land registry department of Tartu County Court and the Centre of Registers and Information Systems. Each of the following, if entered in the land register as an independent unit, is registered immovable an immovable (plot of land); right of superficies; apartment ownership; and right of superficies in apartments.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret nº 93-148/PR portant création et attributions du Comité interministériel consultatif pour l'environnement (CICE).
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte création, organisation et mission du Comité interministériel consultatif de l'environnement (CICE), chargé d'analyser et émettre un avis sur toutes les questions relatives à l'environnement sur le territoire national et de soutenir toute initiative pouvant concourrir à la sauvegarde de l'environnement.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Council Directive 93/75/EEC concerning minimum requirements for vessels bound for or leaving Community ports and carrying dangerous or polluting goods.
Policy_Content: Member States take all necessary and appropriate measures to ensure that the masters or operators of vessels bound for or leaving a Community port and carrying dangerous or polluting goods in bulk or in packaged form, as well as shippers of such goods observe the minimum requirements addressed to them under this Directive. No dangerous or polluting goods shall be offered for carriage or taken on board any vessel unless a declaration has been delivered to the master or operator containing the correct technical names of the dangerous or polluting goods, the quantities of such goods and, if in portable tanks or freight containers, their identification marks. The operator of a vessel leaving a port in a Member State shall notify before departure of the vessel all information listed in Annex I to the competent authority of that Member State. (16 articles and 2 Annexes)
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Council Directive 93/76/EEC to limit carbon dioxide emissions by improving energy efficiency (SAVE).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Directive is the attainment by Member States of the objective of limiting carbon dioxide emissions by improving energy efficiency, notably by means of drawing up and implementing programmes in the fields specified in article 1, such as energy certification of buildings, the billing of heating, air-conditioning and hot water costs on the basis of actual consumption, third-party financing for energy efficiency investments in the public sector and energy audits of undertakings with high energy consumption. Programmes can include laws, regulations, economic and administrative instruments, information, education and voluntary agreements.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Act on governmental guarantees and interest subsidy when granting loans to young farmers (No. 1186 of 1994).
Policy_Content: Through this Act, the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries shall make arrangements with the Danish Agricultural Mortgage Fund for government guarantees for loans granted to young farmers. Criteria for granting loans include the requirement for first-time farmers of max. 40 years of age holding an inherent education.  Furthermore, once subsidies have been received, farmers must within 6 months have residence status on the subsidized land, be the sole owner and managing it as main source of income.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force shall be determined by the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries.

Policy: Loi d'application de la loi fédérale du 4 octobre 1991 sur le droit foncier rural (LVLDFR).
Policy_Content: La présente loi met en exécution la loi fédérale du 4 octobre sur le droit foncier rural. Par exemple, l’article 5 – appliquant l’article 90 de la loi susvisée – discipline la Commission foncière rurale qui est l'autorité compétente en matière d'autorisation. A ce titre, elle statue notamment en matière de: a) partage d'une entreprise et aliénation d'immeubles ou de parties d'immeubles; b) exceptions aux interdictions de partage matériel et de morcellement; c) fixation du prix licite lors de réalisation forcée; d) révocation d'une autorisation; e) rectification du registre foncier; f) décision en constatation; g) morcellement des immeubles agricoles constituant des exploitations d'estivage. Le texte comprend 18 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Entreprises agricoles (Ier); Immeubles agricoles (II); Morcellement d'immeubles (III); Autorités compétentes (IV); Procédure (V); Emoluments et frais administratifs (VI); Dispositions finales (VIII).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Land consolidation,Land commission,Cadastre/land registration,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Enforcement/compliance,Size
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Loi sur les contributions pour des prestations de caractère écologique dans l'agriculture (LECOP).
Policy_Content: La présente loi réglemente les contributions pour des prestations de caractère écologique dans l’agriculture. Elle a aussi pour but d'encourager, par des indemnités annuelles, une exploitation agricole des terrains secs et des prés à litière leur conservant une valeur naturelle. Le texte comprend 20 articles répartis en 5 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Conventions (II); Autorité (III); Financement (IV); Dispositions diverses (V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Agricultural development,Ecological production/organic production,Agricultural land,Less favoured areas,Mountain area,Grazing

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.809 - Normas fiscales relativas a los territorios indígenas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que todos los resguardos indígenas legalmente constituidos serán considerados como municipios, y como tales participan en los ingresos corrientes de la Nación de acuerdo con la población indígena radicada en casa uno de ellos, destinándose exclusivamente a inversiones que beneficien a su correspondiente población.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Barbados Agricultural Development and Marketing Corporation Act.
Policy_Content: The Act provides for the constitution of the Barbados Agricultural Development and Marketing Corporation as a body corporate and defines its  functions and powers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Order No. 298 of the Federal Forest Service regarding validation of the Regulation on training forest areas and the Regulation on experimental forest areas.
Policy_Content: Vice-President of the Federal Forest Service, for the purpose of providing conditions for practical training of graduate forest specialists and raising the level of professional skills of forest officers, orders to validate the Regulation on training forest areas in accordance with the Annex 1 and the Regulation on experimental forest areas in accordance with the Annex 2. Regulation on training forest areas consists of 7 Sections. In accordance with Basic Forestry Legislation training forest areas that own stock of forest side by side with territorial, regional and district state forestry institution are entitled with the task of forest management. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the targets and determines the functions of training forest areas. Section 3 regards the structure and the system of management. Section 4 concerns forestries. Section 5 deals with property and funds. Section 6 determines the rights of training forest areas. Section 7 regards accountability. Regulation on experimental forest areas consists of 7 Sections. In accordance with Basic Forestry Legislation experimental forest areas authorized to carry out functions of forest management within the limits of the stock of public forest entrusted to them side by side with territorial, regional and district state forestry institution are entitled with the task of forest management. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the targets and determines the functions of experimental forest areas. Section 3 regards the structure and the system of management. Section 4 concerns forestries. Section 5 deals with property and funds. Section 6 determines the rights of experimental forest areas. Section 7 regards accountability.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Forest service/forest officers,Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Health policy 1993.
Policy_Content: The Health Policy of the Transitional Government is the result of a critical examination of the nature, magnitude and root causes of the prevailing health problems of the country and awareness of newly emerging health problems. It is founded on commitment to democracy and the rights and powers of the people that derive from it and to decentralization as the most appropriate system of government for the full exercise of these rights and powers in our pluralistic society.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Environmental planning,Pollution control,Monitoring,Policy/planning,Food quality control/food safety,Food security,Food sovereignty,Governance,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Sewerage,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management

Policy: Dahir portant loi nº 1-93-51 instituant les agences urbaines.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte l'institution, la composition et l'organisation des agences urbaines, établissements publics soumis à la tutelle de l'Etat chargés,entre autre, de collaborer à la réalisation et à la programmation des schémas directeurs d'aménagement et des projets d'aménagement urbains.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 238 of the Federal Forest Service regarding validation of the General Regulation on forestry of the Federal Forest Service.
Policy_Content: General Regulation has been elaborated in accordance with the Basic Forestry Legislation. It determines the legal status of the forestry of the Federal Forest Service that holds the right of ownership of the forestry resources, establishes the essence of their activity and the rights in the field of the regulation of forest relationship. General Regulation regards also protected areas, national parks, training and experimental forestry that exercise the right of forest ownership in accordance with the Basic Forestry Legislation. The Regulation consists of 7 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 determines the tasks and the functions of forestry. Section 3 establishes the structure and the management of forestry. Section 4 regards forest service. Section 5 concerns the property and means of forestry. Section 6 determines the rights of forestry. Section 7 deals with accountability and control.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: National Water and Sewerage Authority Sewerage Regulations (Cap. 208).
Policy_Content: These Regulations of the National Water and Sewerage Authority in exercise of the powers under  the National Water and Sewerage Authority Act, contain rules relating to the connection of premises to public sewers, require ships to dispose of sewage into public sewer, and prohibit the discharge of sewage or industrial waste to any natural outlet in an area served by a public sewers and discharge of specified hazardous waste and other material.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Marine pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Pollution control,Waste disposal,Waste management,Water supply,Sewerage,Water charges,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
