Policy: Administrative measures for operation permission of import, export, production and sale of petroleum and petroleum products.
Policy_Content: These Administrative Measures, consisting of 21 Articles, were enacted in accordance with the Petroleum Administration Act.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 886 validating the Regulation on forest fire safety.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that: (a) officials responsible for forestry operations and for cultural activities in recreational forests; and (b) natural and legal persons responsible for managing forest stock shall be liable for the infringement of forest fire safety regulations. Forest service officers shall control the observance of forest fire safety regulations. In the fire risk season (from the thaw until the rainy season or the formation of snow cover), the following activities shall be prohibited: (a) making fires; (b) throwing burning matches; (c) using highly flammable ammunition while hunting; (d) leaving flammable materials; and (e) refuelling vehicles with the motor running.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest fires,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Recreational forest
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 4.731 - Ley de preservación, conservación, defensa y mejoramiento de aquellos ambientes urbanos, rurales y naturales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce principios y reglas generales para la preservación, conservación, defensa y mejoramiento de aquellos ambientes urbanos, rurales y naturales y todos sus elementos constitutivos que por sus funciones y características mantienen o contribuyen a conservar el meido ambiente y el equilibrio ecológico. En particular, la Ley dispone que las personas públicas o privadas responsables de obras o acciones que degraden o sean susceptibles de producir degradación del ambiente y afectan la salud de la población o de los recursos naturales de la Provincia, quedan obligadas a presentar un estudio e informe evaluativo del impacto ambiental en todas las etapas del desarrollo e informe evaluativo del impacto ambiental en todas las etapas del desarrollo de dichas obras.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 4.731 - Declara de interés provincial la preservación, conservación, defensa y mejoramiento de los ambientes urbanos, rurales y naturales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de interés provincial la preservación, conservación, defensa y mejoramiento de aquellos ambientes urbanos, rurales y naturales y todos sus elementos constitutivos, que por sus funciones y características mantienen ó contribuyen a mantener la organización ecológica más conveniente para el desarrollo de condiciones favorables para la salud y el bienestar de la comunidad.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Agrarian Services (Amendment) Act No. 40 of 1993.
Policy_Content: Act No. 58 of 1979 is amended by repealing Paragraph c of Sub-section 3 of Section 21 and by repealing and substituting Sub-section 1 of Section 29 of the already amended version of this Section as per the Agrarian Services (Amendment) Act, No. 9 of 1990.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 608 validating the statute of the state forest, timber, pulp and paper industry institution “BELLESBUMPROM”.
Policy_Content: “BELLESBUMPROM” is the association of enterprises and organizations of forest, timber, and pulp and paper industry. The principal tasks and functions of “BELLESBUMPROM” shall be to supply the population with the products of forests, timber, non-timber products, and pulp and paper industry. “BELLESBUMPROM” shall make forecasts for the development of timber industry, supply timber industry with roundwood and soft resin, elaboration and realization of arrangements for environmental protection.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Act on carbon dioxide taxation on certain energy products (No. 849 of 1995).
Policy_Content: The Act sets prices and regulations on the taxation of certain carbon dioxide-based energy products by commercial energy suppliers. For specific periods, these companies shall be liable to payment of specific percentages of energy consumption.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: National Forestry (Amendment) Act, 1993
Policy_Content: This Act has been adopted to amend and supplement the National Forestry Act, 1984, which is intended to promote uniformity of the laws of the States of Malaysia so as to make a law with respect to the administration, management and conservation of forests and forestry development. Sections 2 and 3 lay down some changes in the national language text. Section 4 adds new definitions to those contained in the National Forestry Act, such as “forest offence”. Further amendments mainly concern administration (appointment of officers, delegation of powers), licences, possession of forest produce, acts which are prohibited in permanent reserved forests and related penalties. Moreover, sections 100A and 100B are added. Last, some amendments are laid down to the first, the second, the third and the third schedule.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Law on the production, pricing and sale of agricultural products.
Policy_Content: This Law concerns the enhancement of agricultural and livestock production in Iceland. It shall also  promote equal market conditions for food producers. It establishes the Agricultural Production Council, which is a cooperative forum for all agricultural producers in the country and their associations. It also provides with respect to a Committee of Commodities. The Act principally sets out rules for the internal marketing of agricultural products. Before decisions are taken on import and export of agricultural products, the parties involved shall seek the opinion and recommendations of the Agricultural Council. The Minister of Agriculture may, by regulation, decide that milk and dairy products, eggs, potatoes, garden vegetables and vegetables, which are sold on the domestic market or exported to foreign markets, shall be assessed, classified and labeled by species, quality and origin, provided that the product meets the health and hygiene rules which are established under Act No. 81 of 1988 on sanitary and health surveillance, and Act No. 24 of 1936 on food and other consumer goods and services.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Fiscal and market measures,Food quality control/food safety,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Institution,Internal trade,International trade,Milk/dairy products,Meat,Poultry products,Animal production,Plant production,Planting material/seeds,Fertilizers/nutrients
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Urban Lands Act (No. 23 of 1993).
Policy_Content: An Act to provide for matters relating to land within urban areas or urban communities declared by Order of the Minister in accordance with sections 2 and 3. The leases on land situated within urban communities are transferable freely between natural persons and/or bodies corporate subject to the following provisions: (a) all applications for the transfer of leases shall continue to be submitted to the Ministry of Lands for approval with copies given to the custom owners or their legal representative, or to the Municipality in the case of public land. Such copies shall be transmitted on the same date of the application for the transfer; and (b) the transfer shall be deemed to have been accepted if, within one month, the Minister or his legal representative has not made any objection. All custom land situated in urban areas or urban communities must be registered within a specified period of time. Each Urban Community Council shall determine and apply the town planning laws in the entire Urban Community under its responsibility. (10 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Urban land,Institution,Traditional rights/customary rights,Land-use planning

Policy: Decret nº 93-1046 tendant à transformer l'inventaire forestier national en un établissement public administratif.
Policy_Content: Ce décret modifie les dispositions du Code forestier relatives à l'inventaire forestier, notamment les articles de la partie réglementaire du titre III du livre V. L'inventaire est désormais réalisé par un établissement public dont les missions, l'organisation et l'administration sont fixées par le présent décret.

Policy: Measures of Fujian Province on Management of Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: These Measures  aim at rational exploitation, utilization and protection of mineral resources. The Text consists of 32 articles. Mineral resources planning is divided into the overall planning and special planning. Special planning includes geological and mineral survey, evaluation and exploration planning, mineral resource development, utilization and protection planning, mine ecological environment protection planning, etc. Exploration and exploitation of the mineral resources shall be conducted under a concession granted by the competent geology and mineral resource authorities.

Policy: Act No. 68/93 concerning uncultivated lands.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the use of public uncultivated lands. It consists of 42 articles specifying the requirements to be met in order to exploit these lands, establishing the conditions for land expropriation, concession, use, etc. It lays down duties, competencies and composition of national administration responsible for the management of these lands, fees to be paid, land lease, etc.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley de proteccion y defensa del patrimonio cultural, tiene por objeto establecer los principios que han de regir la defensa del patrimonio cultural y declarar de utilidad pública e interés social la preservación, defensa y salvaguarda de todas las obras, conjuntos y lugares creados por el hombre o de origen natural que se encuentren en el territorio nacional  y que por su contenido cultural constituyan elementos fundamentales de identidad nacional.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 309/93 regulating the approval of coastal zone management plans.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law regulates the approval of coastal zone management plans. It consists of 19 articles and 2 Annexes dealing with the requirements to be satisfied by the aforementioned plans (called POOC) in compliance with the preservation of marine habitat, valorization of existing coastal zone resources and conservation of environmental and landscape values. This Decree-Law lists the requirements of coastal zones classified as bathing areas (in compliance with attached Annex I), specifying elements that such POOC must contain, responsibility and composition of the competent authorities, private use, controls, contraventions, etc. Annex II deals with soil occupation, bathing recreational facilities, etc.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.831/93 - Obligaciones mínimas del Sistema Estadístico Nacional.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto indica las obligaciones mínimas relativas a la construcción del Sistema Estadístico Nacional, al fin de contar con información estadística veraz y oportuna. Policy: Regulation No. 226 of the Federal Forest Service regarding main use felling in the plain land forests of the European portion of the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is binding on all foreign and domestic legal and natural persons that carry out forestry operations and management. It differentiates forests by use, protection class and category, and type of forest management. It requires felling to be conducted in a manner that ensures: (a) timely and efficient reforestation; (b) the sustainable and rational use of forest resources; and (c) the conservation and strengthening of forests’ protective functions.  Main use felling shall be authorized to extract the timber of mature trees, but shall be prohibited in: (a) protected areas; (b) national parks; (c) forests of historical and cultural importance; and (d) nut-tree, fruit-tree, urban and protection forests. Main use felling shall also be prohibited in cedretums, which shall instead be subject to sanitary felling. The following types of felling shall be authorized in the plain land forests of the European portion of the Russian Federation: (a) selection felling; (b) gradual felling and (c) clear felling with subsequent reforestation.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret nº 1206/PR/MEFPE fixant les clauses générales et particulières des cahiers des charges en matière d'exploitation forestière.
Policy_Content: Ce décret a pour objet de fixer les clauses générales et particulières des cahiers des charges en matière d'exploitation forestière. Il est formé par 36 articles portant les dispositions relatives aux modalités de délimitation des permis sur le terrain; aux modalités d'exécution de l'exploitation forestière ( arbres abattables, diamètre d'exploitabilité minimum, modalités d'abattage, marteau pour le marquage, carnet de chantier); à la circulation des produits de l'exploitation forestière; à la fourniture des résultats d'inventaire et des documents statistiques et comptables relatifs à la production et aux redevances.

Policy: Décret nº 1205/PR/MEFPE définissant les zones d'exploitation forestière.
Policy_Content: Ce décret définit les zones d'exploitation forestière suivant le régime d'attribution des permis, en application de l'article 22 de la loi nº1/82 d'orientation en matière des eaux et des forêts. Le domaine forestier du Gabon est divisé en 2 zones dont les limites sont fixées à l'article 2 du décret. L'exploitation de la première zone, qui s'étend à l'ouest de ces limites et comprend aussi les portions de territoire formant une bande de 5 Km de large sur les côtés des voies férrées, des routes nationales et des cours d'eau flotables, est réservée aux nationaux.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Certification and Agricultural Product Standards (Agriculture Code: Title 2, Chapter 18).
Policy_Content: This Chapter sets forth rules on certification and agricultural product standards. Specifically, it regulates: 1) the organic standards program for the administration and enforcement of standards related to organic agricultural products, including certification and registration of persons who produce, process, distribute, or handle organic agricultural products; 2) the agricultural product standards establishing a certification program related to the protection, sale, advertising, marketing, transporting, or other commercial handling of agricultural, horticultural, or related products if the department determines that a certification program is warranted to ensure genetic purity, identity, or disease or pest resistance, or help prevent the spread of insects, other pests, diseases, or pathogens; and 3) the agricultural production process certification program related to the protection, sale, advertising, marketing, or related agricultural production processes in the state of Texas and the minimum certification standards for production processes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 171 regarding setting of charges rates collected under the Ministry of Environment.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the charges rates collected under the Ministry of Environment as set forth in the Annex. The charges shall be payable prior to the provision of the service. The proceeds from the charges under these rates shall be remitted to the National Environmental Protection Fund. The following charges shall be collected for services related to the issuance of permits for: 1) disposal of waste waters in quantities of up to 100 cubic meters daily (for each point of overflow); 2) disposal of waste waters in quantities exceeding 100 cubic meters daily (for each point of overflow); 3) extracting rubble from riverbeds; 4) transit transportation of hazardous substances and harmful wastes across the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria; 5) transit transportation of hazardous substances and harmful wastes with re-loading across the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria; 7) establishment of artificial plantations of protected plant species, collection and export of protected species, catch, killing or export of protected animal species. The following charges shall be collected for services related to the co-ordination of import and export certificates: 1) for export of wild plant and animal species without established regime of use; 2) for export of wild plant and animal species with established regime of use; 3) for export, import or re-export of endangered species of the wild flora or fauna included in the Washington Convention; 4) for import of hazardous substances. The following charges shall be collected for services related to the coordination of projects: 1) projects for technical and biological reclamation of degraded areas; 2) projects for the drainage of lakes, marshes and other water bodies and anti-erosion projects.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Ley Nº 70 - Desarrolla el Artículo transitorio 55 de la Constitución Política, sobre el derecho de propiedad colectiva de tierras baldías en zonas rurales ribereñas de los ríos de la cuenca del Pacífico.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto reconocer a las comunidades negras que han venido ocupando tierras baldías en las zonas rurales ribereñas de los ríos de la Cuenca del Pacífico, de acuerdo con sus prácticas tradicionales de producción, el derecho a la propiedad colectiva. Así mismo tiene como propósito establecer mecanismos para la protección de la identidad cultural y de los derechos de las comunidades negras de Colombia como grupo étnico, y el fomento de su desarrollo económico y social, con el fin de garantizar que estas comunidades obtengan condiciones reales de igualdad de oportunidades frente al resto de la sociedad colombiana.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Ownership,Common property,Traditional rights/customary rights,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regulation No. 26/93 approving the Regional Land Use Planning within the territory of Alentejo.
Policy_Content: This Regulation approves the Regional Land Use Planning within the territory of Alentejo. It consists of 5 chapters establishing the requirements to be met in order to carry out the said Regional zone programme (called PROTALI. 1). The aim of this programme is: a) regulate land use and transformation with its rational sustainable exploitation; b) regulate building construction and preserve natural heritage; c) draw-up regional land use plans; d) land management, etc. PROTALI shall be enforced for 10 years.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Federal Real Property Regulations (SOR/92-502).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the Federal Real Property and Federal Immovables Act. The Regulations give ministers the power to enter directly into transactions related to acquiring, disposing, optioning, licensing, transferring administration and transferring administration and control of real property. Furthermore, the Regulations give ministers the legal authority to make certain payments related to acquiring real property and impose certain controls, primarily related to title certification, on the full or partial payment of the purchase price. The text consists of 11 sections.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Vested rights/existing rights,Traditional rights/customary rights,Land consolidation,Public land,Enforcement/compliance
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Treaty between the Free State of Saxony and Sachsen-Anhalt on cooperation in spatial planning and land use planning in the area of Halle-Leipzig.
Policy_Content: The contracting parties of the present Treaty (the Free State of Saxony and the Land Sachsen-Anhalt) shall cooperate in the operation of all matters concerning land use planning and spatial planning in the area of Halle – Leipzig. The text consists of 10 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: Purpose of the Treaty (1); Cooperation of the Länder (2); Cooperation of competent authorities (3); Final provisions (4).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Treaty enters into force on 24 February 1994.

Policy: Order No. 222 of the Federal Forest Service validating the form of forestry licence for long-term management (lease) of forest stock.
Policy_Content: Federal Forest Service is entitled with the task of issuing forestry licence for long-term management (lease) of forest stock. The licence specifies the types of forest management that leaseholder is authorized to carry out, establishes terms and conditions for payment of rent, determines the amount of timber to be delivered for state needs and establishes requirements for the state of forest stock by the end of contractual relations of lease.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Biosecurity Act 1993 (No. 95 of 1993).
Policy_Content: The general aim of this Act is to restate and reform the law relating to the exclusion, eradication and effective management of pests and unwanted organisms so as to protect plant life and natural resources. The Act applies to fish and marine mammals taken in the EEZ as well.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Keyword: Biosecurity,Protected area,Inspection,Special fund,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Integrated pest management-IPM/pest management strategies,Plant protection,Pests/diseases,International trade,Institution,Basic legislation

Policy: Loi nº 16/93 relative à la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: L'article 1er stipule que "Cette loi a pour objet de déterminer les principes généraux qui doivent fonder la politique nationale en matière de protection et d'amélioration de l'environnement. Elle tend notamment à: 1) la préservation et l'utilisation durable des ressources naturelles, 2) la lutte contre les pollutions et nuisances, 3) l'amélioration et la protection du cadre de vie, 4) la promotions de nouvelles valeurs et d'activités génératices de revenus, liées à la protection de l'environnement, 5) l'harmonisation du développement avec la sauvegarde du milieu naturel".
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Nigerian Co-operative Societies Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the registration and administration of co-operative societies, duties and privileges of registered societies and rights and liabilities of members, provides for the settlement of disputes between co-operative societies and other institutions or its members, and the division and amalgamation of co-operative societies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Loi n° 13/93 du 26 aout 1993, autorisant la ratification de la convention de Vienne pour la protection de la couche d’ozone, et du protocole de Montréal.
Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise la ratification de la convention de Vienne pour la protection de la couche d’ozone, et du protocole de Montréal.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Regulations on activities of sworn surveyors.
Policy_Content: The Act on activities of sworn surveyors establishes the right of surveyors to carry out activities as independent professionals and private entities such as of topographic, photogrammetric and cartographic work. These Regulations regulate such activities. Regulations concern qualifications, authorization, definition of actual work, registration, contracts for the provision of services, etc. The licence of a  sworn surveyor is issued by the Minister of Agriculture.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: National Sugar Development Council Act.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the National Sugar Development Council as a body corporate, defines its functions and provides with respect to its administration. The functions of the Council shall include: (a) draw policy guidelines and action programmes on sugar development; (b) provide guidelines on the development of sugar estates and the organisation of the sugar cane outgrower scheme to enhance the viability of sugar plants; (c) facilitate the availability of credit for sugar cane outgrowers for land preparation and farm inputs; (d) establish, maintain and supervise the Sugar Cane Research and Development Centre to develop new and improved sugar cane technology and sugar cane varieties; (e) advise on techniques and processes for sugar development; (f) set targets and measurements for the performance of local sugar producers; (g) set and regulate quality standards for local sugar producers and imported sugar; and (h) advise, based on improvements in local sugar production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Statutory Notification S.R.O. 742 (I)/93 on National Environmental Quality Standards.
Policy_Content: This Notification provides for the National Environmental Quality Standards for municipal and liquid industrial effluents (Annex I), industrial gaseous emissions (Annex II), and motor vehicle exhaust and noise (Annex III).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental standards,Emissions,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: Ordonnance visant une utilisation économe et rationnelle de l’énergie (Ordonnance sur l’énergie) (OEN).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution la loi du 24 novembre 1988 sur l’énergie . Notamment, l’ordonnance vise une utilisation économe et rationnelle de l’énergie compatible avec les exigences de la protection de l’environnement, ainsi que le recours aux agents énergétiques renouvelables. Le texte comprend 87 articles répartis en 10 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Performances requises en matière d’isolation thermique des bâtiments (II); Performances requises des installations techniques du bâtiment (III); Décompte individuel des frais de chauffage et d’eau Chaude (IV); Equipements sportifs et de loisirs (V); Producteurs pour leurs propres besoins (VI); Eclairage public (VII); Communication des données énergétiques (VIII); Voies de droit et dispositions pénales (IX); Dispositions finales (X).
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er novembre 1993.

Policy: Ley Nº 26225 - Ley de organización y funciones de PERUPETRO S.A.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Organización y Funciones de PERUPETRO S.A., establece como su objeto social promover la inversión en las actividades de exploración y explotación de hidrocarburos, y negociar, celebrar y supervisar los contratos de exploración y expotación, y los convenios de evaluación técnica de dichas actividades.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 69 - Crea el Seguro agropecuario y el Fondo Nacional de Riesgos Agropecuarios.
Policy_Content: La Ley, que consta de 17 artículos, introduce normas en materia de crédito agropecuario y establece el seguro agropecuario como instrumento para incentivar y proteger la producción de alimentos, buscar el mejoramiento económico del sector rural promoviendo el ordenamiento económico del sector agropecuario. Crea, además, el Fondo Nacional de Riesgos Agropecuarios como una cuenta de manejo especial que será administrada por la Unidad de Seguros de la Caja de Crédito Agrario Industrial y Minero.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Arrêté Ministériel 0037/CAB/VPM/ AGRIDAL/93 du 24 août 1993 portant élévation du programme national riz (PNR) au rang de service national.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée le Programme national riz (PNR), élevé au rang de direction de l’administration publique. Le PNR reprend toutes les activités, structures et infrastructures jadis dévolues au projet «PNR» et a pour mission de coordonner, à l’échelon national, toutes les activités relatives à la culture du riz; de contribuer à la définition de la politique rizicole et à la mise en place des techniques rizicoles; d’encadrer les producteurs dans leurs problèmes de production, de décorticage et de commercialisation de riz.  Le PNR exerce ses activités sur toute l’étendue du territoire national.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Ley Nº 26224 - Modifica el Decreto Legislativo Nº 43, Ley de Petróleos del Perú - PETROPERU.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica el Decreto Legislativo que dispone que Petróleos del Perú – PETROPERU se organice como sociedad anónima, respecto a su autonomía económica, financiera y administrativa para celebrar toda clase de actos y contratos de comercio exterior.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 842 regarding amendments and invalidation of the Legislative Acts of the Government of the RSFSR in connection with putting into effect Basic Forestry Legislation.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to invalidate the Legislative Acts of the Government of the RSFSR in accordance with the list contained in Annex 1. The Government decrees to approve the amendments to the Legislative Acts of the Government of the RSFSR in accordance with the Annex 2. In the Paragraph 12 of the Article three of the Regulation on Federal Forest Service the reference to "Executive Bodies and especially authorized state institutions in the field of environmental protection" is substituted with "respective state executive bodies of the republics making part of the Russian Federation, autonomous regions, autonomous districts, territories, provinces and state institutions in the field of environmental protection."
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: National Planning Commission Act.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the National Planning Commission. The Commission shall, amongst others: determine and advise on policies that will best promote national unity and integration and sustain the Nigerian nation and act a national focal point for the coordination and formulation of national policies and programmes; formulate and prepare long-term, medium-term and short-term national development plans and coordinate such plans at the Federal, State and local Government levels; and  monitor projects and progress relating to plan implementation. The Minister for Agriculture and Rural Development shall form part of the Commission.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Patent Law.
Policy_Content: The Law regulates property and related private non-property issues arising in connection with the creation, legal protection and use of inventions, industrial patterns and useful models (art. 1). Legal protection of invention, useful model and industrial pattern shall be protected by the state and certified by a patent (art. 4). The objects of invention are: 1) devices; 2) processes; 3) substances; 4) micro-organic strains; 5) cell cultures of plants and animals; 6) the use of a known device, process, substance, and strain in a new application (art. 5). Not recognized to be patentable are inventions of varieties of plants and breeds of animals (art. 6).The Act consists of 8 Sections composed of 38 articles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 5663-1 on outer space.
Policy_Content: The present Law governs research and use of outer space. Activities in outer space shall include: (a) research and (b) distant zoning of the Earth, including ecological monitoring. The scope of activity in outer space shall be scientific data collection on the Earth and outer space. The Act consists of 7 Sections divided into 30 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) organization of activity in outer space; (3) economic conditions; (4) extraterrestrial objects and infrastructure; (5) safety of the activity in outer space; (6) international cooperation; (7) liability. The activity in outer space shall ensure safety thereof and environmental protection. Any activity in outer space shall be subject to licensing.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret D/93/147 portant attributions et fonctionnement de la Commission nationale de l'eau du Ministère des ressources naturellles, des énergies et de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte attributions et fonctionnement de la Commission nationale de l'eau, organe consultatif interministériel ayant pour mission de faciliter l'orientation, la définition et le contrôle de la mise en oeuvre de la politique du gouvernement en matière d'eau et d'énergie.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Décret D/93/149 portant attributions, composition et fonctionnement du Conseil national de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret réorganise le Conseil national de l'environnement (CNE) qui avait été créé en 1987. Organe inter-ministériel, le Conseil national de l'environnement est présidé par le Ministre chargé de l'environnement et comprend les représentants des divers départements ministériels concernés par l'environnement et les ressources naturelles, ainsi que des organismes professionnels intéressés, du milieu académique et du secteur associatif. Il est dirigé par un Président qui assure la coordination de ses activités et dispose d'un Bureau qui s'acquitte des tâches de secrétariat. Le Conseil national de l'environnement est un organe consultatif, dont la mission essentielle est d'orienter et de faciliter la définition et l'exécution de la politique nationale en matière d'environnement. A cet effet, il est notamment chargé: d'examiner et de soumettre au Gouvernement le projet de politique environnementale; d'approuver le rapport annuel sur l'état de l'environnement ainsi que les plans et les programmes d'environnement; d'assurer la coordination et la concertation inter-ministérielles dans le domaine de l'environnement, etc.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Decree relative to the impact assessment pursuant to the Genetic Engineering Act (No. 816 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Decree makes provision for assessment of risk for the environment and public health of the release of genetically modified organisms. It regulates the contents and handling of impact assessment reports which shall accompany the application for approval pursuant to section 11 of the Act. Approval authorities are the Department of Environment for release of material and the Department of Social Affairs for restricted use. Such confined use shall only be approved if a assessment of risk of leaking out of the material accompanies the request. The approving authority may submit the impact assessment report to the Biotechnology Board in order to obtain an opinion on the assessment and possible measures to be taken. The remaining provisions of this Decree concern form and contents of the assessment and the power of approving authorities to attach as a condition to approval the submittal possible subsequent reports on effects of the release of material. (6 Chapters)
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree will come into force on 1 September 1993.

Policy: Decree No. 661 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on land monitoring.
Policy_Content: Land monitoring is a system of monitoring of the condition of land in order to timely identify changes, assess them, prevent and eliminate the consequences of negative processes. All land, regardless of form of ownership thereof, shall be subject to mandatory monitoring. Soil monitoring is an integral part of land monitoring. Monitoring of soil on agricultural land shall be performed by the Ministry of Economy in accordance with the regulations approved thereby. Depending on the purpose of observations and the degree of coverage of the territories, the following land monitoring shall be performed: (a) national - on all land within the territory of Ukraine; (b) regional - in areas characterized by the unity of physical, geographical, environmental and economic conditions; and (c) local - on separate land plots and in separate parts (elementary structures) of landscape-ecological complexes. Land monitoring consists of systematic observations of the condition of land (agrochemical certification of land plots, survey, observation and exploration), detection of changes in it, as well as assessment: (a) processes associated with changes in soil fertility (development of water and wind erosion, loss of humus, deterioration of soil structure, waterlogging and salinization), overgrowing of agricultural land, contamination of land with pesticides, heavy metals, radionuclides and other toxic substances; (b) state of the shorelines of rivers, seas, lakes, bays, reservoirs, estuaries, hydraulic structures; (c) processes associated with the formation of ravines, landslides, mudslides, earthquakes, karst, cryogenic and other phenomena; and (d) state of land of residential areas, territories occupied by oil and gas facilities, sewage treatment plants, manure storages, fuel and lubricants warehouses, fertilizers, parking lots, disposal of toxic industrial waste and radioactive materials, as well as other industrial facilities.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural land,Monitoring,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Survey/mapping,Pesticides,Erosion,Disasters,Surface water,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Ley Nº 26221 - Ley Orgánica de Hidrocarburos. Texto Único Ordenado aprobado por el Decreto Supremo Nº 042-2005-EM.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica de Hidrocarburos norma las actividades de los hidrocarburos en el territorio nacional, promoviendo su desarrollo sobre la base de la libre competencia y el libre acceso a la actividad económica con la finalidad de lograr el bienestar de la persona humana y el desarrollo nacional.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Arrêté nº 93-20/MDRP-CAB fixant les attributions détaillées et le mode de fonctionnement des services de la Direction générale de l'environnement (DGE).
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté fixe les attributions détaillées et le mode de fonctionnement des services de la Direction générale de l'environnement, placés sous l'autorité du Directeur général. Ces services sont: le service de la gestion des ressources naturelles et de la recherche, le service de l'aménagement du territoire, le service de l'éducation, de la communication environnementale et de la documentation, le service de la réglementation et du contrôle et les services régionaux.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal portant exécution de la loi du 27 juillet 1993 ayant pour objet (i) le développement et la diversification économiques; et (ii) l'amélioration de la structure générale et l'équilibre régional de l'économie.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement définit les modalités d'application de la précédente loi. Ainsi donne-t-il des précisions en ce qui concerne notamment: (i) les entreprises considérées comme ayant une influence motrice sur le développement économique, au nombre desquelles figurent celles qui déploient des activités importantes dans le domaine de la protection de l'environnement; (ii) les critères de conformité aux exigences de l'aménagement du territoire et de la protection de l'environnement; (iii) les critères de modulation des aides et la possibilité de les accorder cumulativement; (iv) la procédure de demande et d'octroi des différentes catégories d'aide. Le règlement spécifie également les investissements et dépenses éligibles aux aides prévues par la loi. Au titre de la protection de l'environnement, il s'agit en particulier: (i) des coûts d'acquisition de terrains, constructions, équipements, outillages et installations amortissables en plus de trois ans; (ii) des dépenses liées aux études et expertises en rapport avec les investissements de protection de l'environnement et d'utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie. Sont exclus du bénéfice des aides les frais de premier établissement et les intérêts en rapport avec le financement de l'investissement.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Subsidy/incentive,Land-use planning,Environmental planning,Energy conservation/energy production
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 057-93-PCM ─ Estatuto del Fondo Nacional de Compensación y Desarrollo Social (FONCODES).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Estatuto del Fondo Nacional de Compensación y Desarrollo Social (FONCODES), que tiene como función principal la de desarrollar en el país todas aquellas actividades de apoyo solidario que la población requiera para superar el estado de pobreza en que se encuentra, siempre que tales actividades se enmarquen dentro de lo establecido en el Decreto Ley Nº 26.157 y en el presente Estatuto.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Less favoured areas,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Financial agricultural measures
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regulations of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region on supervision and administration of farmers' burden.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to reduce the burden of farmers, protect their legitimate rights and interests of farmers, improve their living standards, and promote the development of rural economy. The Text consists of 5 Chapters.

Policy: Physical Planning (Fees For Application) (Cap. 193).
Policy_Content: This Regulation imposes a physical planning fee for purposes of the Physical Planning Act. All applications for planning permission, outline permission and reserved matters made to the Council shall be accompanied by the fees specified in the Schedule unless otherwise exempted. Where an application is submitted for more than one use, the appropriate fees specified in the Schedule shall be levied in respect of each of the proposed uses.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Instructions for the Power Supply Preparedness Organization (Reg. No. 4121 of 1993).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision for power supply in emergency situations. The Norwegian Water Resources and Energy Administration (NVE) is responsible for coordinating the contingency planning and shall manage the nation's power supply system in wartime. For this purpose, a nationwide organization, the Power Supply Preparedness Organization (KBO), has been developed. The KBO consists of NVE and the undertakings that are in charge of the power supply system. The Regulations provide for the organization of the KBO and assign duties and powers to specified public bodies and power generating and distribution companies in case of an emergency. The Norwegian Power Supply System's Regional Managers shall have also tasks in relation with peacetime disasters and major accidents.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Policy/planning,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Act No. 24 regulating, promoting and improving organic farming in Campania.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act regulates the production, transformation and marketing of organic products and lays down rules on the development of organic farming techniques. It aims in particular at restricting the use of chemical products in agriculture, protecting the environment from pollution and protecting producers' as well as consumers' health. A regional list providing the necessary information on enterprises operating in the organic farming sector shall be elaborated, in accordance with article 3, paragraph 7. Inspections shall be carried out on the enterprises registered. Article 8 concerns labelling requirements. Organic products of extra-regional origin entering into the Lombardia Region shall be accompanied by a certificate issued by the competent authority of the territory of origin. Such products may be used for cattle feeding only upon favourable advice of the local authority. The Regional Committee for Organic Farming (CoRAB) is established by article 14. Article 20 lays down penalties. An Annex, concerning organic farming techniques, is attached.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Regional Act enters into force on 23 August 1993.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 769 of 1993 regarding the validation of the Regulation on the National Parks.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. National Parks are institutions for environmental protection, territories (defined areas of water) that include natural habitats and objects of particular ecological, historical, and aesthetic value destined for the utilisation for environmental protection, recreational, enlightening, scientific and cultural purposes. The document consists of IX parts. Part I lays down the general provisions. Part II establishes the main tasks of the National Parks. Part III determines the modalities of setting up of the National Parks. Part IV regards the management of the National Parks. Part V regulates the functional routine. Part VI deals with scientific research and enlightening activity within the National Parks. Part VII concerns the economic activity within the National Parks. Part VIII establishes the legal status of the National Parks. Part IX regards the supervision of the functioning of the National Parks.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on the date of issue.

Policy: Decree No. 491 on the establishment and duties of the Undersecretariat of Maritime Affairs.
Policy_Content: This Decree lays down rules for the establishment and duties of the Undersecretariat of Maritime Affairs to allocate and develop maritime systems and services in line with the country's maritime interests and needs. The duties of the Undersecretariat of Maritime Affairs include taking measures to encourage maritime trade, maritime trade fleet and ship industry;  development of the maritime industry; maximizing marine and inland water potential; safety of navigation, life, property and the marine environment; taking measures to monitor and control the marine environment in order to prevent deterioration and marine pollution; taking port state measures; determination of the standards and principles related to the technical characteristics, competencies and equipment of vessels; certification and monitoring of vessels; registration of ships and seafarers, and determination of the principles regarding the training, examination and certification of seafarers; carrying out research in order to determine and implement national maritime-related targets and policies and strengthening the coordination between relevant institutions for effective implementation of national policies; coordination and monitoring all activities related to maritime and port services, and prevent illegal activities; and public awareness-raising.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Environmental security,Marine pollution,Pollution control,Inland fisheries,Marine fisheries,Fishery management and conservation,Foreign fishing,Business/industry/corporations,Capacity building,Certification,Management/conservation,Education,Harbour,Institution,International trade,Maritime zone,Monitoring,Policy/planning,Protection of environment,Registration,Research
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Thüringen Forestry Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is: 1) to conserve and increase forestry lands; 2) to conserve or create a stable tree structure of forests; 3) to protect the forest against harmful effects; 4) to ensure and increase the production of wood with a view to a sustainable development; 5) to conserve and develop forests as living space for wild fauna and wild flora; 6) to afford and improve recreation in forests; 7) to help forest owners to achieve the aims listed in 1 - 6; 8) to harmonize public interests with those of individuals. The text consists of 68 articles divided into 11 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Forestry planning, conservation and protection of forests (II); Management of forests (III); Promotion of forestries and compensation (IV); Special provisions for public forests (V); Special provisions for corporate forests (VI); Special provisions for private forests, common forests and forestry mergers (VII); Special provisions for cooperations (VIII); Tasks and organization of the forest service (IX); Penalties (X); Final provisions (XI).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Emission standards for odor pollutants (National standard GB 14554-93).
Policy_Content: This Standard specifies the maximum allowable limits for one-time emission of 8 odor pollutants concentration limit of compound odor substance and factory boundary concentration limit of non-point odor sources that shall be implemented at different time period. It is applicable to the environmental management of all enterprises or landfill facilities that emit odor into ambient air as well as EIA, design and check & acceptance of the environmental protection facilities of completed construction projects as well as post-construction emission management.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Loi concernant l'utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie.
Policy_Content: La susdite loi porte la réglementation relative à l’utilisation rationnelle de l’énergie. Elle vise la production, la transformation, la distribution et l'utilisation de l'énergie au Luxembourg, sans préjudice des lois et règlements existant en la matière. Son objectif principal est la contribution à l'amélioration de l'environnement, notamment par la réduction des émissions de CO2. Le texte comprend 21 articles répartis en 10 titres comme suit: Champ d'application (I); Objectifs (II); Définitions (III); Production d'énergie (IV); Economies d'énergie (V); Energies renouvelables et cogénération; technologies nouvelles (VI); Concepts énergétiques (VII); Conseil National de l'énergie (VIII); Sanctions pénales (IX); Dispositions finales (X).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal portant application de la directive 84/360/CEE du 28 juin 1984 relative à la lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique en provenance des installations industrielles.
Policy_Content: Le susdit règlement grand-ducal porte des dispositions concernant l’application de la directive 84/360/CEE du 28 juin 1984 relative à la lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique en provenance des installations industrielles. Il s'applique encore à des établissements et installations de combustion alimentées en combustible liquide ou gazeux dans la mesure où ils sont soumis à autorisation au titre de la législation relative aux établissements dangereux, insalubres ou incommodes. Le texte comprend 9 articles comme suit: Objet (art. 1er); Définitions (art. 2); Conditions d'autorisation (art. 3); Coopération transfrontière (art. 4); Contrôle des émissions (art. 5); Installations existantes (art. 6); Sanctions pénales (art. 7); Annexes (art. 8); Exécution (art. 9).

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal portant application de la directive 84/360 CEE du 28 juin 1984 relative à la lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique en provenance des installations individuelles.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement grand-ducal met en exécution la directive 84/360CEE du 28 juin 1984 relative à la lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique en provenance des installations individuelles. Son objet est de prévoir des mesures et des procédures visant à prévenir ou à réduire la pollution atmosphérique en venance d’installations industrielles. Le texte comprend 9 articles et 2 annexes qui font partie intégrant du présent règlement.

Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Economic Development Act. Section 3 specifies that the Minister may make loans in accordance with this Regulation to assist the construction of the energy infrastructure for eligible projects. For the purpose of the present Regulation, “resources” includes mineral and energy resources, agriculture and aquaculture, forestry and silviculture, the freshwater fishery and tourism. Policy: Ministry of Agriculture (Incorporation) Act, 1993 (Cap. 241).
Policy_Content: This Act prescribes that the Ministry of Agriculture shall be considered to act as a corporation in dealings and legal proceedings regarding agricultural land. Sale and long-term lease of agricultural land are excluded from provisions of this Act. The Act also requires the Minister to report to parliament on dealings involving agricultural land.

Policy: Regulation No. 201 of the Federal Forest Service regarding main use felling in the forests of the Far East.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is binding on domestic and foreign natural and legal persons that carry out forestry operations in the Far East. It shall not apply to cedretums or broadleaf forests. The purpose of the Regulation shall be to ensure: (a) the continuous, sustainable and rational use of forest resources; (b) the reforestation of and increase in protected forests; and (c) multiple uses of forests. Intermediate felling and sanitary felling shall be authorized in protected forests, but protected forest species shall not be subject to any type of felling. Felling types shall be determined according to a forest’s category and species composition, it soil stability against erosion and the presence of undergrowth. Timber extraction shall be based on inventories of forest plots. Felling shall be authorized in the following order: (a) drying trees and those damaged by forest fire, pests or diseases; (b) undercut from the previous years; (c) trees from which resin has been boxed; (d) overly mature forest; and (e) mature forest.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Protection forest,Timber extraction/logging,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest species,Inventory,Protection of species,Forest management/forest conservation

Pour accomplir sa mission cette direction comprend: des services d'appui (cellule administrative et financière et laboratoire de l'environnement) et 3 divisions techniques: études générales, prévention et contrôle des pollutions et des nuisances, préservation de la nature.

Policy: Law No. 7746 on petroleum.
Policy_Content: This Law sets forth the framework on exploration and production of oil and natural gas. It lays down provisions for rehabilitating existing facilities and recovering oil and gas from established reserves. The Law aims at developing non-renewable resources and ensuring that exploration and production activities do not endanger human life or cause damage to the environment.  All petroleum deposits, including those in maritime areas, pertain exclusively to the Albanian State. Explorations are allowed upon authorization issued by the Ministry under the terms and conditions of a petroleum agreement.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Oil and Gas Act (C.C.S.M. c. O34).
Policy_Content: The objects and purposes of this Act are to provide for, encourage and facilitate the safe and efficient development, and the maximum economic recovery, of the oil, gas, helium and oil shale resources of the province in accordance with the principles of sustainable development; to prevent the waste of oil, gas, helium and oil share resources, to protect the correlative rights of owners; to provide for the safe and efficient construction and operation of pipelines; and to provide for the safe and efficient development and operation of storage reservoirs (sect. 2).
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Environment Information Act - EIA.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the procedures and conditions under which the general public may acquire access to environmental information kept by public bodies. Save for restrictions imposed by the need to keep certain information confidential, data on natural resources (air, soil, water, fauna, flora) and on pollution (waste, noise, etc.) are freely accessible to the public, who may obtain it upon oral or written application. The public may challenge refusals to supply this information. Data on the environment must also be entered in a catalogue by the Ministry of the Environment and placed at the disposal of the public for reference purposes. The data may also be published. The operators of certain polluting installations or installation posing a serious environmental risk are required to submit to the Ministry of the Environment all the information required for the purposes of assessing the ecological impact of their activities.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 1139 regarding some measures for the support of peasant (farmer) associations and agricultural co-operatives.
Policy_Content: The President decrees to support the activity of the Association of peasant (farmer) associations and agricultural cooperatives (AKKOR) in the field of the promotion of agrarian reform, of the protection of the rights and interests of the producers of the agricultural commodities, members of this Association, and assistance to their economic activity. The Government and the Central Bank are entitled to value the issue of the setting up of the Federal Systems of crediting and insuring of the farmers, including special farmers' banks and insurance companies, created on voluntary basis by the unification of the framers and their organizations. The Government is entitled to grant financial support to the farmers' banks and insurance companies in the period of their organizational phase on the repayable basis within the limits destined for the financial support of farming.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Loi ayant pour objet (i) le développement et la diversification économiques; et (ii) l'amélioration de la structure générale et l'équilibre régional de l'économie.
Policy_Content: La présente loi vise, par l'octroi d'aides en matière d'investissement, de restructuration ou la recherche-développement, à promouvoir la création, la rationalisation, la conversion ou la réorientation des entreprises industrielles et de prestation de services qui ont une influence motrice sur le développement économique. Les aides peuvent consister notamment dans des subventions en capital, bonifications d'intérêt, dégrèvements fiscaux, garanties de l'Etat, acquisitions de terrains et bâtiments. Les opérations éligibles à ces aides doivent notamment être conformes aux exigences en matière d'aménagement du territoire et de protection de l'environnement et être susceptibles de contribuer à une meilleure sauvegarde du milieu naturel et à une utilisation plus rationnelle de l'énergie. Un régime spécifique d'aide est prévu en faveur des investissements dans l'intérêt de la protection de l'environnement et de l'utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie. Ce régime spécifique concerne les investissements spécialement destinés à: (i) prévenir, réduire ou éliminer les rejets dans l'eau, l'air et le sol, ainsi que les émissions de bruit, d'odeur, de trépidation ou de radiation; (ii) prévenir, réduire, recycler, éliminer ou gérer rationnellement les déchets générés dans la production et l'exploitation; (iii) mettre en oeuvre une utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie ou des sources d'énergie renouvelables.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ukerewe District Council (Planting and Conservation of Trees and Forests) By-laws, 1994 (G.N. No. 542 of 1994).
Policy_Content: These by-laws, which apply to the area under the jurisdiction of the Ukerewe District Council declare the areas in the first Schedule to be preserved areas (sect. 3), prescribe that every village shall put aside areas for forest conservation and the planting of trees (sect. 4) and that every household and primary school shall plant trees. Policy: Complementary Law No. 0004 providing for public lands given by the State and monitoring their occupation.
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, consisting of 48 articles divided into nine Chapters, provides for public lands given by the State and monitors their occupation. It establishes that the Land Institute of Amapá (IMAP), is the competent body for the execution of the State land policy. The State shall encourage the formation and exploitation of rural property, in harmony with the Agroecological Zoning of its territory and with the principle of the social function of property. Agreements or contracts shall primarily aim at: economy in the conduct of services and works; efficiency in the application of the Law; unit of criteria in the implementation of principles and purposes of the current agrarian legislation. The lands of the State domain are: Lands transferred to the State, pursuant to the Federal Constitution of 1988 and Decree Law No. 2.375 of 24 November 1987; Land incorporated through expropriation, purchase, gift or other means of legal acquisition. The areas which will be reserved and will be adequately preserved are those for: preservation of water resources, landscaping or ecological protection and protection of native flora and fauna, including the boundary strips necessary to ensure their physical integrity; Civil construction, dams and ports; Lands occupied by public buildings; Foundation or increment of settlements; Implementation of Agricultural and Extractive Settlement Projects; Implantation of industrial or agroindustrial areas; Exploitation of mineral deposits and sources of mineral and thermal waters; Any other purpose of social interest linked to the socioeconomic and environmental development plans of the State.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

It consists of 13 articles defining the requirements for re-evaluating the aforementioned properties, on the base of the Law No. 7491 of 24 April 1991 establishing the principal constituent disposal. Commissions are created hereby in order to carry out this activity.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Loi nº 93-84 relative aux groupements interprofessionnels dans le secteur agricole et agro-alimentaire.
Policy_Content: Cette loi porte régime relatif aux groupements interprofessionnels dans le secteur agricole et agro-alimentaire. Il s'agit de personnes morales d'intérêt économique public, dotées de la personnalité civile et de l'autonomie financière, auxquelles adhèrent les producteurs agricoles et les transformateurs ou exportateurs de produits agricoles ou agro-alimentaires. Leurs missions, outre aux missions spécifiques fixées par leurs statuts, sont notamment: de contribuer à lier entre elles les différentes phases par lesquelles transitent les produits; assister les professionnels dans l'intégration de l'évolution scientifique et technique dans leurs exploitations et entreprises afin d'augmenter, améliorer et diversifier la production tout en sauvegardant l'environnement par un emploi rationnel des ressources; contribuer à l'amélioration de la qualité et à la promotion de la transformation, du conditionnement et de l'exportation, contribuer à l'approvisionnement et à la rationalisation des marchés et faciliter la concertation entre l'administration et les professionnels exerçant dans le secteur concerné. Les missions spécifiques de chaque groupement ainsi que son organisation administrative et financière et les modalités de son contrôle sont fixées par des statuts qui doivent être conformes aux statuts-type fixé par décret. La loi est formée par 18 articles répartis en 7 chapitres: Définitions (I); Création (II); Missions(III); Conseil d'administration (IV); Ressources et avantages fiscaux (V); Contrôle et révision des comptes (VI) et Dispositions transitoires et finales (VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Arrêté 0020/CAB/VPM/AGRIDRAL/93 du 26 juillet 1993 portant création d’un Service national de traction animale, (SENATRA).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée au sein du secrétariat général à l’Agriculture un Service national de traction animale (Senatra). Le Senatra est chargé de promouvoir la mécanisation légère dans les petites exploitations agricoles au moyen de la traction animale, notamment par l’initiation des petits exploitants à la technique de dressage des animaux et de labour attelé, ainsi qu’à la gestion des animaux de trait; des conseils techniques auprès des utilisateurs de la traction animale. Le Senatra est en outre chargé de définir la politique animale, en tenant compte notamment des exigences économiques et pédologiques en particulier par l’élaboration des normes de fabrication de matériel de labour, l’élaboration des statistiques annuelles des attelages et des emblavures y relatives, etc.; des essais et tests d’homologation des matériels de traction bovine introduits ou à introduire au Zaïre. Enfin, la Senatra exerce ses activités sur toute l’étendue du territoire national et sa direction est installée à Kinshasa au sein du secrétariat général à l’Agriculture.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No. 5.752 providing for the reorganization of the Secretariat of State for Science, Technology and the Environment (Sectam).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 12 articles divided into six Chapters and three Annexes, establishes the reorganization of the Secretariat of State for Science, Technology and the Environment (SECTAM) into the Secretary of State for Environment and Sustainability (SEMAS), created by Law No. 5.457 of 11 May 1988, with the denomination of SECTAM. SEMAS aims at performing the following activities: planning, organizing, coordinating, controlling and evaluating State actions aimed at the protection, defense, conservation and improvement of the environment and water resources, promoting decentralized, democratic and efficient management through the coordination of implementation of State Policies for the Environment and Water Resources. The basic functions of the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainability (SEMAS): formulate and coordinate the State Policy on the Environment and Water Resources; comply, at the state level, with other national policies related to environmental protection and development; coordinate and supervise plans, programmes and projects for the protection of watersheds for the environmental management of river basins, environmental pollution control and preservation, conservation and sustainable use of water resources, forests , biodiversity and aquatic resources; assist the Territorial Planning Policy, developing the implementation of instruments defining the occupation of rural, coastal and urban territory; carry out the ecological-economic zoning and other instruments of environmental zoning; promote, plan and coordinate actions aimed at education and environmental awareness; represent the Government of the State in the National Council of the Environment (CONAMA); enforce the decisions of the State Environmental Council (COEMA) and the State Council of Water Resources (CERH); promote, in compliance with the provisions of Complementary Law 140 of 8 December 2011, the integration of programmes and actions of organs and entities of the public administration of the Union, aiming at the protection and environmental management; etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Procedural matters,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Sustainable development,Freshwater resources management,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif à l'accessibilité et l'utilisation occasionnelle des forêts.
Policy_Content: Cet arrêté du Gouvernement flamand relatif à l'accessibilité et l'utilisation occasionelle des forêts comprend 16 articles répartis en 6 chapitres. L'article 1er établit que cet arrêté ne s'applique pas aux fôrets ou aux parties des fôrets désignées par le gouvernement flamand comme fôret de protection ou réserve forestière. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, "utilisateurs de forêt", "associations de jeunesse agréées", "véhicule motorisé", "utilisation occasionnelle". L'accès aux chemins forestiers autres que les chemins forestiers publics, est indiqué par les panneaux figurés en annexe. L'article 10 établit que le chef de cantonnement établit pour chaque forêt domaniale un règlement réglant l'accessibilité. Ce règlement doit être approuvé par l'inspecteur forestier. L'accessibilité des autres forêts publiques est disciplinée par le chapitre IV et celle des fôrets privées par le chapitre V.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Recreational forest,Forest service/forest officers,Public forest,Private forest,Inspection,Contract/agreement
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree No. 14/93 approving the Regulation of Law No. 3/93 on Investments.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 29 articles, approves the Regulation of Law No. 3/93 on Investments. It aims at performing the following activities: a) select the coordinating body for investment processes and the creation of the institution that will be dedicated to promote investments and provide advisory services to a Government body in investment matters; b) define areas of activity reserved for the public sector for investments, with or without the involvement of the private sector; c) establish the minimum value of direct investment required in investment projects, as well as the establishment of rules for determining the real value of the investments made; d) stipulate the rules and deadlines for the presentation, analyses, appraisal and decision-making, as well as the monitoring and evaluation of the processes for carrying out investment projects; e) define levels of competence and deadlines for decision-making on investment projects, procedures to be followed when proposals are not decided within the stipulated period; f) establish rules for issuing investment certificates and for introducing changes to the authorizations granted, as well as for their revocation; and g) institutionalize rules for communication and correspondence and for the resolution of possible complaints in connection with investment matters. The provisions contained in this Regulation apply to investment initiatives and projects submitted, decided and carried out under Law No. 3/93 of 24 June.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force immediately.

Policy: Minister's Regulation relating to the Position, Role, Functions, Rights and Organizational Structure of the Department of Land and House Management.
Policy_Content: The functions of the Department of Land and House Management are related to the control of the uniform implementation of land and house management legislation and guiding principles. Within said framework, the Regulation establish functions and rights of the Department of Land and House Management (among others, cadastral control, mediation activity among disputing parties, management of the personnel, etc.). Further provisions concern the organizational structure of the Department of Land and House Management, the functions of the offices of the provinces, municipalities and special zones, and their working method system.

Policy: Act No. 85/IV/93 of 16 June 1993 defining national territories and urban planning.
Policy_Content: This Act defines national territory planning, town and country planning in compliance with article 186, point (b) and article 187, paragraph 2, point (e) of the Constitution. This Act is divided into 8 chapters establishing classifications and definitions of urban territories (Chap. I). It also establishes that national and municipal construction activities must respect the environment. Chapters II and III deal with legislative planning, building typologies, etc. Chapter IV deals with urban and non-urban soils, defining their use, etc. Chapter V establishes that activities must respect the prescribed planning purposes and consider the programs of interested public entities. Concession contracts are concluded under the supervision of municipal authorities.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force immediately (for parts not requiring specific regulation). Parts requiring further regulation shall enter into force accordingly.

Policy: Law on dues (1993).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to regulate relations connected with establishment, payment and collection of dues. State dues are charges collected by state institutions from natural and legal persons for some types of services regarding issuing or registration of documentation on concession or transfer of some rights to the respective person, certification of contracts, transactions and documents, and dispute settlement. Dues must be collected for concession of the following services: 1. dispute settlement, legal and administrative proceedings; 2. registration of firearms; 3. registration of economic units and organizations; 4. issuing model patents and trade marks. The document consists of III chapters that contain 24 articles. Chapter I (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Chapter II (arts. 6-17) sets rates of dues. Chapter III (arts. 18-24) lays down other provisions.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, Landlocked Developing Countries
