Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Development Bank of Kiribati (Amendment) Act 1993 (No. 1 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Development Bank of Kiribati Act: in section 13 by repealing subsection 13(6) and substituting a new subsection; and in section 23 by repealing 23(1)(a)-(d) and substituting new provisions. The purpose of these amendments is to disqualify a Member of the Maneaba ni Maungatabu from appointment as a member of the Development Bank of Kiribati Board and also to remove the period not exceeding four years specified as the term of appointment of the General Manager and Deputy General Manager.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Law No. 1513-XII on sanitary and epidemiological provision of population.
Policy_Content: Sanitary and epidemiological provision is a complex system of inter and intra department measures, implemented at the state level by the territorial-administration unit, economic unit, regardless to activity field or the form of property, at family and economic community level, focused on health maintenance, prevention and control of outbreak and spreading of the contagious diseases, poisoning, determined by the dangerous environmental factors, production field, habitat, education and human behaviour. The sanitary – epidemiological provision of the population is performed by: 1) State sanitary- epidemiological control, the public and production control; 2) Conducting the social-hygienic monitoring and epidemiologic control; 3) The registration of the chemical, biological and radioactive substances, vaccines, bacterial and viruses diagnosis system, nutrition, chemical reagents, disinfectants, raticides, possible dangerous products, including those imported for the first time in our country; 4) State sanitary and epidemiological settlement (Article 2). Individuals have the right to: a) A favourable living conditions which are provided by the implementation of a set of measures related to prevention of dangerous environment factors impact on man, compelling the individual and legal entities to fulfil the provisions laid down in sanitary legislation, act in accordance with the normative acts on production security (work and services); b) Receive the complete and true data from legal entities (within their limit of competence): (i) Data on the situation of living conditions and public health, in their activity area or the subordinate area, sanitary and epidemiological situation and radiation and the current sanitary regulations; (ii) Data on the implemented measures related to sanitary and epidemiological provision of the population and their results; (iii) Data on production quality (work and services), including food staff and drinking water quality (Article 6). The food products, including alimentary raw material, food additives that do not correspond to the sanitary regulations and are dangerous for human health and life are drawn out from the market and production and are used by its owners in purposes safe for the people or are destructed, informing the State Sanitary and Epidemiological service on these issues (Article 13). The population should be supplied with drinking water of high quality (according to the national standard) in sufficient quantity for the fulfilment of their physiological and household needs (Article 15). The chemical, radioactive and biological substances and their preparations, of potential danger for the human health and life, used for the first time in the country and the foodstuffs imported in the country for the first time shall be subject to compulsory registration (Article 32).
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Environmental standards,Monitoring,Disinfection/disinfestation,Access-to-information,Food quality control/food safety,Food additives,Water supply,Potable water
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ordinance on forest assessment and forest clearance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Land Use Planning and Building Law of 3 December 1978. The Ordinance aims at protecting the forest and forest edges against the effects of buildings and building works. Furthermore, the Ordinance aims to ensure the preservation of forest edges as scenic and ecologically valuable space and to promote its accessibility. The text consists of 12 articles as follows: Purpose and sphere of application (1); Principles (2); Small buildings and building works (3); Exceptional authorization (4); Reasons for exceptional authorization (5); Liability (6); Concept of forest edge (7); Forest assessment plan (8); Forest assessment in single cases (9); Proceedings (10); Transitional provisions (11); Entry into force (12).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Land clearing,Forestry protection measures,Forest management/forest conservation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 August 1993.

Policy: Subsoil Code.
Policy_Content: Subsoil Code shall regulate relations concerning management, protection of subsoil and mining. Subsoil shall be public property. The following subsoil management activities shall be authorized: (a) geological and ecological study; (b) extraction of minerals; (c) burial (storage) of hazardous substances and industrial waste; (d) other state and public needs. The Act consists of eleven Sections divided into 51 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) study of subsoil; (3) information system on subsoil; (4) projecting and construction of enterprises, objects and works related to subsoil management; (5) mining; (6) burial (storage) of hazardous substances; (7) safety arrangements; (8) protection of subsoil; (9) mines inspectorate; (10) dispute settlement and liability; and (11) international agreements. Subsoil management shall be charged. Expropriation of subsoil for state and public needs shall be carried out by decision of the body that has authorized concession of subsoil. Subsoil shall be allotted in accordance with concession and mining licence.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: Subsoil Code enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation No. 155 of the Federal Forest Service regarding allotment and taxation of copsewood.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is applicable in the forests of the Russian Federation for the purpose of the preparation of the copsewood for the main use, allotment of timber for logging, for sanitary and other types of cutting, for the sale of secondary timber and non-timber products. This Regulation is obligatory for all forestry institutions and timber enterprises. The Regulation is composed of 9 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 establishes the modalities and the forms of accountability. Section 3 fixes the modalities of allotment of copsewood. Section 4 establishes the allotment of timber for logging and its inventory. Section 5 sets up the taxation of copsewood in relation to the surface. Section 6 fixes the taxation of copsewood in relation to the number of the trees (tree-stumps) and in relation to the number of logs. Section 7 deals with the valuation of copsewood. Section 8 regards the requirements of the precision and quality control of the allotment and the taxation of copsewood. Section 9 specifies the documentation regarding copsewood stock.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Royalties/fees,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 22.266/J - Reglamento de la Ley de la Defensoría de los Habitantes de la República.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de la Ley de la Defensoría de los Habitantes de la República, que es un órgano adscrito al Poder Legislativo, con independencia funcional, administrativa y de criterio, encargado de proteger y promocionar los derechos e intereses de los habitantes y de velar por el buen funcionamiento del sector público.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Creation of the National Institute of Agricultural Research and Development (INIDA).
Policy_Content: This provision contains 5 chapters. Chapter I defines INIDA as a public legal person, responsible for agricultural matters. INIDA has, inter alia, the following duties: promotion of agricultural research plans, cooperation with local and international entities, etc. Chapter II establishes the INIDA administrative organization (support services, etc.) and specifies duties of each department. The President of INIDA is appointed by the Council of Ministers and his competencies, among others, are: representation and financial authorizations. The Scientific Council must give its opinion on agricultural research plans (art. 14). Chapter III deals with financial management, annual budgets, etc.; it also specifies INIDA's income. Chapter V deals with agricultural controls.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Technical requirements for the plan of a plot of land.
Policy_Content: Plan of a plot of land must be usually designed with the application of the national system of coordinates. For securing the boundaries of a plot of land on location there must be installed landmarks. Specially designed point of a boundary of a plot of land or other object. Average errors in the position of the landmarks respectively to the nearest points of state geodetic network must not exceed 0,1 mm on the map of scale of 1:2000. It is possible to design plan of a plot of land with the application of the local system of coordinates, common for a given settlement, subsidiary small-holding settlements and gardening cooperatives by permission of the committees on land resources and land survey of the republics within the Russian Federation, territorial, provincial and autonomous territories’ committees on land resources and land survey. Plan of a plot of land must contain: (a) legal status of land; (b) geodetic data; (c) description of the adjacent plots of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Regional Act No. 37 setting up the Regional Agency for the Development and Innovation of the Agro-forestry Sector (ARSIA).
Policy_Content: The present Act provides for the establishment of the Regional Agency for the Development and Innovation of the Agro-forestry Sector (ARSIA), which shall operate at regional level for the purpose of contributing to the modernization of the agricultural sector. It shall in particular provide technical assistance in matter of production, processing and marketing of agricultural products. The competences of the Agency are defined with further details under article 3.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Law No.5154-1 of 1993 on standardization.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal basis for standardization in Russian Federation that is compulsory for all state administrative bodies, as well as for enterprises and entrepreneurs (subjects of economic activity), social associations and determines arrangements for state protection of the interests of consumers and of the state by means of elaboration and application of normative documents regarding standardization. The document consists of V Sections that contain 16 Articles. Sec.I (arts. 1-5) lays down general provisions. Sec.2 (Arts.6-10) regards normative documents on standardization and their application. Sec.III (Arts.11-13) regards state control and survey over the observance of the requirements of state standards. Sec.IV (art. 14) establishes liability for the infringement of the present Law. Sec.V (Arts.15-16) regards financing of the activity on state standardization, state control and survey and stimulation of the application of state standards.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of its official publication.

Policy: Nunavik Land Claims Agreement Act (S.C.1993, c. 29 ).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to ratify, give effect and declare valid the Agreement between the Inuit of the Nunavut Settlement. Area and Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada. Section 10 decrees that the Nunavut Wildlife Management Board established by the Agreement is hereby constituted as a corporation and, as such, the Board has, for the purposes of carrying out its functions under the Agreement, the capacity, rights, powers and privileges of a natural person. The text consists of 13 sections.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Contract/agreement,Land tenure,Subdivision of land,Indigenous peoples,Business/industry/corporations,Vested rights/existing rights,Enforcement/compliance,Institution

Policy: Decree No. 5153-1 of 1993 of the Supreme Soviet regarding putting into effect of the Law "On certification of produce and service".
Policy_Content: The Supreme Soviet decrees to put into effect this Law from the date of its official publication. The Government must revise and invalidate the legislative acts of the Ministries, State Committees, Committees and Departments and other normative laws, instructions and regulations that contradict this Law. The Government is compelled to conform its legislative acts to this Law and to elaborate the draft of the Law regarding the amendments to the Civil Code and to the Penal Code in accordance with this Law.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition

Policy: Federal Law No. 5151-1 of 1993 "On Certification of produce and service".
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that certification may be of two types: obligatory or voluntary. The Supreme Soviet ratified this Law in second hearing taking into account the amendments made by the President. This Law establishes the legal requirements for the obligatory and the voluntary certification of produce and service and determines the rights, the duties and liability of the components of the certification. The purpose of the certification is to guarantee security of and protection of environment, life and health of the consumers. It regards as well food security and plant security. The Law is composed of IV Parts that comprise 20 articles. Part I lays down the general provisions. It contains 6 articles. Part II deals with the obligatory certification. It contains Articles 7 - 16. Part III concerns voluntary certification. It comprises articles 17-19. Part IV establishes the liability for the infringement of this Law. It contains article 20 that establishes penal, administrative and civil liability.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on the date of its official promulgation.

Policy: Circular on implementation of Decision No. 264-CT.
Policy_Content: This Circular on the implementation of Decision 264-CT is aimed at the protection and development of forests. It concerns the allocation of land for afforestation and promotes the granting of funds in favour of forestry development. The State will provide grants for the establishment of key protection forests and special use forests. The State will fund the production cycle for different tree species and different areas. The State shall also assist with technical guidance, supply of seedlings and other services such as the sales of inputs and marketing of outputs. The State provides low interest credits for the creation of raw materials for the paper and pulp industry. The Circular lists the specific proportion of interest rates to apply for plantations supplying raw materials to industries.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Afforestation/reforestation,Forestry protection measures,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Subsidy/incentive
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Circular commenced on 1 January 1993.

Policy: Décret nº D/93/110 portant composition, organisation et fonctionnement des organes du Fonds forestier national.
Policy_Content: Institué par le Code forestier de 1989, le Fonds forestier national (FFN) est un compte d'affectation spéciale dont les recettes sont exclusivement destinées au financement d'activités forestières. Le présent décret en réglemente la composition, organisation et fonctionnement. L'administration du FFN est assurée par deux organes: l'un de décision, le Comité de gestion; et l'autre d'exécution, le Secrétaire exécutif. Placé sous la présidence du Ministre chargé des forêts et la vice-présidence du Ministre chargé des finances, le Comité de gestion comprend des représentants des diverses institutions concernées par les questions forestières. Il lui appartient, notamment, d'approuver le règlement intérieur du FFN et son budget annuel, ainsi que d'autoriser la conclusion des conventions comportant des engagements financiers. Pour sa part, le Secrétaire exécutif est nommé par le Président de la République. Il est la cheville ouvrière du Comité de gestion, dont il prépare les réunions et exécute les décisions.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Decreto Nº 1.088 - Regula la creación de las asociaciones de Cabildos y/o Autoridades Tradicionales Indígenas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto regula la creación de las asociaciones de Cabildos y/o Autoridades Tradicionales Indígenas, que tienen por objeto el desarrollo integral de las Comunidades Indígenas. Para el cumplimiento de su objeto podrán desarrollar las siguientes acciones: a) adelantar actividades de carácter industrial y comercial, bien sea en forma directa, o mediante convenios celebrados con personas naturales o jurídicas;  b) fomentar en sus comunidades proyectos de salud, educación y vivienda en coordinación con las  respectivas autoridades nacionales, regionales o locales y con sujeción a las normas legales pertinentes.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Common property,Traditional rights/customary rights,Indigenous peoples,Local government,Jurisdictional competence,Agricultural development

Policy: Radiological Protection Act, 1991 (General Control of Radioactive Substances, Nuclear Devices and Irradiating Apparatus) Order, 1993. (S.I. No. 151 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This provides for the control by licence, to be obtained from the Radiological Protection Institute of Ireland, of the custody, transportation, handling, holding, storage, use, manufacture, production, processing, importation, distribution, exportation, or other disposal of radioactive substances, nuclear devices or irradiating apparatus, as defined in the Order.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Guidelines by the Ministry of Forestry concerning implementation of Decision 327-CT
Policy_Content: These guidelines are issued in order to implement Decision 327_CT which regards policies for the use of bare land and degraded hills, forests, coastal alluvial flats, and water bodies. The guidelines state preparation of a general forestry programme which includes harmonization of land definitions between the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of Forestry. The Ministry of Forestry assumes primary responsibility for the appraisal and approval of the 4 projects listed, forestry-agriculture industry projects; agriculture-forestry-industry projects; marine production combined with agriculture, and fixed cultivation and sedentarization. Funds from the state budget are used for protection, natural regeneration, and enrichment of protected forests and special use forests. The State provides basic construction funds for the following purposes: bare lands and denuded hills, seeds and nurseries, forests, agricultural production and food crops. The project-implementing agency, to be appointed by the leading agency for the project, shall have the right to receive, manage, and spend funds for the implementation of the projects (including all state forest enterprises). The guidelines also outline stages in plantation development including the planting and maintenance of plantation protection.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Afforestation/reforestation,Agro-forestry,Basin/catchment/watershed,Agricultural development,Planting material/seeds,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Law of Property Act (1993)
Policy_Content: This Law of Property Act of Estonia was enacted on 9 June 1993. The latest amendments to the Act were made on 30 January 2019.

Policy: Decreto Nº 89 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 24, sobre incentivos y normas para la actividad de reforestación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta los incentivos a la inversión forestal y las actividades relacionadas con la reforestación a través del Instituto Nacional de Recursos Naturales Renovables (INRENARE), que para tal fin creará un registro forestal.

Policy: Decreto Nº 263/993 - Normas sobre la formulación de los planes nacionales de protección del medio ambiente y sobre la formulación y ejecución de las políticas relativas a los recursos naturales renovables.
Policy_Content: La formulación de los planes nacionales de protección del medio ambiente será de competencia del Ministerio de Vivienda, Ordenamiento Territorial y Medio Ambiente, mientras que la formulación y ejecución de las políticas relativas a los recursos naturales renovables corresponderá al Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca. Ambos Ministerios deberán coordinar sus acciones a efectos de que dichas políticas mantengan armonía. El Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca se encargará, además, de la delimitación, manejo y administración de áreas protegidas y parques nacionales (ambos definidos por el artículo 2º).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Decreto Nº 104/93 - Ley General del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La Ley reconoce que la protección, conservación, restauración y manejo sostenible del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales es una cuestión de utilidad pública e interés social. El Gobierno y las Municipalidades deben promover el uso racional y el manejo sostenible de los recursos para su preservación y la obtención de beneficios económicos. Conforme a la presente Ley el medio ambiente está constituido por recursos naturales y culturales en areas rurales y urbanas que pueden ser alterados por agentes físico-químicos o biológicos u otros factores que derivan de causas naturales o humanas y que pueden afectar directa o indirectamente las condiciones de vida y el desarrollo de la sociedad. La Ley prevé la elaboración de Estudios de Impacto Ambiental para prevenir posibles efectos negativos sobre el medio ambiente. Los objetivos que persigue la presente Ley son: 1) el establecimiento de un marco adecuado relativo a las actividades agrícolas, industriales y forestales concernientes a sistemas de explotación del medio ambiente compatibles con la preservación y el uso racional y sostenible de los recursos naturales y la protección del medio ambiente en general; 2) el establecimiento de mecanismos necesarios para mantener el equilibrio ecológico que permitan la conservación de los recursos, la preservación de la diversidad genética y el uso racional de las especies y de los recursos tanto renovables como no renovables; 3) establecer los principios que guiarán las actividades de la administración pública relativas al medio ambiente, incluyendo mecanismos de coordinación para una gestión eficiente; 4) definir el impacto ambiental a fin de establecer una reglamentación relativa a los proyectos privados o públicos susceptibles de producir contaminación o degradación; 5) fomentar la participación de los ciudadanos en actividades relacionadas con la protección, preservación, restauración y gestión adecuada de los recursos naturales y el medio ambiente; 6) promover la educación y la investigación en materia de medio ambiente para crear una conciencia ecológica en la población; 7) mejorar la calidad de vida de los habitantes con la mejora ambiental de los asentamientos humanos; y 8) otras medidas compatibles con los objetivos antes mencionados. La Ley crea la figura del Secretario de Estado en el Ministerio del Medio Ambiente, quien tiene, entre otras obligaciones, la de cumplir y hacer cumplir la legislación sobre medio ambiente en Honduras. El título II de la Ley está dedicado a la organización administrativa y establece un Secretario de Estado en el Ministerio del Medio Ambiente, un Comité Consultivo, un Comité Técnico Consultivo y un Fiscal General para el Medio Ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Munitions Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the prevention of damages caused by weapons. In particular, the Ordinance deals with production, storage, handling and possible destruction of weapons and explosives. The text consists of 8 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Local Government Act 1993.
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Act are as follows: (a) to provide the legal framework for the system of local government for New South Wales; (b) to set out the responsibilities and powers of councils, councillors and other persons and bodies that constitute the system of local government; (c) to provide for governing bodies of councils that are democratically elected; (d) to facilitate engagement with the local community by councils, councillors and other persons and bodies that constitute the system of local government; (e) to provide for a system of local government that is accountable to the community and that is sustainable, flexible and effective.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 17 January 1994.

Policy: Roads Act 1993 No. 33.
Policy_Content: The Act is organised in 16 Parts and 2 Schedules. The objects of this Act are (a) to set out the rights of members of the public to pass along public roads, and (b) to set out the rights of persons who own land adjoining a public road to have access to the public road, and (c) to establish the procedures for the opening and closing of a public road, and (d) to provide for the classification of roads, and (e) to provide for the declaration of TfNSW (TfNSW is the roads authority for all freeways) and other public authorities as roads authorities for both classified and unclassified roads, and (f) to confer certain functions (in particular, the function of carrying out road work) on TfNSW and on other roads authorities, and (g) to provide for the distribution of the functions conferred by this Act between TfNSW and other roads authorities, and (h) to regulate the carrying out of various activities on public roads.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: 1st July 1993.

Policy: Ley Nº 1.047 - Intereses difusos en tutela de la salud pública, en conservación de la fauna, la flora y el paisaje, y en protección del medio ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley se aplica a aquellos actos u omisiones de autoridades administrativas provinciales, municipales o comunales, o de personas privadas, que lesionaren los intereses difusos de los habitantes de la Provincia en tutela de la salud pública, en la conservación de la fauna, de la flora y del paisaje, en la protección del medio ambiente, y en la preservación del patrimonio histórico y cultural. Procederá la acción de defensa de los intereses difusos y derechos colectivos ante el Superior Tribunal de Justicia, la cual podrá ser de protección para la prevención de un daño grave e inminente, o el cese de perjuicios actuales, o bien de reparación de los daños producidos para la reposición de las cosas al estado anterior al menoscabo.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Agreement No. of 1993 between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Tatarstan regarding interaction in the sphere of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Tatarstan have agreed as follows: 1). To carry out common state policy in the field of environmental protection, regulation of the use of natural resources and ensuring ecological safety. 2). The Parties, for the purpose of ensuring environmental protection must keep record of natural resources and their use and carry out environmental monitoring; to make arrangements for reproduction, conservation and renewal of wildlife species and biodiversity; develop and maintain the system of protected areas, natural reserves and National Parks, and to restrict economic and other types of activity in the adjoining areas; to carry out state ecological expertise of productive forces, investment and other types of projects and economic development programs; to keep state Red Books. 3). The Parties, for the purpose of carrying out common policy in the field of environmental protection and use of natural resources must co-ordinate adopted environmental legislative acts, ecological norms and standards; elaborate and carry out joint programs and projects in the field of environmental protection and ecological safety; make all-round assessment of ecological consequences of economic and other types of activity carried out on their territories. 6). The competent authorities of the Parties, for the purpose of carrying out joint plenary powers, institute Co-ordinating Council. They can set up common institutions on the basis of separate agreements.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 851/1993 - Modifica el Real Decreto Nº 1.887/1991, sobre mejora de las estructuras agrarias.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto introduce modificaciones acerca de los valores de las inversiones objeto de ayudas y del importe de éstas, tal como se recogen en el anexo de la presente disposición. Entiende como pequeño productor al agricultor a título principal cuya explotación agraria no supere 12 unidades de dimensión europea (UDEs) y cuya renta total sea igual o inferior al 75 por ciento de la renta de referencia.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Law “On grain market and state grain reserve”.
Policy_Content: This Law shall be applicable to grain production, processing, handling, storage and trade of cereals and grains. State reserve shall be intended public stock of cereals and grains pertaining to public ownership that can be used exclusively in cases envisaged by the national legislation for supply of cereals and grains to the population and grain-based products and derivates. The scope of this Law shall be to set forth preconditions for the formation and function of the national grain market, reaching self-sufficiency of grain, grain-based products and derivates, and also ensuring consumer protection. The State shall effect grain market by means of: (a) state balance of grain production and grain consumption; (b) organization of state grain reserve (grain stock); (c) state supervision over grain trade; (d) establishment of production quotas and grain prices guaranteed by the State; (e) purposeful subsidies; and (f) State Grain Inspection.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Land Acquisition Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 86 sections divided into nine Parts and completed by two Schedules, makes provision for the acquisition of land by the Crown and by other authorities. The Act consists of 9 Parts divided into 86 sections: Preliminary (1); Acquisition of land by Crown for private sector infrastructure project (1A); Acquisition of land (2); Compensation entitlement (3); Claims for, and determination of, compensation (4); Payment of compensation (5); Powers in relation to land (6); Proceedings before the Court and Arbitrator (7); Persons under disability and limited owners (8); Miscellaneous (9).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal fixant les prescriptions générales pour les établissements agricoles de la classe 3.
Policy_Content: Ce règlement grand-ducal fixe les prescriptions générales pour les établissements agricoles relevant de la classe 3 de la nomenclature des établissements dangereux, insalubres ou incommodes, telle qu'elle a été établie par le règlement grand-ducal modifié du 18 mai 1990 déterminant la liste et le classement des établissements dangereux, insalubres ou incommodes. Le texte est composé de 2 parts: Prescriptions générales concernant la protection de l'environnement et prescriptions générales concernant la sécurité pour des établissements telles que bergeries, écuries, étables, porcheries, poulaillers, silos à fourrages, dépôts agricoles d'engrais liquides, etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Arrêté interministériel n°54 MINAGRA-INT du 3 juin 1993 organisant la Commission Paysans-Forêts.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté organise la Commission Paysans-Forêts créé par l’arrêté n°158 du 04 aout 1992. C’est un organe consultatif de dialogue, de concertation et de conciliation sur les actions à entreprendre pour atteindre les objectifs fixés en matière de réhabilitation et d'aménagement des forêts classées du domaine de l'Etat et des autres aires protégées dans l'optique d'une participation des populations locales à la gestion de ces forêts.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Non-governmental entity,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Institution,Public participation,Community management
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Mining (Strategic Prospectivity Zones) Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 13 sections completed by three Schedules, ensures the continuing access for mining purposes to certain areas of the State having a very high potential for effective and efficient mining for minerals, without any implication as to the prospectivity of the remaining areas of the State. Schedule 1 describes the areas of land established as strategic prospectivity zones.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 3 June 1993.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 024-93-EM ─ Reglamento del Título Noveno de la Ley General de Minería, referido a las Garantías y Medidas de Promoción a la Inversión en la actividad minera.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento del Título Noveno de la Ley General de Minería, referido a las Garantías y Medidas de Promoción a la Inversión en la actividad minera. La estabilidad tributaria, cambiaria y administrativa, a que se refiere el Artículo 72 del Texto Único Ordenado de la Ley General de Minería, son las garantías de seguridad jurídica que se conceden a los titulares de actividad minera para el ejercicio de sus actividades. La estabilidad tributaria tiene por finalidad dar permanencia al régimen impositivo aplicable a la actividad minera.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Arrêté concernant l'application de l'ordonnance fédérale sur la protection contre les accidents majeurs.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté met en exécution l'article 23, alinéa 1, de l'ordonnance fédérale du 27 février 1991 sur la protection contre les accidents majeurs (OPAM). L’article 1er établit que les autorités d'exécution des dispositions fédérales sur la protection contre les accidents majeurs sont: 1) le Département de l'économie publique; 2) le Service de la protection des travailleurs et des relations du travail; 3) la Commission sur la protection contre les accidents majeurs (COPAM); 4) la cellule de secours pour les cas de catastrophe (CECA). Le texte comprend 8 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act on Fire Protection.
Policy_Content: This Act contains provisions on the framework for the fire protection in the Republic of Croatia. The text contains provisions on: fire prevention; organization of fire protection and supervision of the implementation of fire protection measures.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act shall enter into force eight days after the publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Act No. 8.661 regulating financial incentives for technical enhancement of agro-forestry and industrial sectors.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates financial incentives for technical enhancement of agro-forestry and industrial sectors. It consists of 13 articles specifying the requirements to be satisfied by industrial and agro-forestry entities in order to obtain financial incentives within Technological Program for the Development of these sectors.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No. 7715 amending Land Law No. 7501 establishing land leasing.
Policy_Content: This Law amends Land Law No. 7501. It consists of 10 articles amending land leasing requirements and the rules for the distribution of such lands to owners.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 1-16/770 of 1993 of the Committee on land resources and land survey validating Model Contract of sale of plot of land (deed of purchase).
Policy_Content: The Committee on land resources and land survey decrees to validate the form of the Model Contract. The document consists of 5 paragraphs. Paragraph 1 determines the object of contract. Paragraph 2 determines the modalities of payment. Paragraph 3 regards clearance of the plot of land destined for sale. Paragraph 4 establishes the commitments of the parties. Paragraph 5 lays down the conclusive provisions. The document contains annotations.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Nigerian Agricultural Insurance Corporation Decree (No. 37 of 1993).
Policy_Content: There is hereby established the Nigerian Agricultural Insurance as a body corporate. The Corporation shall be governed by a Board of Directors. The functions of the Corporation are: (a) to implement, manage and administer the Agricultural Insurance Scheme, established by section 6 of this Decree; (b) to subsidize the premiums chargeable on selected crops and livestock policies from the grants obtained from the Federal and State Governments and the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja; (c) to encourage institutional lenders to lend more for agricultural production having regard to the added security for their loans provided by the Corporation; (c) to carry on other (commercial) insurance business. The general objective of the Scheme is to protect the Nigerian farmer from the effects of natural hazards and diseases by introducing measures which shall ensure an indemnity sufficient to keep the farmer in business. The Scheme shall cover (a) such crops, livestock and other agricultural items and enterprises, as the Corporation may, from time to time, determine; (b) on a commercial basis only, farm buildings, machinery and equipment which form part of the investment on the farm; (c) such other items as the Corporation may, from time to time, deem necessary for giving effect to the objectives of the Scheme. The Corporation shall bear losses up to 200 percent of its premium income in each class of insurance covered under section 7 of this Decree and the Federal Government shall pay for all losses above 200 percent of the premium income. Risks covered are listed in section 8.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Additional explanations and instructions on the implementation of decree on Taxation of Land.
Policy_Content: For the purpose of implementing the land tax system set out by Decree No. 50/PM of 1993, additional explanations are given with respect to: (a) the new system of tax collection; and (b) the calculation of land taxes on the basis of the location and of the use of the land. Part III sets out the types of land which may benefit from tax exemption and the procedure to be followed by the applicant. Final provisions establish tasks to be undertaken by the provincial finance departments in order to favour the uniform implementation of the new land tax system.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Instruction No.NP-4-02/81n of 1993 of State Tax Service regarding the modalities of collection of charges for the use of subsoil.
Policy_Content: Deputy Chief of State Tax Service forwards for guidance Regulation on the modalities and terms of revenues to state budget for the use of subsoil. On the basis of the aforesaid Regulation has been considerably raised the role of state bodies of the republics within the Russian Federation, territorial, regional bodies and bodies of the autonomous regions as regards the determination of forms, conditions and specific amounts of payment for specific deposits. In this connection state tax inspections must interact with the respective state executive bodies in the sphere of taxation, coordination of activity as regards data collection for drawing up the respective budgets and ensuring total and timely revenues to the budget of charges for the use of subsoil.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 503 of 1993 regarding validation of the Regulation on purchase and sale by the Russian nationals of the plots of land.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. The Federal Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey is entitled to provide for generalisation of information on purchase and sale of the plots of land and carry out the analysis of land market. This Regulation is applicable in the process of purchase and sale by the Russian nationals of the plots of land or their shares for the purpose of conducting subsidiary smallholding, gardening or individual housing. The document consists of 8 Articles. Purchase and sale of the plots of land can be carried out only in case of the absence of the dispute as regards the plot of land in question and other legal causes that could possibly hinder striking a bargain. In striking a deal as regards purchase and sale of the plot of land neither vendor nor purchaser are authorized to change either the destination or the modalities of the use of the plot of land (e.g. sanitary and protective areas, environmental protection land, recreational and historical and cultural land, as well as the right of transit through the plot of land, maintenance and repairs of edifices, buildings, surface and underground communication and other conditions of utilisation). The price of the plot of land and the conditions of payment must be determined by agreement between the vendor and the purchaser. The plan of the plot of land must be supplied with the deed of purchase. The deed of purchase without the plan of the plot of land is not subject to registration. In the absence of the plan of the plot of land it must be produced at the expense of either the vendor or of the purchaser on the basis of agreement between them. The Federal Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey establishes the technical requirements for the plans of the plots of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land commission,Institution,Land reform,Subdivision of land,Land tenure,Ownership,Smallholders/peasants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: First Nation of Nacho Nyak Dun Self-Government Agreement.
Policy_Content: An Agreement among the First Nation of Nacho Nyak Dun and the Government of Canada and the Government of the Yukon to establish the self-government of the First Nation Nacho Nyak Dun. For the purpose of the present Agreement "Non-Settlement Land" means all land and water in the Yukon other than Settlement Land; "Settlement Land" means those lands identified in the Final Agreement as “Settlement Land for the First Nation of Nacho Nyak Dun”.
Subject: Fisheries, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Teslin Tlingit Council Self-Government Agreement.
Policy_Content: The present Agreement among the Teslin Tlingit Council and Her Majesty the Queen in Right of Canada and the Government of the Yukon establishes the framework of a modern First Nation Government. In particular, the Agreement provides for the power to enact laws of a local or private nature on settlement land and for many aspects of the citizens' lives (marriage, adoption, education, administration of estates, etc.). For the purpose of the present Agreement "Non-Settlement Land" means all land and water in the Yukon other than Settlement Land; "Settlement Land" means those lands identified in the Final Agreement as “Settlement Land for the Teslin Tlingit Council”.
Subject: Fisheries, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Order No. 134 of the Federal Forest Service validating some forest management regulations.
Policy_Content: The Director of the Federal Forest Service orders to validate Instruction on the modalities of examination and validation of final cutting age (Annex 1) and Instruction on the modalities of examination and validation of calculation of cutting areas (Annexes 2,3). For the purpose of ensuring stable forest management final cutting age must be established for a long period in the process of forest organization. Optimum cutting age currently in force shall be taken as a basis. Calculation of final cutting age in the forests of various purposeful uses shall be carried out by the branch scientific organizations before regularly scheduled forest organization. Calculation of cutting areas must be envisaged for ten years separately for each category of forests. Calculated cutting areas that are recommended for validation shall be examined and validated by the regional forest management institutions.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Environment, Resources and Development Court Act 1993.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 49 sections divided into eight Parts and completed by one Schedule, provides for the establishment and operation of the Environment, Resources and Development Court. The Act contains provisions concerning the establishment of the court (Part 2 Div. 1), its jurisdiction (Part 2 Div. 2), the composition of the Court (Part 3), the constitution of the Court (Part 4), proceedings in front of the Court (Part 5 and 6), appeals (Part 7), contempt in face of Court (sect. 37), enforcement of judgments and orders (sect. 43) and legal costs (sect. 44).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 103/93 - Ley del Instituto Hondureño de Turismo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Instituto Hondureño de Turismo (IHT), que tendrá como finalidad estimular y promover el turismo como una actividad económica que impulse el desarrollo del país por medio se la conservación, protección y aprovechamiento racional de los recursos turísticos nacionales.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Radioactive Substances Act 1993 (c. 12).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to the control on the handling of radioactive substances and the disposal of radioactive waste.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Law regarding the right of citizens to private property and sale of the plots of land for subsidiary small-holding, suburban small-holding, gardening and individual housing (1993).
Policy_Content: Transfer of the plots of land for subsidiary small-holding, suburban small-holding, gardening and individual housing on condition of private property must be carried out in accordance with Federal, Regional land legislation and the present Regional Law. Plots of land allocated to citizens on condition of ownership, open-ended (permanent) tenancy by the date of entry into force of the present Regional Law must be transferred free-of-charge to citizens within the limits established by the local self-government. Citizens whose plots of land exceed the established limits maintain in any case the right to hereditary possession or tenancy of the part of the plot of land exceeding the established limits. The aforesaid category of citizens is authorized to purchase the exceeding part of the plot of land from local self-government on contractual basis. The citizens possessing the plots of land for subsidiary small-holding, suburban small-holding, gardening and individual housing are granted the right to sell them irrespectively of the period of the acquisition of the right of ownership to the plot of land subject to sale.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ozone Layer Protection (Products Containing Scheduled Substances) (Import Banning) Regulation (Chapter 403C).
Policy_Content: This Regulation prohibits the import of products containing any of the substances specified in the Schedule of the Ordinance unless in full compliance with the relevant requirements of the 1987 Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,International trade,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Antarctic Treaty (Environment Protection) (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 1993.
Policy_Content: These are Regulations issued under the Antarctic Treaty (Environment Protection) Act 1980. They lay out detailed procedures for the preparation of initial environmental evaluations and comprehensive environmental evaluations required by the Act for certain activities in the Antarctic, in accordance with the Madrid Protocol. Draft and final comprehensive evaluations prepared under the Regulations must be sent to each signatory of the Madrid Protocol, and notice of the receipt in Australia of draft evaluations prepared by other signatories must be published in the Gazette. Activities in Antarctic may not begin earlier than 60 days after approval in accordance with these Regulations.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Clean Air Act 1993 (Chapter 11).
Policy_Content: This Act consolidates the Clean Air Acts of 1956 and 1968 and certain related enactments. The Act, among other things: concerns dark smoke and the prohibition of dark smoke from chimneys, industrial and trade premises and the meaning of dark smoke; establishes the requirement that any new furnaces must, as far as is practical, be smokeless; imposes limits on emissions of grit and dust from furnaces, requirements for arrestment plants for non-domestic furnaces, emission monitoring provisions and chimney height regulations to ensure efficient and adequate dispersion of emissions; provides for the creation of smoke control areas and introduces prohibition on emission of smoke in controlled areas; establishes control procedures for certain types of air pollution (regulations about motor fuels, the sulphur content of oil fuels for furnaces and engines and cable burning); provides information on air pollution via research and publicity and for appeals processes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Forest Law of the Republic of Slovenia.
Policy_Content: This Law provides the forest management basic principles and rules. The Law closely regulates the protection (also fire protection), cultivation, construction and maintenance of forest infrastructure, timber issues, exploitation and use of forests and the disposal of forests and forest land as important natural resource, with the aim of ensuring sustainable and multi-functional approach and management, in accordance with the principles of environmental protection and protection of natural values, and sustainable and optimal functioning of forests as ecosystem. These rules are meant for both type of owners of forests (legal and/or natural persons). The ownership of forests shall be exercised in such way as to ensure their ecological, social and production functions. Forest owners have the right to participate in the process of preparing and adopting forest management plans. Their needs, proposals and requirements shall be respected as far as possible in accordance with ecosystem and legal constraints. The basis for forest management are national forest programme and forest management plans. The forest management plans shall also lay down the necessary measures for maintaining the favorable status of the special protection areas, determined in accordance with the regulations governing nature conservation.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Basic legislation,Forest fires,Forest service/forest officers,Forestry protection measures,Inspection,Institution,Integrated management,Offences/penalties,Protection forest,Protection of environment,Afforestation/reforestation,Survey/mapping,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Traceability/product tracing,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law entered into force on 25 June 1993 (on the fifteenth day following its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Slovenia).

Policy: Arrêté n°016/MTPS/SG/CJ du 26 Mai 1993 fixant les modalités d’attribution et de calcul de l’indemnité de licenciement
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les modalités d’attribution et de calcul de l’indemnité de licenciement. Hormis le cas de faute lourde laissée à l’appréciation de la juridiction compétente en ce qui concerne la gravité de la faute, tout travailleur licencié ayant accompli au moins deux (02) ans de service dans la même entreprise a droit à une indemnité de licenciement distincte de celle du préavis. Sont considérés comme temps de service comptant pour l’ancienneté, les congés payés, les permissions exceptionnelles d’absence, payées ou non, les périodes de suspension du contrat visées aux alinéas c, d, e, f, g, i et k de l’article 32 du Code du Travail ainsi que les périodes légales de stage et de formation professionnelle. Sauf dispositions plus favorables des conventions collectives, des contrats individuels de travail ou des textes particuliers, l’indemnité de licenciement est égale pour chaque année de présence dans l’entreprise à un pourcentage du salaire mensuel moyen des douze (12) derniers mois précédant le licenciement.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n° 017/MTPS/SG/CJ du 26 Mai 1993 fixant la durée maximale et les modalités de l’engagement à l’essai
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe la durée maximale et les modalités de l’engagement à l’essai. L’essai est une période probatoire pendant laquelle l’employeur juge de la compétence et des aptitudes du travailleur à tenir l’emploi, et ce dernier de ses possibilités d’adaptation aux conditions de travail. L’engagement à l’essai est facultatif. Toutefois, lorsque les parties conviennent d’y recourir, elles doivent se conformer aux dispositions du présent arrêté.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n°018/MTPS/SG/CJ du 26 mai 1993 fixant les conditions auxquelles doit répondre le logement fourni aux travailleurs, le taux minimum et les modalités d'attribution de l'indemnité compensatrice de logement
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les conditions auxquelles doit répondre le logement fourni aux travailleurs, le taux minimum et les modalités d'attribution de l'indemnité compensatrice de logement. L'employeur est tenu d'assurer le logement de tout travailleur qu'il a déplacé pour exécuter un contrat de travail nécessitant l'installation de ce travailleur hors de sa résidence habituelle ou du lieu d'embauché. Hors le cas visé à l'article 1er ci-dessus, l'employeur est également tenu à l'obligation d'assurer le logement en nature de tout travailleur dont la résidence habituelle se trouve située à une distance comprise entre dix et vingt-cinq kilomètre du lieu de travail.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Joint Instruction No.37-2-7/435 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and No.01-19/22-22 of the State Committee of Sanitary and Epidemiological Survey of the modalities of state registration of potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances (1993).
Policy_Content: State registration of potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances shall be carried out by the Russian Register for the purpose of exposure, accumulation of physico-chemical, toxicologo-hygienic and ecologo-toxicological and other information, registration and regulation of the afore-mentioned substances for the purpose of prevention of hazardous impact thereof on human health and environment. Potentially hazardous chemical and biological substances shall be considered single substance (compound) of natural or artificial origin capable of producing negative impact on human health and environment in the process of processing, application, transportation, transformation and under domestic conditions. All single chemical and biological substances (compounds) including those which make part as components of mixtures manufactured and (or) applicable on the territory of the Russian Federation and also imported from abroad shall be subject to compulsory state registration. Substances containing admixtures forming in the process of manufacturing or application shall be registered as single substances. The document consists of 2 sections. Section 1 lays down general provisions. Section 2 establishes the modalities of state registration.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: Entry into force from the date of issue.

Policy: Agreement between the Inuit of the Nunavut settlement area and her Majesty the Queen in right.
Policy_Content: The present Agreement outlines the relationships and obligations between the Iniut of the Nunavut Settlement Area and Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada. This Agreement – also referred to as Nunavut Land Claims Agreement - is a land claims agreement between the Inuit of the Nunavut Settlement Area (part of the Northwest Territories) and the Government of Canada subject to the Constitution Act of 1982. The lands are not deemed to be "Lands Reserved for Indians" with respect to the Constitution Act of 1867. The Inuit are represented by the Tunngavik Federation of Nunavut to establish the Agreement. The Agreement specifies two areas that are subject of the agreement: Area A consists of Arctic Islands and mainland Eastern Arctic, and their adjacent marine areas; Area B includes the Belcher Islands, its associated islands and adjacent marine areas. A complete inventory of land, islands and marine territory subject to the Nunavut Land Claim Agreement is listed in the Agreement itself. Under the terms of the agreement, jurisdiction over some territorial matters is transferred to the new government, among them wildlife management, land use planning and development, property taxation, and natural resource management.
Subject: Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sub-national agreement,Indigenous peoples,Contract/agreement,Land tenure,Subdivision of land,Traditional rights/customary rights,Vested rights/existing rights,Land valuation,Land commission,Land-use planning,Court/tribunal,Dispute settlement,National parks,Protected area
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Ordonnance nº 93-007 portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: La prospection, la recherche, l’exploitation et le transport d’hydrocarbures par canalisations sur le territoire de la République Centrafricaine ainsi que le régime fiscal de ces activités sont régis par les dispositions de la présente ordonnance et de ses textes d’application. l’ordonnance comporte 90 articles répartis en 10 titres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I) ; Autorisation de prospection d’hydrocarbures (II) ; Permis de recherche d’hydrocarbures (III) ; Concession d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures (IV) ; Contrats pétroliers de recherche et d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures (V) ; Transport d’hydrocarbures par canalisations (VI) ; Obligations et des droits attachés aux opérations pétrolières (VII) ; Dispositions fiscales, douanières et financières (VIII) ; Loi, contentieux, infractions et pénalités (IX)  et Dispositions diverses (X).
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Beach Control (Prohibition) Order (SRO No. 19 of 1993).
Policy_Content: This Order, made by the Minister under section 12(4) of the Beach Control Act, defines prohibited areas for purposes of control of removal of sand and other materials from a beach or seashore.
Subject: Fisheries, Land & soil, Sea

Policy: Arrêté du 24 mai 1993 relatif aux ventes à l'amiable auxquelles l'Office national des forêts peut procéder.
Policy_Content: Les lots de valeur très faible, qui peuvent être vendus à l'amiable par l'Office national des forêts, sont les lots dont la valeur d'estimation est au plus égale à: 20000 F pour les coupes vendues sur pied; 30000 F pour les bois abattus. Les lots restés invendus en adjudication peuvent être vendus à l'amiable à la condition que le prix de vente soit supérieur au prix auquel le lot a été retiré lors de l'adjudication et ceux restés invendus après appel d'offres peuvent être vendus à l'amiable à la condition que le prix de vente soit au moins égal à la meilleure soumission recueillie lors de l'appel d'offres.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree of the Ministry of Forestry No. 273/KPTS-IV/93 on the classification of types of wood as the basis for the imposition of forestry fees.
Policy_Content: The present Decree is enacted within the framework of a policy aiming at "imposing Reforestation Funds and Forest Product Fees on logs and/or materials produced by the holders of Forest Concessions/holders of Rights on the Collection of Forest Products/holders of Wood Processing Industry Licences and holders of other legal licences" (preamble). To this end, the Decree establishes the list of types of wood to be used as the basis for the imposition of forestry fees throughout the country. The list is contained in the attachment.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Crop Residues (Burning) Regulations (S.I. No. 1366 of 1993).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit the burning on agricultural land of crop residues listed in Schedule 1, unless the burning is required for a specific purpose (Reg. 4). The Regulations also impose restrictions and requirements in relation to the burning of linseed residues and some exempted burning and these restrictions and requirements are set out in Schedule 2. Burning crop residues in contravention to these Regulations is declared an offence. (6 Regulations and 2 Schedules)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 246 validating the Regulation on special environmental protection funds.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that local special environmental protection funds shall be set up at the local and regional levels, and national special environmental protection fund shall be set up under the jurisdiction of State Committee on Environmental Protection. Local funds shall be set up for financing of local and cross-sectoral arrangements for reduction of emissions of pollutants, effluent waste water discharge to waterbodies, soil pollution, waste formation, and also for recycling of waste, conservation and reproduction of wild fauna and wild flora species. National fund shall be set up for financing of national environmental protection programs and strategies.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Special fund,Jurisdictional competence,Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Emissions,Effluent waste water/discharge,Recycling/reuse,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 128 of 1993 banning the cutting of live trees.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision is composed of 3 articles. Article 1 bans the cutting of green or live trees. It also forbids the gathering or transportation of dry wood (firewood) without a permit issued by the Regional Council. Such permits are also obtainable from the Directorate General for the Protection of Nature in Muscat Governorate, the Directorate General of Environment in the Governorate of Dhofar, or from the Directorate General for Regional Municipalities and Environment for the Al Battinah Region (art. 1). A 200 Omani Riyal fine will be imposed on all who cut green trees, or gather and transport dry wood without a permit. Those who disobey the conditions of the permit are also subject to a fine of 50 Omani Riyals. Fines are increased if the transgressor has previously been fined (art. 2).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decision enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Official Letter No. 2-10/733 of 1993 of the Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey regarding information of the population of the availability of land suitable for the allotment to citizens, the modalities and the process of allotment.
Policy_Content: The Committee entitles its regional, provincial, territorial branches to carry out permanent information of the population through mass media of the availability of land suitable for organization of peasant farms, collective gardening and truck farming, individual housing and summer cottage construction and the modalities of allotment of the plots of land destined for this purpose.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Joint Official Letter No. 2-12/65-1571 of 1993 of the Ministry for environmental protection and natural resources and of the National Agency for International Co-operation and Development regarding the state ecological expertise of the enterprises with foreign investment.
Policy_Content: The Ministry and the National Agency specify that prior to the setting up and registration of the enterprises with foreign investment which activity is connected to large-scale construction or reconstruction that could produce a negative impact on environment, the state ecological expertise must be carried out. Financing and realization of the project must be carried out only in the presence of the positive resolution of the state ecological expertise.
Subject: Environment gen.
